2594 va_end(args_copy);
2595 return;
2596 }
2597
2598 // Add zero-terminator the first time
2599 const int write_off = (Buf.Size != 0) ? Buf.Size : 1;
2600 const int needed_sz = write_off + len;
2601 if (write_off + len >= Buf.Capacity)
2602 {
2603 int new_capacity = Buf.Capacity * 2;
2604 Buf.reserve(needed_sz > new_capacity ? needed_sz : new_capacity);
2605 }
2606
2607 Buf.resize(needed_sz);
2608 ImFormatStringV(&Buf[write_off - 1], (size_t)len + 1, fmt, args_copy);
2609 va_end(args_copy);
2610}
2611
2612void ImGuiTextIndex::append(const char* base, int old_size, int new_size)
2613{
2614 IM_ASSERT(old_size >= 0 && new_size >= old_size && new_size >= EndOffset);
2615 if (old_size == new_size)
2616 return;
2617 if (EndOffset == 0 || base[EndOffset - 1] == '\n')
2618 LineOffsets.push_back(EndOffset);
2619 const char* base_end = base + new_size;
2620 for (const char* p = base + old_size; (p = (const char*)memchr(p, '\n', base_end - p)) != 0; )
2621 if (++p < base_end) // Don't push a trailing offset on last \n
2622 LineOffsets.push_back((int)(intptr_t)(p - base));
2623 EndOffset = ImMax(EndOffset, new_size);
2624}
2625
2626//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2627// [SECTION] ImGuiListClipper
2628// This is currently not as flexible/powerful as it should be and really confusing/spaghetti, mostly because we changed
2629// the API mid-way through development and support two ways to using the clipper, needs some rework (see TODO)
2630//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2631
2632// FIXME-TABLE: This prevents us from using ImGuiListClipper _inside_ a table cell.
2633// The problem we have is that without a Begin/End scheme for rows using the clipper is ambiguous.
2634static bool GetSkipItemForListClipping()
2635{
2636 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2637 return (g.CurrentTable ? g.CurrentTable->HostSkipItems : g.CurrentWindow->SkipItems);
2638}
2639
2640#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2641// Legacy helper to calculate coarse clipping of large list of evenly sized items.
2642// This legacy API is not ideal because it assumes we will return a single contiguous rectangle.
2643// Prefer using ImGuiListClipper which can returns non-contiguous ranges.
2644void ImGui::CalcListClipping(int items_count, float items_height, int* out_items_display_start, int* out_items_display_end)
2645{
2646 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2647 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
2648 if (g.LogEnabled)
2649 {
2650 // If logging is active, do not perform any clipping
2651 *out_items_display_start = 0;
2652 *out_items_display_end = items_count;
2653 return;
2654 }
2655 if (GetSkipItemForListClipping())
2656 {
2657 *out_items_display_start = *out_items_display_end = 0;
2658 return;
2659 }
2660
2661 // We create the union of the ClipRect and the scoring rect which at worst should be 1 page away from ClipRect
2662 // We don't include g.NavId's rectangle in there (unless g.NavJustMovedToId is set) because the rectangle enlargement can get costly.
2663 ImRect rect = window->ClipRect;
2664 if (g.NavMoveScoringItems)
2665 rect.Add(g.NavScoringNoClipRect);
2666 if (g.NavJustMovedToId && window->NavLastIds[0] == g.NavJustMovedToId)
2667 rect.Add(WindowRectRelToAbs(window, window->NavRectRel[0])); // Could store and use NavJustMovedToRectRel
2668
2669 const ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
2670 int start = (int)((rect.Min.y - pos.y) / items_height);
2671 int end = (int)((rect.Max.y - pos.y) / items_height);
2672
2673 // When performing a navigation request, ensure we have one item extra in the direction we are moving to
2674 // FIXME: Verify this works with tabbing
2675 const bool is_nav_request = (g.NavMoveScoringItems && g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->RootWindowForNav == window->RootWindowForNav);
2676 if (is_nav_request && g.NavMoveClipDir == ImGuiDir_Up)
2677 start--;
2678 if (is_nav_request && g.NavMoveClipDir == ImGuiDir_Down)
2679 end++;
2680
2681 start = ImClamp(start, 0, items_count);
2682 end = ImClamp(end + 1, start, items_count);
2683 *out_items_display_start = start;
2684 *out_items_display_end = end;
2685}
2686#endif
2687
2688static void ImGuiListClipper_SortAndFuseRanges(ImVector<ImGuiListClipperRange>& ranges, int offset = 0)
2689{
2690 if (ranges.Size - offset <= 1)
2691 return;
2692
2693 // Helper to order ranges and fuse them together if possible (bubble sort is fine as we are only sorting 2-3 entries)
2694 for (int sort_end = ranges.Size - offset - 1; sort_end > 0; --sort_end)
2695 for (int i = offset; i < sort_end + offset; ++i)
2696 if (ranges[i].Min > ranges[i + 1].Min)
2697 ImSwap(ranges[i], ranges[i + 1]);
2698
2699 // Now fuse ranges together as much as possible.
2700 for (int i = 1 + offset; i < ranges.Size; i++)
2701 {
2702 IM_ASSERT(!ranges[i].PosToIndexConvert && !ranges[i - 1].PosToIndexConvert);
2703 if (ranges[i - 1].Max < ranges[i].Min)
2704 continue;
2705 ranges[i - 1].Min = ImMin(ranges[i - 1].Min, ranges[i].Min);
2706 ranges[i - 1].Max = ImMax(ranges[i - 1].Max, ranges[i].Max);
2707 ranges.erase(ranges.Data + i);
2708 i--;
2709 }
2710}
2711
2712static void ImGuiListClipper_SeekCursorAndSetupPrevLine(float pos_y, float line_height)
2713{
2714 // Set cursor position and a few other things so that SetScrollHereY() and Columns() can work when seeking cursor.
2715 // FIXME: It is problematic that we have to do that here, because custom/equivalent end-user code would stumble on the same issue.
2716 // The clipper should probably have a final step to display the last item in a regular manner, maybe with an opt-out flag for data sets which may have costly seek?
2717 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2718 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
2719 float off_y = pos_y - window->DC.CursorPos.y;
2720 window->DC.CursorPos.y = pos_y;
2721 window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, pos_y - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y);
2722 window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y = window->DC.CursorPos.y - line_height; // Setting those fields so that SetScrollHereY() can properly function after the end of our clipper usage.
2723 window->DC.PrevLineSize.y = (line_height - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y); // If we end up needing more accurate data (to e.g. use SameLine) we may as well make the clipper have a fourth step to let user process and display the last item in their list.
2724 if (ImGuiOldColumns* columns = window->DC.CurrentColumns)
2725 columns->LineMinY = window->DC.CursorPos.y; // Setting this so that cell Y position are set properly
2726 if (ImGuiTable* table = g.CurrentTable)
2727 {
2728 if (table->IsInsideRow)
2729 ImGui::TableEndRow(table);
2730 table->RowPosY2 = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
2731 const int row_increase = (int)((off_y / line_height) + 0.5f);
2732 //table->CurrentRow += row_increase; // Can't do without fixing TableEndRow()
2733 table->RowBgColorCounter += row_increase;
2734 }
2735}
2736
2737static void ImGuiListClipper_SeekCursorForItem(ImGuiListClipper* clipper, int item_n)
2738{
2739 // StartPosY starts from ItemsFrozen hence the subtraction
2740 // Perform the add and multiply with double to allow seeking through larger ranges
2741 ImGuiListClipperData* data = (ImGuiListClipperData*)clipper->TempData;
2742 float pos_y = (float)((double)clipper->StartPosY + data->LossynessOffset + (double)(item_n - data->ItemsFrozen) * clipper->ItemsHeight);
2743 ImGuiListClipper_SeekCursorAndSetupPrevLine(pos_y, clipper->ItemsHeight);
2744}
2745
2746ImGuiListClipper::ImGuiListClipper()
2747{
2748 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2749 Ctx = ImGui::GetCurrentContext();
2750 IM_ASSERT(Ctx != NULL);
2751 ItemsCount = -1;
2752}
2753
2754ImGuiListClipper::~ImGuiListClipper()
2755{
2756 End();
2757}
2758
2759void ImGuiListClipper::Begin(int items_count, float items_height)
2760{
2761 ImGuiContext& g = *Ctx;
2762 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
2763 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_CLIPPER("Clipper: Begin(%d,%.2f) in '%s'\n", items_count, items_height, window->Name);
2764
2765 if (ImGuiTable* table = g.CurrentTable)
2766 if (table->IsInsideRow)
2767 ImGui::TableEndRow(table);
2768
2769 StartPosY = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
2770 ItemsHeight = items_height;
2771 ItemsCount = items_count;
2772 DisplayStart = -1;
2773 DisplayEnd = 0;
2774
2775 // Acquire temporary buffer
2776 if (++g.ClipperTempDataStacked > g.ClipperTempData.Size)
2777 g.ClipperTempData.resize(g.ClipperTempDataStacked, ImGuiListClipperData());
2778 ImGuiListClipperData* data = &g.ClipperTempData[g.ClipperTempDataStacked - 1];
2779 data->Reset(this);
2780 data->LossynessOffset = window->DC.CursorStartPosLossyness.y;
2781 TempData = data;
2782}
2783
2784void ImGuiListClipper::End()
2785{
2786 ImGuiContext& g = *Ctx;
2787 if (ImGuiListClipperData* data = (ImGuiListClipperData*)TempData)
2788 {
2789 // In theory here we should assert that we are already at the right position, but it seems saner to just seek at the end and not assert/crash the user.
2790 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_CLIPPER("Clipper: End() in '%s'\n", g.CurrentWindow->Name);
2791 if (ItemsCount >= 0 && ItemsCount < INT_MAX && DisplayStart >= 0)
2792 ImGuiListClipper_SeekCursorForItem(this, ItemsCount);
2793
2794 // Restore temporary buffer and fix back pointers which may be invalidated when nesting
2795 IM_ASSERT(data->ListClipper == this);
2796 data->StepNo = data->Ranges.Size;
2797 if (--g.ClipperTempDataStacked > 0)
2798 {
2799 data = &g.ClipperTempData[g.ClipperTempDataStacked - 1];
2800 data->ListClipper->TempData = data;
2801 }
2802 TempData = NULL;
2803 }
2804 ItemsCount = -1;
2805}
2806
2807void ImGuiListClipper::ForceDisplayRangeByIndices(int item_min, int item_max)
2808{
2809 ImGuiListClipperData* data = (ImGuiListClipperData*)TempData;
2810 IM_ASSERT(DisplayStart < 0); // Only allowed after Begin() and if there has not been a specified range yet.
2811 IM_ASSERT(item_min <= item_max);
2812 if (item_min < item_max)
2813 data->Ranges.push_back(ImGuiListClipperRange::FromIndices(item_min, item_max));
2814}
2815
2816static bool ImGuiListClipper_StepInternal(ImGuiListClipper* clipper)
2817{
2818 ImGuiContext& g = *clipper->Ctx;
2819 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
2820 ImGuiListClipperData* data = (ImGuiListClipperData*)clipper->TempData;
2821 IM_ASSERT(data != NULL && "Called ImGuiListClipper::Step() too many times, or before ImGuiListClipper::Begin() ?");
2822
2823 ImGuiTable* table = g.CurrentTable;
2824 if (table && table->IsInsideRow)
2825 ImGui::TableEndRow(table);
2826
2827 // No items
2828 if (clipper->ItemsCount == 0 || GetSkipItemForListClipping())
2829 return false;
2830
2831 // While we are in frozen row state, keep displaying items one by one, unclipped
2832 // FIXME: Could be stored as a table-agnostic state.
2833 if (data->StepNo == 0 && table != NULL && !table->IsUnfrozenRows)
2834 {
2835 clipper->DisplayStart = data->ItemsFrozen;
2836 clipper->DisplayEnd = ImMin(data->ItemsFrozen + 1, clipper->ItemsCount);
2837 if (clipper->DisplayStart < clipper->DisplayEnd)
2838 data->ItemsFrozen++;
2839 return true;
2840 }
2841
2842 // Step 0: Let you process the first element (regardless of it being visible or not, so we can measure the element height)
2843 bool calc_clipping = false;
2844 if (data->StepNo == 0)
2845 {
2846 clipper->StartPosY = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
2847 if (clipper->ItemsHeight <= 0.0f)
2848 {
2849 // Submit the first item (or range) so we can measure its height (generally the first range is 0..1)
2850 data->Ranges.push_front(ImGuiListClipperRange::FromIndices(data->ItemsFrozen, data->ItemsFrozen + 1));
2851 clipper->DisplayStart = ImMax(data->Ranges[0].Min, data->ItemsFrozen);
2852 clipper->DisplayEnd = ImMin(data->Ranges[0].Max, clipper->ItemsCount);
2853 data->StepNo = 1;
2854 return true;
2855 }
2856 calc_clipping = true; // If on the first step with known item height, calculate clipping.
2857 }
2858
2859 // Step 1: Let the clipper infer height from first range
2860 if (clipper->ItemsHeight <= 0.0f)
2861 {
2862 IM_ASSERT(data->StepNo == 1);
2863 if (table)
2864 IM_ASSERT(table->RowPosY1 == clipper->StartPosY && table->RowPosY2 == window->DC.CursorPos.y);
2865
2866 clipper->ItemsHeight = (window->DC.CursorPos.y - clipper->StartPosY) / (float)(clipper->DisplayEnd - clipper->DisplayStart);
2867 bool affected_by_floating_point_precision = ImIsFloatAboveGuaranteedIntegerPrecision(clipper->StartPosY) || ImIsFloatAboveGuaranteedIntegerPrecision(window->DC.CursorPos.y);
2868 if (affected_by_floating_point_precision)
2869 clipper->ItemsHeight = window->DC.PrevLineSize.y + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y; // FIXME: Technically wouldn't allow multi-line entries.
2870
2871 IM_ASSERT(clipper->ItemsHeight > 0.0f && "Unable to calculate item height! First item hasn't moved the cursor vertically!");
2872 calc_clipping = true; // If item height had to be calculated, calculate clipping afterwards.
2873 }
2874
2875 // Step 0 or 1: Calculate the actual ranges of visible elements.
2876 const int already_submitted = clipper->DisplayEnd;
2877 if (calc_clipping)
2878 {
2879 if (g.LogEnabled)
2880 {
2881 // If logging is active, do not perform any clipping
2882 data->Ranges.push_back(ImGuiListClipperRange::FromIndices(0, clipper->ItemsCount));
2883 }
2884 else
2885 {
2886 // Add range selected to be included for navigation
2887 const bool is_nav_request = (g.NavMoveScoringItems && g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->RootWindowForNav == window->RootWindowForNav);
2888 if (is_nav_request)
2889 data->Ranges.push_back(ImGuiListClipperRange::FromPositions(g.NavScoringNoClipRect.Min.y, g.NavScoringNoClipRect.Max.y, 0, 0));
2890 if (is_nav_request && (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing) && g.NavTabbingDir == -1)
2891 data->Ranges.push_back(ImGuiListClipperRange::FromIndices(clipper->ItemsCount - 1, clipper->ItemsCount));
2892
2893 // Add focused/active item
2894 ImRect nav_rect_abs = ImGui::WindowRectRelToAbs(window, window->NavRectRel[0]);
2895 if (g.NavId != 0 && window->NavLastIds[0] == g.NavId)
2896 data->Ranges.push_back(ImGuiListClipperRange::FromPositions(nav_rect_abs.Min.y, nav_rect_abs.Max.y, 0, 0));
2897
2898 // Add visible range
2899 const int off_min = (is_nav_request && g.NavMoveClipDir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? -1 : 0;
2900 const int off_max = (is_nav_request && g.NavMoveClipDir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? 1 : 0;
2901 data->Ranges.push_back(ImGuiListClipperRange::FromPositions(window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y, off_min, off_max));
2902 }
2903
2904 // Convert position ranges to item index ranges
2905 // - Very important: when a starting position is after our maximum item, we set Min to (ItemsCount - 1). This allows us to handle most forms of wrapping.
2906 // - Due to how Selectable extra padding they tend to be "unaligned" with exact unit in the item list,
2907 // which with the flooring/ceiling tend to lead to 2 items instead of one being submitted.
2908 for (int i = 0; i < data->Ranges.Size; i++)
2909 if (data->Ranges[i].PosToIndexConvert)
2910 {
2911 int m1 = (int)(((double)data->Ranges[i].Min - window->DC.CursorPos.y - data->LossynessOffset) / clipper->ItemsHeight);
2912 int m2 = (int)((((double)data->Ranges[i].Max - window->DC.CursorPos.y - data->LossynessOffset) / clipper->ItemsHeight) + 0.999999f);
2913 data->Ranges[i].Min = ImClamp(already_submitted + m1 + data->Ranges[i].PosToIndexOffsetMin, already_submitted, clipper->ItemsCount - 1);
2914 data->Ranges[i].Max = ImClamp(already_submitted + m2 + data->Ranges[i].PosToIndexOffsetMax, data->Ranges[i].Min + 1, clipper->ItemsCount);
2915 data->Ranges[i].PosToIndexConvert = false;
2916 }
2917 ImGuiListClipper_SortAndFuseRanges(data->Ranges, data->StepNo);
2918 }
2919
2920 // Step 0+ (if item height is given in advance) or 1+: Display the next range in line.
2921 if (data->StepNo < data->Ranges.Size)
2922 {
2923 clipper->DisplayStart = ImMax(data->Ranges[data->StepNo].Min, already_submitted);
2924 clipper->DisplayEnd = ImMin(data->Ranges[data->StepNo].Max, clipper->ItemsCount);
2925 if (clipper->DisplayStart > already_submitted) //-V1051
2926 ImGuiListClipper_SeekCursorForItem(clipper, clipper->DisplayStart);
2927 data->StepNo++;
2928 return true;
2929 }
2930
2931 // After the last step: Let the clipper validate that we have reached the expected Y position (corresponding to element DisplayEnd),
2932 // Advance the cursor to the end of the list and then returns 'false' to end the loop.
2933 if (clipper->ItemsCount < INT_MAX)
2934 ImGuiListClipper_SeekCursorForItem(clipper, clipper->ItemsCount);
2935
2936 return false;
2937}
2938
2939bool ImGuiListClipper::Step()
2940{
2941 ImGuiContext& g = *Ctx;
2942 bool need_items_height = (ItemsHeight <= 0.0f);
2943 bool ret = ImGuiListClipper_StepInternal(this);
2944 if (ret && (DisplayStart == DisplayEnd))
2945 ret = false;
2946 if (g.CurrentTable && g.CurrentTable->IsUnfrozenRows == false)
2947 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_CLIPPER("Clipper: Step(): inside frozen table row.\n");
2948 if (need_items_height && ItemsHeight > 0.0f)
2949 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_CLIPPER("Clipper: Step(): computed ItemsHeight: %.2f.\n", ItemsHeight);
2950 if (ret)
2951 {
2952 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_CLIPPER("Clipper: Step(): display %d to %d.\n", DisplayStart, DisplayEnd);
2953 }
2954 else
2955 {
2956 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_CLIPPER("Clipper: Step(): End.\n");
2957 End();
2958 }
2959 return ret;
2960}
2961
2962//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2963// [SECTION] STYLING
2964//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2965
2966ImGuiStyle& ImGui::GetStyle()
2967{
2968 IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
2969 return GImGui->Style;
2970}
2971
2972ImU32 ImGui::GetColorU32(ImGuiCol idx, float alpha_mul)
2973{
2974 ImGuiStyle& style = GImGui->Style;
2975 ImVec4 c = style.Colors[idx];
2976 c.w *= style.Alpha * alpha_mul;
2977 return ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(c);
2978}
2979
2980ImU32 ImGui::GetColorU32(const ImVec4& col)
2981{
2982 ImGuiStyle& style = GImGui->Style;
2983 ImVec4 c = col;
2984 c.w *= style.Alpha;
2985 return ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(c);
2986}
2987
2988const ImVec4& ImGui::GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol idx)
2989{
2990 ImGuiStyle& style = GImGui->Style;
2991 return style.Colors[idx];
2992}
2993
2994ImU32 ImGui::GetColorU32(ImU32 col)
2995{
2996 ImGuiStyle& style = GImGui->Style;
2997 if (style.Alpha >= 1.0f)
2998 return col;
2999 ImU32 a = (col & IM_COL32_A_MASK) >> IM_COL32_A_SHIFT;
3000 a = (ImU32)(a * style.Alpha); // We don't need to clamp 0..255 because Style.Alpha is in 0..1 range.
3001 return (col & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK) | (a << IM_COL32_A_SHIFT);
3002}
3003
3004// FIXME: This may incur a round-trip (if the end user got their data from a float4) but eventually we aim to store the in-flight colors as ImU32
3005void ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx, ImU32 col)
3006{
3007 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3008 ImGuiColorMod backup;
3009 backup.Col = idx;
3010 backup.BackupValue = g.Style.Colors[idx];
3011 g.ColorStack.push_back(backup);
3012 g.Style.Colors[idx] = ColorConvertU32ToFloat4(col);
3013}
3014
3015void ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx, const ImVec4& col)
3016{
3017 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3018 ImGuiColorMod backup;
3019 backup.Col = idx;
3020 backup.BackupValue = g.Style.Colors[idx];
3021 g.ColorStack.push_back(backup);
3022 g.Style.Colors[idx] = col;
3023}
3024
3025void ImGui::PopStyleColor(int count)
3026{
3027 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3028 if (g.ColorStack.Size < count)
3029 {
3030 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.ColorStack.Size > count, "Calling PopStyleColor() too many times: stack underflow.");
3031 count = g.ColorStack.Size;
3032 }
3033 while (count > 0)
3034 {
3035 ImGuiColorMod& backup = g.ColorStack.back();
3036 g.Style.Colors[backup.Col] = backup.BackupValue;
3037 g.ColorStack.pop_back();
3038 count--;
3039 }
3040}
3041
3042static const ImGuiDataVarInfo GStyleVarInfo[] =
3043{
3044 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, Alpha) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha
3045 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, DisabledAlpha) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_DisabledAlpha
3046 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, WindowPadding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding
3047 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, WindowRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding
3048 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, WindowBorderSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_WindowBorderSize
3049 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, WindowMinSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_WindowMinSize
3050 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, WindowTitleAlign) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_WindowTitleAlign
3051 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ChildRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding
3052 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ChildBorderSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize
3053 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, PopupRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_PopupRounding
3054 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, PopupBorderSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_PopupBorderSize
3055 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, FramePadding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding
3056 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, FrameRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_FrameRounding
3057 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, FrameBorderSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_FrameBorderSize
3058 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ItemSpacing) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing
3059 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ItemInnerSpacing) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ItemInnerSpacing
3060 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, IndentSpacing) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing
3061 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, CellPadding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_CellPadding
3062 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ScrollbarSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarSize
3063 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ScrollbarRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarRounding
3064 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, GrabMinSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_GrabMinSize
3065 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, GrabRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_GrabRounding
3066 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, TabRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_TabRounding
3067 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ButtonTextAlign) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ButtonTextAlign
3068 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, SelectableTextAlign) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_SelectableTextAlign
3069 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, SeparatorTextBorderSize) },// ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextBorderSize
3070 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, SeparatorTextAlign) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextAlign
3071 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, SeparatorTextPadding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextPadding
3072};
3073
3074const ImGuiDataVarInfo* ImGui::GetStyleVarInfo(ImGuiStyleVar idx)
3075{
3076 IM_ASSERT(idx >= 0 && idx < ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT);
3077 IM_STATIC_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(GStyleVarInfo) == ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT);
3078 return &GStyleVarInfo[idx];
3079}
3080
3081void ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar idx, float val)
3082{
3083 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3084 const ImGuiDataVarInfo* var_info = GetStyleVarInfo(idx);
3085 if (var_info->Type == ImGuiDataType_Float && var_info->Count == 1)
3086 {
3087 float* pvar = (float*)var_info->GetVarPtr(&g.Style);
3088 g.StyleVarStack.push_back(ImGuiStyleMod(idx, *pvar));
3089 *pvar = val;
3090 return;
3091 }
3092 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(0, "Called PushStyleVar() variant with wrong type!");
3093}
3094
3095void ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar idx, const ImVec2& val)
3096{
3097 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3098 const ImGuiDataVarInfo* var_info = GetStyleVarInfo(idx);
3099 if (var_info->Type == ImGuiDataType_Float && var_info->Count == 2)
3100 {
3101 ImVec2* pvar = (ImVec2*)var_info->GetVarPtr(&g.Style);
3102 g.StyleVarStack.push_back(ImGuiStyleMod(idx, *pvar));
3103 *pvar = val;
3104 return;
3105 }
3106 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(0, "Called PushStyleVar() variant with wrong type!");
3107}
3108
3109void ImGui::PopStyleVar(int count)
3110{
3111 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3112 if (g.StyleVarStack.Size < count)
3113 {
3114 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.StyleVarStack.Size > count, "Calling PopStyleVar() too many times: stack underflow.");
3115 count = g.StyleVarStack.Size;
3116 }
3117 while (count > 0)
3118 {
3119 // We avoid a generic memcpy(data, &backup.Backup.., GDataTypeSize[info->Type] * info->Count), the overhead in Debug is not worth it.
3120 ImGuiStyleMod& backup = g.StyleVarStack.back();
3121 const ImGuiDataVarInfo* info = GetStyleVarInfo(backup.VarIdx);
3122 void* data = info->GetVarPtr(&g.Style);
3123 if (info->Type == ImGuiDataType_Float && info->Count == 1) { ((float*)data)[0] = backup.BackupFloat[0]; }
3124 else if (info->Type == ImGuiDataType_Float && info->Count == 2) { ((float*)data)[0] = backup.BackupFloat[0]; ((float*)data)[1] = backup.BackupFloat[1]; }
3125 g.StyleVarStack.pop_back();
3126 count--;
3127 }
3128}
3129
3130const char* ImGui::GetStyleColorName(ImGuiCol idx)
3131{
3132 // Create switch-case from enum with regexp: ImGuiCol_{.*}, --> case ImGuiCol_\1: return "\1";
3133 switch (idx)
3134 {
3135 case ImGuiCol_Text: return "Text";
3136 case ImGuiCol_TextDisabled: return "TextDisabled";
3137 case ImGuiCol_WindowBg: return "WindowBg";
3138 case ImGuiCol_ChildBg: return "ChildBg";
3139 case ImGuiCol_PopupBg: return "PopupBg";
3140 case ImGuiCol_Border: return "Border";
3141 case ImGuiCol_BorderShadow: return "BorderShadow";
3142 case ImGuiCol_FrameBg: return "FrameBg";
3143 case ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered: return "FrameBgHovered";
3144 case ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive: return "FrameBgActive";
3145 case ImGuiCol_TitleBg: return "TitleBg";
3146 case ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive: return "TitleBgActive";
3147 case ImGuiCol_TitleBgCollapsed: return "TitleBgCollapsed";
3148 case ImGuiCol_MenuBarBg: return "MenuBarBg";
3149 case ImGuiCol_ScrollbarBg: return "ScrollbarBg";
3150 case ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrab: return "ScrollbarGrab";
3151 case ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabHovered: return "ScrollbarGrabHovered";
3152 case ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabActive: return "ScrollbarGrabActive";
3153 case ImGuiCol_CheckMark: return "CheckMark";
3154 case ImGuiCol_SliderGrab: return "SliderGrab";
3155 case ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive: return "SliderGrabActive";
3156 case ImGuiCol_Button: return "Button";
3157 case ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered: return "ButtonHovered";
3158 case ImGuiCol_ButtonActive: return "ButtonActive";
3159 case ImGuiCol_Header: return "Header";
3160 case ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered: return "HeaderHovered";
3161 case ImGuiCol_HeaderActive: return "HeaderActive";
3162 case ImGuiCol_Separator: return "Separator";
3163 case ImGuiCol_SeparatorHovered: return "SeparatorHovered";
3164 case ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive: return "SeparatorActive";
3165 case ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip: return "ResizeGrip";
3166 case ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered: return "ResizeGripHovered";
3167 case ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive: return "ResizeGripActive";
3168 case ImGuiCol_Tab: return "Tab";
3169 case ImGuiCol_TabHovered: return "TabHovered";
3170 case ImGuiCol_TabActive: return "TabActive";
3171 case ImGuiCol_TabUnfocused: return "TabUnfocused";
3172 case ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive: return "TabUnfocusedActive";
3173 case ImGuiCol_PlotLines: return "PlotLines";
3174 case ImGuiCol_PlotLinesHovered: return "PlotLinesHovered";
3175 case ImGuiCol_PlotHistogram: return "PlotHistogram";
3176 case ImGuiCol_PlotHistogramHovered: return "PlotHistogramHovered";
3177 case ImGuiCol_TableHeaderBg: return "TableHeaderBg";
3178 case ImGuiCol_TableBorderStrong: return "TableBorderStrong";
3179 case ImGuiCol_TableBorderLight: return "TableBorderLight";
3180 case ImGuiCol_TableRowBg: return "TableRowBg";
3181 case ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt: return "TableRowBgAlt";
3182 case ImGuiCol_TextSelectedBg: return "TextSelectedBg";
3183 case ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget: return "DragDropTarget";
3184 case ImGuiCol_NavHighlight: return "NavHighlight";
3185 case ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight: return "NavWindowingHighlight";
3186 case ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg: return "NavWindowingDimBg";
3187 case ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg: return "ModalWindowDimBg";
3188 }
3189 IM_ASSERT(0);
3190 return "Unknown";
3191}
3192
3193
3194//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3195// [SECTION] RENDER HELPERS
3196// Some of those (internal) functions are currently quite a legacy mess - their signature and behavior will change,
3197// we need a nicer separation between low-level functions and high-level functions relying on the ImGui context.
3198// Also see imgui_draw.cpp for some more which have been reworked to not rely on ImGui:: context.
3199//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3200
3201const char* ImGui::FindRenderedTextEnd(const char* text, const char* text_end)
3202{
3203 const char* text_display_end = text;
3204 if (!text_end)
3205 text_end = (const char*)-1;
3206
3207 while (text_display_end < text_end && *text_display_end != '\0' && (text_display_end[0] != '#' || text_display_end[1] != '#'))
3208 text_display_end++;
3209 return text_display_end;
3210}
3211
3212// Internal ImGui functions to render text
3213// RenderText***() functions calls ImDrawList::AddText() calls ImBitmapFont::RenderText()
3214void ImGui::RenderText(ImVec2 pos, const char* text, const char* text_end, bool hide_text_after_hash)
3215{
3216 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3217 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3218
3219 // Hide anything after a '##' string
3220 const char* text_display_end;
3221 if (hide_text_after_hash)
3222 {
3223 text_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end);
3224 }
3225 else
3226 {
3227 if (!text_end)
3228 text_end = text + strlen(text); // FIXME-OPT
3229 text_display_end = text_end;
3230 }
3231
3232 if (text != text_display_end)
3233 {
3234 window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize, pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), text, text_display_end);
3235 if (g.LogEnabled)
3236 LogRenderedText(&pos, text, text_display_end);
3237 }
3238}
3239
3240void ImGui::RenderTextWrapped(ImVec2 pos, const char* text, const char* text_end, float wrap_width)
3241{
3242 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3243 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3244
3245 if (!text_end)
3246 text_end = text + strlen(text); // FIXME-OPT
3247
3248 if (text != text_end)
3249 {
3250 window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize, pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), text, text_end, wrap_width);
3251 if (g.LogEnabled)
3252 LogRenderedText(&pos, text, text_end);
3253 }
3254}
3255
3256// Default clip_rect uses (pos_min,pos_max)
3257// Handle clipping on CPU immediately (vs typically let the GPU clip the triangles that are overlapping the clipping rectangle edges)
3258// FIXME-OPT: Since we have or calculate text_size we could coarse clip whole block immediately, especally for text above draw_list->DrawList.
3259// Effectively as this is called from widget doing their own coarse clipping it's not very valuable presently. Next time function will take
3260// better advantage of the render function taking size into account for coarse clipping.
3261void ImGui::RenderTextClippedEx(ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImVec2& pos_min, const ImVec2& pos_max, const char* text, const char* text_display_end, const ImVec2* text_size_if_known, const ImVec2& align, const ImRect* clip_rect)
3262{
3263 // Perform CPU side clipping for single clipped element to avoid using scissor state
3264 ImVec2 pos = pos_min;
3265 const ImVec2 text_size = text_size_if_known ? *text_size_if_known : CalcTextSize(text, text_display_end, false, 0.0f);
3266
3267 const ImVec2* clip_min = clip_rect ? &clip_rect->Min : &pos_min;
3268 const ImVec2* clip_max = clip_rect ? &clip_rect->Max : &pos_max;
3269 bool need_clipping = (pos.x + text_size.x >= clip_max->x) || (pos.y + text_size.y >= clip_max->y);
3270 if (clip_rect) // If we had no explicit clipping rectangle then pos==clip_min
3271 need_clipping |= (pos.x < clip_min->x) || (pos.y < clip_min->y);
3272
3273 // Align whole block. We should defer that to the better rendering function when we'll have support for individual line alignment.
3274 if (align.x > 0.0f) pos.x = ImMax(pos.x, pos.x + (pos_max.x - pos.x - text_size.x) * align.x);
3275 if (align.y > 0.0f) pos.y = ImMax(pos.y, pos.y + (pos_max.y - pos.y - text_size.y) * align.y);
3276
3277 // Render
3278 if (need_clipping)
3279 {
3280 ImVec4 fine_clip_rect(clip_min->x, clip_min->y, clip_max->x, clip_max->y);
3281 draw_list->AddText(NULL, 0.0f, pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), text, text_display_end, 0.0f, &fine_clip_rect);
3282 }
3283 else
3284 {
3285 draw_list->AddText(NULL, 0.0f, pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), text, text_display_end, 0.0f, NULL);
3286 }
3287}
3288
3289void ImGui::RenderTextClipped(const ImVec2& pos_min, const ImVec2& pos_max, const char* text, const char* text_end, const ImVec2* text_size_if_known, const ImVec2& align, const ImRect* clip_rect)
3290{
3291 // Hide anything after a '##' string
3292 const char* text_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end);
3293 const int text_len = (int)(text_display_end - text);
3294 if (text_len == 0)
3295 return;
3296
3297 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3298 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3299 RenderTextClippedEx(window->DrawList, pos_min, pos_max, text, text_display_end, text_size_if_known, align, clip_rect);
3300 if (g.LogEnabled)
3301 LogRenderedText(&pos_min, text, text_display_end);
3302}
3303
3304// Another overly complex function until we reorganize everything into a nice all-in-one helper.
3305// This is made more complex because we have dissociated the layout rectangle (pos_min..pos_max) which define _where_ the ellipsis is, from actual clipping of text and limit of the ellipsis display.
3306// This is because in the context of tabs we selectively hide part of the text when the Close Button appears, but we don't want the ellipsis to move.
3307void ImGui::RenderTextEllipsis(ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImVec2& pos_min, const ImVec2& pos_max, float clip_max_x, float ellipsis_max_x, const char* text, const char* text_end_full, const ImVec2* text_size_if_known)
3308{
3309 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3310 if (text_end_full == NULL)
3311 text_end_full = FindRenderedTextEnd(text);
3312 const ImVec2 text_size = text_size_if_known ? *text_size_if_known : CalcTextSize(text, text_end_full, false, 0.0f);
3313
3314 //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(pos_max.x, pos_min.y - 4), ImVec2(pos_max.x, pos_max.y + 4), IM_COL32(0, 0, 255, 255));
3315 //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(ellipsis_max_x, pos_min.y-2), ImVec2(ellipsis_max_x, pos_max.y+2), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
3316 //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_min.y), ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));
3317 // FIXME: We could technically remove (last_glyph->AdvanceX - last_glyph->X1) from text_size.x here and save a few pixels.
3318 if (text_size.x > pos_max.x - pos_min.x)
3319 {
3320 // Hello wo...
3321 // | | |
3322 // min max ellipsis_max
3323 // <-> this is generally some padding value
3324
3325 const ImFont* font = draw_list->_Data->Font;
3326 const float font_size = draw_list->_Data->FontSize;
3327 const float font_scale = font_size / font->FontSize;
3328 const char* text_end_ellipsis = NULL;
3329 const float ellipsis_width = font->EllipsisWidth * font_scale;
3330
3331 // We can now claim the space between pos_max.x and ellipsis_max.x
3332 const float text_avail_width = ImMax((ImMax(pos_max.x, ellipsis_max_x) - ellipsis_width) - pos_min.x, 1.0f);
3333 float text_size_clipped_x = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, text_avail_width, 0.0f, text, text_end_full, &text_end_ellipsis).x;
3334 if (text == text_end_ellipsis && text_end_ellipsis < text_end_full)
3335 {
3336 // Always display at least 1 character if there's no room for character + ellipsis
3337 text_end_ellipsis = text + ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromChar(text, text_end_full);
3338 text_size_clipped_x = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, 0.0f, text, text_end_ellipsis).x;
3339 }
3340 while (text_end_ellipsis > text && ImCharIsBlankA(text_end_ellipsis[-1]))
3341 {
3342 // Trim trailing space before ellipsis (FIXME: Supporting non-ascii blanks would be nice, for this we need a function to backtrack in UTF-8 text)
3343 text_end_ellipsis--;
3344 text_size_clipped_x -= font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, 0.0f, text_end_ellipsis, text_end_ellipsis + 1).x; // Ascii blanks are always 1 byte
3345 }
3346
3347 // Render text, render ellipsis
3348 RenderTextClippedEx(draw_list, pos_min, ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), text, text_end_ellipsis, &text_size, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
3349 ImVec2 ellipsis_pos = ImFloor(ImVec2(pos_min.x + text_size_clipped_x, pos_min.y));
3350 if (ellipsis_pos.x + ellipsis_width <= ellipsis_max_x)
3351 for (int i = 0; i < font->EllipsisCharCount; i++, ellipsis_pos.x += font->EllipsisCharStep * font_scale)
3352 font->RenderChar(draw_list, font_size, ellipsis_pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), font->EllipsisChar);
3353 }
3354 else
3355 {
3356 RenderTextClippedEx(draw_list, pos_min, ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), text, text_end_full, &text_size, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
3357 }
3358
3359 if (g.LogEnabled)
3360 LogRenderedText(&pos_min, text, text_end_full);
3361}
3362
3363// Render a rectangle shaped with optional rounding and borders
3364void ImGui::RenderFrame(ImVec2 p_min, ImVec2 p_max, ImU32 fill_col, bool border, float rounding)
3365{
3366 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3367 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3368 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(p_min, p_max, fill_col, rounding);
3369 const float border_size = g.Style.FrameBorderSize;
3370 if (border && border_size > 0.0f)
3371 {
3372 window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min + ImVec2(1, 1), p_max + ImVec2(1, 1), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_BorderShadow), rounding, 0, border_size);
3373 window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min, p_max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, 0, border_size);
3374 }
3375}
3376
3377void ImGui::RenderFrameBorder(ImVec2 p_min, ImVec2 p_max, float rounding)
3378{
3379 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3380 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3381 const float border_size = g.Style.FrameBorderSize;
3382 if (border_size > 0.0f)
3383 {
3384 window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min + ImVec2(1, 1), p_max + ImVec2(1, 1), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_BorderShadow), rounding, 0, border_size);
3385 window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min, p_max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, 0, border_size);
3386 }
3387}
3388
3389void ImGui::RenderNavHighlight(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags flags)
3390{
3391 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3392 if (id != g.NavId)
3393 return;
3394 if (g.NavDisableHighlight && !(flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_AlwaysDraw))
3395 return;
3396 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3397 if (window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame)
3398 return;
3399
3400 float rounding = (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_NoRounding) ? 0.0f : g.Style.FrameRounding;
3401 ImRect display_rect = bb;
3402 display_rect.ClipWith(window->ClipRect);
3403 if (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeDefault)
3404 {
3405 const float THICKNESS = 2.0f;
3406 const float DISTANCE = 3.0f + THICKNESS * 0.5f;
3407 display_rect.Expand(ImVec2(DISTANCE, DISTANCE));
3408 bool fully_visible = window->ClipRect.Contains(display_rect);
3409 if (!fully_visible)
3410 window->DrawList->PushClipRect(display_rect.Min, display_rect.Max);
3411 window->DrawList->AddRect(display_rect.Min + ImVec2(THICKNESS * 0.5f, THICKNESS * 0.5f), display_rect.Max - ImVec2(THICKNESS * 0.5f, THICKNESS * 0.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavHighlight), rounding, 0, THICKNESS);
3412 if (!fully_visible)
3413 window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
3414 }
3415 if (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin)
3416 {
3417 window->DrawList->AddRect(display_rect.Min, display_rect.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavHighlight), rounding, 0, 1.0f);
3418 }
3419}
3420
3421void ImGui::RenderMouseCursor(ImVec2 base_pos, float base_scale, ImGuiMouseCursor mouse_cursor, ImU32 col_fill, ImU32 col_border, ImU32 col_shadow)
3422{
3423 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3424 IM_ASSERT(mouse_cursor > ImGuiMouseCursor_None && mouse_cursor < ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT);
3425 ImFontAtlas* font_atlas = g.DrawListSharedData.Font->ContainerAtlas;
3426 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
3427 {
3428 // We scale cursor with current viewport/monitor, however Windows 10 for its own hardware cursor seems to be using a different scale factor.
3429 ImVec2 offset, size, uv[4];
3430 if (!font_atlas->GetMouseCursorTexData(mouse_cursor, &offset, &size, &uv[0], &uv[2]))
3431 continue;
3432 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
3433 const ImVec2 pos = base_pos - offset;
3434 const float scale = base_scale;
3435 if (!viewport->GetMainRect().Overlaps(ImRect(pos, pos + ImVec2(size.x + 2, size.y + 2) * scale)))
3436 continue;
3437 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(viewport);
3438 ImTextureID tex_id = font_atlas->TexID;
3439 draw_list->PushTextureID(tex_id);
3440 draw_list->AddImage(tex_id, pos + ImVec2(1, 0) * scale, pos + (ImVec2(1, 0) + size) * scale, uv[2], uv[3], col_shadow);
3441 draw_list->AddImage(tex_id, pos + ImVec2(2, 0) * scale, pos + (ImVec2(2, 0) + size) * scale, uv[2], uv[3], col_shadow);
3442 draw_list->AddImage(tex_id, pos, pos + size * scale, uv[2], uv[3], col_border);
3443 draw_list->AddImage(tex_id, pos, pos + size * scale, uv[0], uv[1], col_fill);
3444 draw_list->PopTextureID();
3445 }
3446}
3447
3448//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3449// [SECTION] INITIALIZATION, SHUTDOWN
3450//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3451
3452// Internal state access - if you want to share Dear ImGui state between modules (e.g. DLL) or allocate it yourself
3453// Note that we still point to some static data and members (such as GFontAtlas), so the state instance you end up using will point to the static data within its module
3454ImGuiContext* ImGui::GetCurrentContext()
3455{
3456 return GImGui;
3457}
3458
3459void ImGui::SetCurrentContext(ImGuiContext* ctx)
3460{
3461#ifdef IMGUI_SET_CURRENT_CONTEXT_FUNC
3462 IMGUI_SET_CURRENT_CONTEXT_FUNC(ctx); // For custom thread-based hackery you may want to have control over this.
3463#else
3464 GImGui = ctx;
3465#endif
3466}
3467
3468void ImGui::SetAllocatorFunctions(ImGuiMemAllocFunc alloc_func, ImGuiMemFreeFunc free_func, void* user_data)
3469{
3470 GImAllocatorAllocFunc = alloc_func;
3471 GImAllocatorFreeFunc = free_func;
3472 GImAllocatorUserData = user_data;
3473}
3474
3475// This is provided to facilitate copying allocators from one static/DLL boundary to another (e.g. retrieve default allocator of your executable address space)
3476void ImGui::GetAllocatorFunctions(ImGuiMemAllocFunc* p_alloc_func, ImGuiMemFreeFunc* p_free_func, void** p_user_data)
3477{
3478 *p_alloc_func = GImAllocatorAllocFunc;
3479 *p_free_func = GImAllocatorFreeFunc;
3480 *p_user_data = GImAllocatorUserData;
3481}
3482
3483ImGuiContext* ImGui::CreateContext(ImFontAtlas* shared_font_atlas)
3484{
3485 ImGuiContext* prev_ctx = GetCurrentContext();
3486 ImGuiContext* ctx = IM_NEW(ImGuiContext)(shared_font_atlas);
3487 SetCurrentContext(ctx);
3488 Initialize();
3489 if (prev_ctx != NULL)
3490 SetCurrentContext(prev_ctx); // Restore previous context if any, else keep new one.
3491 return ctx;
3492}
3493
3494void ImGui::DestroyContext(ImGuiContext* ctx)
3495{
3496 ImGuiContext* prev_ctx = GetCurrentContext();
3497 if (ctx == NULL) //-V1051
3498 ctx = prev_ctx;
3499 SetCurrentContext(ctx);
3500 Shutdown();
3501 SetCurrentContext((prev_ctx != ctx) ? prev_ctx : NULL);
3502 IM_DELETE(ctx);
3503}
3504
3505// IMPORTANT: ###xxx suffixes must be same in ALL languages
3506static const ImGuiLocEntry GLocalizationEntriesEnUS[] =
3507{
3508 { ImGuiLocKey_TableSizeOne, "Size column to fit###SizeOne" },
3509 { ImGuiLocKey_TableSizeAllFit, "Size all columns to fit###SizeAll" },
3510 { ImGuiLocKey_TableSizeAllDefault, "Size all columns to default###SizeAll" },
3511 { ImGuiLocKey_TableResetOrder, "Reset order###ResetOrder" },
3512 { ImGuiLocKey_WindowingMainMenuBar, "(Main menu bar)" },
3513 { ImGuiLocKey_WindowingPopup, "(Popup)" },
3514 { ImGuiLocKey_WindowingUntitled, "(Untitled)" },
3515};
3516
3517void ImGui::Initialize()
3518{
3519 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3520 IM_ASSERT(!g.Initialized && !g.SettingsLoaded);
3521
3522 // Add .ini handle for ImGuiWindow and ImGuiTable types
3523 {
3524 ImGuiSettingsHandler ini_handler;
3525 ini_handler.TypeName = "Window";
3526 ini_handler.TypeHash = ImHashStr("Window");
3527 ini_handler.ClearAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ClearAll;
3528 ini_handler.ReadOpenFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ReadOpen;
3529 ini_handler.ReadLineFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ReadLine;
3530 ini_handler.ApplyAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ApplyAll;
3531 ini_handler.WriteAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_WriteAll;
3532 AddSettingsHandler(&ini_handler);
3533 }
3534 TableSettingsAddSettingsHandler();
3535
3536 // Setup default localization table
3537 LocalizeRegisterEntries(GLocalizationEntriesEnUS, IM_ARRAYSIZE(GLocalizationEntriesEnUS));
3538
3539 // Setup default platform clipboard/IME handlers.
3540 g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn = GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl; // Platform dependent default implementations
3541 g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn = SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl;
3542 g.IO.ClipboardUserData = (void*)&g; // Default implementation use the ImGuiContext as user data (ideally those would be arguments to the function)
3543 g.IO.SetPlatformImeDataFn = SetPlatformImeDataFn_DefaultImpl;
3544
3545 // Create default viewport
3546 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = IM_NEW(ImGuiViewportP)();
3547 g.Viewports.push_back(viewport);
3548 g.TempBuffer.resize(1024 * 3 + 1, 0);
3549
3550#ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
3551#endif
3552
3553 g.Initialized = true;
3554}
3555
3556// This function is merely here to free heap allocations.
3557void ImGui::Shutdown()
3558{
3559 // The fonts atlas can be used prior to calling NewFrame(), so we clear it even if g.Initialized is FALSE (which would happen if we never called NewFrame)
3560 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3561 if (g.IO.Fonts && g.FontAtlasOwnedByContext)
3562 {
3563 g.IO.Fonts->Locked = false;
3564 IM_DELETE(g.IO.Fonts);
3565 }
3566 g.IO.Fonts = NULL;
3567 g.DrawListSharedData.TempBuffer.clear();
3568
3569 // Cleanup of other data are conditional on actually having initialized Dear ImGui.
3570 if (!g.Initialized)
3571 return;
3572
3573 // Save settings (unless we haven't attempted to load them: CreateContext/DestroyContext without a call to NewFrame shouldn't save an empty file)
3574 if (g.SettingsLoaded && g.IO.IniFilename != NULL)
3575 SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
3576
3577 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_Shutdown);
3578
3579 // Clear everything else
3580 g.Windows.clear_delete();
3581 g.WindowsFocusOrder.clear();
3582 g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.clear();
3583 g.CurrentWindow = NULL;
3584 g.CurrentWindowStack.clear();
3585 g.WindowsById.Clear();
3586 g.NavWindow = NULL;
3587 g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = NULL;
3588 g.ActiveIdWindow = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameWindow = NULL;
3589 g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3590
3591 g.KeysRoutingTable.Clear();
3592
3593 g.ColorStack.clear();
3594 g.StyleVarStack.clear();
3595 g.FontStack.clear();
3596 g.OpenPopupStack.clear();
3597 g.BeginPopupStack.clear();
3598
3599 g.Viewports.clear_delete();
3600
3601 g.TabBars.Clear();
3602 g.CurrentTabBarStack.clear();
3603 g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.clear();
3604
3605 g.ClipperTempData.clear_destruct();
3606
3607 g.Tables.Clear();
3608 g.TablesTempData.clear_destruct();
3609 g.DrawChannelsTempMergeBuffer.clear();
3610
3611 g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
3612 g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.clear();
3613 g.InputTextState.ClearFreeMemory();
3614 g.InputTextDeactivatedState.ClearFreeMemory();
3615
3616 g.SettingsWindows.clear();
3617 g.SettingsHandlers.clear();
3618
3619 if (g.LogFile)
3620 {
3621#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
3622 if (g.LogFile != stdout)
3623#endif
3624 ImFileClose(g.LogFile);
3625 g.LogFile = NULL;
3626 }
3627 g.LogBuffer.clear();
3628 g.DebugLogBuf.clear();
3629 g.DebugLogIndex.clear();
3630
3631 g.Initialized = false;
3632}
3633
3634// No specific ordering/dependency support, will see as needed
3635ImGuiID ImGui::AddContextHook(ImGuiContext* ctx, const ImGuiContextHook* hook)
3636{
3637 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3638 IM_ASSERT(hook->Callback != NULL && hook->HookId == 0 && hook->Type != ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_);
3639 g.Hooks.push_back(*hook);
3640 g.Hooks.back().HookId = ++g.HookIdNext;
3641 return g.HookIdNext;
3642}
3643
3644// Deferred removal, avoiding issue with changing vector while iterating it
3645void ImGui::RemoveContextHook(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID hook_id)
3646{
3647 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3648 IM_ASSERT(hook_id != 0);
3649 for (int n = 0; n < g.Hooks.Size; n++)
3650 if (g.Hooks[n].HookId == hook_id)
3651 g.Hooks[n].Type = ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_;
3652}
3653
3654// Call context hooks (used by e.g. test engine)
3655// We assume a small number of hooks so all stored in same array
3656void ImGui::CallContextHooks(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiContextHookType hook_type)
3657{
3658 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3659 for (int n = 0; n < g.Hooks.Size; n++)
3660 if (g.Hooks[n].Type == hook_type)
3661 g.Hooks[n].Callback(&g, &g.Hooks[n]);
3662}
3663
3664
3665//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3666// [SECTION] MAIN CODE (most of the code! lots of stuff, needs tidying up!)
3667//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3668
3669// ImGuiWindow is mostly a dumb struct. It merely has a constructor and a few helper methods
3670ImGuiWindow::ImGuiWindow(ImGuiContext* ctx, const char* name) : DrawListInst(NULL)
3671{
3672 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3673 Ctx = ctx;
3674 Name = ImStrdup(name);
3675 NameBufLen = (int)strlen(name) + 1;
3676 ID = ImHashStr(name);
3677 IDStack.push_back(ID);
3678 MoveId = GetID("#MOVE");
3679 ScrollTarget = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
3680 ScrollTargetCenterRatio = ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f);
3681 AutoFitFramesX = AutoFitFramesY = -1;
3682 AutoPosLastDirection = ImGuiDir_None;
3683 SetWindowPosAllowFlags = SetWindowSizeAllowFlags = SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags = 0;
3684 SetWindowPosVal = SetWindowPosPivot = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
3685 LastFrameActive = -1;
3686 LastTimeActive = -1.0f;
3687 FontWindowScale = 1.0f;
3688 SettingsOffset = -1;
3689 DrawList = &DrawListInst;
3690 DrawList->_Data = &Ctx->DrawListSharedData;
3691 DrawList->_OwnerName = Name;
3692}
3693
3694ImGuiWindow::~ImGuiWindow()
3695{
3696 IM_ASSERT(DrawList == &DrawListInst);
3697 IM_DELETE(Name);
3698 ColumnsStorage.clear_destruct();
3699}
3700
3701ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetID(const char* str, const char* str_end)
3702{
3703 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3704 ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(str, str_end ? (str_end - str) : 0, seed);
3705 ImGuiContext& g = *Ctx;
3706 if (g.DebugHookIdInfo == id)
3707 ImGui::DebugHookIdInfo(id, ImGuiDataType_String, str, str_end);
3708 return id;
3709}
3710
3711ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetID(const void* ptr)
3712{
3713 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3714 ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&ptr, sizeof(void*), seed);
3715 ImGuiContext& g = *Ctx;
3716 if (g.DebugHookIdInfo == id)
3717 ImGui::DebugHookIdInfo(id, ImGuiDataType_Pointer, ptr, NULL);
3718 return id;
3719}
3720
3721ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetID(int n)
3722{
3723 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3724 ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(n), seed);
3725 ImGuiContext& g = *Ctx;
3726 if (g.DebugHookIdInfo == id)
3727 ImGui::DebugHookIdInfo(id, ImGuiDataType_S32, (void*)(intptr_t)n, NULL);
3728 return id;
3729}
3730
3731// This is only used in rare/specific situations to manufacture an ID out of nowhere.
3732ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetIDFromRectangle(const ImRect& r_abs)
3733{
3734 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3735 ImRect r_rel = ImGui::WindowRectAbsToRel(this, r_abs);
3736 ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&r_rel, sizeof(r_rel), seed);
3737 return id;
3738}
3739
3740static void SetCurrentWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
3741{
3742 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3743 g.CurrentWindow = window;
3744 g.CurrentTable = window && window->DC.CurrentTableIdx != -1 ? g.Tables.GetByIndex(window->DC.CurrentTableIdx) : NULL;
3745 if (window)
3746 g.FontSize = g.DrawListSharedData.FontSize = window->CalcFontSize();
3747}
3748
3749void ImGui::GcCompactTransientMiscBuffers()
3750{
3751 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3752 g.ItemFlagsStack.clear();
3753 g.GroupStack.clear();
3754 TableGcCompactSettings();
3755}
3756
3757// Free up/compact internal window buffers, we can use this when a window becomes unused.
3758// Not freed:
3759// - ImGuiWindow, ImGuiWindowSettings, Name, StateStorage, ColumnsStorage (may hold useful data)
3760// This should have no noticeable visual effect. When the window reappear however, expect new allocation/buffer growth/copy cost.
3761void ImGui::GcCompactTransientWindowBuffers(ImGuiWindow* window)
3762{
3763 window->MemoryCompacted = true;
3764 window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity = window->DrawList->IdxBuffer.Capacity;
3765 window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity = window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.Capacity;
3766 window->IDStack.clear();
3767 window->DrawList->_ClearFreeMemory();
3768 window->DC.ChildWindows.clear();
3769 window->DC.ItemWidthStack.clear();
3770 window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.clear();
3771}
3772
3773void ImGui::GcAwakeTransientWindowBuffers(ImGuiWindow* window)
3774{
3775 // We stored capacity of the ImDrawList buffer to reduce growth-caused allocation/copy when awakening.
3776 // The other buffers tends to amortize much faster.
3777 window->MemoryCompacted = false;
3778 window->DrawList->IdxBuffer.reserve(window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity);
3779 window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.reserve(window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity);
3780 window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity = window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity = 0;
3781}
3782
3783void ImGui::SetActiveID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindow* window)
3784{
3785 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3786
3787 // Clear previous active id
3788 if (g.ActiveId != 0)
3789 {
3790 // While most behaved code would make an effort to not steal active id during window move/drag operations,
3791 // we at least need to be resilient to it. Canceling the move is rather aggressive and users of 'master' branch
3792 // may prefer the weird ill-defined half working situation ('docking' did assert), so may need to rework that.
3793 if (g.MovingWindow != NULL && g.ActiveId == g.MovingWindow->MoveId)
3794 {
3795 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_ACTIVEID("SetActiveID() cancel MovingWindow\n");
3796 g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3797 }
3798
3799 // This could be written in a more general way (e.g associate a hook to ActiveId),
3800 // but since this is currently quite an exception we'll leave it as is.
3801 // One common scenario leading to this is: pressing Key ->NavMoveRequestApplyResult() -> ClearActiveId()
3802 if (g.InputTextState.ID == g.ActiveId)
3803 InputTextDeactivateHook(g.ActiveId);
3804 }
3805
3806 // Set active id
3807 g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated = (g.ActiveId != id);
3808 if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
3809 {
3810 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_ACTIVEID("SetActiveID() old:0x%08X (window \"%s\") -> new:0x%08X (window \"%s\")\n", g.ActiveId, g.ActiveIdWindow ? g.ActiveIdWindow->Name : "", id, window ? window->Name : "");
3811 g.ActiveIdTimer = 0.0f;
3812 g.ActiveIdHasBeenPressedBefore = false;
3813 g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore = false;
3814 g.ActiveIdMouseButton = -1;
3815 if (id != 0)
3816 {
3817 g.LastActiveId = id;
3818 g.LastActiveIdTimer = 0.0f;
3819 }
3820 }
3821 g.ActiveId = id;
3822 g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = false;
3823 g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = false;
3824 g.ActiveIdWindow = window;
3825 g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = false;
3826 if (id)
3827 {
3828 g.ActiveIdIsAlive = id;
3829 g.ActiveIdSource = (g.NavActivateId == id || g.NavJustMovedToId == id) ? g.NavInputSource : ImGuiInputSource_Mouse;
3830 IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveIdSource != ImGuiInputSource_None);
3831 }
3832
3833 // Clear declaration of inputs claimed by the widget
3834 // (Please note that this is WIP and not all keys/inputs are thoroughly declared by all widgets yet)
3835 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = 0x00;
3836 g.ActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys = false;
3837#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
3838 g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0x00;
3839#endif
3840}
3841
3842void ImGui::ClearActiveID()
3843{
3844 SetActiveID(0, NULL); // g.ActiveId = 0;
3845}
3846
3847void ImGui::SetHoveredID(ImGuiID id)
3848{
3849 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3850 g.HoveredId = id;
3851 g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = false;
3852 if (id != 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != id)
3853 g.HoveredIdTimer = g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer = 0.0f;
3854}
3855
3856ImGuiID ImGui::GetHoveredID()
3857{
3858 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3859 return g.HoveredId ? g.HoveredId : g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame;
3860}
3861
3862// This is called by ItemAdd().
3863// Code not using ItemAdd() may need to call this manually otherwise ActiveId will be cleared. In IMGUI_VERSION_NUM < 18717 this was called by GetID().
3864void ImGui::KeepAliveID(ImGuiID id)
3865{
3866 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3867 if (g.ActiveId == id)
3868 g.ActiveIdIsAlive = id;
3869 if (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == id)
3870 g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = true;
3871}
3872
3873void ImGui::MarkItemEdited(ImGuiID id)
3874{
3875 // This marking is solely to be able to provide info for IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit().
3876 // ActiveId might have been released by the time we call this (as in the typical press/release button behavior) but still need to fill the data.
3877 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3878 if (g.ActiveId == id || g.ActiveId == 0)
3879 {
3880 g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = true;
3881 g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore = true;
3882 }
3883
3884 // We accept a MarkItemEdited() on drag and drop targets (see https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/1875#issuecomment-978243343)
3885 // We accept 'ActiveIdPreviousFrame == id' for InputText() returning an edit after it has been taken ActiveId away (#4714)
3886 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive || g.ActiveId == id || g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == id);
3887
3888 //IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemId == id);
3889 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited;
3890}
3891
3892bool ImGui::IsWindowContentHoverable(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
3893{
3894 // An active popup disable hovering on other windows (apart from its own children)
3895 // FIXME-OPT: This could be cached/stored within the window.
3896 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3897 if (g.NavWindow)
3898 if (ImGuiWindow* focused_root_window = g.NavWindow->RootWindow)
3899 if (focused_root_window->WasActive && focused_root_window != window->RootWindow)
3900 {
3901 // For the purpose of those flags we differentiate "standard popup" from "modal popup"
3902 // NB: The 'else' is important because Modal windows are also Popups.
3903 bool want_inhibit = false;
3904 if (focused_root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
3905 want_inhibit = true;
3906 else if ((focused_root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
3907 want_inhibit = true;
3908
3909 // Inhibit hover unless the window is within the stack of our modal/popup
3910 if (want_inhibit)
3911 if (!ImGui::IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(window->RootWindow, focused_root_window))
3912 return false;
3913 }
3914 return true;
3915}
3916
3917// This is roughly matching the behavior of internal-facing ItemHoverable()
3918// - we allow hovering to be true when ActiveId==window->MoveID, so that clicking on non-interactive items such as a Text() item still returns true with IsItemHovered()
3919// - this should work even for non-interactive items that have no ID, so we cannot use LastItemId
3920bool ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
3921{
3922 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3923 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3924 if (g.NavDisableMouseHover && !g.NavDisableHighlight && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoNavOverride))
3925 {
3926 if ((g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled))
3927 return false;
3928 if (!IsItemFocused())
3929 return false;
3930 }
3931 else
3932 {
3933 // Test for bounding box overlap, as updated as ItemAdd()
3934 ImGuiItemStatusFlags status_flags = g.LastItemData.StatusFlags;
3935 if (!(status_flags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect))
3936 return false;
3937 IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows | ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoPopupHierarchy)) == 0); // Flags not supported by this function
3938
3939 // Done with rectangle culling so we can perform heavier checks now
3940 // Test if we are hovering the right window (our window could be behind another window)
3941 // [2021/03/02] Reworked / reverted the revert, finally. Note we want e.g. BeginGroup/ItemAdd/EndGroup to work as well. (#3851)
3942 // [2017/10/16] Reverted commit 344d48be3 and testing RootWindow instead. I believe it is correct to NOT test for RootWindow but this leaves us unable
3943 // to use IsItemHovered() after EndChild() itself. Until a solution is found I believe reverting to the test from 2017/09/27 is safe since this was
3944 // the test that has been running for a long while.
3945 if (g.HoveredWindow != window && (status_flags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow) == 0)
3946 if ((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped) == 0)
3947 return false;
3948
3949 // Test if another item is active (e.g. being dragged)
3950 if ((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem) == 0)
3951 if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.LastItemData.ID && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap && g.ActiveId != window->MoveId)
3952 return false;
3953
3954 // Test if interactions on this window are blocked by an active popup or modal.
3955 // The ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup flag will be tested here.
3956 if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(window, flags) && !(g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_NoWindowHoverableCheck))
3957 return false;
3958
3959 // Test if the item is disabled
3960 if ((g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled))
3961 return false;
3962
3963 // Special handling for calling after Begin() which represent the title bar or tab.
3964 // When the window is skipped/collapsed (SkipItems==true) that last item will never be overwritten so we need to detect the case.
3965 if (g.LastItemData.ID == window->MoveId && window->WriteAccessed)
3966 return false;
3967 }
3968
3969 // Handle hover delay
3970 // (some ideas: https://www.nngroup.com/articles/timing-exposing-content)
3971 float delay;
3972 if (flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal)
3973 delay = g.IO.HoverDelayNormal;
3974 else if (flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort)
3975 delay = g.IO.HoverDelayShort;
3976 else
3977 delay = 0.0f;
3978 if (delay > 0.0f)
3979 {
3980 ImGuiID hover_delay_id = (g.LastItemData.ID != 0) ? g.LastItemData.ID : window->GetIDFromRectangle(g.LastItemData.Rect);
3981 if ((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoSharedDelay) && (g.HoverDelayIdPreviousFrame != hover_delay_id))
3982 g.HoverDelayTimer = 0.0f;
3983 g.HoverDelayId = hover_delay_id;
3984 return g.HoverDelayTimer >= delay;
3985 }
3986
3987 return true;
3988}
3989
3990// Internal facing ItemHoverable() used when submitting widgets. Differs slightly from IsItemHovered().
3991bool ImGui::ItemHoverable(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id)
3992{
3993 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3994 if (g.HoveredId != 0 && g.HoveredId != id && !g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap)
3995 return false;
3996
3997 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3998 if (g.HoveredWindow != window)
3999 return false;
4000 if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != id && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap)
4001 return false;
4002 if (!IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max))
4003 return false;
4004
4005 // Done with rectangle culling so we can perform heavier checks now.
4006 ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = (g.LastItemData.ID == id ? g.LastItemData.InFlags : g.CurrentItemFlags);
4007 if (!(item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_NoWindowHoverableCheck) && !IsWindowContentHoverable(window, ImGuiHoveredFlags_None))
4008 {
4009 g.HoveredIdDisabled = true;
4010 return false;
4011 }
4012
4013 // We exceptionally allow this function to be called with id==0 to allow using it for easy high-level
4014 // hover test in widgets code. We could also decide to split this function is two.
4015 if (id != 0)
4016 SetHoveredID(id);
4017
4018 // When disabled we'll return false but still set HoveredId
4019 if (item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled)
4020 {
4021 // Release active id if turning disabled
4022 if (g.ActiveId == id)
4023 ClearActiveID();
4024 g.HoveredIdDisabled = true;
4025 return false;
4026 }
4027
4028 if (id != 0)
4029 {
4030 // [DEBUG] Item Picker tool!
4031 // We perform the check here because SetHoveredID() is not frequently called (1~ time a frame), making
4032 // the cost of this tool near-zero. We can get slightly better call-stack and support picking non-hovered
4033 // items if we performed the test in ItemAdd(), but that would incur a small runtime cost.
4034 if (g.DebugItemPickerActive && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == id)
4035 GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
4036 if (g.DebugItemPickerBreakId == id)
4037 IM_DEBUG_BREAK();
4038 }
4039
4040 if (g.NavDisableMouseHover)
4041 return false;
4042
4043 return true;
4044}
4045
4046// FIXME: This is inlined/duplicated in ItemAdd()
4047bool ImGui::IsClippedEx(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id)
4048{
4049 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4050 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
4051 if (!bb.Overlaps(window->ClipRect))
4052 if (id == 0 || (id != g.ActiveId && id != g.NavId))
4053 if (!g.LogEnabled)
4054 return true;
4055 return false;
4056}
4057
4058// This is also inlined in ItemAdd()
4059// Note: if ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect is set, user needs to set g.LastItemData.DisplayRect.
4060void ImGui::SetLastItemData(ImGuiID item_id, ImGuiItemFlags in_flags, ImGuiItemStatusFlags item_flags, const ImRect& item_rect)
4061{
4062 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4063 g.LastItemData.ID = item_id;
4064 g.LastItemData.InFlags = in_flags;
4065 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags = item_flags;
4066 g.LastItemData.Rect = g.LastItemData.NavRect = item_rect;
4067}
4068
4069float ImGui::CalcWrapWidthForPos(const ImVec2& pos, float wrap_pos_x)
4070{
4071 if (wrap_pos_x < 0.0f)
4072 return 0.0f;
4073
4074 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4075 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
4076 if (wrap_pos_x == 0.0f)
4077 {
4078 // We could decide to setup a default wrapping max point for auto-resizing windows,
4079 // or have auto-wrap (with unspecified wrapping pos) behave as a ContentSize extending function?
4080 //if (window->Hidden && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
4081 // wrap_pos_x = ImMax(window->WorkRect.Min.x + g.FontSize * 10.0f, window->WorkRect.Max.x);
4082 //else
4083 wrap_pos_x = window->WorkRect.Max.x;
4084 }
4085 else if (wrap_pos_x > 0.0f)
4086 {
4087 wrap_pos_x += window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x; // wrap_pos_x is provided is window local space
4088 }
4089
4090 return ImMax(wrap_pos_x - pos.x, 1.0f);
4091}
4092
4093// IM_ALLOC() == ImGui::MemAlloc()
4094void* ImGui::MemAlloc(size_t size)
4095{
4096 if (ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui)
4097 ctx->IO.MetricsActiveAllocations++;
4098 return (*GImAllocatorAllocFunc)(size, GImAllocatorUserData);
4099}
4100
4101// IM_FREE() == ImGui::MemFree()
4102void ImGui::MemFree(void* ptr)
4103{
4104 if (ptr)
4105 if (ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui)
4106 ctx->IO.MetricsActiveAllocations--;
4107 return (*GImAllocatorFreeFunc)(ptr, GImAllocatorUserData);
4108}
4109
4110const char* ImGui::GetClipboardText()
4111{
4112 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4113 return g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn ? g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn(g.IO.ClipboardUserData) : "";
4114}
4115
4116void ImGui::SetClipboardText(const char* text)
4117{
4118 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4119 if (g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn)
4120 g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn(g.IO.ClipboardUserData, text);
4121}
4122
4123const char* ImGui::GetVersion()
4124{
4125 return IMGUI_VERSION;
4126}
4127
4128ImGuiIO& ImGui::GetIO()
4129{
4130 IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
4131 return GImGui->IO;
4132}
4133
4134// Pass this to your backend rendering function! Valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame()
4135ImDrawData* ImGui::GetDrawData()
4136{
4137 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4138 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[0];
4139 return viewport->DrawDataP.Valid ? &viewport->DrawDataP : NULL;
4140}
4141
4142double ImGui::GetTime()
4143{
4144 return GImGui->Time;
4145}
4146
4147int ImGui::GetFrameCount()
4148{
4149 return GImGui->FrameCount;
4150}
4151
4152static ImDrawList* GetViewportDrawList(ImGuiViewportP* viewport, size_t drawlist_no, const char* drawlist_name)
4153{
4154 // Create the draw list on demand, because they are not frequently used for all viewports
4155 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4156 IM_ASSERT(drawlist_no < IM_ARRAYSIZE(viewport->DrawLists));
4157 ImDrawList* draw_list = viewport->DrawLists[drawlist_no];
4158 if (draw_list == NULL)
4159 {
4160 draw_list = IM_NEW(ImDrawList)(&g.DrawListSharedData);
4161 draw_list->_OwnerName = drawlist_name;
4162 viewport->DrawLists[drawlist_no] = draw_list;
4163 }
4164
4165 // Our ImDrawList system requires that there is always a command
4166 if (viewport->DrawListsLastFrame[drawlist_no] != g.FrameCount)
4167 {
4168 draw_list->_ResetForNewFrame();
4169 draw_list->PushTextureID(g.IO.Fonts->TexID);
4170 draw_list->PushClipRect(viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size, false);
4171 viewport->DrawListsLastFrame[drawlist_no] = g.FrameCount;
4172 }
4173 return draw_list;
4174}
4175
4176ImDrawList* ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport* viewport)
4177{
4178 return GetViewportDrawList((ImGuiViewportP*)viewport, 0, "##Background");
4179}
4180
4181ImDrawList* ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList()
4182{
4183 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4184 return GetBackgroundDrawList(g.Viewports[0]);
4185}
4186
4187ImDrawList* ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport* viewport)
4188{
4189 return GetViewportDrawList((ImGuiViewportP*)viewport, 1, "##Foreground");
4190}
4191
4192ImDrawList* ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()
4193{
4194 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4195 return GetForegroundDrawList(g.Viewports[0]);
4196}
4197
4198ImDrawListSharedData* ImGui::GetDrawListSharedData()
4199{
4200 return &GImGui->DrawListSharedData;
4201}
4202
4203void ImGui::StartMouseMovingWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
4204{
4205 // Set ActiveId even if the _NoMove flag is set. Without it, dragging away from a window with _NoMove would activate hover on other windows.
4206 // We _also_ call this when clicking in a window empty space when io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly is set, but clear g.MovingWindow afterward.
4207 // This is because we want ActiveId to be set even when the window is not permitted to move.
4208 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4209 FocusWindow(window);
4210 SetActiveID(window->MoveId, window);
4211 g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
4212 g.ActiveIdClickOffset = g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0] - window->RootWindow->Pos;
4213 g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = true;
4214 SetActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys();
4215
4216 bool can_move_window = true;
4217 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove) || (window->RootWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
4218 can_move_window = false;
4219 if (can_move_window)
4220 g.MovingWindow = window;
4221}
4222
4223// Handle mouse moving window
4224// Note: moving window with the navigation keys (Square + d-pad / CTRL+TAB + Arrows) are processed in NavUpdateWindowing()
4225// FIXME: We don't have strong guarantee that g.MovingWindow stay synched with g.ActiveId == g.MovingWindow->MoveId.
4226// This is currently enforced by the fact that BeginDragDropSource() is setting all g.ActiveIdUsingXXXX flags to inhibit navigation inputs,
4227// but if we should more thoroughly test cases where g.ActiveId or g.MovingWindow gets changed and not the other.
4228void ImGui::UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame()
4229{
4230 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4231 if (g.MovingWindow != NULL)
4232 {
4233 // We actually want to move the root window. g.MovingWindow == window we clicked on (could be a child window).
4234 // We track it to preserve Focus and so that generally ActiveIdWindow == MovingWindow and ActiveId == MovingWindow->MoveId for consistency.
4235 KeepAliveID(g.ActiveId);
4236 IM_ASSERT(g.MovingWindow && g.MovingWindow->RootWindow);
4237 ImGuiWindow* moving_window = g.MovingWindow->RootWindow;
4238 if (g.IO.MouseDown[0] && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
4239 {
4240 ImVec2 pos = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset;
4241 SetWindowPos(moving_window, pos, ImGuiCond_Always);
4242 FocusWindow(g.MovingWindow);
4243 }
4244 else
4245 {
4246 g.MovingWindow = NULL;
4247 ClearActiveID();
4248 }
4249 }
4250 else
4251 {
4252 // When clicking/dragging from a window that has the _NoMove flag, we still set the ActiveId in order to prevent hovering others.
4253 if (g.ActiveIdWindow && g.ActiveIdWindow->MoveId == g.ActiveId)
4254 {
4255 KeepAliveID(g.ActiveId);
4256 if (!g.IO.MouseDown[0])
4257 ClearActiveID();
4258 }
4259 }
4260}
4261
4262// Initiate moving window when clicking on empty space or title bar.
4263// Handle left-click and right-click focus.
4264void ImGui::UpdateMouseMovingWindowEndFrame()
4265{
4266 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4267 if (g.ActiveId != 0 || g.HoveredId != 0)
4268 return;
4269
4270 // Unless we just made a window/popup appear
4271 if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->Appearing)
4272 return;
4273
4274 // Click on empty space to focus window and start moving
4275 // (after we're done with all our widgets)
4276 if (g.IO.MouseClicked[0])
4277 {
4278 // Handle the edge case of a popup being closed while clicking in its empty space.
4279 // If we try to focus it, FocusWindow() > ClosePopupsOverWindow() will accidentally close any parent popups because they are not linked together any more.
4280 ImGuiWindow* root_window = g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow : NULL;
4281 const bool is_closed_popup = root_window && (root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !IsPopupOpen(root_window->PopupId, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel);
4282
4283 if (root_window != NULL && !is_closed_popup)
4284 {
4285 StartMouseMovingWindow(g.HoveredWindow); //-V595
4286
4287 // Cancel moving if clicked outside of title bar
4288 if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly && !(root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
4289 if (!root_window->TitleBarRect().Contains(g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0]))
4290 g.MovingWindow = NULL;
4291
4292 // Cancel moving if clicked over an item which was disabled or inhibited by popups (note that we know HoveredId == 0 already)
4293 if (g.HoveredIdDisabled)
4294 g.MovingWindow = NULL;
4295 }
4296 else if (root_window == NULL && g.NavWindow != NULL && GetTopMostPopupModal() == NULL)
4297 {
4298 // Clicking on void disable focus
4299 FocusWindow(NULL);
4300 }
4301 }
4302
4303 // With right mouse button we close popups without changing focus based on where the mouse is aimed
4304 // Instead, focus will be restored to the window under the bottom-most closed popup.
4305 // (The left mouse button path calls FocusWindow on the hovered window, which will lead NewFrame->ClosePopupsOverWindow to trigger)
4306 if (g.IO.MouseClicked[1])
4307 {
4308 // Find the top-most window between HoveredWindow and the top-most Modal Window.
4309 // This is where we can trim the popup stack.
4310 ImGuiWindow* modal = GetTopMostPopupModal();
4311 bool hovered_window_above_modal = g.HoveredWindow && (modal == NULL || IsWindowAbove(g.HoveredWindow, modal));
4312 ClosePopupsOverWindow(hovered_window_above_modal ? g.HoveredWindow : modal, true);
4313 }
4314}
4315
4316static bool IsWindowActiveAndVisible(ImGuiWindow* window)
4317{
4318 return (window->Active) && (!window->Hidden);
4319}
4320
4321// The reason this is exposed in imgui_internal.h is: on touch-based system that don't have hovering, we want to dispatch inputs to the right target (imgui vs imgui+app)
4322void ImGui::UpdateHoveredWindowAndCaptureFlags()
4323{
4324 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4325 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
4326 g.WindowsHoverPadding = ImMax(g.Style.TouchExtraPadding, ImVec2(WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING, WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING));
4327
4328 // Find the window hovered by mouse:
4329 // - Child windows can extend beyond the limit of their parent so we need to derive HoveredRootWindow from HoveredWindow.
4330 // - When moving a window we can skip the search, which also conveniently bypasses the fact that window->WindowRectClipped is lagging as this point of the frame.
4331 // - We also support the moved window toggling the NoInputs flag after moving has started in order to be able to detect windows below it, which is useful for e.g. docking mechanisms.
4332 bool clear_hovered_windows = false;
4333 FindHoveredWindow();
4334
4335 // Modal windows prevents mouse from hovering behind them.
4336 ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
4337 if (modal_window && g.HoveredWindow && !IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow, modal_window))
4338 clear_hovered_windows = true;
4339
4340 // Disabled mouse?
4341 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse)
4342 clear_hovered_windows = true;
4343
4344 // We track click ownership. When clicked outside of a window the click is owned by the application and
4345 // won't report hovering nor request capture even while dragging over our windows afterward.
4346 const bool has_open_popup = (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0);
4347 const bool has_open_modal = (modal_window != NULL);
4348 int mouse_earliest_down = -1;
4349 bool mouse_any_down = false;
4350 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++)
4351 {
4352 if (io.MouseClicked[i])
4353 {
4354 io.MouseDownOwned[i] = (g.HoveredWindow != NULL) || has_open_popup;
4355 io.MouseDownOwnedUnlessPopupClose[i] = (g.HoveredWindow != NULL) || has_open_modal;
4356 }
4357 mouse_any_down |= io.MouseDown[i];
4358 if (io.MouseDown[i])
4359 if (mouse_earliest_down == -1 || io.MouseClickedTime[i] < io.MouseClickedTime[mouse_earliest_down])
4360 mouse_earliest_down = i;
4361 }
4362 const bool mouse_avail = (mouse_earliest_down == -1) || io.MouseDownOwned[mouse_earliest_down];
4363 const bool mouse_avail_unless_popup_close = (mouse_earliest_down == -1) || io.MouseDownOwnedUnlessPopupClose[mouse_earliest_down];
4364
4365 // If mouse was first clicked outside of ImGui bounds we also cancel out hovering.
4366 // FIXME: For patterns of drag and drop across OS windows, we may need to rework/remove this test (first committed 311c0ca9 on 2015/02)
4367 const bool mouse_dragging_extern_payload = g.DragDropActive && (g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern) != 0;
4368 if (!mouse_avail && !mouse_dragging_extern_payload)
4369 clear_hovered_windows = true;
4370
4371 if (clear_hovered_windows)
4372 g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = NULL;
4373
4374 // Update io.WantCaptureMouse for the user application (true = dispatch mouse info to Dear ImGui only, false = dispatch mouse to Dear ImGui + underlying app)
4375 // Update io.WantCaptureMouseAllowPopupClose (experimental) to give a chance for app to react to popup closure with a drag
4376 if (g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame != -1)
4377 {
4378 io.WantCaptureMouse = io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose = (g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame != 0);
4379 }
4380 else
4381 {
4382 io.WantCaptureMouse = (mouse_avail && (g.HoveredWindow != NULL || mouse_any_down)) || has_open_popup;
4383 io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose = (mouse_avail_unless_popup_close && (g.HoveredWindow != NULL || mouse_any_down)) || has_open_modal;
4384 }
4385
