4386 // Update io.WantCaptureKeyboard for the user application (true = dispatch keyboard info to Dear ImGui only, false = dispatch keyboard info to Dear ImGui + underlying app)
4387 if (g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame != -1)
4388 io.WantCaptureKeyboard = (g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame != 0);
4389 else
4390 io.WantCaptureKeyboard = (g.ActiveId != 0) || (modal_window != NULL);
4391 if (io.NavActive && (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) && !(io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard))
4392 io.WantCaptureKeyboard = true;
4393
4394 // Update io.WantTextInput flag, this is to allow systems without a keyboard (e.g. mobile, hand-held) to show a software keyboard if possible
4395 io.WantTextInput = (g.WantTextInputNextFrame != -1) ? (g.WantTextInputNextFrame != 0) : false;
4396}
4397
4398void ImGui::NewFrame()
4399{
4400 IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
4401 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4402
4403 // Remove pending delete hooks before frame start.
4404 // This deferred removal avoid issues of removal while iterating the hook vector
4405 for (int n = g.Hooks.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
4406 if (g.Hooks[n].Type == ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_)
4407 g.Hooks.erase(&g.Hooks[n]);
4408
4409 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_NewFramePre);
4410
4411 // Check and assert for various common IO and Configuration mistakes
4412 ErrorCheckNewFrameSanityChecks();
4413
4414 // Load settings on first frame, save settings when modified (after a delay)
4415 UpdateSettings();
4416
4417 g.Time += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4418 g.WithinFrameScope = true;
4419 g.FrameCount += 1;
4420 g.TooltipOverrideCount = 0;
4421 g.WindowsActiveCount = 0;
4422 g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.resize(0);
4423
4424 // Calculate frame-rate for the user, as a purely luxurious feature
4425 g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum += g.IO.DeltaTime - g.FramerateSecPerFrame[g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx];
4426 g.FramerateSecPerFrame[g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx] = g.IO.DeltaTime;
4427 g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx = (g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx + 1) % IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.FramerateSecPerFrame);
4428 g.FramerateSecPerFrameCount = ImMin(g.FramerateSecPerFrameCount + 1, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.FramerateSecPerFrame));
4429 g.IO.Framerate = (g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum > 0.0f) ? (1.0f / (g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum / (float)g.FramerateSecPerFrameCount)) : FLT_MAX;
4430
4431 // Process input queue (trickle as many events as possible), turn events into writes to IO structure
4432 g.InputEventsTrail.resize(0);
4433 UpdateInputEvents(g.IO.ConfigInputTrickleEventQueue);
4434
4435 // Update viewports (after processing input queue, so io.MouseHoveredViewport is set)
4436 UpdateViewportsNewFrame();
4437
4438 // Setup current font and draw list shared data
4439 g.IO.Fonts->Locked = true;
4440 SetCurrentFont(GetDefaultFont());
4441 IM_ASSERT(g.Font->IsLoaded());
4442 ImRect virtual_space(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
4443 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4444 virtual_space.Add(g.Viewports[n]->GetMainRect());
4445 g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen = virtual_space.ToVec4();
4446 g.DrawListSharedData.CurveTessellationTol = g.Style.CurveTessellationTol;
4447 g.DrawListSharedData.SetCircleTessellationMaxError(g.Style.CircleTessellationMaxError);
4448 g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags = ImDrawListFlags_None;
4449 if (g.Style.AntiAliasedLines)
4450 g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines;
4451 if (g.Style.AntiAliasedLinesUseTex && !(g.Font->ContainerAtlas->Flags & ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines))
4452 g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLinesUseTex;
4453 if (g.Style.AntiAliasedFill)
4454 g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedFill;
4455 if (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset)
4456 g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset;
4457
4458 // Mark rendering data as invalid to prevent user who may have a handle on it to use it.
4459 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4460 {
4461 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
4462 viewport->DrawDataP.Clear();
4463 }
4464
4465 // Drag and drop keep the source ID alive so even if the source disappear our state is consistent
4466 if (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == g.ActiveId)
4467 KeepAliveID(g.DragDropPayload.SourceId);
4468
4469 // Update HoveredId data
4470 if (!g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame)
4471 g.HoveredIdTimer = 0.0f;
4472 if (!g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame || (g.HoveredId && g.ActiveId == g.HoveredId))
4473 g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer = 0.0f;
4474 if (g.HoveredId)
4475 g.HoveredIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4476 if (g.HoveredId && g.ActiveId != g.HoveredId)
4477 g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4478 g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame = g.HoveredId;
4479 g.HoveredId = 0;
4480 g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = false;
4481 g.HoveredIdDisabled = false;
4482
4483 // Clear ActiveID if the item is not alive anymore.
4484 // In 1.87, the common most call to KeepAliveID() was moved from GetID() to ItemAdd().
4485 // As a result, custom widget using ButtonBehavior() _without_ ItemAdd() need to call KeepAliveID() themselves.
4486 if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdIsAlive != g.ActiveId && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == g.ActiveId)
4487 {
4488 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_ACTIVEID("NewFrame(): ClearActiveID() because it isn't marked alive anymore!\n");
4489 ClearActiveID();
4490 }
4491
4492 // Update ActiveId data (clear reference to active widget if the widget isn't alive anymore)
4493 if (g.ActiveId)
4494 g.ActiveIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4495 g.LastActiveIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4496 g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame = g.ActiveId;
4497 g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameWindow = g.ActiveIdWindow;
4498 g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameHasBeenEditedBefore = g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore;
4499 g.ActiveIdIsAlive = 0;
4500 g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = false;
4501 g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = false;
4502 g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated = false;
4503 if (g.TempInputId != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.TempInputId)
4504 g.TempInputId = 0;
4505 if (g.ActiveId == 0)
4506 {
4507 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = 0x00;
4508 g.ActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys = false;
4509#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
4510 g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0x00;
4511#endif
4512 }
4513
4514#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
4515 if (g.ActiveId == 0)
4516 g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0;
4517 else if (g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask != 0)
4518 {
4519 // If your custom widget code used: { g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask |= (1 << ImGuiNavInput_Cancel); }
4520 // Since IMGUI_VERSION_NUM >= 18804 it should be: { SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_Escape, g.ActiveId); SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadCancel, g.ActiveId); }
4521 if (g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask & (1 << ImGuiNavInput_Cancel))
4522 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_Escape, g.ActiveId);
4523 if (g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask & ~(1 << ImGuiNavInput_Cancel))
4524 IM_ASSERT(0); // Other values unsupported
4525 }
4526#endif
4527
4528 // Update hover delay for IsItemHovered() with delays and tooltips
4529 g.HoverDelayIdPreviousFrame = g.HoverDelayId;
4530 if (g.HoverDelayId != 0)
4531 {
4532 //if (g.IO.MouseDelta.x == 0.0f && g.IO.MouseDelta.y == 0.0f) // Need design/flags
4533 g.HoverDelayTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4534 g.HoverDelayClearTimer = 0.0f;
4535 g.HoverDelayId = 0;
4536 }
4537 else if (g.HoverDelayTimer > 0.0f)
4538 {
4539 // This gives a little bit of leeway before clearing the hover timer, allowing mouse to cross gaps
4540 g.HoverDelayClearTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4541 if (g.HoverDelayClearTimer >= ImMax(0.20f, g.IO.DeltaTime * 2.0f)) // ~6 frames at 30 Hz + allow for low framerate
4542 g.HoverDelayTimer = g.HoverDelayClearTimer = 0.0f; // May want a decaying timer, in which case need to clamp at max first, based on max of caller last requested timer.
4543 }
4544
4545 // Drag and drop
4546 g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev = g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr;
4547 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = 0;
4548 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = FLT_MAX;
4549 g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
4550 g.DragDropWithinTarget = false;
4551 g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId = 0;
4552
4553 // Close popups on focus lost (currently wip/opt-in)
4554 //if (g.IO.AppFocusLost)
4555 // ClosePopupsExceptModals();
4556
4557 // Update keyboard input state
4558 UpdateKeyboardInputs();
4559
4560 //IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyCtrl == IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_LeftCtrl) || IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_RightCtrl));
4561 //IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyShift == IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_LeftShift) || IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_RightShift));
4562 //IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyAlt == IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_LeftAlt) || IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_RightAlt));
4563 //IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeySuper == IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_LeftSuper) || IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_RightSuper));
4564
4565 // Update gamepad/keyboard navigation
4566 NavUpdate();
4567
4568 // Update mouse input state
4569 UpdateMouseInputs();
4570
4571 // Find hovered window
4572 // (needs to be before UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame so we fill g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow on the mouse release frame)
4573 UpdateHoveredWindowAndCaptureFlags();
4574
4575 // Handle user moving window with mouse (at the beginning of the frame to avoid input lag or sheering)
4576 UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame();
4577
4578 // Background darkening/whitening
4579 if (GetTopMostPopupModal() != NULL || (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha > 0.0f))
4580 g.DimBgRatio = ImMin(g.DimBgRatio + g.IO.DeltaTime * 6.0f, 1.0f);
4581 else
4582 g.DimBgRatio = ImMax(g.DimBgRatio - g.IO.DeltaTime * 10.0f, 0.0f);
4583
4584 g.MouseCursor = ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow;
4585 g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame = g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame = g.WantTextInputNextFrame = -1;
4586
4587 // Platform IME data: reset for the frame
4588 g.PlatformImeDataPrev = g.PlatformImeData;
4589 g.PlatformImeData.WantVisible = false;
4590
4591 // Mouse wheel scrolling, scale
4592 UpdateMouseWheel();
4593
4594 // Mark all windows as not visible and compact unused memory.
4595 IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size <= g.Windows.Size);
4596 const float memory_compact_start_time = (g.GcCompactAll || g.IO.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer < 0.0f) ? FLT_MAX : (float)g.Time - g.IO.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer;
4597 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
4598 {
4599 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
4600 window->WasActive = window->Active;
4601 window->Active = false;
4602 window->WriteAccessed = false;
4603 window->BeginCountPreviousFrame = window->BeginCount;
4604 window->BeginCount = 0;
4605
4606 // Garbage collect transient buffers of recently unused windows
4607 if (!window->WasActive && !window->MemoryCompacted && window->LastTimeActive < memory_compact_start_time)
4608 GcCompactTransientWindowBuffers(window);
4609 }
4610
4611 // Garbage collect transient buffers of recently unused tables
4612 for (int i = 0; i < g.TablesLastTimeActive.Size; i++)
4613 if (g.TablesLastTimeActive[i] >= 0.0f && g.TablesLastTimeActive[i] < memory_compact_start_time)
4614 TableGcCompactTransientBuffers(g.Tables.GetByIndex(i));
4615 for (int i = 0; i < g.TablesTempData.Size; i++)
4616 if (g.TablesTempData[i].LastTimeActive >= 0.0f && g.TablesTempData[i].LastTimeActive < memory_compact_start_time)
4617 TableGcCompactTransientBuffers(&g.TablesTempData[i]);
4618 if (g.GcCompactAll)
4619 GcCompactTransientMiscBuffers();
4620 g.GcCompactAll = false;
4621
4622 // Closing the focused window restore focus to the first active root window in descending z-order
4623 if (g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindow->WasActive)
4624 FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(NULL, NULL);
4625
4626 // No window should be open at the beginning of the frame.
4627 // But in order to allow the user to call NewFrame() multiple times without calling Render(), we are doing an explicit clear.
4628 g.CurrentWindowStack.resize(0);
4629 g.BeginPopupStack.resize(0);
4630 g.ItemFlagsStack.resize(0);
4631 g.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(ImGuiItemFlags_None);
4632 g.GroupStack.resize(0);
4633
4634 // [DEBUG] Update debug features
4635 UpdateDebugToolItemPicker();
4636 UpdateDebugToolStackQueries();
4637 if (g.DebugLocateFrames > 0 && --g.DebugLocateFrames == 0)
4638 g.DebugLocateId = 0;
4639 if (g.DebugLogClipperAutoDisableFrames > 0 && --g.DebugLogClipperAutoDisableFrames == 0)
4640 {
4641 DebugLog("(Auto-disabled ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventClipper to avoid spamming)\n");
4642 g.DebugLogFlags &= ~ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventClipper;
4643 }
4644
4645 // Create implicit/fallback window - which we will only render it if the user has added something to it.
4646 // We don't use "Debug" to avoid colliding with user trying to create a "Debug" window with custom flags.
4647 // This fallback is particularly important as it prevents ImGui:: calls from crashing.
4648 g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow = true;
4649 SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(400, 400), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
4650 Begin("Debug##Default");
4651 IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->IsFallbackWindow == true);
4652
4653 // [DEBUG] When io.ConfigDebugBeginReturnValue is set, we make Begin()/BeginChild() return false at different level of the window-stack,
4654 // allowing to validate correct Begin/End behavior in user code.
4655 if (g.IO.ConfigDebugBeginReturnValueLoop)
4656 g.DebugBeginReturnValueCullDepth = (g.DebugBeginReturnValueCullDepth == -1) ? 0 : ((g.DebugBeginReturnValueCullDepth + ((g.FrameCount % 4) == 0 ? 1 : 0)) % 10);
4657 else
4658 g.DebugBeginReturnValueCullDepth = -1;
4659
4660 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_NewFramePost);
4661}
4662
4663// FIXME: Add a more explicit sort order in the window structure.
4664static int IMGUI_CDECL ChildWindowComparer(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
4665{
4666 const ImGuiWindow* const a = *(const ImGuiWindow* const *)lhs;
4667 const ImGuiWindow* const b = *(const ImGuiWindow* const *)rhs;
4668 if (int d = (a->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) - (b->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
4669 return d;
4670 if (int d = (a->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) - (b->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
4671 return d;
4672 return (a->BeginOrderWithinParent - b->BeginOrderWithinParent);
4673}
4674
4675static void AddWindowToSortBuffer(ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>* out_sorted_windows, ImGuiWindow* window)
4676{
4677 out_sorted_windows->push_back(window);
4678 if (window->Active)
4679 {
4680 int count = window->DC.ChildWindows.Size;
4681 ImQsort(window->DC.ChildWindows.Data, (size_t)count, sizeof(ImGuiWindow*), ChildWindowComparer);
4682 for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
4683 {
4684 ImGuiWindow* child = window->DC.ChildWindows[i];
4685 if (child->Active)
4686 AddWindowToSortBuffer(out_sorted_windows, child);
4687 }
4688 }
4689}
4690
4691static void AddDrawListToDrawData(ImVector<ImDrawList*>* out_list, ImDrawList* draw_list)
4692{
4693 if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size == 0)
4694 return;
4695 if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size == 1 && draw_list->CmdBuffer[0].ElemCount == 0 && draw_list->CmdBuffer[0].UserCallback == NULL)
4696 return;
4697
4698 // Draw list sanity check. Detect mismatch between PrimReserve() calls and incrementing _VtxCurrentIdx, _VtxWritePtr etc.
4699 // May trigger for you if you are using PrimXXX functions incorrectly.
4700 IM_ASSERT(draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size == 0 || draw_list->_VtxWritePtr == draw_list->VtxBuffer.Data + draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size);
4701 IM_ASSERT(draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size == 0 || draw_list->_IdxWritePtr == draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data + draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size);
4702 if (!(draw_list->Flags & ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset))
4703 IM_ASSERT((int)draw_list->_VtxCurrentIdx == draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size);
4704
4705 // Check that draw_list doesn't use more vertices than indexable (default ImDrawIdx = unsigned short = 2 bytes = 64K vertices per ImDrawList = per window)
4706 // If this assert triggers because you are drawing lots of stuff manually:
4707 // - First, make sure you are coarse clipping yourself and not trying to draw many things outside visible bounds.
4708 // Be mindful that the ImDrawList API doesn't filter vertices. Use the Metrics/Debugger window to inspect draw list contents.
4709 // - If you want large meshes with more than 64K vertices, you can either:
4710 // (A) Handle the ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset value in your renderer backend, and set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset'.
4711 // Most example backends already support this from 1.71. Pre-1.71 backends won't.
4712 // Some graphics API such as GL ES 1/2 don't have a way to offset the starting vertex so it is not supported for them.
4713 // (B) Or handle 32-bit indices in your renderer backend, and uncomment '#define ImDrawIdx unsigned int' line in imconfig.h.
4714 // Most example backends already support this. For example, the OpenGL example code detect index size at compile-time:
4715 // glDrawElements(GL_TRIANGLES, (GLsizei)pcmd->ElemCount, sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2 ? GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT : GL_UNSIGNED_INT, idx_buffer_offset);
4716 // Your own engine or render API may use different parameters or function calls to specify index sizes.
4717 // 2 and 4 bytes indices are generally supported by most graphics API.
4718 // - If for some reason neither of those solutions works for you, a workaround is to call BeginChild()/EndChild() before reaching
4719 // the 64K limit to split your draw commands in multiple draw lists.
4720 if (sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2)
4721 IM_ASSERT(draw_list->_VtxCurrentIdx < (1 << 16) && "Too many vertices in ImDrawList using 16-bit indices. Read comment above");
4722
4723 out_list->push_back(draw_list);
4724}
4725
4726static void AddWindowToDrawData(ImGuiWindow* window, int layer)
4727{
4728 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4729 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[0];
4730 g.IO.MetricsRenderWindows++;
4731 AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer], window->DrawList);
4732 for (int i = 0; i < window->DC.ChildWindows.Size; i++)
4733 {
4734 ImGuiWindow* child = window->DC.ChildWindows[i];
4735 if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(child)) // Clipped children may have been marked not active
4736 AddWindowToDrawData(child, layer);
4737 }
4738}
4739
4740static inline int GetWindowDisplayLayer(ImGuiWindow* window)
4741{
4742 return (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) ? 1 : 0;
4743}
4744
4745// Layer is locked for the root window, however child windows may use a different viewport (e.g. extruding menu)
4746static inline void AddRootWindowToDrawData(ImGuiWindow* window)
4747{
4748 AddWindowToDrawData(window, GetWindowDisplayLayer(window));
4749}
4750
4751void ImDrawDataBuilder::FlattenIntoSingleLayer()
4752{
4753 int n = Layers[0].Size;
4754 int size = n;
4755 for (int i = 1; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Layers); i++)
4756 size += Layers[i].Size;
4757 Layers[0].resize(size);
4758 for (int layer_n = 1; layer_n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Layers); layer_n++)
4759 {
4760 ImVector<ImDrawList*>& layer = Layers[layer_n];
4761 if (layer.empty())
4762 continue;
4763 memcpy(&Layers[0][n], &layer[0], layer.Size * sizeof(ImDrawList*));
4764 n += layer.Size;
4765 layer.resize(0);
4766 }
4767}
4768
4769static void SetupViewportDrawData(ImGuiViewportP* viewport, ImVector<ImDrawList*>* draw_lists)
4770{
4771 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
4772 ImDrawData* draw_data = &viewport->DrawDataP;
4773 draw_data->Valid = true;
4774 draw_data->CmdLists = (draw_lists->Size > 0) ? draw_lists->Data : NULL;
4775 draw_data->CmdListsCount = draw_lists->Size;
4776 draw_data->TotalVtxCount = draw_data->TotalIdxCount = 0;
4777 draw_data->DisplayPos = viewport->Pos;
4778 draw_data->DisplaySize = viewport->Size;
4779 draw_data->FramebufferScale = io.DisplayFramebufferScale;
4780 for (int n = 0; n < draw_lists->Size; n++)
4781 {
4782 ImDrawList* draw_list = draw_lists->Data[n];
4783 draw_list->_PopUnusedDrawCmd();
4784 draw_data->TotalVtxCount += draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size;
4785 draw_data->TotalIdxCount += draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size;
4786 }
4787}
4788
4789// Push a clipping rectangle for both ImGui logic (hit-testing etc.) and low-level ImDrawList rendering.
4790// - When using this function it is sane to ensure that float are perfectly rounded to integer values,
4791// so that e.g. (int)(max.x-min.x) in user's render produce correct result.
4792// - If the code here changes, may need to update code of functions like NextColumn() and PushColumnClipRect():
4793// some frequently called functions which to modify both channels and clipping simultaneously tend to use the
4794// more specialized SetWindowClipRectBeforeSetChannel() to avoid extraneous updates of underlying ImDrawCmds.
4795void ImGui::PushClipRect(const ImVec2& clip_rect_min, const ImVec2& clip_rect_max, bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect)
4796{
4797 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4798 window->DrawList->PushClipRect(clip_rect_min, clip_rect_max, intersect_with_current_clip_rect);
4799 window->ClipRect = window->DrawList->_ClipRectStack.back();
4800}
4801
4802void ImGui::PopClipRect()
4803{
4804 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4805 window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
4806 window->ClipRect = window->DrawList->_ClipRectStack.back();
4807}
4808
4809static void ImGui::RenderDimmedBackgroundBehindWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, ImU32 col)
4810{
4811 if ((col & IM_COL32_A_MASK) == 0)
4812 return;
4813
4814 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)GetMainViewport();
4815 ImRect viewport_rect = viewport->GetMainRect();
4816
4817 // Draw behind window by moving the draw command at the FRONT of the draw list
4818 {
4819 // We've already called AddWindowToDrawData() which called DrawList->ChannelsMerge() on DockNodeHost windows,
4820 // and draw list have been trimmed already, hence the explicit recreation of a draw command if missing.
4821 // FIXME: This is creating complication, might be simpler if we could inject a drawlist in drawdata at a given position and not attempt to manipulate ImDrawCmd order.
4822 ImDrawList* draw_list = window->RootWindow->DrawList;
4823 if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size == 0)
4824 draw_list->AddDrawCmd();
4825 draw_list->PushClipRect(viewport_rect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), viewport_rect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), false); // Ensure ImDrawCmd are not merged
4826 draw_list->AddRectFilled(viewport_rect.Min, viewport_rect.Max, col);
4827 ImDrawCmd cmd = draw_list->CmdBuffer.back();
4828 IM_ASSERT(cmd.ElemCount == 6);
4829 draw_list->CmdBuffer.pop_back();
4830 draw_list->CmdBuffer.push_front(cmd);
4831 draw_list->PopClipRect();
4832 draw_list->AddDrawCmd(); // We need to create a command as CmdBuffer.back().IdxOffset won't be correct if we append to same command.
4833 }
4834}
4835
4836ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindBottomMostVisibleWindowWithinBeginStack(ImGuiWindow* parent_window)
4837{
4838 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4839 ImGuiWindow* bottom_most_visible_window = parent_window;
4840 for (int i = FindWindowDisplayIndex(parent_window); i >= 0; i--)
4841 {
4842 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
4843 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
4844 continue;
4845 if (!IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(window, parent_window))
4846 break;
4847 if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(window) && GetWindowDisplayLayer(window) <= GetWindowDisplayLayer(parent_window))
4848 bottom_most_visible_window = window;
4849 }
4850 return bottom_most_visible_window;
4851}
4852
4853static void ImGui::RenderDimmedBackgrounds()
4854{
4855 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4856 ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostAndVisiblePopupModal();
4857 if (g.DimBgRatio <= 0.0f && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha <= 0.0f)
4858 return;
4859 const bool dim_bg_for_modal = (modal_window != NULL);
4860 const bool dim_bg_for_window_list = (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim != NULL && g.NavWindowingTargetAnim->Active);
4861 if (!dim_bg_for_modal && !dim_bg_for_window_list)
4862 return;
4863
4864 if (dim_bg_for_modal)
4865 {
4866 // Draw dimming behind modal or a begin stack child, whichever comes first in draw order.
4867 ImGuiWindow* dim_behind_window = FindBottomMostVisibleWindowWithinBeginStack(modal_window);
4868 RenderDimmedBackgroundBehindWindow(dim_behind_window, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg, g.DimBgRatio));
4869 }
4870 else if (dim_bg_for_window_list)
4871 {
4872 // Draw dimming behind CTRL+Tab target window
4873 RenderDimmedBackgroundBehindWindow(g.NavWindowingTargetAnim, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, g.DimBgRatio));
4874
4875 // Draw border around CTRL+Tab target window
4876 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim;
4877 ImGuiViewport* viewport = GetMainViewport();
4878 float distance = g.FontSize;
4879 ImRect bb = window->Rect();
4880 bb.Expand(distance);
4881 if (bb.GetWidth() >= viewport->Size.x && bb.GetHeight() >= viewport->Size.y)
4882 bb.Expand(-distance - 1.0f); // If a window fits the entire viewport, adjust its highlight inward
4883 if (window->DrawList->CmdBuffer.Size == 0)
4884 window->DrawList->AddDrawCmd();
4885 window->DrawList->PushClipRect(viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size);
4886 window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha), window->WindowRounding, 0, 3.0f);
4887 window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
4888 }
4889}
4890
4891// This is normally called by Render(). You may want to call it directly if you want to avoid calling Render() but the gain will be very minimal.
4892void ImGui::EndFrame()
4893{
4894 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4895 IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
4896
4897 // Don't process EndFrame() multiple times.
4898 if (g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount)
4899 return;
4900 IM_ASSERT(g.WithinFrameScope && "Forgot to call ImGui::NewFrame()?");
4901
4902 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_EndFramePre);
4903
4904 ErrorCheckEndFrameSanityChecks();
4905
4906 // Notify Platform/OS when our Input Method Editor cursor has moved (e.g. CJK inputs using Microsoft IME)
4907 ImGuiPlatformImeData* ime_data = &g.PlatformImeData;
4908 if (g.IO.SetPlatformImeDataFn && memcmp(ime_data, &g.PlatformImeDataPrev, sizeof(ImGuiPlatformImeData)) != 0)
4909 {
4910 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("Calling io.SetPlatformImeDataFn(): WantVisible: %d, InputPos (%.2f,%.2f)\n", ime_data->WantVisible, ime_data->InputPos.x, ime_data->InputPos.y);
4911 ImGuiViewport* viewport = GetMainViewport();
4912#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
4913 if (viewport->PlatformHandleRaw == NULL && g.IO.ImeWindowHandle != NULL)
4914 {
4915 viewport->PlatformHandleRaw = g.IO.ImeWindowHandle;
4916 g.IO.SetPlatformImeDataFn(viewport, ime_data);
4917 viewport->PlatformHandleRaw = NULL;
4918 }
4919 else
4920#endif
4921 {
4922 g.IO.SetPlatformImeDataFn(viewport, ime_data);
4923 }
4924 }
4925
4926 // Hide implicit/fallback "Debug" window if it hasn't been used
4927 g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow = false;
4928 if (g.CurrentWindow && !g.CurrentWindow->WriteAccessed)
4929 g.CurrentWindow->Active = false;
4930 End();
4931
4932 // Update navigation: CTRL+Tab, wrap-around requests
4933 NavEndFrame();
4934
4935 // Drag and Drop: Elapse payload (if delivered, or if source stops being submitted)
4936 if (g.DragDropActive)
4937 {
4938 bool is_delivered = g.DragDropPayload.Delivery;
4939 bool is_elapsed = (g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount + 1 < g.FrameCount) && ((g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload) || !IsMouseDown(g.DragDropMouseButton));
4940 if (is_delivered || is_elapsed)
4941 ClearDragDrop();
4942 }
4943
4944 // Drag and Drop: Fallback for source tooltip. This is not ideal but better than nothing.
4945 if (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropSourceFrameCount < g.FrameCount && !(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
4946 {
4947 g.DragDropWithinSource = true;
4948 SetTooltip("...");
4949 g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
4950 }
4951
4952 // End frame
4953 g.WithinFrameScope = false;
4954 g.FrameCountEnded = g.FrameCount;
4955
4956 // Initiate moving window + handle left-click and right-click focus
4957 UpdateMouseMovingWindowEndFrame();
4958
4959 // Sort the window list so that all child windows are after their parent
4960 // We cannot do that on FocusWindow() because children may not exist yet
4961 g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.resize(0);
4962 g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.reserve(g.Windows.Size);
4963 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
4964 {
4965 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
4966 if (window->Active && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)) // if a child is active its parent will add it
4967 continue;
4968 AddWindowToSortBuffer(&g.WindowsTempSortBuffer, window);
4969 }
4970
4971 // This usually assert if there is a mismatch between the ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow / ParentWindow values and DC.ChildWindows[] in parents, aka we've done something wrong.
4972 IM_ASSERT(g.Windows.Size == g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.Size);
4973 g.Windows.swap(g.WindowsTempSortBuffer);
4974 g.IO.MetricsActiveWindows = g.WindowsActiveCount;
4975
4976 // Unlock font atlas
4977 g.IO.Fonts->Locked = false;
4978
4979 // Clear Input data for next frame
4980 g.IO.AppFocusLost = false;
4981 g.IO.MouseWheel = g.IO.MouseWheelH = 0.0f;
4982 g.IO.InputQueueCharacters.resize(0);
4983
4984 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_EndFramePost);
4985}
4986
4987// Prepare the data for rendering so you can call GetDrawData()
4988// (As with anything within the ImGui:: namspace this doesn't touch your GPU or graphics API at all:
4989// it is the role of the ImGui_ImplXXXX_RenderDrawData() function provided by the renderer backend)
4990void ImGui::Render()
4991{
4992 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4993 IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
4994
4995 if (g.FrameCountEnded != g.FrameCount)
4996 EndFrame();
4997 const bool first_render_of_frame = (g.FrameCountRendered != g.FrameCount);
4998 g.FrameCountRendered = g.FrameCount;
4999 g.IO.MetricsRenderWindows = 0;
5000
5001 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_RenderPre);
5002
5003 // Add background ImDrawList (for each active viewport)
5004 for (int n = 0; n != g.Viewports.Size; n++)
5005 {
5006 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
5007 viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Clear();
5008 if (viewport->DrawLists[0] != NULL)
5009 AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], GetBackgroundDrawList(viewport));
5010 }
5011
5012 // Draw modal/window whitening backgrounds
5013 if (first_render_of_frame)
5014 RenderDimmedBackgrounds();
5015
5016 // Add ImDrawList to render
5017 ImGuiWindow* windows_to_render_top_most[2];
5018 windows_to_render_top_most[0] = (g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus)) ? g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow : NULL;
5019 windows_to_render_top_most[1] = (g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingListWindow : NULL);
5020 for (int n = 0; n != g.Windows.Size; n++)
5021 {
5022 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[n];
5023 IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(6011); // Static Analysis false positive "warning C6011: Dereferencing NULL pointer 'window'"
5024 if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(window) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) == 0 && window != windows_to_render_top_most[0] && window != windows_to_render_top_most[1])
5025 AddRootWindowToDrawData(window);
5026 }
5027 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(windows_to_render_top_most); n++)
5028 if (windows_to_render_top_most[n] && IsWindowActiveAndVisible(windows_to_render_top_most[n])) // NavWindowingTarget is always temporarily displayed as the top-most window
5029 AddRootWindowToDrawData(windows_to_render_top_most[n]);
5030
5031 // Draw software mouse cursor if requested by io.MouseDrawCursor flag
5032 if (g.IO.MouseDrawCursor && first_render_of_frame && g.MouseCursor != ImGuiMouseCursor_None)
5033 RenderMouseCursor(g.IO.MousePos, g.Style.MouseCursorScale, g.MouseCursor, IM_COL32_WHITE, IM_COL32_BLACK, IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 48));
5034
5035 // Setup ImDrawData structures for end-user
5036 g.IO.MetricsRenderVertices = g.IO.MetricsRenderIndices = 0;
5037 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
5038 {
5039 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
5040 viewport->DrawDataBuilder.FlattenIntoSingleLayer();
5041
5042 // Add foreground ImDrawList (for each active viewport)
5043 if (viewport->DrawLists[1] != NULL)
5044 AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], GetForegroundDrawList(viewport));
5045
5046 SetupViewportDrawData(viewport, &viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0]);
5047 ImDrawData* draw_data = &viewport->DrawDataP;
5048 g.IO.MetricsRenderVertices += draw_data->TotalVtxCount;
5049 g.IO.MetricsRenderIndices += draw_data->TotalIdxCount;
5050 }
5051
5052 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_RenderPost);
5053}
5054
5055// Calculate text size. Text can be multi-line. Optionally ignore text after a ## marker.
5056// CalcTextSize("") should return ImVec2(0.0f, g.FontSize)
5057ImVec2 ImGui::CalcTextSize(const char* text, const char* text_end, bool hide_text_after_double_hash, float wrap_width)
5058{
5059 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5060
5061 const char* text_display_end;
5062 if (hide_text_after_double_hash)
5063 text_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end); // Hide anything after a '##' string
5064 else
5065 text_display_end = text_end;
5066
5067 ImFont* font = g.Font;
5068 const float font_size = g.FontSize;
5069 if (text == text_display_end)
5070 return ImVec2(0.0f, font_size);
5071 ImVec2 text_size = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, wrap_width, text, text_display_end, NULL);
5072
5073 // Round
5074 // FIXME: This has been here since Dec 2015 (7b0bf230) but down the line we want this out.
5075 // FIXME: Investigate using ceilf or e.g.
5076 // - https://git.musl-libc.org/cgit/musl/tree/src/math/ceilf.c
5077 // - https://embarkstudios.github.io/rust-gpu/api/src/libm/math/ceilf.rs.html
5078 text_size.x = IM_FLOOR(text_size.x + 0.99999f);
5079
5080 return text_size;
5081}
5082
5083// Find window given position, search front-to-back
5084// FIXME: Note that we have an inconsequential lag here: OuterRectClipped is updated in Begin(), so windows moved programmatically
5085// with SetWindowPos() and not SetNextWindowPos() will have that rectangle lagging by a frame at the time FindHoveredWindow() is
5086// called, aka before the next Begin(). Moving window isn't affected.
5087static void FindHoveredWindow()
5088{
5089 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5090
5091 ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = NULL;
5092 ImGuiWindow* hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window = NULL;
5093 if (g.MovingWindow && !(g.MovingWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
5094 hovered_window = g.MovingWindow;
5095
5096 ImVec2 padding_regular = g.Style.TouchExtraPadding;
5097 ImVec2 padding_for_resize = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? g.WindowsHoverPadding : padding_regular;
5098 for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
5099 {
5100 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
5101 IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(28182); // [Static Analyzer] Dereferencing NULL pointer.
5102 if (!window->Active || window->Hidden)
5103 continue;
5104 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs)
5105 continue;
5106
5107 // Using the clipped AABB, a child window will typically be clipped by its parent (not always)
5108 ImRect bb(window->OuterRectClipped);
5109 if (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
5110 bb.Expand(padding_regular);
5111 else
5112 bb.Expand(padding_for_resize);
5113 if (!bb.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
5114 continue;
5115
5116 // Support for one rectangular hole in any given window
5117 // FIXME: Consider generalizing hit-testing override (with more generic data, callback, etc.) (#1512)
5118 if (window->HitTestHoleSize.x != 0)
5119 {
5120 ImVec2 hole_pos(window->Pos.x + (float)window->HitTestHoleOffset.x, window->Pos.y + (float)window->HitTestHoleOffset.y);
5121 ImVec2 hole_size((float)window->HitTestHoleSize.x, (float)window->HitTestHoleSize.y);
5122 if (ImRect(hole_pos, hole_pos + hole_size).Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
5123 continue;
5124 }
5125
5126 if (hovered_window == NULL)
5127 hovered_window = window;
5128 IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(28182); // [Static Analyzer] Dereferencing NULL pointer.
5129 if (hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window == NULL && (!g.MovingWindow || window->RootWindow != g.MovingWindow->RootWindow))
5130 hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window = window;
5131 if (hovered_window && hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window)
5132 break;
5133 }
5134
5135 g.HoveredWindow = hovered_window;
5136 g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window;
5137}
5138
5139bool ImGui::IsItemActive()
5140{
5141 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5142 if (g.ActiveId)
5143 return g.ActiveId == g.LastItemData.ID;
5144 return false;
5145}
5146
5147bool ImGui::IsItemActivated()
5148{
5149 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5150 if (g.ActiveId)
5151 if (g.ActiveId == g.LastItemData.ID && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame != g.LastItemData.ID)
5152 return true;
5153 return false;
5154}
5155
5156bool ImGui::IsItemDeactivated()
5157{
5158 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5159 if (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated)
5160 return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated) != 0;
5161 return (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == g.LastItemData.ID && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.LastItemData.ID);
5162}
5163
5164bool ImGui::IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit()
5165{
5166 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5167 return IsItemDeactivated() && (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameHasBeenEditedBefore || (g.ActiveId == 0 && g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore));
5168}
5169
5170// == GetItemID() == GetFocusID()
5171bool ImGui::IsItemFocused()
5172{
5173 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5174 if (g.NavId != g.LastItemData.ID || g.NavId == 0)
5175 return false;
5176 return true;
5177}
5178
5179// Important: this can be useful but it is NOT equivalent to the behavior of e.g.Button()!
5180// Most widgets have specific reactions based on mouse-up/down state, mouse position etc.
5181bool ImGui::IsItemClicked(ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button)
5182{
5183 return IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_None);
5184}
5185
5186bool ImGui::IsItemToggledOpen()
5187{
5188 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5189 return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledOpen) ? true : false;
5190}
5191
5192bool ImGui::IsItemToggledSelection()
5193{
5194 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5195 return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection) ? true : false;
5196}
5197
5198bool ImGui::IsAnyItemHovered()
5199{
5200 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5201 return g.HoveredId != 0 || g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != 0;
5202}
5203
5204bool ImGui::IsAnyItemActive()
5205{
5206 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5207 return g.ActiveId != 0;
5208}
5209
5210bool ImGui::IsAnyItemFocused()
5211{
5212 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5213 return g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight;
5214}
5215
5216bool ImGui::IsItemVisible()
5217{
5218 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5219 return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible) != 0;
5220}
5221
5222bool ImGui::IsItemEdited()
5223{
5224 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5225 return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited) != 0;
5226}
5227
5228// Allow last item to be overlapped by a subsequent item. Both may be activated during the same frame before the later one takes priority.
5229// FIXME: Although this is exposed, its interaction and ideal idiom with using ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowItemOverlap flag are extremely confusing, need rework.
5230void ImGui::SetItemAllowOverlap()
5231{
5232 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5233 ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
5234 if (g.HoveredId == id)
5235 g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = true;
5236 if (g.ActiveId == id)
5237 g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = true;
5238}
5239
5240// FIXME: It might be undesirable that this will likely disable KeyOwner-aware shortcuts systems. Consider a more fine-tuned version for the two users of this function.
5241void ImGui::SetActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys()
5242{
5243 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5244 IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId != 0);
5245 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = (1 << ImGuiDir_COUNT) - 1;
5246 g.ActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys = true;
5247 NavMoveRequestCancel();
5248}
5249
5250ImGuiID ImGui::GetItemID()
5251{
5252 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5253 return g.LastItemData.ID;
5254}
5255
5256ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectMin()
5257{
5258 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5259 return g.LastItemData.Rect.Min;
5260}
5261
5262ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectMax()
5263{
5264 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5265 return g.LastItemData.Rect.Max;
5266}
5267
5268ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectSize()
5269{
5270 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5271 return g.LastItemData.Rect.GetSize();
5272}
5273
5274bool ImGui::BeginChildEx(const char* name, ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5275{
5276 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5277 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5278
5279 flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow;
5280 flags |= (parent_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove); // Inherit the NoMove flag
5281
5282 // Size
5283 const ImVec2 content_avail = GetContentRegionAvail();
5284 ImVec2 size = ImFloor(size_arg);
5285 const int auto_fit_axises = ((size.x == 0.0f) ? (1 << ImGuiAxis_X) : 0x00) | ((size.y == 0.0f) ? (1 << ImGuiAxis_Y) : 0x00);
5286 if (size.x <= 0.0f)
5287 size.x = ImMax(content_avail.x + size.x, 4.0f); // Arbitrary minimum child size (0.0f causing too many issues)
5288 if (size.y <= 0.0f)
5289 size.y = ImMax(content_avail.y + size.y, 4.0f);
5290 SetNextWindowSize(size);
5291
5292 // Build up name. If you need to append to a same child from multiple location in the ID stack, use BeginChild(ImGuiID id) with a stable value.
5293 const char* temp_window_name;
5294 if (name)
5295 ImFormatStringToTempBuffer(&temp_window_name, NULL, "%s/%s_%08X", parent_window->Name, name, id);
5296 else
5297 ImFormatStringToTempBuffer(&temp_window_name, NULL, "%s/%08X", parent_window->Name, id);
5298
5299 const float backup_border_size = g.Style.ChildBorderSize;
5300 if (!border)
5301 g.Style.ChildBorderSize = 0.0f;
5302 bool ret = Begin(temp_window_name, NULL, flags);
5303 g.Style.ChildBorderSize = backup_border_size;
5304
5305 ImGuiWindow* child_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5306 child_window->ChildId = id;
5307 child_window->AutoFitChildAxises = (ImS8)auto_fit_axises;
5308
5309 // Set the cursor to handle case where the user called SetNextWindowPos()+BeginChild() manually.
5310 // While this is not really documented/defined, it seems that the expected thing to do.
5311 if (child_window->BeginCount == 1)
5312 parent_window->DC.CursorPos = child_window->Pos;
5313
5314 // Process navigation-in immediately so NavInit can run on first frame
5315 if (g.NavActivateId == id && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened) && (child_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask != 0 || child_window->DC.NavHasScroll))
5316 {
5317 FocusWindow(child_window);
5318 NavInitWindow(child_window, false);
5319 SetActiveID(id + 1, child_window); // Steal ActiveId with another arbitrary id so that key-press won't activate child item
5320 g.ActiveIdSource = g.NavInputSource;
5321 }
5322 return ret;
5323}
5324
5325bool ImGui::BeginChild(const char* str_id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5326{
5327 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
5328 return BeginChildEx(str_id, window->GetID(str_id), size_arg, border, extra_flags);
5329}
5330
5331bool ImGui::BeginChild(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5332{
5333 IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
5334 return BeginChildEx(NULL, id, size_arg, border, extra_flags);
5335}
5336
5337void ImGui::EndChild()
5338{
5339 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5340 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
5341
5342 IM_ASSERT(g.WithinEndChild == false);
5343 IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow); // Mismatched BeginChild()/EndChild() calls
5344
5345 g.WithinEndChild = true;
5346 if (window->BeginCount > 1)
5347 {
5348 End();
5349 }
5350 else
5351 {
5352 ImVec2 sz = window->Size;
5353 if (window->AutoFitChildAxises & (1 << ImGuiAxis_X)) // Arbitrary minimum zero-ish child size of 4.0f causes less trouble than a 0.0f
5354 sz.x = ImMax(4.0f, sz.x);
5355 if (window->AutoFitChildAxises & (1 << ImGuiAxis_Y))
5356 sz.y = ImMax(4.0f, sz.y);
5357 End();
5358
5359 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5360 ImRect bb(parent_window->DC.CursorPos, parent_window->DC.CursorPos + sz);
5361 ItemSize(sz);
5362 if ((window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask != 0 || window->DC.NavHasScroll) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened))
5363 {
5364 ItemAdd(bb, window->ChildId);
5365 RenderNavHighlight(bb, window->ChildId);
5366
5367 // When browsing a window that has no activable items (scroll only) we keep a highlight on the child (pass g.NavId to trick into always displaying)
5368 if (window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask == 0 && window == g.NavWindow)
5369 RenderNavHighlight(ImRect(bb.Min - ImVec2(2, 2), bb.Max + ImVec2(2, 2)), g.NavId, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin);
5370 }
5371 else
5372 {
5373 // Not navigable into
5374 ItemAdd(bb, 0);
5375 }
5376 if (g.HoveredWindow == window)
5377 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow;
5378 }
5379 g.WithinEndChild = false;
5380 g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce a carriage return
5381}
5382
5383// Helper to create a child window / scrolling region that looks like a normal widget frame.
5384bool ImGui::BeginChildFrame(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5385{
5386 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5387 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5388 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_FrameBg]);
5389 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, style.FrameRounding);
5390 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, style.FrameBorderSize);
5391 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, style.FramePadding);
5392 bool ret = BeginChild(id, size, true, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding | extra_flags);
5393 PopStyleVar(3);
5394 PopStyleColor();
5395 return ret;
5396}
5397
5398void ImGui::EndChildFrame()
5399{
5400 EndChild();
5401}
5402
5403static void SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiCond flags, bool enabled)
5404{
5405 window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & ~flags);
5406 window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & ~flags);
5407 window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags & ~flags);
5408}
5409
5410ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindWindowByID(ImGuiID id)
5411{
5412 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5413 return (ImGuiWindow*)g.WindowsById.GetVoidPtr(id);
5414}
5415
5416ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindWindowByName(const char* name)
5417{
5418 ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(name);
5419 return FindWindowByID(id);
5420}
5421
5422static void ApplyWindowSettings(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindowSettings* settings)
5423{
5424 window->Pos = ImFloor(ImVec2(settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y));
5425 if (settings->Size.x > 0 && settings->Size.y > 0)
5426 window->Size = window->SizeFull = ImFloor(ImVec2(settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y));
5427 window->Collapsed = settings->Collapsed;
5428}
5429
5430static void UpdateWindowInFocusOrderList(ImGuiWindow* window, bool just_created, ImGuiWindowFlags new_flags)
5431{
5432 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5433
5434 const bool new_is_explicit_child = (new_flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) != 0 && ((new_flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) == 0 || (new_flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) != 0);
5435 const bool child_flag_changed = new_is_explicit_child != window->IsExplicitChild;
5436 if ((just_created || child_flag_changed) && !new_is_explicit_child)
5437 {
5438 IM_ASSERT(!g.WindowsFocusOrder.contains(window));
5439 g.WindowsFocusOrder.push_back(window);
5440 window->FocusOrder = (short)(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1);
5441 }
5442 else if (!just_created && child_flag_changed && new_is_explicit_child)
5443 {
5444 IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder[window->FocusOrder] == window);
5445 for (int n = window->FocusOrder + 1; n < g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size; n++)
5446 g.WindowsFocusOrder[n]->FocusOrder--;
5447 g.WindowsFocusOrder.erase(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Data + window->FocusOrder);
5448 window->FocusOrder = -1;
5449 }
5450 window->IsExplicitChild = new_is_explicit_child;
5451}
5452
5453static void InitOrLoadWindowSettings(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindowSettings* settings)
5454{
5455 // Initial window state with e.g. default/arbitrary window position
5456 // Use SetNextWindowPos() with the appropriate condition flag to change the initial position of a window.
5457 const ImGuiViewport* main_viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
5458 window->Pos = main_viewport->Pos + ImVec2(60, 60);
5459 window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags = window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags = window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags = ImGuiCond_Always | ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing;
5460
5461 if (settings != NULL)
5462 {
5463 SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, false);
5464 ApplyWindowSettings(window, settings);
5465 }
5466 window->DC.CursorStartPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.IdealMaxPos = window->Pos; // So first call to CalcWindowContentSizes() doesn't return crazy values
5467
5468 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) != 0)
5469 {
5470 window->AutoFitFramesX = window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
5471 window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
5472 }
5473 else
5474 {
5475 if (window->Size.x <= 0.0f)
5476 window->AutoFitFramesX = 2;
5477 if (window->Size.y <= 0.0f)
5478 window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
5479 window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0) || (window->AutoFitFramesY > 0);
5480 }
5481}
5482
5483static ImGuiWindow* CreateNewWindow(const char* name, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5484{
5485 // Create window the first time
5486 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("CreateNewWindow '%s', flags = 0x%08X\n", name, flags);
5487 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5488 ImGuiWindow* window = IM_NEW(ImGuiWindow)(&g, name);
5489 window->Flags = flags;
5490 g.WindowsById.SetVoidPtr(window->ID, window);
5491
5492 ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = NULL;
5493 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings))
5494 if ((settings = ImGui::FindWindowSettingsByWindow(window)) != 0)
5495 window->SettingsOffset = g.SettingsWindows.offset_from_ptr(settings);
5496
5497 InitOrLoadWindowSettings(window, settings);
5498
5499 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus)
5500 g.Windows.push_front(window); // Quite slow but rare and only once
5501 else
5502 g.Windows.push_back(window);
5503
5504 return window;
5505}
5506
5507static ImVec2 CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_desired)
5508{
5509 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5510 ImVec2 new_size = size_desired;
5511 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint)
5512 {
5513 // Using -1,-1 on either X/Y axis to preserve the current size.
5514 ImRect cr = g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect;
5515 new_size.x = (cr.Min.x >= 0 && cr.Max.x >= 0) ? ImClamp(new_size.x, cr.Min.x, cr.Max.x) : window->SizeFull.x;
5516 new_size.y = (cr.Min.y >= 0 && cr.Max.y >= 0) ? ImClamp(new_size.y, cr.Min.y, cr.Max.y) : window->SizeFull.y;
5517 if (g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback)
5518 {
5519 ImGuiSizeCallbackData data;
5520 data.UserData = g.NextWindowData.SizeCallbackUserData;
5521 data.Pos = window->Pos;
5522 data.CurrentSize = window->SizeFull;
5523 data.DesiredSize = new_size;
5524 g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback(&data);
5525 new_size = data.DesiredSize;
5526 }
5527 new_size.x = IM_FLOOR(new_size.x);
5528 new_size.y = IM_FLOOR(new_size.y);
5529 }
5530
5531 // Minimum size
5532 if (!(window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize)))
5533 {
5534 ImGuiWindow* window_for_height = window;
5535 new_size = ImMax(new_size, g.Style.WindowMinSize);
5536 const float minimum_height = window_for_height->TitleBarHeight() + window_for_height->MenuBarHeight() + ImMax(0.0f, g.Style.WindowRounding - 1.0f);
5537 new_size.y = ImMax(new_size.y, minimum_height); // Reduce artifacts with very small windows
5538 }
5539 return new_size;
5540}
5541
5542static void CalcWindowContentSizes(ImGuiWindow* window, ImVec2* content_size_current, ImVec2* content_size_ideal)
5543{
5544 bool preserve_old_content_sizes = false;
5545 if (window->Collapsed && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0)
5546 preserve_old_content_sizes = true;
5547 else if (window->Hidden && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems == 0 && window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0)
5548 preserve_old_content_sizes = true;
5549 if (preserve_old_content_sizes)
5550 {
5551 *content_size_current = window->ContentSize;
5552 *content_size_ideal = window->ContentSizeIdeal;
5553 return;
5554 }
5555
5556 content_size_current->x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x - window->DC.CursorStartPos.x);
5557 content_size_current->y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y - window->DC.CursorStartPos.y);
5558 content_size_ideal->x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : IM_FLOOR(ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x) - window->DC.CursorStartPos.x);
5559 content_size_ideal->y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : IM_FLOOR(ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.IdealMaxPos.y) - window->DC.CursorStartPos.y);
5560}
5561
5562static ImVec2 CalcWindowAutoFitSize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_contents)
5563{
5564 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5565 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5566 const float decoration_w_without_scrollbars = window->DecoOuterSizeX1 + window->DecoOuterSizeX2 - window->ScrollbarSizes.x;
5567 const float decoration_h_without_scrollbars = window->DecoOuterSizeY1 + window->DecoOuterSizeY2 - window->ScrollbarSizes.y;
5568 ImVec2 size_pad = window->WindowPadding * 2.0f;
5569 ImVec2 size_desired = size_contents + size_pad + ImVec2(decoration_w_without_scrollbars, decoration_h_without_scrollbars);
5570 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
5571 {
5572 // Tooltip always resize
5573 return size_desired;
5574 }
5575 else
5576 {
5577 // Maximum window size is determined by the viewport size or monitor size
5578 const bool is_popup = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0;
5579 const bool is_menu = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) != 0;
5580 ImVec2 size_min = style.WindowMinSize;
5581 if (is_popup || is_menu) // Popups and menus bypass style.WindowMinSize by default, but we give then a non-zero minimum size to facilitate understanding problematic cases (e.g. empty popups)
5582 size_min = ImMin(size_min, ImVec2(4.0f, 4.0f));
5583
5584 ImVec2 avail_size = ImGui::GetMainViewport()->WorkSize;
5585 ImVec2 size_auto_fit = ImClamp(size_desired, size_min, ImMax(size_min, avail_size - style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding * 2.0f));
5586
5587 // When the window cannot fit all contents (either because of constraints, either because screen is too small),
5588 // we are growing the size on the other axis to compensate for expected scrollbar. FIXME: Might turn bigger than ViewportSize-WindowPadding.
5589 ImVec2 size_auto_fit_after_constraint = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5590 bool will_have_scrollbar_x = (size_auto_fit_after_constraint.x - size_pad.x - decoration_w_without_scrollbars < size_contents.x && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar)) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar);
5591 bool will_have_scrollbar_y = (size_auto_fit_after_constraint.y - size_pad.y - decoration_h_without_scrollbars < size_contents.y && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar)) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar);
5592 if (will_have_scrollbar_x)
5593 size_auto_fit.y += style.ScrollbarSize;
5594 if (will_have_scrollbar_y)
5595 size_auto_fit.x += style.ScrollbarSize;
5596 return size_auto_fit;
5597 }
5598}
5599
5600ImVec2 ImGui::CalcWindowNextAutoFitSize(ImGuiWindow* window)
5601{
5602 ImVec2 size_contents_current;
5603 ImVec2 size_contents_ideal;
5604 CalcWindowContentSizes(window, &size_contents_current, &size_contents_ideal);
5605 ImVec2 size_auto_fit = CalcWindowAutoFitSize(window, size_contents_ideal);
5606 ImVec2 size_final = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5607 return size_final;
5608}
5609
5610static ImGuiCol GetWindowBgColorIdx(ImGuiWindow* window)
5611{
5612 if (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
5613 return ImGuiCol_PopupBg;
5614 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
5615 return ImGuiCol_ChildBg;
5616 return ImGuiCol_WindowBg;
5617}
5618
5619static void CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& corner_target, const ImVec2& corner_norm, ImVec2* out_pos, ImVec2* out_size)
5620{
5621 ImVec2 pos_min = ImLerp(corner_target, window->Pos, corner_norm); // Expected window upper-left
5622 ImVec2 pos_max = ImLerp(window->Pos + window->Size, corner_target, corner_norm); // Expected window lower-right
5623 ImVec2 size_expected = pos_max - pos_min;
5624 ImVec2 size_constrained = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_expected);
5625 *out_pos = pos_min;
5626 if (corner_norm.x == 0.0f)
5627 out_pos->x -= (size_constrained.x - size_expected.x);
5628 if (corner_norm.y == 0.0f)
5629 out_pos->y -= (size_constrained.y - size_expected.y);
5630 *out_size = size_constrained;
5631}
5632
5633// Data for resizing from corner
5634struct ImGuiResizeGripDef
5635{
5636 ImVec2 CornerPosN;
5637 ImVec2 InnerDir;
5638 int AngleMin12, AngleMax12;
5639};
5640static const ImGuiResizeGripDef resize_grip_def[4] =
5641{
5642 { ImVec2(1, 1), ImVec2(-1, -1), 0, 3 }, // Lower-right
5643 { ImVec2(0, 1), ImVec2(+1, -1), 3, 6 }, // Lower-left
5644 { ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(+1, +1), 6, 9 }, // Upper-left (Unused)
5645 { ImVec2(1, 0), ImVec2(-1, +1), 9, 12 } // Upper-right (Unused)
5646};
5647
5648// Data for resizing from borders
5649struct ImGuiResizeBorderDef
5650{
5651 ImVec2 InnerDir;
5652 ImVec2 SegmentN1, SegmentN2;
5653 float OuterAngle;
5654};
5655static const ImGuiResizeBorderDef resize_border_def[4] =
5656{
5657 { ImVec2(+1, 0), ImVec2(0, 1), ImVec2(0, 0), IM_PI * 1.00f }, // Left
5658 { ImVec2(-1, 0), ImVec2(1, 0), ImVec2(1, 1), IM_PI * 0.00f }, // Right
5659 { ImVec2(0, +1), ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(1, 0), IM_PI * 1.50f }, // Up
5660 { ImVec2(0, -1), ImVec2(1, 1), ImVec2(0, 1), IM_PI * 0.50f } // Down
5661};
5662
5663static ImRect GetResizeBorderRect(ImGuiWindow* window, int border_n, float perp_padding, float thickness)
5664{
5665 ImRect rect = window->Rect();
5666 if (thickness == 0.0f)
5667 rect.Max -= ImVec2(1, 1);
5668 if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Left) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x - thickness, rect.Min.y + perp_padding, rect.Min.x + thickness, rect.Max.y - perp_padding); }
5669 if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Right) { return ImRect(rect.Max.x - thickness, rect.Min.y + perp_padding, rect.Max.x + thickness, rect.Max.y - perp_padding); }
5670 if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Up) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x + perp_padding, rect.Min.y - thickness, rect.Max.x - perp_padding, rect.Min.y + thickness); }
5671 if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Down) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x + perp_padding, rect.Max.y - thickness, rect.Max.x - perp_padding, rect.Max.y + thickness); }
5672 IM_ASSERT(0);
5673 return ImRect();
5674}
5675
5676// 0..3: corners (Lower-right, Lower-left, Unused, Unused)
5677ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowResizeCornerID(ImGuiWindow* window, int n)
5678{
5679 IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < 4);
5680 ImGuiID id = window->ID;
5681 id = ImHashStr("#RESIZE", 0, id);
5682 id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(int), id);
5683 return id;
5684}
5685
5686// Borders (Left, Right, Up, Down)
5687ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowResizeBorderID(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiDir dir)
5688{
5689 IM_ASSERT(dir >= 0 && dir < 4);
5690 int n = (int)dir + 4;
5691 ImGuiID id = window->ID;
5692 id = ImHashStr("#RESIZE", 0, id);
5693 id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(int), id);
5694 return id;
5695}
5696
5697// Handle resize for: Resize Grips, Borders, Gamepad
5698// Return true when using auto-fit (double-click on resize grip)
5699static bool ImGui::UpdateWindowManualResize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_auto_fit, int* border_held, int resize_grip_count, ImU32 resize_grip_col[4], const ImRect& visibility_rect)
5700{
5701 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5702 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5703
5704 if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize) || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) || window->AutoFitFramesX > 0 || window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
5705 return false;
5706 if (window->WasActive == false) // Early out to avoid running this code for e.g. a hidden implicit/fallback Debug window.
5707 return false;
5708
5709 bool ret_auto_fit = false;
5710 const int resize_border_count = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? 4 : 0;
5711 const float grip_draw_size = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(g.FontSize * 1.35f, window->WindowRounding + 1.0f + g.FontSize * 0.2f));
5712 const float grip_hover_inner_size = IM_FLOOR(grip_draw_size * 0.75f);
5713 const float grip_hover_outer_size = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING : 0.0f;
5714
5715 ImVec2 pos_target(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5716 ImVec2 size_target(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5717
5718 // Resize grips and borders are on layer 1
5719 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
5720
5721 // Manual resize grips
5722 PushID("#RESIZE");
5723 for (int resize_grip_n = 0; resize_grip_n < resize_grip_count; resize_grip_n++)
5724 {
5725 const ImGuiResizeGripDef& def = resize_grip_def[resize_grip_n];
5726 const ImVec2 corner = ImLerp(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, def.CornerPosN);
5727
5728 // Using the FlattenChilds button flag we make the resize button accessible even if we are hovering over a child window
5729 bool hovered, held;
5730 ImRect resize_rect(corner - def.InnerDir * grip_hover_outer_size, corner + def.InnerDir * grip_hover_inner_size);
5731 if (resize_rect.Min.x > resize_rect.Max.x) ImSwap(resize_rect.Min.x, resize_rect.Max.x);
5732 if (resize_rect.Min.y > resize_rect.Max.y) ImSwap(resize_rect.Min.y, resize_rect.Max.y);
5733 ImGuiID resize_grip_id = window->GetID(resize_grip_n); // == GetWindowResizeCornerID()
5734 ItemAdd(resize_rect, resize_grip_id, NULL, ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav);
5735 ButtonBehavior(resize_rect, resize_grip_id, &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren | ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus);
5736 //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(resize_rect.Min, resize_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
5737 if (hovered || held)
5738 g.MouseCursor = (resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNESW : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNWSE;
5739
5740 if (held && g.IO.MouseClickedCount[0] == 2 && resize_grip_n == 0)
5741 {
5742 // Manual auto-fit when double-clicking
5743 size_target = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5744 ret_auto_fit = true;
5745 ClearActiveID();
5746 }
5747 else if (held)
5748 {
5749 // Resize from any of the four corners
5750 // We don't use an incremental MouseDelta but rather compute an absolute target size based on mouse position
5751 ImVec2 clamp_min = ImVec2(def.CornerPosN.x == 1.0f ? visibility_rect.Min.x : -FLT_MAX, def.CornerPosN.y == 1.0f ? visibility_rect.Min.y : -FLT_MAX);
5752 ImVec2 clamp_max = ImVec2(def.CornerPosN.x == 0.0f ? visibility_rect.Max.x : +FLT_MAX, def.CornerPosN.y == 0.0f ? visibility_rect.Max.y : +FLT_MAX);
5753 ImVec2 corner_target = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset + ImLerp(def.InnerDir * grip_hover_outer_size, def.InnerDir * -grip_hover_inner_size, def.CornerPosN); // Corner of the window corresponding to our corner grip
5754 corner_target = ImClamp(corner_target, clamp_min, clamp_max);
5755 CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(window, corner_target, def.CornerPosN, &pos_target, &size_target);
5756 }
5757
5758 // Only lower-left grip is visible before hovering/activating
5759 if (resize_grip_n == 0 || held || hovered)
5760 resize_grip_col[resize_grip_n] = GetColorU32(held ? ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered : ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip);
5761 }
5762 for (int border_n = 0; border_n < resize_border_count; border_n++)
5763 {
5764 const ImGuiResizeBorderDef& def = resize_border_def[border_n];
5765 const ImGuiAxis axis = (border_n == ImGuiDir_Left || border_n == ImGuiDir_Right) ? ImGuiAxis_X : ImGuiAxis_Y;
5766
5767 bool hovered, held;
5768 ImRect border_rect = GetResizeBorderRect(window, border_n, grip_hover_inner_size, WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING);
5769 ImGuiID border_id = window->GetID(border_n + 4); // == GetWindowResizeBorderID()
5770 ItemAdd(border_rect, border_id, NULL, ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav);
5771 ButtonBehavior(border_rect, border_id, &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren | ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus);
5772 //GetForegroundDrawLists(window)->AddRect(border_rect.Min, border_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
5773 if ((hovered && g.HoveredIdTimer > WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_FEEDBACK_TIMER) || held)
5774 {
5775 g.MouseCursor = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS;
5776 if (held)
5777 *border_held = border_n;
5778 }
5779 if (held)
5780 {
5781 ImVec2 clamp_min(border_n == ImGuiDir_Right ? visibility_rect.Min.x : -FLT_MAX, border_n == ImGuiDir_Down ? visibility_rect.Min.y : -FLT_MAX);
5782 ImVec2 clamp_max(border_n == ImGuiDir_Left ? visibility_rect.Max.x : +FLT_MAX, border_n == ImGuiDir_Up ? visibility_rect.Max.y : +FLT_MAX);
5783 ImVec2 border_target = window->Pos;
5784 border_target[axis] = g.IO.MousePos[axis] - g.ActiveIdClickOffset[axis] + WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING;
5785 border_target = ImClamp(border_target, clamp_min, clamp_max);
5786 CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(window, border_target, ImMin(def.SegmentN1, def.SegmentN2), &pos_target, &size_target);
5787 }
5788 }
5789 PopID();
5790
5791 // Restore nav layer
5792 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
5793
5794 // Navigation resize (keyboard/gamepad)
5795 // FIXME: This cannot be moved to NavUpdateWindowing() because CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint() need to callback into user.
5796 // Not even sure the callback works here.
5797 if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow == window)
5798 {
5799 ImVec2 nav_resize_dir;
5800 if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard && g.IO.KeyShift)
5801 nav_resize_dir = GetKeyMagnitude2d(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow, ImGuiKey_RightArrow, ImGuiKey_UpArrow, ImGuiKey_DownArrow);
5802 if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
5803 nav_resize_dir = GetKeyMagnitude2d(ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadLeft, ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadRight, ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadUp, ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadDown);
5804 if (nav_resize_dir.x != 0.0f || nav_resize_dir.y != 0.0f)
5805 {
5806 const float NAV_RESIZE_SPEED = 600.0f;
5807 const float resize_step = NAV_RESIZE_SPEED * g.IO.DeltaTime * ImMin(g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.y);
5808 g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaSize += nav_resize_dir * resize_step;
5809 g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaSize = ImMax(g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaSize, visibility_rect.Min - window->Pos - window->Size); // We need Pos+Size >= visibility_rect.Min, so Size >= visibility_rect.Min - Pos, so size_delta >= visibility_rect.Min - window->Pos - window->Size
5810 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
5811 g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
5812 resize_grip_col[0] = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive);
5813 ImVec2 accum_floored = ImFloor(g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaSize);
5814 if (accum_floored.x != 0.0f || accum_floored.y != 0.0f)
5815 {
5816 // FIXME-NAV: Should store and accumulate into a separate size buffer to handle sizing constraints properly, right now a constraint will make us stuck.
5817 size_target = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, window->SizeFull + accum_floored);
5818 g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaSize -= accum_floored;
5819 }
5820 }
5821 }
5822
5823 // Apply back modified position/size to window
5824 if (size_target.x != FLT_MAX)
5825 {
5826 window->SizeFull = size_target;
5827 MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5828 }
5829 if (pos_target.x != FLT_MAX)
5830 {
5831 window->Pos = ImFloor(pos_target);
5832 MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5833 }
5834
5835 window->Size = window->SizeFull;
5836 return ret_auto_fit;
5837}
5838
5839static inline void ClampWindowPos(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& visibility_rect)
5840{
5841 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5842 ImVec2 size_for_clamping = window->Size;
5843 if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5844 size_for_clamping.y = window->TitleBarHeight();
5845 window->Pos = ImClamp(window->Pos, visibility_rect.Min - size_for_clamping, visibility_rect.Max);
5846}
5847
5848static void ImGui::RenderWindowOuterBorders(ImGuiWindow* window)
5849{
5850 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5851 float rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5852 float border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
5853 if (border_size > 0.0f && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
5854 window->DrawList->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, 0, border_size);
5855
5856 int border_held = window->ResizeBorderHeld;
5857 if (border_held != -1)
5858 {
5859 const ImGuiResizeBorderDef& def = resize_border_def[border_held];
5860 ImRect border_r = GetResizeBorderRect(window, border_held, rounding, 0.0f);
5861 window->DrawList->PathArcTo(ImLerp(border_r.Min, border_r.Max, def.SegmentN1) + ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) + def.InnerDir * rounding, rounding, def.OuterAngle - IM_PI * 0.25f, def.OuterAngle);
5862 window->DrawList->PathArcTo(ImLerp(border_r.Min, border_r.Max, def.SegmentN2) + ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) + def.InnerDir * rounding, rounding, def.OuterAngle, def.OuterAngle + IM_PI * 0.25f);
5863 window->DrawList->PathStroke(GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive), 0, ImMax(2.0f, border_size)); // Thicker than usual
5864 }
5865 if (g.Style.FrameBorderSize > 0 && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5866 {
5867 float y = window->Pos.y + window->TitleBarHeight() - 1;
5868 window->DrawList->AddLine(ImVec2(window->Pos.x + border_size, y), ImVec2(window->Pos.x + window->Size.x - border_size, y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), g.Style.FrameBorderSize);
5869 }
5870}
5871
5872// Draw background and borders
5873// Draw and handle scrollbars
5874void ImGui::RenderWindowDecorations(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& title_bar_rect, bool title_bar_is_highlight, bool handle_borders_and_resize_grips, int resize_grip_count, const ImU32 resize_grip_col[4], float resize_grip_draw_size)
5875{
5876 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5877 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5878 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5879
5880 // Ensure that ScrollBar doesn't read last frame's SkipItems
5881 IM_ASSERT(window->BeginCount == 0);
5882 window->SkipItems = false;
5883
5884 // Draw window + handle manual resize
5885 // As we highlight the title bar when want_focus is set, multiple reappearing windows will have their title bar highlighted on their reappearing frame.
5886 const float window_rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5887 const float window_border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
5888 if (window->Collapsed)
5889 {
5890 // Title bar only
5891 const float backup_border_size = style.FrameBorderSize;
5892 g.Style.FrameBorderSize = window->WindowBorderSize;
5893 ImU32 title_bar_col = GetColorU32((title_bar_is_highlight && !g.NavDisableHighlight) ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBgCollapsed);
5894 RenderFrame(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, title_bar_col, true, window_rounding);
5895 g.Style.FrameBorderSize = backup_border_size;
5896 }
5897 else
5898 {
5899 // Window background
5900 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
5901 {
5902 ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32(GetWindowBgColorIdx(window));
5903 bool override_alpha = false;
5904 float alpha = 1.0f;
5905 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasBgAlpha)
5906 {
5907 alpha = g.NextWindowData.BgAlphaVal;
5908 override_alpha = true;
5909 }
5910 if (override_alpha)
5911 bg_col = (bg_col & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK) | (IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(alpha) << IM_COL32_A_SHIFT);
5912 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(window->Pos + ImVec2(0, window->TitleBarHeight()), window->Pos + window->Size, bg_col, window_rounding, (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) ? 0 : ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottom);
5913 }
5914
5915 // Title bar
5916 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5917 {
5918 ImU32 title_bar_col = GetColorU32(title_bar_is_highlight ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBg);
5919 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, title_bar_col, window_rounding, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTop);
5920 }
5921
5922 // Menu bar
5923 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar)
5924 {
5925 ImRect menu_bar_rect = window->MenuBarRect();
5926 menu_bar_rect.ClipWith(window->Rect()); // Soft clipping, in particular child window don't have minimum size covering the menu bar so this is useful for them.
5927 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(menu_bar_rect.Min + ImVec2(window_border_size, 0), menu_bar_rect.Max - ImVec2(window_border_size, 0), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_MenuBarBg), (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) ? window_rounding : 0.0f, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTop);
5928 if (style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f && menu_bar_rect.Max.y < window->Pos.y + window->Size.y)
5929 window->DrawList->AddLine(menu_bar_rect.GetBL(), menu_bar_rect.GetBR(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), style.FrameBorderSize);
5930 }
5931
5932 // Scrollbars
5933 if (window->ScrollbarX)
5934 Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis_X);
5935 if (window->ScrollbarY)
5936 Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis_Y);
5937
5938 // Render resize grips (after their input handling so we don't have a frame of latency)
5939 if (handle_borders_and_resize_grips && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize))
5940 {
5941 for (int resize_grip_n = 0; resize_grip_n < resize_grip_count; resize_grip_n++)
5942 {
5943 const ImU32 col = resize_grip_col[resize_grip_n];
5944 if ((col & IM_COL32_A_MASK) == 0)
5945 continue;
5946 const ImGuiResizeGripDef& grip = resize_grip_def[resize_grip_n];
5947 const ImVec2 corner = ImLerp(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, grip.CornerPosN);
5948 window->DrawList->PathLineTo(corner + grip.InnerDir * ((resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImVec2(window_border_size, resize_grip_draw_size) : ImVec2(resize_grip_draw_size, window_border_size)));
5949 window->DrawList->PathLineTo(corner + grip.InnerDir * ((resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImVec2(resize_grip_draw_size, window_border_size) : ImVec2(window_border_size, resize_grip_draw_size)));
5950 window->DrawList->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(corner.x + grip.InnerDir.x * (window_rounding + window_border_size), corner.y + grip.InnerDir.y * (window_rounding + window_border_size)), window_rounding, grip.AngleMin12, grip.AngleMax12);
5951 window->DrawList->PathFillConvex(col);
5952 }
5953 }
5954
5955 // Borders
5956 if (handle_borders_and_resize_grips)
5957 RenderWindowOuterBorders(window);
5958 }
5959}
5960
5961// Render title text, collapse button, close button
5962void ImGui::RenderWindowTitleBarContents(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& title_bar_rect, const char* name, bool* p_open)
5963{
5964 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5965 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5966 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5967
5968 const bool has_close_button = (p_open != NULL);
5969 const bool has_collapse_button = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse) && (style.WindowMenuButtonPosition != ImGuiDir_None);
5970
5971 // Close & Collapse button are on the Menu NavLayer and don't default focus (unless there's nothing else on that layer)
5972 // FIXME-NAV: Might want (or not?) to set the equivalent of ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus so that mouse clicks on standard title bar items don't necessarily set nav/keyboard ref?
5973 const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags_backup = g.CurrentItemFlags;
5974 g.CurrentItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus;
5975 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
5976
5977 // Layout buttons
5978 // FIXME: Would be nice to generalize the subtleties expressed here into reusable code.
5979 float pad_l = style.FramePadding.x;
5980 float pad_r = style.FramePadding.x;
5981 float button_sz = g.FontSize;
5982 ImVec2 close_button_pos;
5983 ImVec2 collapse_button_pos;
5984 if (has_close_button)
5985 {
5986 pad_r += button_sz;
5987 close_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5988 }
5989 if (has_collapse_button && style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Right)
5990 {
5991 pad_r += button_sz;
5992 collapse_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5993 }
5994 if (has_collapse_button && style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left)
5995 {
5996 collapse_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Min.x + pad_l - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5997 pad_l += button_sz;
5998 }
5999
6000 // Collapse button (submitting first so it gets priority when choosing a navigation init fallback)
6001 if (has_collapse_button)
6002 if (CollapseButton(window->GetID("#COLLAPSE"), collapse_button_pos))
6003 window->WantCollapseToggle = true; // Defer actual collapsing to next frame as we are too far in the Begin() function
6004
6005 // Close button
6006 if (has_close_button)
6007 if (CloseButton(window->GetID("#CLOSE"), close_button_pos))
6008 *p_open = false;
6009
6010 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
6011 g.CurrentItemFlags = item_flags_backup;
6012
6013 // Title bar text (with: horizontal alignment, avoiding collapse/close button, optional "unsaved document" marker)
6014 // FIXME: Refactor text alignment facilities along with RenderText helpers, this is WAY too much messy code..
6015 const float marker_size_x = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument) ? button_sz * 0.80f : 0.0f;
6016 const ImVec2 text_size = CalcTextSize(name, NULL, true) + ImVec2(marker_size_x, 0.0f);
6017
6018 // As a nice touch we try to ensure that centered title text doesn't get affected by visibility of Close/Collapse button,
6019 // while uncentered title text will still reach edges correctly.
6020 if (pad_l > style.FramePadding.x)
6021 pad_l += g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
6022 if (pad_r > style.FramePadding.x)
6023 pad_r += g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
6024 if (style.WindowTitleAlign.x > 0.0f && style.WindowTitleAlign.x < 1.0f)
6025 {
6026 float centerness = ImSaturate(1.0f - ImFabs(style.WindowTitleAlign.x - 0.5f) * 2.0f); // 0.0f on either edges, 1.0f on center
6027 float pad_extend = ImMin(ImMax(pad_l, pad_r), title_bar_rect.GetWidth() - pad_l - pad_r - text_size.x);
6028 pad_l = ImMax(pad_l, pad_extend * centerness);
6029 pad_r = ImMax(pad_r, pad_extend * centerness);
6030 }
6031
6032 ImRect layout_r(title_bar_rect.Min.x + pad_l, title_bar_rect.Min.y, title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r, title_bar_rect.Max.y);
6033 ImRect clip_r(layout_r.Min.x, layout_r.Min.y, ImMin(layout_r.Max.x + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, title_bar_rect.Max.x), layout_r.Max.y);
6034 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument)
6035 {
6036 ImVec2 marker_pos;
6037 marker_pos.x = ImClamp(layout_r.Min.x + (layout_r.GetWidth() - text_size.x) * style.WindowTitleAlign.x + text_size.x, layout_r.Min.x, layout_r.Max.x);
6038 marker_pos.y = (layout_r.Min.y + layout_r.Max.y) * 0.5f;
6039 if (marker_pos.x > layout_r.Min.x)
6040 {
6041 RenderBullet(window->DrawList, marker_pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
6042 clip_r.Max.x = ImMin(clip_r.Max.x, marker_pos.x - (int)(marker_size_x * 0.5f));
6043 }
6044 }
6045 //if (g.IO.KeyShift) window->DrawList->AddRect(layout_r.Min, layout_r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 128, 0, 255)); // [DEBUG]
6046 //if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) window->DrawList->AddRect(clip_r.Min, clip_r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 128, 0, 255)); // [DEBUG]
6047 RenderTextClipped(layout_r.Min, layout_r.Max, name, NULL, &text_size, style.WindowTitleAlign, &clip_r);
6048}
6049
6050void ImGui::UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindowFlags flags, ImGuiWindow* parent_window)
6051{
6052 window->ParentWindow = parent_window;
6053 window->RootWindow = window->RootWindowPopupTree = window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight = window->RootWindowForNav = window;
