7788 "I", "J", "K", "L", "M", "N", "O", "P", "Q", "R", "S", "T", "U", "V", "W", "X", "Y", "Z",
7789 "F1", "F2", "F3", "F4", "F5", "F6", "F7", "F8", "F9", "F10", "F11", "F12",
7790 "Apostrophe", "Comma", "Minus", "Period", "Slash", "Semicolon", "Equal", "LeftBracket",
7791 "Backslash", "RightBracket", "GraveAccent", "CapsLock", "ScrollLock", "NumLock", "PrintScreen",
7792 "Pause", "Keypad0", "Keypad1", "Keypad2", "Keypad3", "Keypad4", "Keypad5", "Keypad6",
7793 "Keypad7", "Keypad8", "Keypad9", "KeypadDecimal", "KeypadDivide", "KeypadMultiply",
7794 "KeypadSubtract", "KeypadAdd", "KeypadEnter", "KeypadEqual",
7795 "GamepadStart", "GamepadBack",
7796 "GamepadFaceLeft", "GamepadFaceRight", "GamepadFaceUp", "GamepadFaceDown",
7797 "GamepadDpadLeft", "GamepadDpadRight", "GamepadDpadUp", "GamepadDpadDown",
7798 "GamepadL1", "GamepadR1", "GamepadL2", "GamepadR2", "GamepadL3", "GamepadR3",
7799 "GamepadLStickLeft", "GamepadLStickRight", "GamepadLStickUp", "GamepadLStickDown",
7800 "GamepadRStickLeft", "GamepadRStickRight", "GamepadRStickUp", "GamepadRStickDown",
7801 "MouseLeft", "MouseRight", "MouseMiddle", "MouseX1", "MouseX2", "MouseWheelX", "MouseWheelY",
7802 "ModCtrl", "ModShift", "ModAlt", "ModSuper", // ReservedForModXXX are showing the ModXXX names.
7803};
7804IM_STATIC_ASSERT(ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT == IM_ARRAYSIZE(GKeyNames));
7805
7806const char* ImGui::GetKeyName(ImGuiKey key)
7807{
7808 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7809#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
7810 IM_ASSERT((IsNamedKey(key) || key == ImGuiKey_None) && "Support for user key indices was dropped in favor of ImGuiKey. Please update backend and user code.");
7811#else
7812 if (IsLegacyKey(key))
7813 {
7814 if (g.IO.KeyMap[key] == -1)
7815 return "N/A";
7816 IM_ASSERT(IsNamedKey((ImGuiKey)g.IO.KeyMap[key]));
7817 key = (ImGuiKey)g.IO.KeyMap[key];
7818 }
7819#endif
7820 if (key == ImGuiKey_None)
7821 return "None";
7822 if (key & ImGuiMod_Mask_)
7823 key = ConvertSingleModFlagToKey(&g, key);
7824 if (!IsNamedKey(key))
7825 return "Unknown";
7826
7827 return GKeyNames[key - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN];
7828}
7829
7830// ImGuiMod_Shortcut is translated to either Ctrl or Super.
7831void ImGui::GetKeyChordName(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, char* out_buf, int out_buf_size)
7832{
7833 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7834 if (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Shortcut)
7835 key_chord = ConvertShortcutMod(key_chord);
7836 ImFormatString(out_buf, (size_t)out_buf_size, "%s%s%s%s%s",
7837 (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Ctrl) ? "Ctrl+" : "",
7838 (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Shift) ? "Shift+" : "",
7839 (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Alt) ? "Alt+" : "",
7840 (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Super) ? (g.IO.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors ? "Cmd+" : "Super+") : "",
7841 GetKeyName((ImGuiKey)(key_chord & ~ImGuiMod_Mask_)));
7842}
7843
7844// t0 = previous time (e.g.: g.Time - g.IO.DeltaTime)
7845// t1 = current time (e.g.: g.Time)
7846// An event is triggered at:
7847// t = 0.0f t = repeat_delay, t = repeat_delay + repeat_rate*N
7848int ImGui::CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(float t0, float t1, float repeat_delay, float repeat_rate)
7849{
7850 if (t1 == 0.0f)
7851 return 1;
7852 if (t0 >= t1)
7853 return 0;
7854 if (repeat_rate <= 0.0f)
7855 return (t0 < repeat_delay) && (t1 >= repeat_delay);
7856 const int count_t0 = (t0 < repeat_delay) ? -1 : (int)((t0 - repeat_delay) / repeat_rate);
7857 const int count_t1 = (t1 < repeat_delay) ? -1 : (int)((t1 - repeat_delay) / repeat_rate);
7858 const int count = count_t1 - count_t0;
7859 return count;
7860}
7861
7862void ImGui::GetTypematicRepeatRate(ImGuiInputFlags flags, float* repeat_delay, float* repeat_rate)
7863{
7864 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7865 switch (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateMask_)
7866 {
7867 case ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateNavMove: *repeat_delay = g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 0.72f; *repeat_rate = g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.80f; return;
7868 case ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateNavTweak: *repeat_delay = g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 0.72f; *repeat_rate = g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.30f; return;
7869 case ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateDefault: default: *repeat_delay = g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 1.00f; *repeat_rate = g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 1.00f; return;
7870 }
7871}
7872
7873// Return value representing the number of presses in the last time period, for the given repeat rate
7874// (most often returns 0 or 1. The result is generally only >1 when RepeatRate is smaller than DeltaTime, aka large DeltaTime or fast RepeatRate)
7875int ImGui::GetKeyPressedAmount(ImGuiKey key, float repeat_delay, float repeat_rate)
7876{
7877 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7878 const ImGuiKeyData* key_data = GetKeyData(key);
7879 if (!key_data->Down) // In theory this should already be encoded as (DownDuration < 0.0f), but testing this facilitates eating mechanism (until we finish work on key ownership)
7880 return 0;
7881 const float t = key_data->DownDuration;
7882 return CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, repeat_delay, repeat_rate);
7883}
7884
7885// Return 2D vector representing the combination of four cardinal direction, with analog value support (for e.g. ImGuiKey_GamepadLStick* values).
7886ImVec2 ImGui::GetKeyMagnitude2d(ImGuiKey key_left, ImGuiKey key_right, ImGuiKey key_up, ImGuiKey key_down)
7887{
7888 return ImVec2(
7889 GetKeyData(key_right)->AnalogValue - GetKeyData(key_left)->AnalogValue,
7890 GetKeyData(key_down)->AnalogValue - GetKeyData(key_up)->AnalogValue);
7891}
7892
7893// Rewrite routing data buffers to strip old entries + sort by key to make queries not touch scattered data.
7894// Entries D,A,B,B,A,C,B --> A,A,B,B,B,C,D
7895// Index A:1 B:2 C:5 D:0 --> A:0 B:2 C:5 D:6
7896// See 'Metrics->Key Owners & Shortcut Routing' to visualize the result of that operation.
7897static void ImGui::UpdateKeyRoutingTable(ImGuiKeyRoutingTable* rt)
7898{
7899 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7900 rt->EntriesNext.resize(0);
7901 for (ImGuiKey key = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN; key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1))
7902 {
7903 const int new_routing_start_idx = rt->EntriesNext.Size;
7904 ImGuiKeyRoutingData* routing_entry;
7905 for (int old_routing_idx = rt->Index[key - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN]; old_routing_idx != -1; old_routing_idx = routing_entry->NextEntryIndex)
7906 {
7907 routing_entry = &rt->Entries[old_routing_idx];
7908 routing_entry->RoutingCurr = routing_entry->RoutingNext; // Update entry
7909 routing_entry->RoutingNext = ImGuiKeyOwner_None;
7910 routing_entry->RoutingNextScore = 255;
7911 if (routing_entry->RoutingCurr == ImGuiKeyOwner_None)
7912 continue;
7913 rt->EntriesNext.push_back(*routing_entry); // Write alive ones into new buffer
7914
7915 // Apply routing to owner if there's no owner already (RoutingCurr == None at this point)
7916 if (routing_entry->Mods == g.IO.KeyMods)
7917 {
7918 ImGuiKeyOwnerData* owner_data = GetKeyOwnerData(&g, key);
7919 if (owner_data->OwnerCurr == ImGuiKeyOwner_None)
7920 owner_data->OwnerCurr = routing_entry->RoutingCurr;
7921 }
7922 }
7923
7924 // Rewrite linked-list
7925 rt->Index[key - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN] = (ImGuiKeyRoutingIndex)(new_routing_start_idx < rt->EntriesNext.Size ? new_routing_start_idx : -1);
7926 for (int n = new_routing_start_idx; n < rt->EntriesNext.Size; n++)
7927 rt->EntriesNext[n].NextEntryIndex = (ImGuiKeyRoutingIndex)((n + 1 < rt->EntriesNext.Size) ? n + 1 : -1);
7928 }
7929 rt->Entries.swap(rt->EntriesNext); // Swap new and old indexes
7930}
7931
7932// owner_id may be None/Any, but routing_id needs to be always be set, so we default to GetCurrentFocusScope().
7933static inline ImGuiID GetRoutingIdFromOwnerId(ImGuiID owner_id)
7934{
7935 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7936 return (owner_id != ImGuiKeyOwner_None && owner_id != ImGuiKeyOwner_Any) ? owner_id : g.CurrentFocusScopeId;
7937}
7938
7939ImGuiKeyRoutingData* ImGui::GetShortcutRoutingData(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord)
7940{
7941 // Majority of shortcuts will be Key + any number of Mods
7942 // We accept _Single_ mod with ImGuiKey_None.
7943 // - Shortcut(ImGuiKey_S | ImGuiMod_Ctrl); // Legal
7944 // - Shortcut(ImGuiKey_S | ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiMod_Shift); // Legal
7945 // - Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl); // Legal
7946 // - Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiMod_Shift); // Not legal
7947 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7948 ImGuiKeyRoutingTable* rt = &g.KeysRoutingTable;
7949 ImGuiKeyRoutingData* routing_data;
7950 if (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Shortcut)
7951 key_chord = ConvertShortcutMod(key_chord);
7952 ImGuiKey key = (ImGuiKey)(key_chord & ~ImGuiMod_Mask_);
7953 ImGuiKey mods = (ImGuiKey)(key_chord & ImGuiMod_Mask_);
7954 if (key == ImGuiKey_None)
7955 key = ConvertSingleModFlagToKey(&g, mods);
7956 IM_ASSERT(IsNamedKey(key));
7957
7958 // Get (in the majority of case, the linked list will have one element so this should be 2 reads.
7959 // Subsequent elements will be contiguous in memory as list is sorted/rebuilt in NewFrame).
7960 for (ImGuiKeyRoutingIndex idx = rt->Index[key - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN]; idx != -1; idx = routing_data->NextEntryIndex)
7961 {
7962 routing_data = &rt->Entries[idx];
7963 if (routing_data->Mods == mods)
7964 return routing_data;
7965 }
7966
7967 // Add to linked-list
7968 ImGuiKeyRoutingIndex routing_data_idx = (ImGuiKeyRoutingIndex)rt->Entries.Size;
7969 rt->Entries.push_back(ImGuiKeyRoutingData());
7970 routing_data = &rt->Entries[routing_data_idx];
7971 routing_data->Mods = (ImU16)mods;
7972 routing_data->NextEntryIndex = rt->Index[key - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN]; // Setup linked list
7973 rt->Index[key - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN] = routing_data_idx;
7974 return routing_data;
7975}
7976
7977// Current score encoding (lower is highest priority):
7978// - 0: ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobalHigh
7979// - 1: ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused (if item active)
7980// - 2: ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal
7981// - 3+: ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused (if window in focus-stack)
7982// - 254: ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobalLow
7983// - 255: never route
7984// 'flags' should include an explicit routing policy
7985static int CalcRoutingScore(ImGuiWindow* location, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags)
7986{
7987 if (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused)
7988 {
7989 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7990 ImGuiWindow* focused = g.NavWindow;
7991
7992 // ActiveID gets top priority
7993 // (we don't check g.ActiveIdUsingAllKeys here. Routing is applied but if input ownership is tested later it may discard it)
7994 if (owner_id != 0 && g.ActiveId == owner_id)
7995 return 1;
7996
7997 // Score based on distance to focused window (lower is better)
7998 // Assuming both windows are submitting a routing request,
7999 // - When Window....... is focused -> Window scores 3 (best), Window/ChildB scores 255 (no match)
8000 // - When Window/ChildB is focused -> Window scores 4, Window/ChildB scores 3 (best)
8001 // Assuming only WindowA is submitting a routing request,
8002 // - When Window/ChildB is focused -> Window scores 4 (best), Window/ChildB doesn't have a score.
8003 if (focused != NULL && focused->RootWindow == location->RootWindow)
8004 for (int next_score = 3; focused != NULL; next_score++)
8005 {
8006 if (focused == location)
8007 {
8008 IM_ASSERT(next_score < 255);
8009 return next_score;
8010 }
8011 focused = (focused->RootWindow != focused) ? focused->ParentWindow : NULL; // FIXME: This could be later abstracted as a focus path
8012 }
8013 return 255;
8014 }
8015
8016 // ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobalHigh is default, so calls without flags are not conditional
8017 if (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal)
8018 return 2;
8019 if (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobalLow)
8020 return 254;
8021 return 0;
8022}
8023
8024// Request a desired route for an input chord (key + mods).
8025// Return true if the route is available this frame.
8026// - Routes and key ownership are attributed at the beginning of next frame based on best score and mod state.
8027// (Conceptually this does a "Submit for next frame" + "Test for current frame".
8028// As such, it could be called TrySetXXX or SubmitXXX, or the Submit and Test operations should be separate.)
8029// - Using 'owner_id == ImGuiKeyOwner_Any/0': auto-assign an owner based on current focus scope (each window has its focus scope by default)
8030// - Using 'owner_id == ImGuiKeyOwner_None': allows disabling/locking a shortcut.
8031bool ImGui::SetShortcutRouting(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags)
8032{
8033 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8034 if ((flags & ImGuiInputFlags_RouteMask_) == 0)
8035 flags |= ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobalHigh; // IMPORTANT: This is the default for SetShortcutRouting() but NOT Shortcut()
8036 else
8037 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiInputFlags_RouteMask_)); // Check that only 1 routing flag is used
8038
8039 if (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused)
8040 if (g.NavWindow == NULL)
8041 return false;
8042 if (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways)
8043 return true;
8044
8045 const int score = CalcRoutingScore(g.CurrentWindow, owner_id, flags);
8046 if (score == 255)
8047 return false;
8048
8049 // Submit routing for NEXT frame (assuming score is sufficient)
8050 // FIXME: Could expose a way to use a "serve last" policy for same score resolution (using <= instead of <).
8051 ImGuiKeyRoutingData* routing_data = GetShortcutRoutingData(key_chord);
8052 const ImGuiID routing_id = GetRoutingIdFromOwnerId(owner_id);
8053 //const bool set_route = (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_ServeLast) ? (score <= routing_data->RoutingNextScore) : (score < routing_data->RoutingNextScore);
8054 if (score < routing_data->RoutingNextScore)
8055 {
8056 routing_data->RoutingNext = routing_id;
8057 routing_data->RoutingNextScore = (ImU8)score;
8058 }
8059
8060 // Return routing state for CURRENT frame
8061 return routing_data->RoutingCurr == routing_id;
8062}
8063
8064// Currently unused by core (but used by tests)
8065// Note: this cannot be turned into GetShortcutRouting() because we do the owner_id->routing_id translation, name would be more misleading.
8066bool ImGui::TestShortcutRouting(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiID owner_id)
8067{
8068 const ImGuiID routing_id = GetRoutingIdFromOwnerId(owner_id);
8069 ImGuiKeyRoutingData* routing_data = GetShortcutRoutingData(key_chord); // FIXME: Could avoid creating entry.
8070 return routing_data->RoutingCurr == routing_id;
8071}
8072
8073// Note that Dear ImGui doesn't know the meaning/semantic of ImGuiKey from 0..511: they are legacy native keycodes.
8074// Consider transitioning from 'IsKeyDown(MY_ENGINE_KEY_A)' (<1.87) to IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_A) (>= 1.87)
8075bool ImGui::IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey key)
8076{
8077 return IsKeyDown(key, ImGuiKeyOwner_Any);
8078}
8079
8080bool ImGui::IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id)
8081{
8082 const ImGuiKeyData* key_data = GetKeyData(key);
8083 if (!key_data->Down)
8084 return false;
8085 if (!TestKeyOwner(key, owner_id))
8086 return false;
8087 return true;
8088}
8089
8090bool ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey key, bool repeat)
8091{
8092 return IsKeyPressed(key, ImGuiKeyOwner_Any, repeat ? ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat : ImGuiInputFlags_None);
8093}
8094
8095// Important: unless legacy IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey, bool repeat=true) which DEFAULT to repeat, this requires EXPLICIT repeat.
8096bool ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags)
8097{
8098 const ImGuiKeyData* key_data = GetKeyData(key);
8099 if (!key_data->Down) // In theory this should already be encoded as (DownDuration < 0.0f), but testing this facilitates eating mechanism (until we finish work on key ownership)
8100 return false;
8101 const float t = key_data->DownDuration;
8102 if (t < 0.0f)
8103 return false;
8104 IM_ASSERT((flags & ~ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedByIsKeyPressed) == 0); // Passing flags not supported by this function!
8105
8106 bool pressed = (t == 0.0f);
8107 if (!pressed && ((flags & ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat) != 0))
8108 {
8109 float repeat_delay, repeat_rate;
8110 GetTypematicRepeatRate(flags, &repeat_delay, &repeat_rate);
8111 pressed = (t > repeat_delay) && GetKeyPressedAmount(key, repeat_delay, repeat_rate) > 0;
8112 }
8113 if (!pressed)
8114 return false;
8115 if (!TestKeyOwner(key, owner_id))
8116 return false;
8117 return true;
8118}
8119
8120bool ImGui::IsKeyReleased(ImGuiKey key)
8121{
8122 return IsKeyReleased(key, ImGuiKeyOwner_Any);
8123}
8124
8125bool ImGui::IsKeyReleased(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id)
8126{
8127 const ImGuiKeyData* key_data = GetKeyData(key);
8128 if (key_data->DownDurationPrev < 0.0f || key_data->Down)
8129 return false;
8130 if (!TestKeyOwner(key, owner_id))
8131 return false;
8132 return true;
8133}
8134
8135bool ImGui::IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton button)
8136{
8137 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8138 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8139 return g.IO.MouseDown[button] && TestKeyOwner(MouseButtonToKey(button), ImGuiKeyOwner_Any); // should be same as IsKeyDown(MouseButtonToKey(button), ImGuiKeyOwner_Any), but this allows legacy code hijacking the io.Mousedown[] array.
8140}
8141
8142bool ImGui::IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiID owner_id)
8143{
8144 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8145 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8146 return g.IO.MouseDown[button] && TestKeyOwner(MouseButtonToKey(button), owner_id); // Should be same as IsKeyDown(MouseButtonToKey(button), owner_id), but this allows legacy code hijacking the io.Mousedown[] array.
8147}
8148
8149bool ImGui::IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, bool repeat)
8150{
8151 return IsMouseClicked(button, ImGuiKeyOwner_Any, repeat ? ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat : ImGuiInputFlags_None);
8152}
8153
8154bool ImGui::IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags)
8155{
8156 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8157 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8158 if (!g.IO.MouseDown[button]) // In theory this should already be encoded as (DownDuration < 0.0f), but testing this facilitates eating mechanism (until we finish work on key ownership)
8159 return false;
8160 const float t = g.IO.MouseDownDuration[button];
8161 if (t < 0.0f)
8162 return false;
8163 IM_ASSERT((flags & ~ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedByIsKeyPressed) == 0); // Passing flags not supported by this function!
8164
8165 const bool repeat = (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat) != 0;
8166 const bool pressed = (t == 0.0f) || (repeat && t > g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay && CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate) > 0);
8167 if (!pressed)
8168 return false;
8169
8170 if (!TestKeyOwner(MouseButtonToKey(button), owner_id))
8171 return false;
8172
8173 return true;
8174}
8175
8176bool ImGui::IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton button)
8177{
8178 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8179 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8180 return g.IO.MouseReleased[button] && TestKeyOwner(MouseButtonToKey(button), ImGuiKeyOwner_Any); // Should be same as IsKeyReleased(MouseButtonToKey(button), ImGuiKeyOwner_Any)
8181}
8182
8183bool ImGui::IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiID owner_id)
8184{
8185 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8186 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8187 return g.IO.MouseReleased[button] && TestKeyOwner(MouseButtonToKey(button), owner_id); // Should be same as IsKeyReleased(MouseButtonToKey(button), owner_id)
8188}
8189
8190bool ImGui::IsMouseDoubleClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button)
8191{
8192 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8193 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8194 return g.IO.MouseClickedCount[button] == 2 && TestKeyOwner(MouseButtonToKey(button), ImGuiKeyOwner_Any);
8195}
8196
8197int ImGui::GetMouseClickedCount(ImGuiMouseButton button)
8198{
8199 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8200 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8201 return g.IO.MouseClickedCount[button];
8202}
8203
8204// Test if mouse cursor is hovering given rectangle
8205// NB- Rectangle is clipped by our current clip setting
8206// NB- Expand the rectangle to be generous on imprecise inputs systems (g.Style.TouchExtraPadding)
8207bool ImGui::IsMouseHoveringRect(const ImVec2& r_min, const ImVec2& r_max, bool clip)
8208{
8209 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8210
8211 // Clip
8212 ImRect rect_clipped(r_min, r_max);
8213 if (clip)
8214 rect_clipped.ClipWith(g.CurrentWindow->ClipRect);
8215
8216 // Expand for touch input
8217 const ImRect rect_for_touch(rect_clipped.Min - g.Style.TouchExtraPadding, rect_clipped.Max + g.Style.TouchExtraPadding);
8218 if (!rect_for_touch.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
8219 return false;
8220 return true;
8221}
8222
8223// Return if a mouse click/drag went past the given threshold. Valid to call during the MouseReleased frame.
8224// [Internal] This doesn't test if the button is pressed
8225bool ImGui::IsMouseDragPastThreshold(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
8226{
8227 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8228 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8229 if (lock_threshold < 0.0f)
8230 lock_threshold = g.IO.MouseDragThreshold;
8231 return g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[button] >= lock_threshold * lock_threshold;
8232}
8233
8234bool ImGui::IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
8235{
8236 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8237 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8238 if (!g.IO.MouseDown[button])
8239 return false;
8240 return IsMouseDragPastThreshold(button, lock_threshold);
8241}
8242
8243ImVec2 ImGui::GetMousePos()
8244{
8245 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8246 return g.IO.MousePos;
8247}
8248
8249// NB: prefer to call right after BeginPopup(). At the time Selectable/MenuItem is activated, the popup is already closed!
8250ImVec2 ImGui::GetMousePosOnOpeningCurrentPopup()
8251{
8252 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8253 if (g.BeginPopupStack.Size > 0)
8254 return g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1].OpenMousePos;
8255 return g.IO.MousePos;
8256}
8257
8258// We typically use ImVec2(-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX) to denote an invalid mouse position.
8259bool ImGui::IsMousePosValid(const ImVec2* mouse_pos)
8260{
8261 // The assert is only to silence a false-positive in XCode Static Analysis.
8262 // Because GImGui is not dereferenced in every code path, the static analyzer assume that it may be NULL (which it doesn't for other functions).
8263 IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL);
8264 const float MOUSE_INVALID = -256000.0f;
8265 ImVec2 p = mouse_pos ? *mouse_pos : GImGui->IO.MousePos;
8266 return p.x >= MOUSE_INVALID && p.y >= MOUSE_INVALID;
8267}
8268
8269// [WILL OBSOLETE] This was designed for backends, but prefer having backend maintain a mask of held mouse buttons, because upcoming input queue system will make this invalid.
8270bool ImGui::IsAnyMouseDown()
8271{
8272 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8273 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown); n++)
8274 if (g.IO.MouseDown[n])
8275 return true;
8276 return false;
8277}
8278
8279// Return the delta from the initial clicking position while the mouse button is clicked or was just released.
8280// This is locked and return 0.0f until the mouse moves past a distance threshold at least once.
8281// NB: This is only valid if IsMousePosValid(). backends in theory should always keep mouse position valid when dragging even outside the client window.
8282ImVec2 ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
8283{
8284 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8285 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8286 if (lock_threshold < 0.0f)
8287 lock_threshold = g.IO.MouseDragThreshold;
8288 if (g.IO.MouseDown[button] || g.IO.MouseReleased[button])
8289 if (g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[button] >= lock_threshold * lock_threshold)
8290 if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button]))
8291 return g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button];
8292 return ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
8293}
8294
8295void ImGui::ResetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button)
8296{
8297 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8298 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
8299 // NB: We don't need to reset g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr
8300 g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button] = g.IO.MousePos;
8301}
8302
8303// Get desired mouse cursor shape.
8304// Important: this is meant to be used by a platform backend, it is reset in ImGui::NewFrame(),
8305// updated during the frame, and locked in EndFrame()/Render().
8306// If you use software rendering by setting io.MouseDrawCursor then Dear ImGui will render those for you
8307ImGuiMouseCursor ImGui::GetMouseCursor()
8308{
8309 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8310 return g.MouseCursor;
8311}
8312
8313void ImGui::SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor cursor_type)
8314{
8315 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8316 g.MouseCursor = cursor_type;
8317}
8318
8319static void UpdateAliasKey(ImGuiKey key, bool v, float analog_value)
8320{
8321 IM_ASSERT(ImGui::IsAliasKey(key));
8322 ImGuiKeyData* key_data = ImGui::GetKeyData(key);
8323 key_data->Down = v;
8324 key_data->AnalogValue = analog_value;
8325}
8326
8327// [Internal] Do not use directly
8328static ImGuiKeyChord GetMergedModsFromKeys()
8329{
8330 ImGuiKeyChord mods = 0;
8331 if (ImGui::IsKeyDown(ImGuiMod_Ctrl)) { mods |= ImGuiMod_Ctrl; }
8332 if (ImGui::IsKeyDown(ImGuiMod_Shift)) { mods |= ImGuiMod_Shift; }
8333 if (ImGui::IsKeyDown(ImGuiMod_Alt)) { mods |= ImGuiMod_Alt; }
8334 if (ImGui::IsKeyDown(ImGuiMod_Super)) { mods |= ImGuiMod_Super; }
8335 return mods;
8336}
8337
8338static void ImGui::UpdateKeyboardInputs()
8339{
8340 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8341 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
8342
8343 // Import legacy keys or verify they are not used
8344#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
8345 if (io.BackendUsingLegacyKeyArrays == 0)
8346 {
8347 // Backend used new io.AddKeyEvent() API: Good! Verify that old arrays are never written to externally.
8348 for (int n = 0; n < ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_END; n++)
8349 IM_ASSERT((io.KeysDown[n] == false || IsKeyDown((ImGuiKey)n)) && "Backend needs to either only use io.AddKeyEvent(), either only fill legacy io.KeysDown[] + io.KeyMap[]. Not both!");
8350 }
8351 else
8352 {
8353 if (g.FrameCount == 0)
8354 for (int n = ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_BEGIN; n < ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_END; n++)
8355 IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMap[n] == -1 && "Backend is not allowed to write to io.KeyMap[0..511]!");
8356
8357 // Build reverse KeyMap (Named -> Legacy)
8358 for (int n = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN; n < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END; n++)
8359 if (io.KeyMap[n] != -1)
8360 {
8361 IM_ASSERT(IsLegacyKey((ImGuiKey)io.KeyMap[n]));
8362 io.KeyMap[io.KeyMap[n]] = n;
8363 }
8364
8365 // Import legacy keys into new ones
8366 for (int n = ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_BEGIN; n < ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_END; n++)
8367 if (io.KeysDown[n] || io.BackendUsingLegacyKeyArrays == 1)
8368 {
8369 const ImGuiKey key = (ImGuiKey)(io.KeyMap[n] != -1 ? io.KeyMap[n] : n);
8370 IM_ASSERT(io.KeyMap[n] == -1 || IsNamedKey(key));
8371 io.KeysData[key].Down = io.KeysDown[n];
8372 if (key != n)
8373 io.KeysDown[key] = io.KeysDown[n]; // Allow legacy code using io.KeysDown[GetKeyIndex()] with old backends
8374 io.BackendUsingLegacyKeyArrays = 1;
8375 }
8376 if (io.BackendUsingLegacyKeyArrays == 1)
8377 {
8378 GetKeyData(ImGuiMod_Ctrl)->Down = io.KeyCtrl;
8379 GetKeyData(ImGuiMod_Shift)->Down = io.KeyShift;
8380 GetKeyData(ImGuiMod_Alt)->Down = io.KeyAlt;
8381 GetKeyData(ImGuiMod_Super)->Down = io.KeySuper;
8382 }
8383 }
8384
8385#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
8386 const bool nav_gamepad_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
8387 if (io.BackendUsingLegacyNavInputArray && nav_gamepad_active)
8388 {
8389 #define MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(_KEY, _NAV1) do { io.KeysData[_KEY].Down = (io.NavInputs[_NAV1] > 0.0f); io.KeysData[_KEY].AnalogValue = io.NavInputs[_NAV1]; } while (0)
8390 #define MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY2(_KEY, _NAV1, _NAV2) do { io.KeysData[_KEY].Down = (io.NavInputs[_NAV1] > 0.0f) || (io.NavInputs[_NAV2] > 0.0f); io.KeysData[_KEY].AnalogValue = ImMax(io.NavInputs[_NAV1], io.NavInputs[_NAV2]); } while (0)
8391 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceDown, ImGuiNavInput_Activate);
8392 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceRight, ImGuiNavInput_Cancel);
8393 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceLeft, ImGuiNavInput_Menu);
8394 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceUp, ImGuiNavInput_Input);
8395 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadLeft, ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft);
8396 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadRight, ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight);
8397 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadUp, ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp);
8398 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadDown, ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown);
8399 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY2(ImGuiKey_GamepadL1, ImGuiNavInput_FocusPrev, ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow);
8400 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY2(ImGuiKey_GamepadR1, ImGuiNavInput_FocusNext, ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast);
8401 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickLeft, ImGuiNavInput_LStickLeft);
8402 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickRight, ImGuiNavInput_LStickRight);
8403 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickUp, ImGuiNavInput_LStickUp);
8404 MAP_LEGACY_NAV_INPUT_TO_KEY1(ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickDown, ImGuiNavInput_LStickDown);
8405 #undef NAV_MAP_KEY
8406 }
8407#endif
8408#endif
8409
8410 // Update aliases
8411 for (int n = 0; n < ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT; n++)
8412 UpdateAliasKey(MouseButtonToKey(n), io.MouseDown[n], io.MouseDown[n] ? 1.0f : 0.0f);
8413 UpdateAliasKey(ImGuiKey_MouseWheelX, io.MouseWheelH != 0.0f, io.MouseWheelH);
8414 UpdateAliasKey(ImGuiKey_MouseWheelY, io.MouseWheel != 0.0f, io.MouseWheel);
8415
8416 // Synchronize io.KeyMods and io.KeyXXX values.
8417 // - New backends (1.87+): send io.AddKeyEvent(ImGuiMod_XXX) -> -> (here) deriving io.KeyMods + io.KeyXXX from key array.
8418 // - Legacy backends: set io.KeyXXX bools -> (above) set key array from io.KeyXXX -> (here) deriving io.KeyMods + io.KeyXXX from key array.
8419 // So with legacy backends the 4 values will do a unnecessary back-and-forth but it makes the code simpler and future facing.
8420 io.KeyMods = GetMergedModsFromKeys();
8421 io.KeyCtrl = (io.KeyMods & ImGuiMod_Ctrl) != 0;
8422 io.KeyShift = (io.KeyMods & ImGuiMod_Shift) != 0;
8423 io.KeyAlt = (io.KeyMods & ImGuiMod_Alt) != 0;
8424 io.KeySuper = (io.KeyMods & ImGuiMod_Super) != 0;
8425
8426 // Clear gamepad data if disabled
8427 if ((io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) == 0)
8428 for (int i = ImGuiKey_Gamepad_BEGIN; i < ImGuiKey_Gamepad_END; i++)
8429 {
8430 io.KeysData[i - ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET].Down = false;
8431 io.KeysData[i - ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET].AnalogValue = 0.0f;
8432 }
8433
8434 // Update keys
8435 for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiKey_KeysData_SIZE; i++)
8436 {
8437 ImGuiKeyData* key_data = &io.KeysData[i];
8438 key_data->DownDurationPrev = key_data->DownDuration;
8439 key_data->DownDuration = key_data->Down ? (key_data->DownDuration < 0.0f ? 0.0f : key_data->DownDuration + io.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
8440 }
8441
8442 // Update keys/input owner (named keys only): one entry per key
8443 for (ImGuiKey key = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN; key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1))
8444 {
8445 ImGuiKeyData* key_data = &io.KeysData[key - ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET];
8446 ImGuiKeyOwnerData* owner_data = &g.KeysOwnerData[key - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN];
8447 owner_data->OwnerCurr = owner_data->OwnerNext;
8448 if (!key_data->Down) // Important: ownership is released on the frame after a release. Ensure a 'MouseDown -> CloseWindow -> MouseUp' chain doesn't lead to someone else seeing the MouseUp.
8449 owner_data->OwnerNext = ImGuiKeyOwner_None;
8450 owner_data->LockThisFrame = owner_data->LockUntilRelease = owner_data->LockUntilRelease && key_data->Down; // Clear LockUntilRelease when key is not Down anymore
8451 }
8452
8453 UpdateKeyRoutingTable(&g.KeysRoutingTable);
8454}
8455
8456static void ImGui::UpdateMouseInputs()
8457{
8458 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8459 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
8460
8461 // Mouse Wheel swapping flag
8462 // As a standard behavior holding SHIFT while using Vertical Mouse Wheel triggers Horizontal scroll instead
8463 // - We avoid doing it on OSX as it the OS input layer handles this already.
8464 // - FIXME: However this means when running on OSX over Emscripten, Shift+WheelY will incur two swapping (1 in OS, 1 here), canceling the feature.
8465 // - FIXME: When we can distinguish e.g. touchpad scroll events from mouse ones, we'll set this accordingly based on input source.
8466 io.MouseWheelRequestAxisSwap = io.KeyShift && !io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors;
8467
8468 // Round mouse position to avoid spreading non-rounded position (e.g. UpdateManualResize doesn't support them well)
8469 if (IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos))
8470 io.MousePos = g.MouseLastValidPos = ImFloorSigned(io.MousePos);
8471
8472 // If mouse just appeared or disappeared (usually denoted by -FLT_MAX components) we cancel out movement in MouseDelta
8473 if (IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos) && IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePosPrev))
8474 io.MouseDelta = io.MousePos - io.MousePosPrev;
8475 else
8476 io.MouseDelta = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
8477
8478 // If mouse moved we re-enable mouse hovering in case it was disabled by gamepad/keyboard. In theory should use a >0.0f threshold but would need to reset in everywhere we set this to true.
8479 if (io.MouseDelta.x != 0.0f || io.MouseDelta.y != 0.0f)
8480 g.NavDisableMouseHover = false;
8481
8482 io.MousePosPrev = io.MousePos;
8483 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++)
8484 {
8485 io.MouseClicked[i] = io.MouseDown[i] && io.MouseDownDuration[i] < 0.0f;
8486 io.MouseClickedCount[i] = 0; // Will be filled below
8487 io.MouseReleased[i] = !io.MouseDown[i] && io.MouseDownDuration[i] >= 0.0f;
8488 io.MouseDownDurationPrev[i] = io.MouseDownDuration[i];
8489 io.MouseDownDuration[i] = io.MouseDown[i] ? (io.MouseDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : io.MouseDownDuration[i] + io.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
8490 if (io.MouseClicked[i])
8491 {
8492 bool is_repeated_click = false;
8493 if ((float)(g.Time - io.MouseClickedTime[i]) < io.MouseDoubleClickTime)
8494 {
8495 ImVec2 delta_from_click_pos = IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos) ? (io.MousePos - io.MouseClickedPos[i]) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
8496 if (ImLengthSqr(delta_from_click_pos) < io.MouseDoubleClickMaxDist * io.MouseDoubleClickMaxDist)
8497 is_repeated_click = true;
8498 }
8499 if (is_repeated_click)
8500 io.MouseClickedLastCount[i]++;
8501 else
8502 io.MouseClickedLastCount[i] = 1;
8503 io.MouseClickedTime[i] = g.Time;
8504 io.MouseClickedPos[i] = io.MousePos;
8505 io.MouseClickedCount[i] = io.MouseClickedLastCount[i];
8506 io.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i] = 0.0f;
8507 }
8508 else if (io.MouseDown[i])
8509 {
8510 // Maintain the maximum distance we reaching from the initial click position, which is used with dragging threshold
8511 float delta_sqr_click_pos = IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos) ? ImLengthSqr(io.MousePos - io.MouseClickedPos[i]) : 0.0f;
8512 io.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i] = ImMax(io.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i], delta_sqr_click_pos);
8513 }
8514
8515 // We provide io.MouseDoubleClicked[] as a legacy service
8516 io.MouseDoubleClicked[i] = (io.MouseClickedCount[i] == 2);
8517
8518 // Clicking any mouse button reactivate mouse hovering which may have been deactivated by gamepad/keyboard navigation
8519 if (io.MouseClicked[i])
8520 g.NavDisableMouseHover = false;
8521 }
8522}
8523
8524static void LockWheelingWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, float wheel_amount)
8525{
8526 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8527 if (window)
8528 g.WheelingWindowReleaseTimer = ImMin(g.WheelingWindowReleaseTimer + ImAbs(wheel_amount) * WINDOWS_MOUSE_WHEEL_SCROLL_LOCK_TIMER, WINDOWS_MOUSE_WHEEL_SCROLL_LOCK_TIMER);
8529 else
8530 g.WheelingWindowReleaseTimer = 0.0f;
8531 if (g.WheelingWindow == window)
8532 return;
8533 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("LockWheelingWindow() \"%s\"\n", window ? window->Name : "NULL");
8534 g.WheelingWindow = window;
8535 g.WheelingWindowRefMousePos = g.IO.MousePos;
8536 if (window == NULL)
8537 {
8538 g.WheelingWindowStartFrame = -1;
8539 g.WheelingAxisAvg = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
8540 }
8541}
8542
8543static ImGuiWindow* FindBestWheelingWindow(const ImVec2& wheel)
8544{
8545 // For each axis, find window in the hierarchy that may want to use scrolling
8546 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8547 ImGuiWindow* windows[2] = { NULL, NULL };
8548 for (int axis = 0; axis < 2; axis++)
8549 if (wheel[axis] != 0.0f)
8550 for (ImGuiWindow* window = windows[axis] = g.HoveredWindow; window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow; window = windows[axis] = window->ParentWindow)
8551 {
8552 // Bubble up into parent window if:
8553 // - a child window doesn't allow any scrolling.
8554 // - a child window has the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse flag.
8555 //// - a child window doesn't need scrolling because it is already at the edge for the direction we are going in (FIXME-WIP)
8556 const bool has_scrolling = (window->ScrollMax[axis] != 0.0f);
8557 const bool inputs_disabled = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs);
8558 //const bool scrolling_past_limits = (wheel_v < 0.0f) ? (window->Scroll[axis] <= 0.0f) : (window->Scroll[axis] >= window->ScrollMax[axis]);
8559 if (has_scrolling && !inputs_disabled) // && !scrolling_past_limits)
8560 break; // select this window
8561 }
8562 if (windows[0] == NULL && windows[1] == NULL)
8563 return NULL;
8564
8565 // If there's only one window or only one axis then there's no ambiguity
8566 if (windows[0] == windows[1] || windows[0] == NULL || windows[1] == NULL)
8567 return windows[1] ? windows[1] : windows[0];
8568
8569 // If candidate are different windows we need to decide which one to prioritize
8570 // - First frame: only find a winner if one axis is zero.
8571 // - Subsequent frames: only find a winner when one is more than the other.
8572 if (g.WheelingWindowStartFrame == -1)
8573 g.WheelingWindowStartFrame = g.FrameCount;
8574 if ((g.WheelingWindowStartFrame == g.FrameCount && wheel.x != 0.0f && wheel.y != 0.0f) || (g.WheelingAxisAvg.x == g.WheelingAxisAvg.y))
8575 {
8576 g.WheelingWindowWheelRemainder = wheel;
8577 return NULL;
8578 }
8579 return (g.WheelingAxisAvg.x > g.WheelingAxisAvg.y) ? windows[0] : windows[1];
8580}
8581
8582// Called by NewFrame()
8583void ImGui::UpdateMouseWheel()
8584{
8585 // Reset the locked window if we move the mouse or after the timer elapses.
8586 // FIXME: Ideally we could refactor to have one timer for "changing window w/ same axis" and a shorter timer for "changing window or axis w/ other axis" (#3795)
8587 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8588 if (g.WheelingWindow != NULL)
8589 {
8590 g.WheelingWindowReleaseTimer -= g.IO.DeltaTime;
8591 if (IsMousePosValid() && ImLengthSqr(g.IO.MousePos - g.WheelingWindowRefMousePos) > g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * g.IO.MouseDragThreshold)
8592 g.WheelingWindowReleaseTimer = 0.0f;
8593 if (g.WheelingWindowReleaseTimer <= 0.0f)
8594 LockWheelingWindow(NULL, 0.0f);
8595 }
8596
8597 ImVec2 wheel;
8598 wheel.x = TestKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseWheelX, ImGuiKeyOwner_None) ? g.IO.MouseWheelH : 0.0f;
8599 wheel.y = TestKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseWheelY, ImGuiKeyOwner_None) ? g.IO.MouseWheel : 0.0f;
8600
8601 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("MouseWheel X:%.3f Y:%.3f\n", wheel_x, wheel_y);
8602 ImGuiWindow* mouse_window = g.WheelingWindow ? g.WheelingWindow : g.HoveredWindow;
8603 if (!mouse_window || mouse_window->Collapsed)
8604 return;
8605
8606 // Zoom / Scale window
8607 // FIXME-OBSOLETE: This is an old feature, it still works but pretty much nobody is using it and may be best redesigned.
8608 if (wheel.y != 0.0f && g.IO.KeyCtrl && g.IO.FontAllowUserScaling)
8609 {
8610 LockWheelingWindow(mouse_window, wheel.y);
8611 ImGuiWindow* window = mouse_window;
8612 const float new_font_scale = ImClamp(window->FontWindowScale + g.IO.MouseWheel * 0.10f, 0.50f, 2.50f);
8613 const float scale = new_font_scale / window->FontWindowScale;
8614 window->FontWindowScale = new_font_scale;
8615 if (window == window->RootWindow)
8616 {
8617 const ImVec2 offset = window->Size * (1.0f - scale) * (g.IO.MousePos - window->Pos) / window->Size;
8618 SetWindowPos(window, window->Pos + offset, 0);
8619 window->Size = ImFloor(window->Size * scale);
8620 window->SizeFull = ImFloor(window->SizeFull * scale);
8621 }
8622 return;
8623 }
8624 if (g.IO.KeyCtrl)
8625 return;
8626
8627 // Mouse wheel scrolling
8628 // Read about io.MouseWheelRequestAxisSwap and its issue on Mac+Emscripten in UpdateMouseInputs()
8629 if (g.IO.MouseWheelRequestAxisSwap)
8630 wheel = ImVec2(wheel.y, 0.0f);
8631
8632 // Maintain a rough average of moving magnitude on both axises
8633 // FIXME: should by based on wall clock time rather than frame-counter
8634 g.WheelingAxisAvg.x = ImExponentialMovingAverage(g.WheelingAxisAvg.x, ImAbs(wheel.x), 30);
8635 g.WheelingAxisAvg.y = ImExponentialMovingAverage(g.WheelingAxisAvg.y, ImAbs(wheel.y), 30);
8636
8637 // In the rare situation where FindBestWheelingWindow() had to defer first frame of wheeling due to ambiguous main axis, reinject it now.
8638 wheel += g.WheelingWindowWheelRemainder;
8639 g.WheelingWindowWheelRemainder = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
8640 if (wheel.x == 0.0f && wheel.y == 0.0f)
8641 return;
8642
8643 // Mouse wheel scrolling: find target and apply
8644 // - don't renew lock if axis doesn't apply on the window.
8645 // - select a main axis when both axises are being moved.
8646 if (ImGuiWindow* window = (g.WheelingWindow ? g.WheelingWindow : FindBestWheelingWindow(wheel)))
8647 if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
8648 {
8649 bool do_scroll[2] = { wheel.x != 0.0f && window->ScrollMax.x != 0.0f, wheel.y != 0.0f && window->ScrollMax.y != 0.0f };
8650 if (do_scroll[ImGuiAxis_X] && do_scroll[ImGuiAxis_Y])
8651 do_scroll[(g.WheelingAxisAvg.x > g.WheelingAxisAvg.y) ? ImGuiAxis_Y : ImGuiAxis_X] = false;
8652 if (do_scroll[ImGuiAxis_X])
8653 {
8654 LockWheelingWindow(window, wheel.x);
8655 float max_step = window->InnerRect.GetWidth() * 0.67f;
8656 float scroll_step = ImFloor(ImMin(2 * window->CalcFontSize(), max_step));
8657 SetScrollX(window, window->Scroll.x - wheel.x * scroll_step);
8658 }
8659 if (do_scroll[ImGuiAxis_Y])
8660 {
8661 LockWheelingWindow(window, wheel.y);
8662 float max_step = window->InnerRect.GetHeight() * 0.67f;
8663 float scroll_step = ImFloor(ImMin(5 * window->CalcFontSize(), max_step));
8664 SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y - wheel.y * scroll_step);
8665 }
8666 }
8667}
8668
8669void ImGui::SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard(bool want_capture_keyboard)
8670{
8671 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8672 g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame = want_capture_keyboard ? 1 : 0;
8673}
8674
8675void ImGui::SetNextFrameWantCaptureMouse(bool want_capture_mouse)
8676{
8677 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8678 g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame = want_capture_mouse ? 1 : 0;
8679}
8680
8681#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
8682static const char* GetInputSourceName(ImGuiInputSource source)
8683{
8684 const char* input_source_names[] = { "None", "Mouse", "Keyboard", "Gamepad", "Clipboard" };
8685 IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(input_source_names) == ImGuiInputSource_COUNT && source >= 0 && source < ImGuiInputSource_COUNT);
8686 return input_source_names[source];
8687}
8688static const char* GetMouseSourceName(ImGuiMouseSource source)
8689{
8690 const char* mouse_source_names[] = { "Mouse", "TouchScreen", "Pen" };
8691 IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(mouse_source_names) == ImGuiMouseSource_COUNT && source >= 0 && source < ImGuiMouseSource_COUNT);
8692 return mouse_source_names[source];
8693}
8694static void DebugPrintInputEvent(const char* prefix, const ImGuiInputEvent* e)
8695{
8696 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8697 if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_MousePos) { if (e->MousePos.PosX == -FLT_MAX && e->MousePos.PosY == -FLT_MAX) IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("%s: MousePos (-FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX)\n", prefix); else IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("%s: MousePos (%.1f, %.1f) (%s)\n", prefix, e->MousePos.PosX, e->MousePos.PosY, GetMouseSourceName(e->MouseWheel.MouseSource)); return; }
8698 if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_MouseButton) { IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("%s: MouseButton %d %s (%s)\n", prefix, e->MouseButton.Button, e->MouseButton.Down ? "Down" : "Up", GetMouseSourceName(e->MouseWheel.MouseSource)); return; }
8699 if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_MouseWheel) { IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("%s: MouseWheel (%.3f, %.3f) (%s)\n", prefix, e->MouseWheel.WheelX, e->MouseWheel.WheelY, GetMouseSourceName(e->MouseWheel.MouseSource)); return; }
8700 if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_Key) { IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("%s: Key \"%s\" %s\n", prefix, ImGui::GetKeyName(e->Key.Key), e->Key.Down ? "Down" : "Up"); return; }
8701 if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_Text) { IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("%s: Text: %c (U+%08X)\n", prefix, e->Text.Char, e->Text.Char); return; }
8702 if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_Focus) { IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("%s: AppFocused %d\n", prefix, e->AppFocused.Focused); return; }
8703}
8704#endif
8705
8706// Process input queue
8707// We always call this with the value of 'bool g.IO.ConfigInputTrickleEventQueue'.
8708// - trickle_fast_inputs = false : process all events, turn into flattened input state (e.g. successive down/up/down/up will be lost)
8709// - trickle_fast_inputs = true : process as many events as possible (successive down/up/down/up will be trickled over several frames so nothing is lost) (new feature in 1.87)
8710void ImGui::UpdateInputEvents(bool trickle_fast_inputs)
8711{
8712 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8713 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
8714
8715 // Only trickle chars<>key when working with InputText()
8716 // FIXME: InputText() could parse event trail?
8717 // FIXME: Could specialize chars<>keys trickling rules for control keys (those not typically associated to characters)
8718 const bool trickle_interleaved_keys_and_text = (trickle_fast_inputs && g.WantTextInputNextFrame == 1);
8719
8720 bool mouse_moved = false, mouse_wheeled = false, key_changed = false, text_inputted = false;
8721 int mouse_button_changed = 0x00;
8722 ImBitArray<ImGuiKey_KeysData_SIZE> key_changed_mask;
8723
8724 int event_n = 0;
8725 for (; event_n < g.InputEventsQueue.Size; event_n++)
8726 {
8727 ImGuiInputEvent* e = &g.InputEventsQueue[event_n];
8728 if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_MousePos)
8729 {
8730 // Trickling Rule: Stop processing queued events if we already handled a mouse button change
8731 ImVec2 event_pos(e->MousePos.PosX, e->MousePos.PosY);
8732 if (trickle_fast_inputs && (mouse_button_changed != 0 || mouse_wheeled || key_changed || text_inputted))
8733 break;
8734 io.MousePos = event_pos;
8735 io.MouseSource = e->MousePos.MouseSource;
8736 mouse_moved = true;
8737 }
8738 else if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_MouseButton)
8739 {
8740 // Trickling Rule: Stop processing queued events if we got multiple action on the same button
8741 const ImGuiMouseButton button = e->MouseButton.Button;
8742 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT);
8743 if (trickle_fast_inputs && ((mouse_button_changed & (1 << button)) || mouse_wheeled))
8744 break;
8745 if (trickle_fast_inputs && e->MouseButton.MouseSource == ImGuiMouseSource_TouchScreen && mouse_moved) // #2702: TouchScreen have no initial hover.
8746 break;
8747 io.MouseDown[button] = e->MouseButton.Down;
8748 io.MouseSource = e->MouseButton.MouseSource;
8749 mouse_button_changed |= (1 << button);
8750 }
8751 else if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_MouseWheel)
8752 {
8753 // Trickling Rule: Stop processing queued events if we got multiple action on the event
8754 if (trickle_fast_inputs && (mouse_moved || mouse_button_changed != 0))
8755 break;
8756 io.MouseWheelH += e->MouseWheel.WheelX;
8757 io.MouseWheel += e->MouseWheel.WheelY;
8758 io.MouseSource = e->MouseWheel.MouseSource;
8759 mouse_wheeled = true;
8760 }
8761 else if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_Key)
8762 {
8763 // Trickling Rule: Stop processing queued events if we got multiple action on the same button
8764 ImGuiKey key = e->Key.Key;
8765 IM_ASSERT(key != ImGuiKey_None);
8766 ImGuiKeyData* key_data = GetKeyData(key);
8767 const int key_data_index = (int)(key_data - g.IO.KeysData);
8768 if (trickle_fast_inputs && key_data->Down != e->Key.Down && (key_changed_mask.TestBit(key_data_index) || text_inputted || mouse_button_changed != 0))
8769 break;
8770 key_data->Down = e->Key.Down;
8771 key_data->AnalogValue = e->Key.AnalogValue;
8772 key_changed = true;
8773 key_changed_mask.SetBit(key_data_index);
8774
8775 // Allow legacy code using io.KeysDown[GetKeyIndex()] with new backends
8776#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
8777 io.KeysDown[key_data_index] = key_data->Down;
8778 if (io.KeyMap[key_data_index] != -1)
8779 io.KeysDown[io.KeyMap[key_data_index]] = key_data->Down;
8780#endif
8781 }
8782 else if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_Text)
8783 {
8784 // Trickling Rule: Stop processing queued events if keys/mouse have been interacted with
8785 if (trickle_fast_inputs && ((key_changed && trickle_interleaved_keys_and_text) || mouse_button_changed != 0 || mouse_moved || mouse_wheeled))
8786 break;
8787 unsigned int c = e->Text.Char;
8788 io.InputQueueCharacters.push_back(c <= IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX ? (ImWchar)c : IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_INVALID);
8789 if (trickle_interleaved_keys_and_text)
8790 text_inputted = true;
8791 }
8792 else if (e->Type == ImGuiInputEventType_Focus)
8793 {
8794 // We intentionally overwrite this and process in NewFrame(), in order to give a chance
8795 // to multi-viewports backends to queue AddFocusEvent(false) + AddFocusEvent(true) in same frame.
8796 const bool focus_lost = !e->AppFocused.Focused;
8797 io.AppFocusLost = focus_lost;
8798 }
8799 else
8800 {
8801 IM_ASSERT(0 && "Unknown event!");
8802 }
8803 }
8804
8805 // Record trail (for domain-specific applications wanting to access a precise trail)
8806 //if (event_n != 0) IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("Processed: %d / Remaining: %d\n", event_n, g.InputEventsQueue.Size - event_n);
8807 for (int n = 0; n < event_n; n++)
8808 g.InputEventsTrail.push_back(g.InputEventsQueue[n]);
8809
8810 // [DEBUG]
8811#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
8812 if (event_n != 0 && (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventIO))
8813 for (int n = 0; n < g.InputEventsQueue.Size; n++)
8814 DebugPrintInputEvent(n < event_n ? "Processed" : "Remaining", &g.InputEventsQueue[n]);
8815#endif
8816
8817 // Remaining events will be processed on the next frame
8818 if (event_n == g.InputEventsQueue.Size)
8819 g.InputEventsQueue.resize(0);
8820 else
8821 g.InputEventsQueue.erase(g.InputEventsQueue.Data, g.InputEventsQueue.Data + event_n);
8822
8823 // Clear buttons state when focus is lost
8824 // - this is useful so e.g. releasing Alt after focus loss on Alt-Tab doesn't trigger the Alt menu toggle.
8825 // - we clear in EndFrame() and not now in order allow application/user code polling this flag
8826 // (e.g. custom backend may want to clear additional data, custom widgets may want to react with a "canceling" event).
8827 if (g.IO.AppFocusLost)
8828 g.IO.ClearInputKeys();
8829}
8830
8831ImGuiID ImGui::GetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key)
8832{
8833 if (!IsNamedKeyOrModKey(key))
8834 return ImGuiKeyOwner_None;
8835
8836 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8837 ImGuiKeyOwnerData* owner_data = GetKeyOwnerData(&g, key);
8838 ImGuiID owner_id = owner_data->OwnerCurr;
8839
8840 if (g.ActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys && owner_id != g.ActiveId && owner_id != ImGuiKeyOwner_Any)
8841 if (key >= ImGuiKey_Keyboard_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_Keyboard_END)
8842 return ImGuiKeyOwner_None;
8843
8844 return owner_id;
8845}
8846
8847// TestKeyOwner(..., ID) : (owner == None || owner == ID)
8848// TestKeyOwner(..., None) : (owner == None)
8849// TestKeyOwner(..., Any) : no owner test
8850// All paths are also testing for key not being locked, for the rare cases that key have been locked with using ImGuiInputFlags_LockXXX flags.
8851bool ImGui::TestKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id)
8852{
8853 if (!IsNamedKeyOrModKey(key))
8854 return true;
8855
8856 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8857 if (g.ActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys && owner_id != g.ActiveId && owner_id != ImGuiKeyOwner_Any)
8858 if (key >= ImGuiKey_Keyboard_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_Keyboard_END)
8859 return false;
8860
8861 ImGuiKeyOwnerData* owner_data = GetKeyOwnerData(&g, key);
8862 if (owner_id == ImGuiKeyOwner_Any)
8863 return (owner_data->LockThisFrame == false);
8864
8865 // Note: SetKeyOwner() sets OwnerCurr. It is not strictly required for most mouse routing overlap (because of ActiveId/HoveredId
8866 // are acting as filter before this has a chance to filter), but sane as soon as user tries to look into things.
8867 // Setting OwnerCurr in SetKeyOwner() is more consistent than testing OwnerNext here: would be inconsistent with getter and other functions.
8868 if (owner_data->OwnerCurr != owner_id)
8869 {
8870 if (owner_data->LockThisFrame)
8871 return false;
8872 if (owner_data->OwnerCurr != ImGuiKeyOwner_None)
8873 return false;
8874 }
8875
8876 return true;
8877}
8878
8879// _LockXXX flags are useful to lock keys away from code which is not input-owner aware.
8880// When using _LockXXX flags, you can use ImGuiKeyOwner_Any to lock keys from everyone.
8881// - SetKeyOwner(..., None) : clears owner
8882// - SetKeyOwner(..., Any, !Lock) : illegal (assert)
8883// - SetKeyOwner(..., Any or None, Lock) : set lock
8884void ImGui::SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags)
8885{
8886 IM_ASSERT(IsNamedKeyOrModKey(key) && (owner_id != ImGuiKeyOwner_Any || (flags & (ImGuiInputFlags_LockThisFrame | ImGuiInputFlags_LockUntilRelease)))); // Can only use _Any with _LockXXX flags (to eat a key away without an ID to retrieve it)
8887 IM_ASSERT((flags & ~ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedBySetKeyOwner) == 0); // Passing flags not supported by this function!
8888
8889 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8890 ImGuiKeyOwnerData* owner_data = GetKeyOwnerData(&g, key);
8891 owner_data->OwnerCurr = owner_data->OwnerNext = owner_id;
8892
8893 // We cannot lock by default as it would likely break lots of legacy code.
8894 // In the case of using LockUntilRelease while key is not down we still lock during the frame (no key_data->Down test)
8895 owner_data->LockUntilRelease = (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_LockUntilRelease) != 0;
8896 owner_data->LockThisFrame = (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_LockThisFrame) != 0 || (owner_data->LockUntilRelease);
8897}
8898
8899// Rarely used helper
8900void ImGui::SetKeyOwnersForKeyChord(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags)
8901{
8902 if (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Ctrl) { SetKeyOwner(ImGuiMod_Ctrl, owner_id, flags); }
8903 if (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Shift) { SetKeyOwner(ImGuiMod_Shift, owner_id, flags); }
8904 if (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Alt) { SetKeyOwner(ImGuiMod_Alt, owner_id, flags); }
8905 if (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Super) { SetKeyOwner(ImGuiMod_Super, owner_id, flags); }
8906 if (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Shortcut) { SetKeyOwner(ImGuiMod_Shortcut, owner_id, flags); }
8907 if (key_chord & ~ImGuiMod_Mask_) { SetKeyOwner((ImGuiKey)(key_chord & ~ImGuiMod_Mask_), owner_id, flags); }
8908}
8909
8910// This is more or less equivalent to:
8911// if (IsItemHovered() || IsItemActive())
8912// SetKeyOwner(key, GetItemID());
8913// Extensive uses of that (e.g. many calls for a single item) may want to manually perform the tests once and then call SetKeyOwner() multiple times.
8914// More advanced usage scenarios may want to call SetKeyOwner() manually based on different condition.
8915// Worth noting is that only one item can be hovered and only one item can be active, therefore this usage pattern doesn't need to bother with routing and priority.
8916void ImGui::SetItemKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiInputFlags flags)
8917{
8918 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8919 ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
8920 if (id == 0 || (g.HoveredId != id && g.ActiveId != id))
8921 return;
8922 if ((flags & ImGuiInputFlags_CondMask_) == 0)
8923 flags |= ImGuiInputFlags_CondDefault_;
8924 if ((g.HoveredId == id && (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_CondHovered)) || (g.ActiveId == id && (flags & ImGuiInputFlags_CondActive)))
8925 {
8926 IM_ASSERT((flags & ~ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedBySetItemKeyOwner) == 0); // Passing flags not supported by this function!
8927 SetKeyOwner(key, id, flags & ~ImGuiInputFlags_CondMask_);
8928 }
8929}
8930
8931bool ImGui::Shortcut(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags)
8932{
8933 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8934
8935 // When using (owner_id == 0/Any): SetShortcutRouting() will use CurrentFocusScopeId and filter with this, so IsKeyPressed() is fine with he 0/Any.
8936 if ((flags & ImGuiInputFlags_RouteMask_) == 0)
8937 flags |= ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused;
8938 if (!SetShortcutRouting(key_chord, owner_id, flags))
8939 return false;
8940
8941 if (key_chord & ImGuiMod_Shortcut)
8942 key_chord = ConvertShortcutMod(key_chord);
8943 ImGuiKey mods = (ImGuiKey)(key_chord & ImGuiMod_Mask_);
8944 if (g.IO.KeyMods != mods)
8945 return false;
8946
8947 // Special storage location for mods
8948 ImGuiKey key = (ImGuiKey)(key_chord & ~ImGuiMod_Mask_);
8949 if (key == ImGuiKey_None)
8950 key = ConvertSingleModFlagToKey(&g, mods);
8951
8952 if (!IsKeyPressed(key, owner_id, (flags & (ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat | (ImGuiInputFlags)ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateMask_))))
8953 return false;
8954 IM_ASSERT((flags & ~ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedByShortcut) == 0); // Passing flags not supported by this function!
8955
8956 return true;
8957}
8958
8959
8960//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8961// [SECTION] ERROR CHECKING
8962//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8963
8964// Helper function to verify ABI compatibility between caller code and compiled version of Dear ImGui.
8965// Verify that the type sizes are matching between the calling file's compilation unit and imgui.cpp's compilation unit
8966// If this triggers you have an issue:
8967// - Most commonly: mismatched headers and compiled code version.
8968// - Or: mismatched configuration #define, compilation settings, packing pragma etc.
8969// The configuration settings mentioned in imconfig.h must be set for all compilation units involved with Dear ImGui,
8970// which is way it is required you put them in your imconfig file (and not just before including imgui.h).
8971// Otherwise it is possible that different compilation units would see different structure layout
8972bool ImGui::DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout(const char* version, size_t sz_io, size_t sz_style, size_t sz_vec2, size_t sz_vec4, size_t sz_vert, size_t sz_idx)
8973{
8974 bool error = false;
8975 if (strcmp(version, IMGUI_VERSION) != 0) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(strcmp(version, IMGUI_VERSION) == 0 && "Mismatched version string!"); }
8976 if (sz_io != sizeof(ImGuiIO)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_io == sizeof(ImGuiIO) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
8977 if (sz_style != sizeof(ImGuiStyle)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_style == sizeof(ImGuiStyle) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
8978 if (sz_vec2 != sizeof(ImVec2)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vec2 == sizeof(ImVec2) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
8979 if (sz_vec4 != sizeof(ImVec4)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vec4 == sizeof(ImVec4) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
8980 if (sz_vert != sizeof(ImDrawVert)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vert == sizeof(ImDrawVert) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
8981 if (sz_idx != sizeof(ImDrawIdx)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_idx == sizeof(ImDrawIdx) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
8982 return !error;
8983}
8984
8985// Until 1.89 (IMGUI_VERSION_NUM < 18814) it was legal to use SetCursorPos() to extend the boundary of a parent (e.g. window or table cell)
8986// This is causing issues and ambiguity and we need to retire that.
8987// See https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/5548 for more details.
8988// [Scenario 1]
8989// Previously this would make the window content size ~200x200:
8990// Begin(...) + SetCursorScreenPos(GetCursorScreenPos() + ImVec2(200,200)) + End(); // NOT OK
8991// Instead, please submit an item:
8992// Begin(...) + SetCursorScreenPos(GetCursorScreenPos() + ImVec2(200,200)) + Dummy(ImVec2(0,0)) + End(); // OK
8993// Alternative:
8994// Begin(...) + Dummy(ImVec2(200,200)) + End(); // OK
8995// [Scenario 2]
8996// For reference this is one of the issue what we aim to fix with this change:
8997// BeginGroup() + SomeItem("foobar") + SetCursorScreenPos(GetCursorScreenPos()) + EndGroup()
8998// The previous logic made SetCursorScreenPos(GetCursorScreenPos()) have a side-effect! It would erroneously incorporate ItemSpacing.y after the item into content size, making the group taller!
8999// While this code is a little twisted, no-one would expect SetXXX(GetXXX()) to have a side-effect. Using vertical alignment patterns could trigger this issue.
9000void ImGui::ErrorCheckUsingSetCursorPosToExtendParentBoundaries()
9001{
9002 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9003 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9004 IM_ASSERT(window->DC.IsSetPos);
9005 window->DC.IsSetPos = false;
9006#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
9007 if (window->DC.CursorPos.x <= window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x && window->DC.CursorPos.y <= window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y)
9008 return;
9009 if (window->SkipItems)
9010 return;
9011 IM_ASSERT(0 && "Code uses SetCursorPos()/SetCursorScreenPos() to extend window/parent boundaries. Please submit an item e.g. Dummy() to validate extent.");
9012#else
9013 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorPos);
9014#endif
9015}
9016
9017static void ImGui::ErrorCheckNewFrameSanityChecks()
9018{
9019 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9020
9021 // Check user IM_ASSERT macro
9022 // (IF YOU GET A WARNING OR COMPILE ERROR HERE: it means your assert macro is incorrectly defined!
9023 // If your macro uses multiple statements, it NEEDS to be surrounded by a 'do { ... } while (0)' block.
9024 // This is a common C/C++ idiom to allow multiple statements macros to be used in control flow blocks.)
9025 // #define IM_ASSERT(EXPR) if (SomeCode(EXPR)) SomeMoreCode(); // Wrong!
9026 // #define IM_ASSERT(EXPR) do { if (SomeCode(EXPR)) SomeMoreCode(); } while (0) // Correct!
9027 if (true) IM_ASSERT(1); else IM_ASSERT(0);
9028
9029 // Emscripten backends are often imprecise in their submission of DeltaTime. (#6114, #3644)
9030 // Ideally the Emscripten app/backend should aim to fix or smooth this value and avoid feeding zero, but we tolerate it.
9031#ifdef __EMSCRIPTEN__
9032 if (g.IO.DeltaTime <= 0.0f && g.FrameCount > 0)
9033 g.IO.DeltaTime = 0.00001f;
9034#endif
9035
9036 // Check user data
9037 // (We pass an error message in the assert expression to make it visible to programmers who are not using a debugger, as most assert handlers display their argument)
9038 IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
9039 IM_ASSERT((g.IO.DeltaTime > 0.0f || g.FrameCount == 0) && "Need a positive DeltaTime!");
9040 IM_ASSERT((g.FrameCount == 0 || g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount) && "Forgot to call Render() or EndFrame() at the end of the previous frame?");
9041 IM_ASSERT(g.IO.DisplaySize.x >= 0.0f && g.IO.DisplaySize.y >= 0.0f && "Invalid DisplaySize value!");
9042 IM_ASSERT(g.IO.Fonts->IsBuilt() && "Font Atlas not built! Make sure you called ImGui_ImplXXXX_NewFrame() function for renderer backend, which should call io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32() / GetTexDataAsAlpha8()");
9043 IM_ASSERT(g.Style.CurveTessellationTol > 0.0f && "Invalid style setting!");
9044 IM_ASSERT(g.Style.CircleTessellationMaxError > 0.0f && "Invalid style setting!");
9045 IM_ASSERT(g.Style.Alpha >= 0.0f && g.Style.Alpha <= 1.0f && "Invalid style setting!"); // Allows us to avoid a few clamps in color computations
9046 IM_ASSERT(g.Style.WindowMinSize.x >= 1.0f && g.Style.WindowMinSize.y >= 1.0f && "Invalid style setting.");
9047 IM_ASSERT(g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_None || g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left || g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Right);
9048 IM_ASSERT(g.Style.ColorButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left || g.Style.ColorButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Right);
9049#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
9050 for (int n = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN; n < ImGuiKey_COUNT; n++)
9051 IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMap[n] >= -1 && g.IO.KeyMap[n] < ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_END && "io.KeyMap[] contains an out of bound value (need to be 0..511, or -1 for unmapped key)");
9052
9053 // Check: required key mapping (we intentionally do NOT check all keys to not pressure user into setting up everything, but Space is required and was only added in 1.60 WIP)
9054 if ((g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) && g.IO.BackendUsingLegacyKeyArrays == 1)
9055 IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_Space] != -1 && "ImGuiKey_Space is not mapped, required for keyboard navigation.");
9056#endif
9057
9058 // Check: the io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges option requires backend to honor mouse cursor changes and set the ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors flag accordingly.
9059 if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges && !(g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors))
9060 g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges = false;
9061}
9062
9063static void ImGui::ErrorCheckEndFrameSanityChecks()
9064{
9065 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9066
9067 // Verify that io.KeyXXX fields haven't been tampered with. Key mods should not be modified between NewFrame() and EndFrame()
9068 // One possible reason leading to this assert is that your backends update inputs _AFTER_ NewFrame().
9069 // It is known that when some modal native windows called mid-frame takes focus away, some backends such as GLFW will
9070 // send key release events mid-frame. This would normally trigger this assertion and lead to sheared inputs.
9071 // We silently accommodate for this case by ignoring the case where all io.KeyXXX modifiers were released (aka key_mod_flags == 0),
9072 // while still correctly asserting on mid-frame key press events.
9073 const ImGuiKeyChord key_mods = GetMergedModsFromKeys();
9074 IM_ASSERT((key_mods == 0 || g.IO.KeyMods == key_mods) && "Mismatching io.KeyCtrl/io.KeyShift/io.KeyAlt/io.KeySuper vs io.KeyMods");
9075 IM_UNUSED(key_mods);
9076
9077 // [EXPERIMENTAL] Recover from errors: You may call this yourself before EndFrame().
9078 //ErrorCheckEndFrameRecover();
9079
9080 // Report when there is a mismatch of Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls. Important: Remember that the Begin/BeginChild API requires you
9081 // to always call End/EndChild even if Begin/BeginChild returns false! (this is unfortunately inconsistent with most other Begin* API).
9082 if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size != 1)
9083 {
9084 if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1)
9085 {
9086 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindowStack.back().Window; // <-- This window was not Ended!
9087 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1, "Mismatched Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls: did you forget to call End/EndChild?");
9088 IM_UNUSED(window);
9089 while (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1)
9090 End();
9091 }
9092 else
9093 {
9094 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1, "Mismatched Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls: did you call End/EndChild too much?");
9095 }
9096 }
9097
9098 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.GroupStack.Size == 0, "Missing EndGroup call!");
9099}
9100
9101// Experimental recovery from incorrect usage of BeginXXX/EndXXX/PushXXX/PopXXX calls.
9102// Must be called during or before EndFrame().
9103// This is generally flawed as we are not necessarily End/Popping things in the right order.
9104// FIXME: Can't recover from inside BeginTabItem/EndTabItem yet.
9105// FIXME: Can't recover from interleaved BeginTabBar/Begin
9106void ImGui::ErrorCheckEndFrameRecover(ImGuiErrorLogCallback log_callback, void* user_data)
9107{
9108 // PVS-Studio V1044 is "Loop break conditions do not depend on the number of iterations"
9109 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9110 while (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 0) //-V1044
9111 {
9112 ErrorCheckEndWindowRecover(log_callback, user_data);
9113 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9114 if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1)
9115 {
9116 IM_ASSERT(window->IsFallbackWindow);
9117 break;
9118 }
9119 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
9120 {
9121 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndChild() for '%s'", window->Name);
9122 EndChild();
9123 }
9124 else
9125 {
9126 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing End() for '%s'", window->Name);
9127 End();
9128 }
9129 }
9130}
9131
9132// Must be called before End()/EndChild()
9133void ImGui::ErrorCheckEndWindowRecover(ImGuiErrorLogCallback log_callback, void* user_data)
9134{
9135 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9136 while (g.CurrentTable && (g.CurrentTable->OuterWindow == g.CurrentWindow || g.CurrentTable->InnerWindow == g.CurrentWindow))
9137 {
9138 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndTable() in '%s'", g.CurrentTable->OuterWindow->Name);
9139 EndTable();
9140 }
9141
9142 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9143 ImGuiStackSizes* stack_sizes = &g.CurrentWindowStack.back().StackSizesOnBegin;
9144 IM_ASSERT(window != NULL);
9145 while (g.CurrentTabBar != NULL) //-V1044
9146 {
9147 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndTabBar() in '%s'", window->Name);
9148 EndTabBar();
9149 }
9150 while (window->DC.TreeDepth > 0)
9151 {
9152 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing TreePop() in '%s'", window->Name);
9153 TreePop();
9154 }
9155 while (g.GroupStack.Size > stack_sizes->SizeOfGroupStack) //-V1044
9156 {
9157 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndGroup() in '%s'", window->Name);
9158 EndGroup();
9159 }
9160 while (window->IDStack.Size > 1)
9161 {
9162 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopID() in '%s'", window->Name);
9163 PopID();
9164 }
9165 while (g.DisabledStackSize > stack_sizes->SizeOfDisabledStack) //-V1044
9166 {
9167 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndDisabled() in '%s'", window->Name);
9168 EndDisabled();
9169 }
9170 while (g.ColorStack.Size > stack_sizes->SizeOfColorStack)
9171 {
9172 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopStyleColor() in '%s' for ImGuiCol_%s", window->Name, GetStyleColorName(g.ColorStack.back().Col));
9173 PopStyleColor();
9174 }
9175 while (g.ItemFlagsStack.Size > stack_sizes->SizeOfItemFlagsStack) //-V1044
9176 {
9177 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopItemFlag() in '%s'", window->Name);
9178 PopItemFlag();
9179 }
9180 while (g.StyleVarStack.Size > stack_sizes->SizeOfStyleVarStack) //-V1044
9181 {
9182 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopStyleVar() in '%s'", window->Name);
9183 PopStyleVar();
9184 }
9185 while (g.FocusScopeStack.Size > stack_sizes->SizeOfFocusScopeStack + 1) //-V1044
9186 {
9187 if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopFocusScope() in '%s'", window->Name);
9188 PopFocusScope();
9189 }
9190}
9191
9192// Save current stack sizes for later compare
9193void ImGuiStackSizes::SetToContextState(ImGuiContext* ctx)
9194{
9195 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
9196 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9197 SizeOfIDStack = (short)window->IDStack.Size;
9198 SizeOfColorStack = (short)g.ColorStack.Size;
9199 SizeOfStyleVarStack = (short)g.StyleVarStack.Size;
9200 SizeOfFontStack = (short)g.FontStack.Size;
9201 SizeOfFocusScopeStack = (short)g.FocusScopeStack.Size;
9202 SizeOfGroupStack = (short)g.GroupStack.Size;
9203 SizeOfItemFlagsStack = (short)g.ItemFlagsStack.Size;
9204 SizeOfBeginPopupStack = (short)g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
9205 SizeOfDisabledStack = (short)g.DisabledStackSize;
9206}
9207
9208// Compare to detect usage errors
9209void ImGuiStackSizes::CompareWithContextState(ImGuiContext* ctx)
9210{
9211 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
9212 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9213 IM_UNUSED(window);
9214
9215 // Window stacks
9216 // NOT checking: DC.ItemWidth, DC.TextWrapPos (per window) to allow user to conveniently push once and not pop (they are cleared on Begin)
9217 IM_ASSERT(SizeOfIDStack == window->IDStack.Size && "PushID/PopID or TreeNode/TreePop Mismatch!");
9218
9219 // Global stacks
9220 // For color, style and font stacks there is an incentive to use Push/Begin/Pop/.../End patterns, so we relax our checks a little to allow them.
9221 IM_ASSERT(SizeOfGroupStack == g.GroupStack.Size && "BeginGroup/EndGroup Mismatch!");
9222 IM_ASSERT(SizeOfBeginPopupStack == g.BeginPopupStack.Size && "BeginPopup/EndPopup or BeginMenu/EndMenu Mismatch!");
9223 IM_ASSERT(SizeOfDisabledStack == g.DisabledStackSize && "BeginDisabled/EndDisabled Mismatch!");
9224 IM_ASSERT(SizeOfItemFlagsStack >= g.ItemFlagsStack.Size && "PushItemFlag/PopItemFlag Mismatch!");
9225 IM_ASSERT(SizeOfColorStack >= g.ColorStack.Size && "PushStyleColor/PopStyleColor Mismatch!");
9226 IM_ASSERT(SizeOfStyleVarStack >= g.StyleVarStack.Size && "PushStyleVar/PopStyleVar Mismatch!");
9227 IM_ASSERT(SizeOfFontStack >= g.FontStack.Size && "PushFont/PopFont Mismatch!");
9228 IM_ASSERT(SizeOfFocusScopeStack == g.FocusScopeStack.Size && "PushFocusScope/PopFocusScope Mismatch!");
9229}
9230
9231
9232//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9233// [SECTION] LAYOUT
9234//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9235// - ItemSize()
9236// - ItemAdd()
9237// - SameLine()
9238// - GetCursorScreenPos()
9239// - SetCursorScreenPos()
9240// - GetCursorPos(), GetCursorPosX(), GetCursorPosY()
9241// - SetCursorPos(), SetCursorPosX(), SetCursorPosY()
9242// - GetCursorStartPos()
9243// - Indent()
9244// - Unindent()
9245// - SetNextItemWidth()
9246// - PushItemWidth()
9247// - PushMultiItemsWidths()
9248// - PopItemWidth()
9249// - CalcItemWidth()
9250// - CalcItemSize()
9251// - GetTextLineHeight()
9252// - GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()
9253// - GetFrameHeight()
9254// - GetFrameHeightWithSpacing()
9255// - GetContentRegionMax()
9256// - GetContentRegionMaxAbs() [Internal]
9257// - GetContentRegionAvail(),
9258// - GetWindowContentRegionMin(), GetWindowContentRegionMax()
9259// - BeginGroup()
9260// - EndGroup()
9261// Also see in imgui_widgets: tab bars, and in imgui_tables: tables, columns.
9262//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9263
9264// Advance cursor given item size for layout.
9265// Register minimum needed size so it can extend the bounding box used for auto-fit calculation.
9266// See comments in ItemAdd() about how/why the size provided to ItemSize() vs ItemAdd() may often different.
9267void ImGui::ItemSize(const ImVec2& size, float text_baseline_y)
9268{
9269 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9270 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9271 if (window->SkipItems)
9272 return;
9273
9274 // We increase the height in this function to accommodate for baseline offset.
9275 // In theory we should be offsetting the starting position (window->DC.CursorPos), that will be the topic of a larger refactor,
9276 // but since ItemSize() is not yet an API that moves the cursor (to handle e.g. wrapping) enlarging the height has the same effect.
9277 const float offset_to_match_baseline_y = (text_baseline_y >= 0) ? ImMax(0.0f, window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset - text_baseline_y) : 0.0f;
9278
9279 const float line_y1 = window->DC.IsSameLine ? window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y : window->DC.CursorPos.y;
9280 const float line_height = ImMax(window->DC.CurrLineSize.y, /*ImMax(*/window->DC.CursorPos.y - line_y1/*, 0.0f)*/ + size.y + offset_to_match_baseline_y);
9281
9282 // Always align ourselves on pixel boundaries
9283 //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddRect(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(size.x, line_height), IM_COL32(255,0,0,200)); // [DEBUG]
9284 window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x + size.x;
9285 window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y = line_y1;
9286 window->DC.CursorPos.x = IM_FLOOR(window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x); // Next line
9287 window->DC.CursorPos.y = IM_FLOOR(line_y1 + line_height + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y); // Next line
9288 window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x);
9289 window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.CursorPos.y - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y);
9290 //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddCircle(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, 3.0f, IM_COL32(255,0,0,255), 4); // [DEBUG]
9291
9292 window->DC.PrevLineSize.y = line_height;
9293 window->DC.CurrLineSize.y = 0.0f;
9294 window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = ImMax(window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset, text_baseline_y);
9295 window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = 0.0f;
9296 window->DC.IsSameLine = window->DC.IsSetPos = false;
9297
9298 // Horizontal layout mode
9299 if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal)
9300 SameLine();
9301}
9302
9303// Declare item bounding box for clipping and interaction.
9304// Note that the size can be different than the one provided to ItemSize(). Typically, widgets that spread over available surface
9305// declare their minimum size requirement to ItemSize() and provide a larger region to ItemAdd() which is used drawing/interaction.
9306bool ImGui::ItemAdd(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, const ImRect* nav_bb_arg, ImGuiItemFlags extra_flags)
9307{
9308 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9309 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9310
9311 // Set item data
9312 // (DisplayRect is left untouched, made valid when ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect is set)
9313 g.LastItemData.ID = id;
9314 g.LastItemData.Rect = bb;
9315 g.LastItemData.NavRect = nav_bb_arg ? *nav_bb_arg : bb;
9316 g.LastItemData.InFlags = g.CurrentItemFlags | extra_flags;
9317 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags = ImGuiItemStatusFlags_None;
9318
9319 // Directional navigation processing
9320 if (id != 0)
9321 {
9322 KeepAliveID(id);
9323
9324 // Runs prior to clipping early-out
9325 // (a) So that NavInitRequest can be honored, for newly opened windows to select a default widget
9326 // (b) So that we can scroll up/down past clipped items. This adds a small O(N) cost to regular navigation requests
9327 // unfortunately, but it is still limited to one window. It may not scale very well for windows with ten of
9328 // thousands of item, but at least NavMoveRequest is only set on user interaction, aka maximum once a frame.
9329 // We could early out with "if (is_clipped && !g.NavInitRequest) return false;" but when we wouldn't be able
9330 // to reach unclipped widgets. This would work if user had explicit scrolling control (e.g. mapped on a stick).
9331 // We intentionally don't check if g.NavWindow != NULL because g.NavAnyRequest should only be set when it is non null.
9332 // If we crash on a NULL g.NavWindow we need to fix the bug elsewhere.
9333 if (!(g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav))
9334 {
9335 window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext |= (1 << window->DC.NavLayerCurrent);
9336 if (g.NavId == id || g.NavAnyRequest)
9337 if (g.NavWindow->RootWindowForNav == window->RootWindowForNav)
9338 if (window == g.NavWindow || ((window->Flags | g.NavWindow->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened))
9339 NavProcessItem();
9340 }
9341
9342 // [DEBUG] People keep stumbling on this problem and using "" as identifier in the root of a window instead of "##something".
9343 // Empty identifier are valid and useful in a small amount of cases, but 99.9% of the time you want to use "##something".
9344 // READ THE FAQ: https://dearimgui.com/faq
9345 IM_ASSERT(id != window->ID && "Cannot have an empty ID at the root of a window. If you need an empty label, use ## and read the FAQ about how the ID Stack works!");
9346 }
9347 g.NextItemData.Flags = ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_None;
9348
9349#ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
9350 if (id != 0)
9351 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(id, g.LastItemData.NavRect, &g.LastItemData);
9352#endif
9353
9354 // Clipping test
9355 // (FIXME: This is a modified copy of IsClippedEx() so we can reuse the is_rect_visible value)
