9356 //const bool is_clipped = IsClippedEx(bb, id);
9357 //if (is_clipped)
9358 // return false;
9359 const bool is_rect_visible = bb.Overlaps(window->ClipRect);
9360 if (!is_rect_visible)
9361 if (id == 0 || (id != g.ActiveId && id != g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame && id != g.NavId))
9362 if (!g.LogEnabled)
9363 return false;
9364
9365 // [DEBUG]
9366#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
9367 if (id != 0 && id == g.DebugLocateId)
9368 DebugLocateItemResolveWithLastItem();
9369#endif
9370 //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(255,255,0,120)); // [DEBUG]
9371
9372 // We need to calculate this now to take account of the current clipping rectangle (as items like Selectable may change them)
9373 if (is_rect_visible)
9374 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible;
9375 if (IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max))
9376 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect;
9377 return true;
9378}
9379
9380// Gets back to previous line and continue with horizontal layout
9381// offset_from_start_x == 0 : follow right after previous item
9382// offset_from_start_x != 0 : align to specified x position (relative to window/group left)
9383// spacing_w < 0 : use default spacing if pos_x == 0, no spacing if pos_x != 0
9384// spacing_w >= 0 : enforce spacing amount
9385void ImGui::SameLine(float offset_from_start_x, float spacing_w)
9386{
9387 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9388 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9389 if (window->SkipItems)
9390 return;
9391
9392 if (offset_from_start_x != 0.0f)
9393 {
9394 if (spacing_w < 0.0f)
9395 spacing_w = 0.0f;
9396 window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + offset_from_start_x + spacing_w + window->DC.GroupOffset.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
9397 window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y;
9398 }
9399 else
9400 {
9401 if (spacing_w < 0.0f)
9402 spacing_w = g.Style.ItemSpacing.x;
9403 window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x + spacing_w;
9404 window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y;
9405 }
9406 window->DC.CurrLineSize = window->DC.PrevLineSize;
9407 window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset;
9408 window->DC.IsSameLine = true;
9409}
9410
9411ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos()
9412{
9413 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
9414 return window->DC.CursorPos;
9415}
9416
9417// 2022/08/05: Setting cursor position also extend boundaries (via modifying CursorMaxPos) used to compute window size, group size etc.
9418// I believe this was is a judicious choice but it's probably being relied upon (it has been the case since 1.31 and 1.50)
9419// It would be sane if we requested user to use SetCursorPos() + Dummy(ImVec2(0,0)) to extend CursorMaxPos...
9420void ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(const ImVec2& pos)
9421{
9422 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
9423 window->DC.CursorPos = pos;
9424 //window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorPos);
9425 window->DC.IsSetPos = true;
9426}
9427
9428// User generally sees positions in window coordinates. Internally we store CursorPos in absolute screen coordinates because it is more convenient.
9429// Conversion happens as we pass the value to user, but it makes our naming convention confusing because GetCursorPos() == (DC.CursorPos - window.Pos). May want to rename 'DC.CursorPos'.
9430ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorPos()
9431{
9432 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
9433 return window->DC.CursorPos - window->Pos + window->Scroll;
9434}
9435
9436float ImGui::GetCursorPosX()
9437{
9438 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
9439 return window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x + window->Scroll.x;
9440}
9441
9442float ImGui::GetCursorPosY()
9443{
9444 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
9445 return window->DC.CursorPos.y - window->Pos.y + window->Scroll.y;
9446}
9447
9448void ImGui::SetCursorPos(const ImVec2& local_pos)
9449{
9450 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
9451 window->DC.CursorPos = window->Pos - window->Scroll + local_pos;
9452 //window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorPos);
9453 window->DC.IsSetPos = true;
9454}
9455
9456void ImGui::SetCursorPosX(float x)
9457{
9458 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
9459 window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + x;
9460 //window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.CursorPos.x);
9461 window->DC.IsSetPos = true;
9462}
9463
9464void ImGui::SetCursorPosY(float y)
9465{
9466 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
9467 window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->Pos.y - window->Scroll.y + y;
9468 //window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.CursorPos.y);
9469 window->DC.IsSetPos = true;
9470}
9471
9472ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorStartPos()
9473{
9474 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
9475 return window->DC.CursorStartPos - window->Pos;
9476}
9477
9478void ImGui::Indent(float indent_w)
9479{
9480 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9481 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
9482 window->DC.Indent.x += (indent_w != 0.0f) ? indent_w : g.Style.IndentSpacing;
9483 window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
9484}
9485
9486void ImGui::Unindent(float indent_w)
9487{
9488 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9489 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
9490 window->DC.Indent.x -= (indent_w != 0.0f) ? indent_w : g.Style.IndentSpacing;
9491 window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
9492}
9493
9494// Affect large frame+labels widgets only.
9495void ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(float item_width)
9496{
9497 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9498 g.NextItemData.Flags |= ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
9499 g.NextItemData.Width = item_width;
9500}
9501
9502// FIXME: Remove the == 0.0f behavior?
9503void ImGui::PushItemWidth(float item_width)
9504{
9505 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9506 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9507 window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(window->DC.ItemWidth); // Backup current width
9508 window->DC.ItemWidth = (item_width == 0.0f ? window->ItemWidthDefault : item_width);
9509 g.NextItemData.Flags &= ~ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
9510}
9511
9512void ImGui::PushMultiItemsWidths(int components, float w_full)
9513{
9514 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9515 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9516 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
9517 const float w_item_one = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR((w_full - (style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * (components - 1)) / (float)components));
9518 const float w_item_last = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR(w_full - (w_item_one + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * (components - 1)));
9519 window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(window->DC.ItemWidth); // Backup current width
9520 window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(w_item_last);
9521 for (int i = 0; i < components - 2; i++)
9522 window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(w_item_one);
9523 window->DC.ItemWidth = (components == 1) ? w_item_last : w_item_one;
9524 g.NextItemData.Flags &= ~ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
9525}
9526
9527void ImGui::PopItemWidth()
9528{
9529 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
9530 window->DC.ItemWidth = window->DC.ItemWidthStack.back();
9531 window->DC.ItemWidthStack.pop_back();
9532}
9533
9534// Calculate default item width given value passed to PushItemWidth() or SetNextItemWidth().
9535// The SetNextItemWidth() data is generally cleared/consumed by ItemAdd() or NextItemData.ClearFlags()
9536float ImGui::CalcItemWidth()
9537{
9538 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9539 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9540 float w;
9541 if (g.NextItemData.Flags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth)
9542 w = g.NextItemData.Width;
9543 else
9544 w = window->DC.ItemWidth;
9545 if (w < 0.0f)
9546 {
9547 float region_max_x = GetContentRegionMaxAbs().x;
9548 w = ImMax(1.0f, region_max_x - window->DC.CursorPos.x + w);
9549 }
9550 w = IM_FLOOR(w);
9551 return w;
9552}
9553
9554// [Internal] Calculate full item size given user provided 'size' parameter and default width/height. Default width is often == CalcItemWidth().
9555// Those two functions CalcItemWidth vs CalcItemSize are awkwardly named because they are not fully symmetrical.
9556// Note that only CalcItemWidth() is publicly exposed.
9557// The 4.0f here may be changed to match CalcItemWidth() and/or BeginChild() (right now we have a mismatch which is harmless but undesirable)
9558ImVec2 ImGui::CalcItemSize(ImVec2 size, float default_w, float default_h)
9559{
9560 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9561 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9562
9563 ImVec2 region_max;
9564 if (size.x < 0.0f || size.y < 0.0f)
9565 region_max = GetContentRegionMaxAbs();
9566
9567 if (size.x == 0.0f)
9568 size.x = default_w;
9569 else if (size.x < 0.0f)
9570 size.x = ImMax(4.0f, region_max.x - window->DC.CursorPos.x + size.x);
9571
9572 if (size.y == 0.0f)
9573 size.y = default_h;
9574 else if (size.y < 0.0f)
9575 size.y = ImMax(4.0f, region_max.y - window->DC.CursorPos.y + size.y);
9576
9577 return size;
9578}
9579
9580float ImGui::GetTextLineHeight()
9581{
9582 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9583 return g.FontSize;
9584}
9585
9586float ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()
9587{
9588 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9589 return g.FontSize + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
9590}
9591
9592float ImGui::GetFrameHeight()
9593{
9594 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9595 return g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f;
9596}
9597
9598float ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing()
9599{
9600 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9601 return g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
9602}
9603
9604// FIXME: All the Contents Region function are messy or misleading. WE WILL AIM TO OBSOLETE ALL OF THEM WITH A NEW "WORK RECT" API. Thanks for your patience!
9605
9606// FIXME: This is in window space (not screen space!).
9607ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionMax()
9608{
9609 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9610 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9611 ImVec2 mx = window->ContentRegionRect.Max - window->Pos;
9612 if (window->DC.CurrentColumns || g.CurrentTable)
9613 mx.x = window->WorkRect.Max.x - window->Pos.x;
9614 return mx;
9615}
9616
9617// [Internal] Absolute coordinate. Saner. This is not exposed until we finishing refactoring work rect features.
9618ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionMaxAbs()
9619{
9620 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9621 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9622 ImVec2 mx = window->ContentRegionRect.Max;
9623 if (window->DC.CurrentColumns || g.CurrentTable)
9624 mx.x = window->WorkRect.Max.x;
9625 return mx;
9626}
9627
9628ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail()
9629{
9630 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
9631 return GetContentRegionMaxAbs() - window->DC.CursorPos;
9632}
9633
9634// In window space (not screen space!)
9635ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionMin()
9636{
9637 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
9638 return window->ContentRegionRect.Min - window->Pos;
9639}
9640
9641ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionMax()
9642{
9643 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
9644 return window->ContentRegionRect.Max - window->Pos;
9645}
9646
9647// Lock horizontal starting position + capture group bounding box into one "item" (so you can use IsItemHovered() or layout primitives such as SameLine() on whole group, etc.)
9648// Groups are currently a mishmash of functionalities which should perhaps be clarified and separated.
9649// FIXME-OPT: Could we safely early out on ->SkipItems?
9650void ImGui::BeginGroup()
9651{
9652 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9653 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9654
9655 g.GroupStack.resize(g.GroupStack.Size + 1);
9656 ImGuiGroupData& group_data = g.GroupStack.back();
9657 group_data.WindowID = window->ID;
9658 group_data.BackupCursorPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
9659 group_data.BackupCursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
9660 group_data.BackupIndent = window->DC.Indent;
9661 group_data.BackupGroupOffset = window->DC.GroupOffset;
9662 group_data.BackupCurrLineSize = window->DC.CurrLineSize;
9663 group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset;
9664 group_data.BackupActiveIdIsAlive = g.ActiveIdIsAlive;
9665 group_data.BackupHoveredIdIsAlive = g.HoveredId != 0;
9666 group_data.BackupActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive;
9667 group_data.EmitItem = true;
9668
9669 window->DC.GroupOffset.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x - window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
9670 window->DC.Indent = window->DC.GroupOffset;
9671 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
9672 window->DC.CurrLineSize = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
9673 if (g.LogEnabled)
9674 g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce a carriage return
9675}
9676
9677void ImGui::EndGroup()
9678{
9679 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9680 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9681 IM_ASSERT(g.GroupStack.Size > 0); // Mismatched BeginGroup()/EndGroup() calls
9682
9683 ImGuiGroupData& group_data = g.GroupStack.back();
9684 IM_ASSERT(group_data.WindowID == window->ID); // EndGroup() in wrong window?
9685
9686 if (window->DC.IsSetPos)
9687 ErrorCheckUsingSetCursorPosToExtendParentBoundaries();
9688
9689 ImRect group_bb(group_data.BackupCursorPos, ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, group_data.BackupCursorPos));
9690
9691 window->DC.CursorPos = group_data.BackupCursorPos;
9692 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(group_data.BackupCursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorMaxPos);
9693 window->DC.Indent = group_data.BackupIndent;
9694 window->DC.GroupOffset = group_data.BackupGroupOffset;
9695 window->DC.CurrLineSize = group_data.BackupCurrLineSize;
9696 window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset;
9697 if (g.LogEnabled)
9698 g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce a carriage return
9699
9700 if (!group_data.EmitItem)
9701 {
9702 g.GroupStack.pop_back();
9703 return;
9704 }
9705
9706 window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = ImMax(window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset, group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset); // FIXME: Incorrect, we should grab the base offset from the *first line* of the group but it is hard to obtain now.
9707 ItemSize(group_bb.GetSize());
9708 ItemAdd(group_bb, 0, NULL, ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop);
9709
9710 // If the current ActiveId was declared within the boundary of our group, we copy it to LastItemId so IsItemActive(), IsItemDeactivated() etc. will be functional on the entire group.
9711 // It would be neater if we replaced window.DC.LastItemId by e.g. 'bool LastItemIsActive', but would put a little more burden on individual widgets.
9712 // Also if you grep for LastItemId you'll notice it is only used in that context.
9713 // (The two tests not the same because ActiveIdIsAlive is an ID itself, in order to be able to handle ActiveId being overwritten during the frame.)
9714 const bool group_contains_curr_active_id = (group_data.BackupActiveIdIsAlive != g.ActiveId) && (g.ActiveIdIsAlive == g.ActiveId) && g.ActiveId;
9715 const bool group_contains_prev_active_id = (group_data.BackupActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive == false) && (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive == true);
9716 if (group_contains_curr_active_id)
9717 g.LastItemData.ID = g.ActiveId;
9718 else if (group_contains_prev_active_id)
9719 g.LastItemData.ID = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame;
9720 g.LastItemData.Rect = group_bb;
9721
9722 // Forward Hovered flag
9723 const bool group_contains_curr_hovered_id = (group_data.BackupHoveredIdIsAlive == false) && g.HoveredId != 0;
9724 if (group_contains_curr_hovered_id)
9725 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow;
9726
9727 // Forward Edited flag
9728 if (group_contains_curr_active_id && g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame)
9729 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited;
9730
9731 // Forward Deactivated flag
9732 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated;
9733 if (group_contains_prev_active_id && g.ActiveId != g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame)
9734 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated;
9735
9736 g.GroupStack.pop_back();
9737 //window->DrawList->AddRect(group_bb.Min, group_bb.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,255,255)); // [Debug]
9738}
9739
9740
9741//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9742// [SECTION] SCROLLING
9743//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9744
9745// Helper to snap on edges when aiming at an item very close to the edge,
9746// So the difference between WindowPadding and ItemSpacing will be in the visible area after scrolling.
9747// When we refactor the scrolling API this may be configurable with a flag?
9748// Note that the effect for this won't be visible on X axis with default Style settings as WindowPadding.x == ItemSpacing.x by default.
9749static float CalcScrollEdgeSnap(float target, float snap_min, float snap_max, float snap_threshold, float center_ratio)
9750{
9751 if (target <= snap_min + snap_threshold)
9752 return ImLerp(snap_min, target, center_ratio);
9753 if (target >= snap_max - snap_threshold)
9754 return ImLerp(target, snap_max, center_ratio);
9755 return target;
9756}
9757
9758static ImVec2 CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(ImGuiWindow* window)
9759{
9760 ImVec2 scroll = window->Scroll;
9761 ImVec2 decoration_size(window->DecoOuterSizeX1 + window->DecoInnerSizeX1 + window->DecoOuterSizeX2, window->DecoOuterSizeY1 + window->DecoInnerSizeY1 + window->DecoOuterSizeY2);
9762 for (int axis = 0; axis < 2; axis++)
9763 {
9764 if (window->ScrollTarget[axis] < FLT_MAX)
9765 {
9766 float center_ratio = window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio[axis];
9767 float scroll_target = window->ScrollTarget[axis];
9768 if (window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist[axis] > 0.0f)
9769 {
9770 float snap_min = 0.0f;
9771 float snap_max = window->ScrollMax[axis] + window->SizeFull[axis] - decoration_size[axis];
9772 scroll_target = CalcScrollEdgeSnap(scroll_target, snap_min, snap_max, window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist[axis], center_ratio);
9773 }
9774 scroll[axis] = scroll_target - center_ratio * (window->SizeFull[axis] - decoration_size[axis]);
9775 }
9776 scroll[axis] = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(scroll[axis], 0.0f));
9777 if (!window->Collapsed && !window->SkipItems)
9778 scroll[axis] = ImMin(scroll[axis], window->ScrollMax[axis]);
9779 }
9780 return scroll;
9781}
9782
9783void ImGui::ScrollToItem(ImGuiScrollFlags flags)
9784{
9785 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9786 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9787 ScrollToRectEx(window, g.LastItemData.NavRect, flags);
9788}
9789
9790void ImGui::ScrollToRect(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& item_rect, ImGuiScrollFlags flags)
9791{
9792 ScrollToRectEx(window, item_rect, flags);
9793}
9794
9795// Scroll to keep newly navigated item fully into view
9796ImVec2 ImGui::ScrollToRectEx(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& item_rect, ImGuiScrollFlags flags)
9797{
9798 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9799 ImRect scroll_rect(window->InnerRect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), window->InnerRect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1));
9800 scroll_rect.Min.x = ImMin(scroll_rect.Min.x + window->DecoInnerSizeX1, scroll_rect.Max.x);
9801 scroll_rect.Min.y = ImMin(scroll_rect.Min.y + window->DecoInnerSizeY1, scroll_rect.Max.y);
9802 //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(item_rect.Min, item_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,0,255), 0.0f, 0, 5.0f); // [DEBUG]
9803 //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(scroll_rect.Min, scroll_rect.Max, IM_COL32_WHITE); // [DEBUG]
9804
9805 // Check that only one behavior is selected per axis
9806 IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_MaskX_) == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_MaskX_));
9807 IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_MaskY_) == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_MaskY_));
9808
9809 // Defaults
9810 ImGuiScrollFlags in_flags = flags;
9811 if ((flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_MaskX_) == 0 && window->ScrollbarX)
9812 flags |= ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeX;
9813 if ((flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_MaskY_) == 0)
9814 flags |= window->Appearing ? ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterY : ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeY;
9815
9816 const bool fully_visible_x = item_rect.Min.x >= scroll_rect.Min.x && item_rect.Max.x <= scroll_rect.Max.x;
9817 const bool fully_visible_y = item_rect.Min.y >= scroll_rect.Min.y && item_rect.Max.y <= scroll_rect.Max.y;
9818 const bool can_be_fully_visible_x = (item_rect.GetWidth() + g.Style.ItemSpacing.x * 2.0f) <= scroll_rect.GetWidth() || (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) != 0;
9819 const bool can_be_fully_visible_y = (item_rect.GetHeight() + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y * 2.0f) <= scroll_rect.GetHeight() || (window->AutoFitFramesY > 0) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) != 0;
9820
9821 if ((flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeX) && !fully_visible_x)
9822 {
9823 if (item_rect.Min.x < scroll_rect.Min.x || !can_be_fully_visible_x)
9824 SetScrollFromPosX(window, item_rect.Min.x - g.Style.ItemSpacing.x - window->Pos.x, 0.0f);
9825 else if (item_rect.Max.x >= scroll_rect.Max.x)
9826 SetScrollFromPosX(window, item_rect.Max.x + g.Style.ItemSpacing.x - window->Pos.x, 1.0f);
9827 }
9828 else if (((flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleCenterX) && !fully_visible_x) || (flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterX))
9829 {
9830 if (can_be_fully_visible_x)
9831 SetScrollFromPosX(window, ImFloor((item_rect.Min.x + item_rect.Max.x) * 0.5f) - window->Pos.x, 0.5f);
9832 else
9833 SetScrollFromPosX(window, item_rect.Min.x - window->Pos.x, 0.0f);
9834 }
9835
9836 if ((flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeY) && !fully_visible_y)
9837 {
9838 if (item_rect.Min.y < scroll_rect.Min.y || !can_be_fully_visible_y)
9839 SetScrollFromPosY(window, item_rect.Min.y - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y - window->Pos.y, 0.0f);
9840 else if (item_rect.Max.y >= scroll_rect.Max.y)
9841 SetScrollFromPosY(window, item_rect.Max.y + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y - window->Pos.y, 1.0f);
9842 }
9843 else if (((flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleCenterY) && !fully_visible_y) || (flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterY))
9844 {
9845 if (can_be_fully_visible_y)
9846 SetScrollFromPosY(window, ImFloor((item_rect.Min.y + item_rect.Max.y) * 0.5f) - window->Pos.y, 0.5f);
9847 else
9848 SetScrollFromPosY(window, item_rect.Min.y - window->Pos.y, 0.0f);
9849 }
9850
9851 ImVec2 next_scroll = CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window);
9852 ImVec2 delta_scroll = next_scroll - window->Scroll;
9853
9854 // Also scroll parent window to keep us into view if necessary
9855 if (!(flags & ImGuiScrollFlags_NoScrollParent) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
9856 {
9857 // FIXME-SCROLL: May be an option?
9858 if ((in_flags & (ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterX | ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleCenterX)) != 0)
9859 in_flags = (in_flags & ~ImGuiScrollFlags_MaskX_) | ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeX;
9860 if ((in_flags & (ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterY | ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleCenterY)) != 0)
9861 in_flags = (in_flags & ~ImGuiScrollFlags_MaskY_) | ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeY;
9862 delta_scroll += ScrollToRectEx(window->ParentWindow, ImRect(item_rect.Min - delta_scroll, item_rect.Max - delta_scroll), in_flags);
9863 }
9864
9865 return delta_scroll;
9866}
9867
9868float ImGui::GetScrollX()
9869{
9870 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
9871 return window->Scroll.x;
9872}
9873
9874float ImGui::GetScrollY()
9875{
9876 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
9877 return window->Scroll.y;
9878}
9879
9880float ImGui::GetScrollMaxX()
9881{
9882 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
9883 return window->ScrollMax.x;
9884}
9885
9886float ImGui::GetScrollMaxY()
9887{
9888 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
9889 return window->ScrollMax.y;
9890}
9891
9892void ImGui::SetScrollX(ImGuiWindow* window, float scroll_x)
9893{
9894 window->ScrollTarget.x = scroll_x;
9895 window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = 0.0f;
9896 window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x = 0.0f;
9897}
9898
9899void ImGui::SetScrollY(ImGuiWindow* window, float scroll_y)
9900{
9901 window->ScrollTarget.y = scroll_y;
9902 window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = 0.0f;
9903 window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y = 0.0f;
9904}
9905
9906void ImGui::SetScrollX(float scroll_x)
9907{
9908 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9909 SetScrollX(g.CurrentWindow, scroll_x);
9910}
9911
9912void ImGui::SetScrollY(float scroll_y)
9913{
9914 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9915 SetScrollY(g.CurrentWindow, scroll_y);
9916}
9917
9918// Note that a local position will vary depending on initial scroll value,
9919// This is a little bit confusing so bear with us:
9920// - local_pos = (absolution_pos - window->Pos)
9921// - So local_x/local_y are 0.0f for a position at the upper-left corner of a window,
9922// and generally local_x/local_y are >(padding+decoration) && <(size-padding-decoration) when in the visible area.
9923// - They mostly exist because of legacy API.
9924// Following the rules above, when trying to work with scrolling code, consider that:
9925// - SetScrollFromPosY(0.0f) == SetScrollY(0.0f + scroll.y) == has no effect!
9926// - SetScrollFromPosY(-scroll.y) == SetScrollY(-scroll.y + scroll.y) == SetScrollY(0.0f) == reset scroll. Of course writing SetScrollY(0.0f) directly then makes more sense
9927// We store a target position so centering and clamping can occur on the next frame when we are guaranteed to have a known window size
9928void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(ImGuiWindow* window, float local_x, float center_x_ratio)
9929{
9930 IM_ASSERT(center_x_ratio >= 0.0f && center_x_ratio <= 1.0f);
9931 window->ScrollTarget.x = IM_FLOOR(local_x - window->DecoOuterSizeX1 - window->DecoInnerSizeX1 + window->Scroll.x); // Convert local position to scroll offset
9932 window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = center_x_ratio;
9933 window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x = 0.0f;
9934}
9935
9936void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(ImGuiWindow* window, float local_y, float center_y_ratio)
9937{
9938 IM_ASSERT(center_y_ratio >= 0.0f && center_y_ratio <= 1.0f);
9939 window->ScrollTarget.y = IM_FLOOR(local_y - window->DecoOuterSizeY1 - window->DecoInnerSizeY1 + window->Scroll.y); // Convert local position to scroll offset
9940 window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = center_y_ratio;
9941 window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y = 0.0f;
9942}
9943
9944void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(float local_x, float center_x_ratio)
9945{
9946 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9947 SetScrollFromPosX(g.CurrentWindow, local_x, center_x_ratio);
9948}
9949
9950void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(float local_y, float center_y_ratio)
9951{
9952 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9953 SetScrollFromPosY(g.CurrentWindow, local_y, center_y_ratio);
9954}
9955
9956// center_x_ratio: 0.0f left of last item, 0.5f horizontal center of last item, 1.0f right of last item.
9957void ImGui::SetScrollHereX(float center_x_ratio)
9958{
9959 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9960 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9961 float spacing_x = ImMax(window->WindowPadding.x, g.Style.ItemSpacing.x);
9962 float target_pos_x = ImLerp(g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.x - spacing_x, g.LastItemData.Rect.Max.x + spacing_x, center_x_ratio);
9963 SetScrollFromPosX(window, target_pos_x - window->Pos.x, center_x_ratio); // Convert from absolute to local pos
9964
9965 // Tweak: snap on edges when aiming at an item very close to the edge
9966 window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x = ImMax(0.0f, window->WindowPadding.x - spacing_x);
9967}
9968
9969// center_y_ratio: 0.0f top of last item, 0.5f vertical center of last item, 1.0f bottom of last item.
9970void ImGui::SetScrollHereY(float center_y_ratio)
9971{
9972 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9973 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9974 float spacing_y = ImMax(window->WindowPadding.y, g.Style.ItemSpacing.y);
9975 float target_pos_y = ImLerp(window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y - spacing_y, window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y + window->DC.PrevLineSize.y + spacing_y, center_y_ratio);
9976 SetScrollFromPosY(window, target_pos_y - window->Pos.y, center_y_ratio); // Convert from absolute to local pos
9977
9978 // Tweak: snap on edges when aiming at an item very close to the edge
9979 window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y = ImMax(0.0f, window->WindowPadding.y - spacing_y);
9980}
9981
9982//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9983// [SECTION] TOOLTIPS
9984//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9985
9986bool ImGui::BeginTooltip()
9987{
9988 return BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiTooltipFlags_None, ImGuiWindowFlags_None);
9989}
9990
9991bool ImGui::BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiTooltipFlags tooltip_flags, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_window_flags)
9992{
9993 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9994
9995 if (g.DragDropWithinSource || g.DragDropWithinTarget)
9996 {
9997 // The default tooltip position is a little offset to give space to see the context menu (it's also clamped within the current viewport/monitor)
9998 // In the context of a dragging tooltip we try to reduce that offset and we enforce following the cursor.
9999 // Whatever we do we want to call SetNextWindowPos() to enforce a tooltip position and disable clipping the tooltip without our display area, like regular tooltip do.
10000 //ImVec2 tooltip_pos = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset - g.Style.WindowPadding;
10001 ImVec2 tooltip_pos = g.IO.MousePos + ImVec2(16 * g.Style.MouseCursorScale, 8 * g.Style.MouseCursorScale);
10002 SetNextWindowPos(tooltip_pos);
10003 SetNextWindowBgAlpha(g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_PopupBg].w * 0.60f);
10004 //PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha, g.Style.Alpha * 0.60f); // This would be nice but e.g ColorButton with checkboard has issue with transparent colors :(
10005 tooltip_flags |= ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip;
10006 }
10007
10008 char window_name[16];
10009 ImFormatString(window_name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(window_name), "##Tooltip_%02d", g.TooltipOverrideCount);
10010 if (tooltip_flags & ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip)
10011 if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(window_name))
10012 if (window->Active)
10013 {
10014 // Hide previous tooltip from being displayed. We can't easily "reset" the content of a window so we create a new one.
10015 SetWindowHiddendAndSkipItemsForCurrentFrame(window);
10016 ImFormatString(window_name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(window_name), "##Tooltip_%02d", ++g.TooltipOverrideCount);
10017 }
10018 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize;
10019 Begin(window_name, NULL, flags | extra_window_flags);
10020 // 2023-03-09: Added bool return value to the API, but currently always returning true.
10021 // If this ever returns false we need to update BeginDragDropSource() accordingly.
10022 //if (!ret)
10023 // End();
10024 //return ret;
10025 return true;
10026}
10027
10028void ImGui::EndTooltip()
10029{
10030 IM_ASSERT(GetCurrentWindowRead()->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip); // Mismatched BeginTooltip()/EndTooltip() calls
10031 End();
10032}
10033
10034void ImGui::SetTooltipV(const char* fmt, va_list args)
10035{
10036 if (!BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip, ImGuiWindowFlags_None))
10037 return;
10038 TextV(fmt, args);
10039 EndTooltip();
10040}
10041
10042void ImGui::SetTooltip(const char* fmt, ...)
10043{
10044 va_list args;
10045 va_start(args, fmt);
10046 SetTooltipV(fmt, args);
10047 va_end(args);
10048}
10049
10050//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10051// [SECTION] POPUPS
10052//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10053
10054// Supported flags: ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel
10055bool ImGui::IsPopupOpen(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
10056{
10057 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10058 if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId)
10059 {
10060 // Return true if any popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack
10061 // This may be used to e.g. test for another popups already opened to handle popups priorities at the same level.
10062 IM_ASSERT(id == 0);
10063 if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel)
10064 return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0;
10065 else
10066 return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
10067 }
10068 else
10069 {
10070 if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel)
10071 {
10072 // Return true if the popup is open anywhere in the popup stack
10073 for (int n = 0; n < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; n++)
10074 if (g.OpenPopupStack[n].PopupId == id)
10075 return true;
10076 return false;
10077 }
10078 else
10079 {
10080 // Return true if the popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack (this is the most-common query)
10081 return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size && g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size].PopupId == id;
10082 }
10083 }
10084}
10085
10086bool ImGui::IsPopupOpen(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
10087{
10088 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10089 ImGuiID id = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId) ? 0 : g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id);
10090 if ((popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel) && id != 0)
10091 IM_ASSERT(0 && "Cannot use IsPopupOpen() with a string id and ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel."); // But non-string version is legal and used internally
10092 return IsPopupOpen(id, popup_flags);
10093}
10094
10095ImGuiWindow* ImGui::GetTopMostPopupModal()
10096{
10097 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10098 for (int n = g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
10099 if (ImGuiWindow* popup = g.OpenPopupStack.Data[n].Window)
10100 if (popup->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
10101 return popup;
10102 return NULL;
10103}
10104
10105ImGuiWindow* ImGui::GetTopMostAndVisiblePopupModal()
10106{
10107 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10108 for (int n = g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
10109 if (ImGuiWindow* popup = g.OpenPopupStack.Data[n].Window)
10110 if ((popup->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && IsWindowActiveAndVisible(popup))
10111 return popup;
10112 return NULL;
10113}
10114
10115void ImGui::OpenPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
10116{
10117 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10118 ImGuiID id = g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id);
10119 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("[popup] OpenPopup(\"%s\" -> 0x%08X)\n", str_id, id);
10120 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
10121}
10122
10123void ImGui::OpenPopup(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
10124{
10125 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
10126}
10127
10128// Mark popup as open (toggle toward open state).
10129// Popups are closed when user click outside, or activate a pressable item, or CloseCurrentPopup() is called within a BeginPopup()/EndPopup() block.
10130// Popup identifiers are relative to the current ID-stack (so OpenPopup and BeginPopup needs to be at the same level).
10131// One open popup per level of the popup hierarchy (NB: when assigning we reset the Window member of ImGuiPopupRef to NULL)
10132void ImGui::OpenPopupEx(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
10133{
10134 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10135 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
10136 const int current_stack_size = g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
10137
10138 if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup)
10139 if (IsPopupOpen((ImGuiID)0, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId))
10140 return;
10141
10142 ImGuiPopupData popup_ref; // Tagged as new ref as Window will be set back to NULL if we write this into OpenPopupStack.
10143 popup_ref.PopupId = id;
10144 popup_ref.Window = NULL;
10145 popup_ref.BackupNavWindow = g.NavWindow; // When popup closes focus may be restored to NavWindow (depend on window type).
10146 popup_ref.OpenFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
10147 popup_ref.OpenParentId = parent_window->IDStack.back();
10148 popup_ref.OpenPopupPos = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
10149 popup_ref.OpenMousePos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? g.IO.MousePos : popup_ref.OpenPopupPos;
10150
10151 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("[popup] OpenPopupEx(0x%08X)\n", id);
10152 if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size < current_stack_size + 1)
10153 {
10154 g.OpenPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
10155 }
10156 else
10157 {
10158 // Gently handle the user mistakenly calling OpenPopup() every frame. It is a programming mistake! However, if we were to run the regular code path, the ui
10159 // would become completely unusable because the popup will always be in hidden-while-calculating-size state _while_ claiming focus. Which would be a very confusing
10160 // situation for the programmer. Instead, we silently allow the popup to proceed, it will keep reappearing and the programming error will be more obvious to understand.
10161 if (g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].PopupId == id && g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].OpenFrameCount == g.FrameCount - 1)
10162 {
10163 g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].OpenFrameCount = popup_ref.OpenFrameCount;
10164 }
10165 else
10166 {
10167 // Close child popups if any, then flag popup for open/reopen
10168 ClosePopupToLevel(current_stack_size, false);
10169 g.OpenPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
10170 }
10171
10172 // When reopening a popup we first refocus its parent, otherwise if its parent is itself a popup it would get closed by ClosePopupsOverWindow().
10173 // This is equivalent to what ClosePopupToLevel() does.
10174 //if (g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].PopupId == id)
10175 // FocusWindow(parent_window);
10176 }
10177}
10178
10179// When popups are stacked, clicking on a lower level popups puts focus back to it and close popups above it.
10180// This function closes any popups that are over 'ref_window'.
10181void ImGui::ClosePopupsOverWindow(ImGuiWindow* ref_window, bool restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
10182{
10183 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10184 if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size == 0)
10185 return;
10186
10187 // Don't close our own child popup windows.
10188 int popup_count_to_keep = 0;
10189 if (ref_window)
10190 {
10191 // Find the highest popup which is a descendant of the reference window (generally reference window = NavWindow)
10192 for (; popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; popup_count_to_keep++)
10193 {
10194 ImGuiPopupData& popup = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_count_to_keep];
10195 if (!popup.Window)
10196 continue;
10197 IM_ASSERT((popup.Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0);
10198 if (popup.Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
10199 continue;
10200
10201 // Trim the stack unless the popup is a direct parent of the reference window (the reference window is often the NavWindow)
10202 // - With this stack of window, clicking/focusing Popup1 will close Popup2 and Popup3:
10203 // Window -> Popup1 -> Popup2 -> Popup3
10204 // - Each popups may contain child windows, which is why we compare ->RootWindow!
10205 // Window -> Popup1 -> Popup1_Child -> Popup2 -> Popup2_Child
10206 bool ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup = false;
10207 for (int n = popup_count_to_keep; n < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; n++)
10208 if (ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[n].Window)
10209 if (IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(ref_window, popup_window))
10210 {
10211 ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup = true;
10212 break;
10213 }
10214 if (!ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup)
10215 break;
10216 }
10217 }
10218 if (popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size) // This test is not required but it allows to set a convenient breakpoint on the statement below
10219 {
10220 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("[popup] ClosePopupsOverWindow(\"%s\")\n", ref_window ? ref_window->Name : "<NULL>");
10221 ClosePopupToLevel(popup_count_to_keep, restore_focus_to_window_under_popup);
10222 }
10223}
10224
10225void ImGui::ClosePopupsExceptModals()
10226{
10227 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10228
10229 int popup_count_to_keep;
10230 for (popup_count_to_keep = g.OpenPopupStack.Size; popup_count_to_keep > 0; popup_count_to_keep--)
10231 {
10232 ImGuiWindow* window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_count_to_keep - 1].Window;
10233 if (!window || window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
10234 break;
10235 }
10236 if (popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size) // This test is not required but it allows to set a convenient breakpoint on the statement below
10237 ClosePopupToLevel(popup_count_to_keep, true);
10238}
10239
10240void ImGui::ClosePopupToLevel(int remaining, bool restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
10241{
10242 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10243 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("[popup] ClosePopupToLevel(%d), restore_focus_to_window_under_popup=%d\n", remaining, restore_focus_to_window_under_popup);
10244 IM_ASSERT(remaining >= 0 && remaining < g.OpenPopupStack.Size);
10245
10246 // Trim open popup stack
10247 ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[remaining].Window;
10248 ImGuiWindow* popup_backup_nav_window = g.OpenPopupStack[remaining].BackupNavWindow;
10249 g.OpenPopupStack.resize(remaining);
10250
10251 if (restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
10252 {
10253 ImGuiWindow* focus_window = (popup_window && popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) ? popup_window->ParentWindow : popup_backup_nav_window;
10254 if (focus_window && !focus_window->WasActive && popup_window)
10255 {
10256 // Fallback
10257 FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(popup_window, NULL);
10258 }
10259 else
10260 {
10261 if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main && focus_window)
10262 focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(focus_window);
10263 FocusWindow(focus_window);
10264 }
10265 }
10266}
10267
10268// Close the popup we have begin-ed into.
10269void ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup()
10270{
10271 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10272 int popup_idx = g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1;
10273 if (popup_idx < 0 || popup_idx >= g.OpenPopupStack.Size || g.BeginPopupStack[popup_idx].PopupId != g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx].PopupId)
10274 return;
10275
10276 // Closing a menu closes its top-most parent popup (unless a modal)
10277 while (popup_idx > 0)
10278 {
10279 ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx].Window;
10280 ImGuiWindow* parent_popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx - 1].Window;
10281 bool close_parent = false;
10282 if (popup_window && (popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
10283 if (parent_popup_window && !(parent_popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
10284 close_parent = true;
10285 if (!close_parent)
10286 break;
10287 popup_idx--;
10288 }
10289 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("[popup] CloseCurrentPopup %d -> %d\n", g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1, popup_idx);
10290 ClosePopupToLevel(popup_idx, true);
10291
10292 // A common pattern is to close a popup when selecting a menu item/selectable that will open another window.
10293 // To improve this usage pattern, we avoid nav highlight for a single frame in the parent window.
10294 // Similarly, we could avoid mouse hover highlight in this window but it is less visually problematic.
10295 if (ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow)
10296 window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame = true;
10297}
10298
10299// Attention! BeginPopup() adds default flags which BeginPopupEx()!
10300bool ImGui::BeginPopupEx(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
10301{
10302 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10303 if (!IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
10304 {
10305 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
10306 return false;
10307 }
10308
10309 char name[20];
10310 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
10311 ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Menu_%02d", g.BeginMenuCount); // Recycle windows based on depth
10312 else
10313 ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Popup_%08x", id); // Not recycling, so we can close/open during the same frame
10314
10315 flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup;
10316 bool is_open = Begin(name, NULL, flags);
10317 if (!is_open) // NB: Begin can return false when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
10318 EndPopup();
10319
10320 return is_open;
10321}
10322
10323bool ImGui::BeginPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
10324{
10325 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10326 if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size <= g.BeginPopupStack.Size) // Early out for performance
10327 {
10328 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
10329 return false;
10330 }
10331 flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings;
10332 ImGuiID id = g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id);
10333 return BeginPopupEx(id, flags);
10334}
10335
10336// If 'p_open' is specified for a modal popup window, the popup will have a regular close button which will close the popup.
10337// Note that popup visibility status is owned by Dear ImGui (and manipulated with e.g. OpenPopup) so the actual value of *p_open is meaningless here.
10338bool ImGui::BeginPopupModal(const char* name, bool* p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
10339{
10340 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10341 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10342 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(name);
10343 if (!IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
10344 {
10345 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
10346 return false;
10347 }
10348
10349 // Center modal windows by default for increased visibility
10350 // (this won't really last as settings will kick in, and is mostly for backward compatibility. user may do the same themselves)
10351 // FIXME: Should test for (PosCond & window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags) with the upcoming window.
10352 if ((g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos) == 0)
10353 {
10354 const ImGuiViewport* viewport = GetMainViewport();
10355 SetNextWindowPos(viewport->GetCenter(), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
10356 }
10357
10358 flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse;
10359 const bool is_open = Begin(name, p_open, flags);
10360 if (!is_open || (p_open && !*p_open)) // NB: is_open can be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
10361 {
10362 EndPopup();
10363 if (is_open)
10364 ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size, true);
10365 return false;
10366 }
10367 return is_open;
10368}
10369
10370void ImGui::EndPopup()
10371{
10372 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10373 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10374 IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup); // Mismatched BeginPopup()/EndPopup() calls
10375 IM_ASSERT(g.BeginPopupStack.Size > 0);
10376
10377 // Make all menus and popups wrap around for now, may need to expose that policy (e.g. focus scope could include wrap/loop policy flags used by new move requests)
10378 if (g.NavWindow == window)
10379 NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(window, ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY);
10380
10381 // Child-popups don't need to be laid out
10382 IM_ASSERT(g.WithinEndChild == false);
10383 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
10384 g.WithinEndChild = true;
10385 End();
10386 g.WithinEndChild = false;
10387}
10388
10389// Helper to open a popup if mouse button is released over the item
10390// - This is essentially the same as BeginPopupContextItem() but without the trailing BeginPopup()
10391void ImGui::OpenPopupOnItemClick(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
10392{
10393 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10394 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10395 int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
10396 if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
10397 {
10398 ImGuiID id = str_id ? window->GetID(str_id) : g.LastItemData.ID; // If user hasn't passed an ID, we can use the LastItemID. Using LastItemID as a Popup ID won't conflict!
10399 IM_ASSERT(id != 0); // You cannot pass a NULL str_id if the last item has no identifier (e.g. a Text() item)
10400 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
10401 }
10402}
10403
10404// This is a helper to handle the simplest case of associating one named popup to one given widget.
10405// - To create a popup associated to the last item, you generally want to pass a NULL value to str_id.
10406// - To create a popup with a specific identifier, pass it in str_id.
10407// - This is useful when using using BeginPopupContextItem() on an item which doesn't have an identifier, e.g. a Text() call.
10408// - This is useful when multiple code locations may want to manipulate/open the same popup, given an explicit id.
10409// - You may want to handle the whole on user side if you have specific needs (e.g. tweaking IsItemHovered() parameters).
10410// This is essentially the same as:
10411// id = str_id ? GetID(str_id) : GetItemID();
10412// OpenPopupOnItemClick(str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
10413// return BeginPopup(id);
10414// Which is essentially the same as:
10415// id = str_id ? GetID(str_id) : GetItemID();
10416// if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton_Right))
10417// OpenPopup(id);
10418// return BeginPopup(id);
10419// The main difference being that this is tweaked to avoid computing the ID twice.
10420bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
10421{
10422 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10423 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10424 if (window->SkipItems)
10425 return false;
10426 ImGuiID id = str_id ? window->GetID(str_id) : g.LastItemData.ID; // If user hasn't passed an ID, we can use the LastItemID. Using LastItemID as a Popup ID won't conflict!
10427 IM_ASSERT(id != 0); // You cannot pass a NULL str_id if the last item has no identifier (e.g. a Text() item)
10428 int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
10429 if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
10430 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
10431 return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
10432}
10433
10434bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
10435{
10436 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10437 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10438 if (!str_id)
10439 str_id = "window_context";
10440 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
10441 int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
10442 if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
10443 if (!(popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems) || !IsAnyItemHovered())
10444 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
10445 return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
10446}
10447
10448bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextVoid(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
10449{
10450 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10451 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10452 if (!str_id)
10453 str_id = "void_context";
10454 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
10455 int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
10456 if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && !IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow))
10457 if (GetTopMostPopupModal() == NULL)
10458 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
10459 return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
10460}
10461
10462// r_avoid = the rectangle to avoid (e.g. for tooltip it is a rectangle around the mouse cursor which we want to avoid. for popups it's a small point around the cursor.)
10463// r_outer = the visible area rectangle, minus safe area padding. If our popup size won't fit because of safe area padding we ignore it.
10464// (r_outer is usually equivalent to the viewport rectangle minus padding, but when multi-viewports are enabled and monitor
10465// information are available, it may represent the entire platform monitor from the frame of reference of the current viewport.
10466// this allows us to have tooltips/popups displayed out of the parent viewport.)
10467ImVec2 ImGui::FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(const ImVec2& ref_pos, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiDir* last_dir, const ImRect& r_outer, const ImRect& r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy policy)
10468{
10469 ImVec2 base_pos_clamped = ImClamp(ref_pos, r_outer.Min, r_outer.Max - size);
10470 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r_avoid.Min, r_avoid.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,0,255));
10471 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r_outer.Min, r_outer.Max, IM_COL32(0,255,0,255));
10472
10473 // Combo Box policy (we want a connecting edge)
10474 if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_ComboBox)
10475 {
10476 const ImGuiDir dir_prefered_order[ImGuiDir_COUNT] = { ImGuiDir_Down, ImGuiDir_Right, ImGuiDir_Left, ImGuiDir_Up };
10477 for (int n = (*last_dir != ImGuiDir_None) ? -1 : 0; n < ImGuiDir_COUNT; n++)
10478 {
10479 const ImGuiDir dir = (n == -1) ? *last_dir : dir_prefered_order[n];
10480 if (n != -1 && dir == *last_dir) // Already tried this direction?
10481 continue;
10482 ImVec2 pos;
10483 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Down) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Min.x, r_avoid.Max.y); // Below, Toward Right (default)
10484 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Right) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Min.x, r_avoid.Min.y - size.y); // Above, Toward Right
10485 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Left) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Max.x - size.x, r_avoid.Max.y); // Below, Toward Left
10486 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Up) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Max.x - size.x, r_avoid.Min.y - size.y); // Above, Toward Left
10487 if (!r_outer.Contains(ImRect(pos, pos + size)))
10488 continue;
10489 *last_dir = dir;
10490 return pos;
10491 }
10492 }
10493
10494 // Tooltip and Default popup policy
10495 // (Always first try the direction we used on the last frame, if any)
10496 if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip || policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default)
10497 {
10498 const ImGuiDir dir_prefered_order[ImGuiDir_COUNT] = { ImGuiDir_Right, ImGuiDir_Down, ImGuiDir_Up, ImGuiDir_Left };
10499 for (int n = (*last_dir != ImGuiDir_None) ? -1 : 0; n < ImGuiDir_COUNT; n++)
10500 {
10501 const ImGuiDir dir = (n == -1) ? *last_dir : dir_prefered_order[n];
10502 if (n != -1 && dir == *last_dir) // Already tried this direction?
10503 continue;
10504
10505 const float avail_w = (dir == ImGuiDir_Left ? r_avoid.Min.x : r_outer.Max.x) - (dir == ImGuiDir_Right ? r_avoid.Max.x : r_outer.Min.x);
10506 const float avail_h = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up ? r_avoid.Min.y : r_outer.Max.y) - (dir == ImGuiDir_Down ? r_avoid.Max.y : r_outer.Min.y);
10507
10508 // If there's not enough room on one axis, there's no point in positioning on a side on this axis (e.g. when not enough width, use a top/bottom position to maximize available width)
10509 if (avail_w < size.x && (dir == ImGuiDir_Left || dir == ImGuiDir_Right))
10510 continue;
10511 if (avail_h < size.y && (dir == ImGuiDir_Up || dir == ImGuiDir_Down))
10512 continue;
10513
10514 ImVec2 pos;
10515 pos.x = (dir == ImGuiDir_Left) ? r_avoid.Min.x - size.x : (dir == ImGuiDir_Right) ? r_avoid.Max.x : base_pos_clamped.x;
10516 pos.y = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? r_avoid.Min.y - size.y : (dir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? r_avoid.Max.y : base_pos_clamped.y;
10517
10518 // Clamp top-left corner of popup
10519 pos.x = ImMax(pos.x, r_outer.Min.x);
10520 pos.y = ImMax(pos.y, r_outer.Min.y);
10521
10522 *last_dir = dir;
10523 return pos;
10524 }
10525 }
10526
10527 // Fallback when not enough room:
10528 *last_dir = ImGuiDir_None;
10529
10530 // For tooltip we prefer avoiding the cursor at all cost even if it means that part of the tooltip won't be visible.
10531 if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip)
10532 return ref_pos + ImVec2(2, 2);
10533
10534 // Otherwise try to keep within display
10535 ImVec2 pos = ref_pos;
10536 pos.x = ImMax(ImMin(pos.x + size.x, r_outer.Max.x) - size.x, r_outer.Min.x);
10537 pos.y = ImMax(ImMin(pos.y + size.y, r_outer.Max.y) - size.y, r_outer.Min.y);
10538 return pos;
10539}
10540
10541// Note that this is used for popups, which can overlap the non work-area of individual viewports.
10542ImRect ImGui::GetPopupAllowedExtentRect(ImGuiWindow* window)
10543{
10544 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10545 IM_UNUSED(window);
10546 ImRect r_screen = ((ImGuiViewportP*)(void*)GetMainViewport())->GetMainRect();
10547 ImVec2 padding = g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding;
10548 r_screen.Expand(ImVec2((r_screen.GetWidth() > padding.x * 2) ? -padding.x : 0.0f, (r_screen.GetHeight() > padding.y * 2) ? -padding.y : 0.0f));
10549 return r_screen;
10550}
10551
10552ImVec2 ImGui::FindBestWindowPosForPopup(ImGuiWindow* window)
10553{
10554 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10555
10556 ImRect r_outer = GetPopupAllowedExtentRect(window);
10557 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
10558 {
10559 // Child menus typically request _any_ position within the parent menu item, and then we move the new menu outside the parent bounds.
10560 // This is how we end up with child menus appearing (most-commonly) on the right of the parent menu.
10561 IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow == window);
10562 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindowStack[g.CurrentWindowStack.Size - 2].Window;
10563 float horizontal_overlap = g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x; // We want some overlap to convey the relative depth of each menu (currently the amount of overlap is hard-coded to style.ItemSpacing.x).
10564 ImRect r_avoid;
10565 if (parent_window->DC.MenuBarAppending)
10566 r_avoid = ImRect(-FLT_MAX, parent_window->ClipRect.Min.y, FLT_MAX, parent_window->ClipRect.Max.y); // Avoid parent menu-bar. If we wanted multi-line menu-bar, we may instead want to have the calling window setup e.g. a NextWindowData.PosConstraintAvoidRect field
10567 else
10568 r_avoid = ImRect(parent_window->Pos.x + horizontal_overlap, -FLT_MAX, parent_window->Pos.x + parent_window->Size.x - horizontal_overlap - parent_window->ScrollbarSizes.x, FLT_MAX);
10569 return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(window->Pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default);
10570 }
10571 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
10572 {
10573 return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(window->Pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, ImRect(window->Pos, window->Pos), ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default); // Ideally we'd disable r_avoid here
10574 }
10575 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
10576 {
10577 // Position tooltip (always follows mouse)
10578 float sc = g.Style.MouseCursorScale;
10579 ImVec2 ref_pos = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
10580 ImRect r_avoid;
10581 if (!g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && !(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos))
10582 r_avoid = ImRect(ref_pos.x - 16, ref_pos.y - 8, ref_pos.x + 16, ref_pos.y + 8);
10583 else
10584 r_avoid = ImRect(ref_pos.x - 16, ref_pos.y - 8, ref_pos.x + 24 * sc, ref_pos.y + 24 * sc); // FIXME: Hard-coded based on mouse cursor shape expectation. Exact dimension not very important.
10585 return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(ref_pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip);
10586 }
10587 IM_ASSERT(0);
10588 return window->Pos;
10589}
10590
10591//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10592// [SECTION] KEYBOARD/GAMEPAD NAVIGATION
10593//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10594
10595// FIXME-NAV: The existence of SetNavID vs SetFocusID vs FocusWindow() needs to be clarified/reworked.
10596// In our terminology those should be interchangeable, yet right now this is super confusing.
10597// Those two functions are merely a legacy artifact, so at minimum naming should be clarified.
10598
10599void ImGui::SetNavWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
10600{
10601 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10602 if (g.NavWindow != window)
10603 {
10604 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FOCUS("[focus] SetNavWindow(\"%s\")\n", window ? window->Name : "<NULL>");
10605 g.NavWindow = window;
10606 }
10607 g.NavInitRequest = g.NavMoveSubmitted = g.NavMoveScoringItems = false;
10608 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10609}
10610
10611void ImGui::SetNavID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiNavLayer nav_layer, ImGuiID focus_scope_id, const ImRect& rect_rel)
10612{
10613 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10614 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow != NULL);
10615 IM_ASSERT(nav_layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main || nav_layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu);
10616 g.NavId = id;
10617 g.NavLayer = nav_layer;
10618 g.NavFocusScopeId = focus_scope_id;
10619 g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[nav_layer] = id;
10620 g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[nav_layer] = rect_rel;
10621}
10622
10623void ImGui::SetFocusID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindow* window)
10624{
10625 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10626 IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
10627
10628 if (g.NavWindow != window)
10629 SetNavWindow(window);
10630
10631 // Assume that SetFocusID() is called in the context where its window->DC.NavLayerCurrent and g.CurrentFocusScopeId are valid.
10632 // Note that window may be != g.CurrentWindow (e.g. SetFocusID call in InputTextEx for multi-line text)
10633 const ImGuiNavLayer nav_layer = window->DC.NavLayerCurrent;
10634 g.NavId = id;
10635 g.NavLayer = nav_layer;
10636 g.NavFocusScopeId = g.CurrentFocusScopeId;
10637 window->NavLastIds[nav_layer] = id;
10638 if (g.LastItemData.ID == id)
10639 window->NavRectRel[nav_layer] = WindowRectAbsToRel(window, g.LastItemData.NavRect);
10640
10641 if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard || g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
10642 g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
10643 else
10644 g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
10645}
10646
10647ImGuiDir ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(float dx, float dy)
10648{
10649 if (ImFabs(dx) > ImFabs(dy))
10650 return (dx > 0.0f) ? ImGuiDir_Right : ImGuiDir_Left;
10651 return (dy > 0.0f) ? ImGuiDir_Down : ImGuiDir_Up;
10652}
10653
10654static float inline NavScoreItemDistInterval(float a0, float a1, float b0, float b1)
10655{
10656 if (a1 < b0)
10657 return a1 - b0;
10658 if (b1 < a0)
10659 return a0 - b1;
10660 return 0.0f;
10661}
10662
10663static void inline NavClampRectToVisibleAreaForMoveDir(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImRect& r, const ImRect& clip_rect)
10664{
10665 if (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Right)
10666 {
10667 r.Min.y = ImClamp(r.Min.y, clip_rect.Min.y, clip_rect.Max.y);
10668 r.Max.y = ImClamp(r.Max.y, clip_rect.Min.y, clip_rect.Max.y);
10669 }
10670 else // FIXME: PageUp/PageDown are leaving move_dir == None
10671 {
10672 r.Min.x = ImClamp(r.Min.x, clip_rect.Min.x, clip_rect.Max.x);
10673 r.Max.x = ImClamp(r.Max.x, clip_rect.Min.x, clip_rect.Max.x);
10674 }
10675}
10676
10677// Scoring function for gamepad/keyboard directional navigation. Based on https://gist.github.com/rygorous/6981057
10678static bool ImGui::NavScoreItem(ImGuiNavItemData* result)
10679{
10680 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10681 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10682 if (g.NavLayer != window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
10683 return false;
10684
10685 // FIXME: Those are not good variables names
10686 ImRect cand = g.LastItemData.NavRect; // Current item nav rectangle
10687 const ImRect curr = g.NavScoringRect; // Current modified source rect (NB: we've applied Max.x = Min.x in NavUpdate() to inhibit the effect of having varied item width)
10688 g.NavScoringDebugCount++;
10689
10690 // When entering through a NavFlattened border, we consider child window items as fully clipped for scoring
10691 if (window->ParentWindow == g.NavWindow)
10692 {
10693 IM_ASSERT((window->Flags | g.NavWindow->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened);
10694 if (!window->ClipRect.Overlaps(cand))
10695 return false;
10696 cand.ClipWithFull(window->ClipRect); // This allows the scored item to not overlap other candidates in the parent window
10697 }
10698
10699 // We perform scoring on items bounding box clipped by the current clipping rectangle on the other axis (clipping on our movement axis would give us equal scores for all clipped items)
10700 // For example, this ensures that items in one column are not reached when moving vertically from items in another column.
10701 NavClampRectToVisibleAreaForMoveDir(g.NavMoveClipDir, cand, window->ClipRect);
10702
10703 // Compute distance between boxes
10704 // FIXME-NAV: Introducing biases for vertical navigation, needs to be removed.
10705 float dbx = NavScoreItemDistInterval(cand.Min.x, cand.Max.x, curr.Min.x, curr.Max.x);
10706 float dby = NavScoreItemDistInterval(ImLerp(cand.Min.y, cand.Max.y, 0.2f), ImLerp(cand.Min.y, cand.Max.y, 0.8f), ImLerp(curr.Min.y, curr.Max.y, 0.2f), ImLerp(curr.Min.y, curr.Max.y, 0.8f)); // Scale down on Y to keep using box-distance for vertically touching items
10707 if (dby != 0.0f && dbx != 0.0f)
10708 dbx = (dbx / 1000.0f) + ((dbx > 0.0f) ? +1.0f : -1.0f);
10709 float dist_box = ImFabs(dbx) + ImFabs(dby);
10710
10711 // Compute distance between centers (this is off by a factor of 2, but we only compare center distances with each other so it doesn't matter)
10712 float dcx = (cand.Min.x + cand.Max.x) - (curr.Min.x + curr.Max.x);
10713 float dcy = (cand.Min.y + cand.Max.y) - (curr.Min.y + curr.Max.y);
10714 float dist_center = ImFabs(dcx) + ImFabs(dcy); // L1 metric (need this for our connectedness guarantee)
10715
10716 // Determine which quadrant of 'curr' our candidate item 'cand' lies in based on distance
10717 ImGuiDir quadrant;
10718 float dax = 0.0f, day = 0.0f, dist_axial = 0.0f;
10719 if (dbx != 0.0f || dby != 0.0f)
10720 {
10721 // For non-overlapping boxes, use distance between boxes
10722 dax = dbx;
10723 day = dby;
10724 dist_axial = dist_box;
10725 quadrant = ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(dbx, dby);
10726 }
10727 else if (dcx != 0.0f || dcy != 0.0f)
10728 {
10729 // For overlapping boxes with different centers, use distance between centers
10730 dax = dcx;
10731 day = dcy;
10732 dist_axial = dist_center;
10733 quadrant = ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(dcx, dcy);
10734 }
10735 else
10736 {
10737 // Degenerate case: two overlapping buttons with same center, break ties arbitrarily (note that LastItemId here is really the _previous_ item order, but it doesn't matter)
10738 quadrant = (g.LastItemData.ID < g.NavId) ? ImGuiDir_Left : ImGuiDir_Right;
10739 }
10740
10741#if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
10742 char buf[128];
10743 if (IsMouseHoveringRect(cand.Min, cand.Max))
10744 {
10745 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "dbox (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\ndcen (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\nd (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\nnav %c, quadrant %c", dbx, dby, dist_box, dcx, dcy, dist_center, dax, day, dist_axial, "WENS"[g.NavMoveDir], "WENS"[quadrant]);
10746 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
10747 draw_list->AddRect(curr.Min, curr.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,100));
10748 draw_list->AddRect(cand.Min, cand.Max, IM_COL32(255,255,0,200));
10749 draw_list->AddRectFilled(cand.Max - ImVec2(4, 4), cand.Max + CalcTextSize(buf) + ImVec2(4, 4), IM_COL32(40,0,0,150));
10750 draw_list->AddText(cand.Max, ~0U, buf);
10751 }
10752 else if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) // Hold to preview score in matching quadrant. Press C to rotate.
10753 {
10754 if (quadrant == g.NavMoveDir)
10755 {
10756 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "%.0f/%.0f", dist_box, dist_center);
10757 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
10758 draw_list->AddRectFilled(cand.Min, cand.Max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 200));
10759 draw_list->AddText(cand.Min, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255), buf);
10760 }
10761 }
10762#endif
10763
10764 // Is it in the quadrant we're interested in moving to?
10765 bool new_best = false;
10766 const ImGuiDir move_dir = g.NavMoveDir;
10767 if (quadrant == move_dir)
10768 {
10769 // Does it beat the current best candidate?
10770 if (dist_box < result->DistBox)
10771 {
10772 result->DistBox = dist_box;
10773 result->DistCenter = dist_center;
10774 return true;
10775 }
10776 if (dist_box == result->DistBox)
10777 {
10778 // Try using distance between center points to break ties
10779 if (dist_center < result->DistCenter)
10780 {
10781 result->DistCenter = dist_center;
10782 new_best = true;
10783 }
10784 else if (dist_center == result->DistCenter)
10785 {
10786 // Still tied! we need to be extra-careful to make sure everything gets linked properly. We consistently break ties by symbolically moving "later" items
10787 // (with higher index) to the right/downwards by an infinitesimal amount since we the current "best" button already (so it must have a lower index),
10788 // this is fairly easy. This rule ensures that all buttons with dx==dy==0 will end up being linked in order of appearance along the x axis.
10789 if (((move_dir == ImGuiDir_Up || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? dby : dbx) < 0.0f) // moving bj to the right/down decreases distance
10790 new_best = true;
10791 }
10792 }
10793 }
10794
10795 // Axial check: if 'curr' has no link at all in some direction and 'cand' lies roughly in that direction, add a tentative link. This will only be kept if no "real" matches
10796 // are found, so it only augments the graph produced by the above method using extra links. (important, since it doesn't guarantee strong connectedness)
10797 // This is just to avoid buttons having no links in a particular direction when there's a suitable neighbor. you get good graphs without this too.
10798 // 2017/09/29: FIXME: This now currently only enabled inside menu bars, ideally we'd disable it everywhere. Menus in particular need to catch failure. For general navigation it feels awkward.
10799 // Disabling it may lead to disconnected graphs when nodes are very spaced out on different axis. Perhaps consider offering this as an option?
10800 if (result->DistBox == FLT_MAX && dist_axial < result->DistAxial) // Check axial match
10801 if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
10802 if ((move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left && dax < 0.0f) || (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Right && dax > 0.0f) || (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Up && day < 0.0f) || (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Down && day > 0.0f))
10803 {
10804 result->DistAxial = dist_axial;
10805 new_best = true;
10806 }
10807
10808 return new_best;
10809}
10810
10811static void ImGui::NavApplyItemToResult(ImGuiNavItemData* result)
10812{
10813 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10814 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10815 result->Window = window;
10816 result->ID = g.LastItemData.ID;
10817 result->FocusScopeId = g.CurrentFocusScopeId;
10818 result->InFlags = g.LastItemData.InFlags;
10819 result->RectRel = WindowRectAbsToRel(window, g.LastItemData.NavRect);
10820}
10821
10822// We get there when either NavId == id, or when g.NavAnyRequest is set (which is updated by NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag above)
10823// This is called after LastItemData is set.
10824static void ImGui::NavProcessItem()
10825{
10826 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10827 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10828 const ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
10829 const ImRect nav_bb = g.LastItemData.NavRect;
10830 const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = g.LastItemData.InFlags;
10831
10832 // Process Init Request
10833 if (g.NavInitRequest && g.NavLayer == window->DC.NavLayerCurrent && (item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) == 0)
10834 {
10835 // Even if 'ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus' is on (typically collapse/close button) we record the first ResultId so they can be used as a fallback
10836 const bool candidate_for_nav_default_focus = (item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus) == 0;
10837 if (candidate_for_nav_default_focus || g.NavInitResultId == 0)
10838 {
10839 g.NavInitResultId = id;
10840 g.NavInitResultRectRel = WindowRectAbsToRel(window, nav_bb);
10841 }
10842 if (candidate_for_nav_default_focus)
10843 {
10844 g.NavInitRequest = false; // Found a match, clear request
10845 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10846 }
10847 }
10848
10849 // Process Move Request (scoring for navigation)
10850 // FIXME-NAV: Consider policy for double scoring (scoring from NavScoringRect + scoring from a rect wrapped according to current wrapping policy)
10851 if (g.NavMoveScoringItems && (item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) == 0)
10852 {
10853 const bool is_tabbing = (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing) != 0;
10854 if (is_tabbing)
10855 {
10856 NavProcessItemForTabbingRequest(id, item_flags, g.NavMoveFlags);
10857 }
10858 else if (g.NavId != id || (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId))
10859 {
10860 ImGuiNavItemData* result = (window == g.NavWindow) ? &g.NavMoveResultLocal : &g.NavMoveResultOther;
10861 if (NavScoreItem(result))
10862 NavApplyItemToResult(result);
10863
10864 // Features like PageUp/PageDown need to maintain a separate score for the visible set of items.
10865 const float VISIBLE_RATIO = 0.70f;
10866 if ((g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet) && window->ClipRect.Overlaps(nav_bb))
10867 if (ImClamp(nav_bb.Max.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y) - ImClamp(nav_bb.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y) >= (nav_bb.Max.y - nav_bb.Min.y) * VISIBLE_RATIO)
10868 if (NavScoreItem(&g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible))
10869 NavApplyItemToResult(&g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible);
10870 }
10871 }
10872
10873 // Update window-relative bounding box of navigated item
10874 if (g.NavId == id)
10875 {
10876 if (g.NavWindow != window)
10877 SetNavWindow(window); // Always refresh g.NavWindow, because some operations such as FocusItem() may not have a window.
10878 g.NavLayer = window->DC.NavLayerCurrent;
10879 g.NavFocusScopeId = g.CurrentFocusScopeId;
10880 g.NavIdIsAlive = true;
10881 window->NavRectRel[window->DC.NavLayerCurrent] = WindowRectAbsToRel(window, nav_bb); // Store item bounding box (relative to window position)
10882 }
10883}
10884
10885// Handle "scoring" of an item for a tabbing/focusing request initiated by NavUpdateCreateTabbingRequest().
10886// Note that SetKeyboardFocusHere() API calls are considered tabbing requests!
10887// - Case 1: no nav/active id: set result to first eligible item, stop storing.
10888// - Case 2: tab forward: on ref id set counter, on counter elapse store result
10889// - Case 3: tab forward wrap: set result to first eligible item (preemptively), on ref id set counter, on next frame if counter hasn't elapsed store result. // FIXME-TABBING: Could be done as a next-frame forwarded request
10890// - Case 4: tab backward: store all results, on ref id pick prev, stop storing
10891// - Case 5: tab backward wrap: store all results, on ref id if no result keep storing until last // FIXME-TABBING: Could be done as next-frame forwarded requested
10892void ImGui::NavProcessItemForTabbingRequest(ImGuiID id, ImGuiItemFlags item_flags, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags)
10893{
10894 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10895
10896 if ((move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_FocusApi) == 0)
10897 if (g.NavLayer != g.CurrentWindow->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
10898 return;
10899
10900 // - Can always land on an item when using API call.
10901 // - Tabbing with _NavEnableKeyboard (space/enter/arrows): goes through every item.
10902 // - Tabbing without _NavEnableKeyboard: goes through inputable items only.
10903 bool can_stop;
10904 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_FocusApi)
10905 can_stop = true;
10906 else
10907 can_stop = (item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop) == 0 && ((g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) || (item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable));
10908
10909 // Always store in NavMoveResultLocal (unlike directional request which uses NavMoveResultOther on sibling/flattened windows)
10910 ImGuiNavItemData* result = &g.NavMoveResultLocal;
10911 if (g.NavTabbingDir == +1)
10912 {
10913 // Tab Forward or SetKeyboardFocusHere() with >= 0
10914 if (can_stop && g.NavTabbingResultFirst.ID == 0)
10915 NavApplyItemToResult(&g.NavTabbingResultFirst);
10916 if (can_stop && g.NavTabbingCounter > 0 && --g.NavTabbingCounter == 0)
10917 NavMoveRequestResolveWithLastItem(result);
10918 else if (g.NavId == id)
10919 g.NavTabbingCounter = 1;
10920 }
10921 else if (g.NavTabbingDir == -1)
10922 {
10923 // Tab Backward
10924 if (g.NavId == id)
10925 {
10926 if (result->ID)
10927 {
10928 g.NavMoveScoringItems = false;
10929 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10930 }
10931 }
10932 else if (can_stop)
10933 {
10934 // Keep applying until reaching NavId
10935 NavApplyItemToResult(result);
10936 }
10937 }
10938 else if (g.NavTabbingDir == 0)
10939 {
10940 if (can_stop && g.NavId == id)
10941 NavMoveRequestResolveWithLastItem(result);
10942 if (can_stop && g.NavTabbingResultFirst.ID == 0) // Tab init
10943 NavApplyItemToResult(&g.NavTabbingResultFirst);
10944 }
10945}
10946
10947bool ImGui::NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet()
10948{
10949 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10950 return g.NavMoveScoringItems && g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0;
10951}
10952
10953// FIXME: ScoringRect is not set
10954void ImGui::NavMoveRequestSubmit(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImGuiDir clip_dir, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags, ImGuiScrollFlags scroll_flags)
10955{
10956 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10957 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow != NULL);
10958
10959 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing)
10960 move_flags |= ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId;
10961
10962 g.NavMoveSubmitted = g.NavMoveScoringItems = true;
10963 g.NavMoveDir = move_dir;
10964 g.NavMoveDirForDebug = move_dir;
10965 g.NavMoveClipDir = clip_dir;
10966 g.NavMoveFlags = move_flags;
10967 g.NavMoveScrollFlags = scroll_flags;
10968 g.NavMoveForwardToNextFrame = false;
10969 g.NavMoveKeyMods = g.IO.KeyMods;
10970 g.NavMoveResultLocal.Clear();
10971 g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible.Clear();
10972 g.NavMoveResultOther.Clear();
10973 g.NavTabbingCounter = 0;
10974 g.NavTabbingResultFirst.Clear();
10975 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10976}
10977
10978void ImGui::NavMoveRequestResolveWithLastItem(ImGuiNavItemData* result)
10979{
10980 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10981 g.NavMoveScoringItems = false; // Ensure request doesn't need more processing
10982 NavApplyItemToResult(result);
10983 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10984}
10985
10986void ImGui::NavMoveRequestCancel()
10987{
10988 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10989 g.NavMoveSubmitted = g.NavMoveScoringItems = false;
10990 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10991}
10992
10993// Forward will reuse the move request again on the next frame (generally with modifications done to it)
10994void ImGui::NavMoveRequestForward(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImGuiDir clip_dir, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags, ImGuiScrollFlags scroll_flags)
10995{
10996 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10997 IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveForwardToNextFrame == false);
10998 NavMoveRequestCancel();
10999 g.NavMoveForwardToNextFrame = true;
11000 g.NavMoveDir = move_dir;
11001 g.NavMoveClipDir = clip_dir;
11002 g.NavMoveFlags = move_flags | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Forwarded;
11003 g.NavMoveScrollFlags = scroll_flags;
11004}
11005
11006// Navigation wrap-around logic is delayed to the end of the frame because this operation is only valid after entire
11007// popup is assembled and in case of appended popups it is not clear which EndPopup() call is final.
11008void ImGui::NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiNavMoveFlags wrap_flags)
11009{
11010 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11011 IM_ASSERT(wrap_flags != 0); // Call with _WrapX, _WrapY, _LoopX, _LoopY
11012 // In theory we should test for NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() but there's no point doing it, NavEndFrame() will do the same test
11013 if (g.NavWindow == window && g.NavMoveScoringItems && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
11014 g.NavMoveFlags |= wrap_flags;
11015}
11016
11017// FIXME: This could be replaced by updating a frame number in each window when (window == NavWindow) and (NavLayer == 0).
11018// This way we could find the last focused window among our children. It would be much less confusing this way?
11019static void ImGui::NavSaveLastChildNavWindowIntoParent(ImGuiWindow* nav_window)
11020{
11021 ImGuiWindow* parent = nav_window;
11022 while (parent && parent->RootWindow != parent && (parent->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)) == 0)
11023 parent = parent->ParentWindow;
11024 if (parent && parent != nav_window)
11025 parent->NavLastChildNavWindow = nav_window;
11026}
11027
11028// Restore the last focused child.
11029// Call when we are expected to land on the Main Layer (0) after FocusWindow()
11030static ImGuiWindow* ImGui::NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
11031{
11032 if (window->NavLastChildNavWindow && window->NavLastChildNavWindow->WasActive)
11033 return window->NavLastChildNavWindow;
11034 return window;
11035}
11036
11037void ImGui::NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer layer)
11038{
11039 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
