11040 if (layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
11041 {
11042 ImGuiWindow* prev_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
11043 g.NavWindow = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(g.NavWindow); // FIXME-NAV: Should clear ongoing nav requests?
11044 if (prev_nav_window)
11045 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FOCUS("[focus] NavRestoreLayer: from \"%s\" to SetNavWindow(\"%s\")\n", prev_nav_window->Name, g.NavWindow->Name);
11046 }
11047 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
11048 if (window->NavLastIds[layer] != 0)
11049 {
11050 SetNavID(window->NavLastIds[layer], layer, 0, window->NavRectRel[layer]);
11051 }
11052 else
11053 {
11054 g.NavLayer = layer;
11055 NavInitWindow(window, true);
11056 }
11057}
11058
11059void ImGui::NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove()
11060{
11061 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11062 g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
11063 g.NavDisableMouseHover = g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
11064}
11065
11066static inline void ImGui::NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag()
11067{
11068 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11069 g.NavAnyRequest = g.NavMoveScoringItems || g.NavInitRequest || (IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING && g.NavWindow != NULL);
11070 if (g.NavAnyRequest)
11071 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow != NULL);
11072}
11073
11074// This needs to be called before we submit any widget (aka in or before Begin)
11075void ImGui::NavInitWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, bool force_reinit)
11076{
11077 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11078 IM_ASSERT(window == g.NavWindow);
11079
11080 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs)
11081 {
11082 g.NavId = 0;
11083 g.NavFocusScopeId = window->NavRootFocusScopeId;
11084 return;
11085 }
11086
11087 bool init_for_nav = false;
11088 if (window == window->RootWindow || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) || (window->NavLastIds[0] == 0) || force_reinit)
11089 init_for_nav = true;
11090 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: from NavInitWindow(), init_for_nav=%d, window=\"%s\", layer=%d\n", init_for_nav, window->Name, g.NavLayer);
11091 if (init_for_nav)
11092 {
11093 SetNavID(0, g.NavLayer, window->NavRootFocusScopeId, ImRect());
11094 g.NavInitRequest = true;
11095 g.NavInitRequestFromMove = false;
11096 g.NavInitResultId = 0;
11097 g.NavInitResultRectRel = ImRect();
11098 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
11099 }
11100 else
11101 {
11102 g.NavId = window->NavLastIds[0];
11103 g.NavFocusScopeId = window->NavRootFocusScopeId;
11104 }
11105}
11106
11107static ImVec2 ImGui::NavCalcPreferredRefPos()
11108{
11109 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11110 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
11111 if (g.NavDisableHighlight || !g.NavDisableMouseHover || !window)
11112 {
11113 // Mouse (we need a fallback in case the mouse becomes invalid after being used)
11114 // The +1.0f offset when stored by OpenPopupEx() allows reopening this or another popup (same or another mouse button) while not moving the mouse, it is pretty standard.
11115 // In theory we could move that +1.0f offset in OpenPopupEx()
11116 ImVec2 p = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? g.IO.MousePos : g.MouseLastValidPos;
11117 return ImVec2(p.x + 1.0f, p.y);
11118 }
11119 else
11120 {
11121 // When navigation is active and mouse is disabled, pick a position around the bottom left of the currently navigated item
11122 // Take account of upcoming scrolling (maybe set mouse pos should be done in EndFrame?)
11123 ImRect rect_rel = WindowRectRelToAbs(window, window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer]);
11124 if (window->LastFrameActive != g.FrameCount && (window->ScrollTarget.x != FLT_MAX || window->ScrollTarget.y != FLT_MAX))
11125 {
11126 ImVec2 next_scroll = CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window);
11127 rect_rel.Translate(window->Scroll - next_scroll);
11128 }
11129 ImVec2 pos = ImVec2(rect_rel.Min.x + ImMin(g.Style.FramePadding.x * 4, rect_rel.GetWidth()), rect_rel.Max.y - ImMin(g.Style.FramePadding.y, rect_rel.GetHeight()));
11130 ImGuiViewport* viewport = GetMainViewport();
11131 return ImFloor(ImClamp(pos, viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size)); // ImFloor() is important because non-integer mouse position application in backend might be lossy and result in undesirable non-zero delta.
11132 }
11133}
11134
11135float ImGui::GetNavTweakPressedAmount(ImGuiAxis axis)
11136{
11137 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11138 float repeat_delay, repeat_rate;
11139 GetTypematicRepeatRate(ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateNavTweak, &repeat_delay, &repeat_rate);
11140
11141 ImGuiKey key_less, key_more;
11142 if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
11143 {
11144 key_less = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadLeft : ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadUp;
11145 key_more = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadRight : ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadDown;
11146 }
11147 else
11148 {
11149 key_less = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? ImGuiKey_LeftArrow : ImGuiKey_UpArrow;
11150 key_more = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? ImGuiKey_RightArrow : ImGuiKey_DownArrow;
11151 }
11152 float amount = (float)GetKeyPressedAmount(key_more, repeat_delay, repeat_rate) - (float)GetKeyPressedAmount(key_less, repeat_delay, repeat_rate);
11153 if (amount != 0.0f && IsKeyDown(key_less) && IsKeyDown(key_more)) // Cancel when opposite directions are held, regardless of repeat phase
11154 amount = 0.0f;
11155 return amount;
11156}
11157
11158static void ImGui::NavUpdate()
11159{
11160 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11161 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
11162
11163 io.WantSetMousePos = false;
11164 //if (g.NavScoringDebugCount > 0) IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavScoringDebugCount %d for '%s' layer %d (Init:%d, Move:%d)\n", g.NavScoringDebugCount, g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Name : "NULL", g.NavLayer, g.NavInitRequest || g.NavInitResultId != 0, g.NavMoveRequest);
11165
11166 // Set input source based on which keys are last pressed (as some features differs when used with Gamepad vs Keyboard)
11167 // FIXME-NAV: Now that keys are separated maybe we can get rid of NavInputSource?
11168 const bool nav_gamepad_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
11169 const ImGuiKey nav_gamepad_keys_to_change_source[] = { ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceRight, ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceLeft, ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceUp, ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceDown, ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadRight, ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadLeft, ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadUp, ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadDown };
11170 if (nav_gamepad_active)
11171 for (ImGuiKey key : nav_gamepad_keys_to_change_source)
11172 if (IsKeyDown(key))
11173 g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad;
11174 const bool nav_keyboard_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
11175 const ImGuiKey nav_keyboard_keys_to_change_source[] = { ImGuiKey_Space, ImGuiKey_Enter, ImGuiKey_Escape, ImGuiKey_RightArrow, ImGuiKey_LeftArrow, ImGuiKey_UpArrow, ImGuiKey_DownArrow };
11176 if (nav_keyboard_active)
11177 for (ImGuiKey key : nav_keyboard_keys_to_change_source)
11178 if (IsKeyDown(key))
11179 g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard;
11180
11181 // Process navigation init request (select first/default focus)
11182 if (g.NavInitResultId != 0)
11183 NavInitRequestApplyResult();
11184 g.NavInitRequest = false;
11185 g.NavInitRequestFromMove = false;
11186 g.NavInitResultId = 0;
11187 g.NavJustMovedToId = 0;
11188
11189 // Process navigation move request
11190 if (g.NavMoveSubmitted)
11191 NavMoveRequestApplyResult();
11192 g.NavTabbingCounter = 0;
11193 g.NavMoveSubmitted = g.NavMoveScoringItems = false;
11194
11195 // Schedule mouse position update (will be done at the bottom of this function, after 1) processing all move requests and 2) updating scrolling)
11196 bool set_mouse_pos = false;
11197 if (g.NavMousePosDirty && g.NavIdIsAlive)
11198 if (!g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && g.NavWindow)
11199 set_mouse_pos = true;
11200 g.NavMousePosDirty = false;
11201 IM_ASSERT(g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main || g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu);
11202
11203 // Store our return window (for returning from Menu Layer to Main Layer) and clear it as soon as we step back in our own Layer 0
11204 if (g.NavWindow)
11205 NavSaveLastChildNavWindowIntoParent(g.NavWindow);
11206 if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->NavLastChildNavWindow != NULL && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
11207 g.NavWindow->NavLastChildNavWindow = NULL;
11208
11209 // Update CTRL+TAB and Windowing features (hold Square to move/resize/etc.)
11210 NavUpdateWindowing();
11211
11212 // Set output flags for user application
11213 io.NavActive = (nav_keyboard_active || nav_gamepad_active) && g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs);
11214 io.NavVisible = (io.NavActive && g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight) || (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL);
11215
11216 // Process NavCancel input (to close a popup, get back to parent, clear focus)
11217 NavUpdateCancelRequest();
11218
11219 // Process manual activation request
11220 g.NavActivateId = g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavActivatePressedId = 0;
11221 g.NavActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_None;
11222 if (g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight && !g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
11223 {
11224 const bool activate_down = (nav_keyboard_active && IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_Space)) || (nav_gamepad_active && IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadActivate));
11225 const bool activate_pressed = activate_down && ((nav_keyboard_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space, false)) || (nav_gamepad_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadActivate, false)));
11226 const bool input_down = (nav_keyboard_active && IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_Enter)) || (nav_gamepad_active && IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadInput));
11227 const bool input_pressed = input_down && ((nav_keyboard_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Enter, false)) || (nav_gamepad_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadInput, false)));
11228 if (g.ActiveId == 0 && activate_pressed)
11229 {
11230 g.NavActivateId = g.NavId;
11231 g.NavActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferTweak;
11232 }
11233 if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && input_pressed)
11234 {
11235 g.NavActivateId = g.NavId;
11236 g.NavActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput;
11237 }
11238 if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && (activate_down || input_down))
11239 g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavId;
11240 if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && (activate_pressed || input_pressed))
11241 g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavId;
11242 }
11243 if (g.NavWindow && (g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
11244 g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
11245 if (g.NavActivateId != 0)
11246 IM_ASSERT(g.NavActivateDownId == g.NavActivateId);
11247
11248 // Process programmatic activation request
11249 // FIXME-NAV: Those should eventually be queued (unlike focus they don't cancel each others)
11250 if (g.NavNextActivateId != 0)
11251 {
11252 g.NavActivateId = g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavNextActivateId;
11253 g.NavActivateFlags = g.NavNextActivateFlags;
11254 }
11255 g.NavNextActivateId = 0;
11256
11257 // Process move requests
11258 NavUpdateCreateMoveRequest();
11259 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_None)
11260 NavUpdateCreateTabbingRequest();
11261 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
11262 g.NavIdIsAlive = false;
11263
11264 // Scrolling
11265 if (g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) && !g.NavWindowingTarget)
11266 {
11267 // *Fallback* manual-scroll with Nav directional keys when window has no navigable item
11268 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
11269 const float scroll_speed = IM_ROUND(window->CalcFontSize() * 100 * io.DeltaTime); // We need round the scrolling speed because sub-pixel scroll isn't reliably supported.
11270 const ImGuiDir move_dir = g.NavMoveDir;
11271 if (window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask == 0x00 && window->DC.NavHasScroll && move_dir != ImGuiDir_None)
11272 {
11273 if (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Right)
11274 SetScrollX(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.x + ((move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) * scroll_speed));
11275 if (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Up || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Down)
11276 SetScrollY(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.y + ((move_dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) * scroll_speed));
11277 }
11278
11279 // *Normal* Manual scroll with LStick
11280 // Next movement request will clamp the NavId reference rectangle to the visible area, so navigation will resume within those bounds.
11281 if (nav_gamepad_active)
11282 {
11283 const ImVec2 scroll_dir = GetKeyMagnitude2d(ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickLeft, ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickRight, ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickUp, ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickDown);
11284 const float tweak_factor = IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakSlow) ? 1.0f / 10.0f : IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakFast) ? 10.0f : 1.0f;
11285 if (scroll_dir.x != 0.0f && window->ScrollbarX)
11286 SetScrollX(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.x + scroll_dir.x * scroll_speed * tweak_factor));
11287 if (scroll_dir.y != 0.0f)
11288 SetScrollY(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.y + scroll_dir.y * scroll_speed * tweak_factor));
11289 }
11290 }
11291
11292 // Always prioritize mouse highlight if navigation is disabled
11293 if (!nav_keyboard_active && !nav_gamepad_active)
11294 {
11295 g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
11296 g.NavDisableMouseHover = set_mouse_pos = false;
11297 }
11298
11299 // Update mouse position if requested
11300 // (This will take into account the possibility that a Scroll was queued in the window to offset our absolute mouse position before scroll has been applied)
11301 if (set_mouse_pos && (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos) && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos))
11302 {
11303 io.MousePos = io.MousePosPrev = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
11304 io.WantSetMousePos = true;
11305 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO("SetMousePos: (%.1f,%.1f)\n", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);
11306 }
11307
11308 // [DEBUG]
11309 g.NavScoringDebugCount = 0;
11310#if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_RECTS
11311 if (g.NavWindow)
11312 {
11313 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(g.NavWindow);
11314 if (1) { for (int layer = 0; layer < 2; layer++) { ImRect r = WindowRectRelToAbs(g.NavWindow, g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[layer]); draw_list->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,255)); } } // [DEBUG]
11315 if (1) { ImU32 col = (!g.NavWindow->Hidden) ? IM_COL32(255,0,255,255) : IM_COL32(255,0,0,255); ImVec2 p = NavCalcPreferredRefPos(); char buf[32]; ImFormatString(buf, 32, "%d", g.NavLayer); draw_list->AddCircleFilled(p, 3.0f, col); draw_list->AddText(NULL, 13.0f, p + ImVec2(8,-4), col, buf); }
11316 }
11317#endif
11318}
11319
11320void ImGui::NavInitRequestApplyResult()
11321{
11322 // In very rare cases g.NavWindow may be null (e.g. clearing focus after requesting an init request, which does happen when releasing Alt while clicking on void)
11323 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11324 if (!g.NavWindow)
11325 return;
11326
11327 // Apply result from previous navigation init request (will typically select the first item, unless SetItemDefaultFocus() has been called)
11328 // FIXME-NAV: On _NavFlattened windows, g.NavWindow will only be updated during subsequent frame. Not a problem currently.
11329 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: ApplyResult: NavID 0x%08X in Layer %d Window \"%s\"\n", g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, g.NavWindow->Name);
11330 SetNavID(g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, 0, g.NavInitResultRectRel);
11331 g.NavIdIsAlive = true; // Mark as alive from previous frame as we got a result
11332 if (g.NavInitRequestFromMove)
11333 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11334}
11335
11336void ImGui::NavUpdateCreateMoveRequest()
11337{
11338 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11339 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
11340 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
11341 const bool nav_gamepad_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
11342 const bool nav_keyboard_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
11343
11344 if (g.NavMoveForwardToNextFrame && window != NULL)
11345 {
11346 // Forwarding previous request (which has been modified, e.g. wrap around menus rewrite the requests with a starting rectangle at the other side of the window)
11347 // (preserve most state, which were already set by the NavMoveRequestForward() function)
11348 IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None && g.NavMoveClipDir != ImGuiDir_None);
11349 IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Forwarded);
11350 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequestForward %d\n", g.NavMoveDir);
11351 }
11352 else
11353 {
11354 // Initiate directional inputs request
11355 g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_None;
11356 g.NavMoveFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_None;
11357 g.NavMoveScrollFlags = ImGuiScrollFlags_None;
11358 if (window && !g.NavWindowingTarget && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
11359 {
11360 const ImGuiInputFlags repeat_mode = ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat | (ImGuiInputFlags)ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateNavMove;
11361 if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Left) && ((nav_gamepad_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadLeft, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, repeat_mode)) || (nav_keyboard_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, repeat_mode)))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Left; }
11362 if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Right) && ((nav_gamepad_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadRight, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, repeat_mode)) || (nav_keyboard_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_RightArrow, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, repeat_mode)))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Right; }
11363 if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Up) && ((nav_gamepad_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadUp, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, repeat_mode)) || (nav_keyboard_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_UpArrow, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, repeat_mode)))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up; }
11364 if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Down) && ((nav_gamepad_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadDown, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, repeat_mode)) || (nav_keyboard_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_DownArrow, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, repeat_mode)))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down; }
11365 }
11366 g.NavMoveClipDir = g.NavMoveDir;
11367 g.NavScoringNoClipRect = ImRect(+FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
11368 }
11369
11370 // Update PageUp/PageDown/Home/End scroll
11371 // FIXME-NAV: Consider enabling those keys even without the master ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard flag?
11372 float scoring_rect_offset_y = 0.0f;
11373 if (window && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_None && nav_keyboard_active)
11374 scoring_rect_offset_y = NavUpdatePageUpPageDown();
11375 if (scoring_rect_offset_y != 0.0f)
11376 {
11377 g.NavScoringNoClipRect = window->InnerRect;
11378 g.NavScoringNoClipRect.TranslateY(scoring_rect_offset_y);
11379 }
11380
11381 // [DEBUG] Always send a request
11382#if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
11383 if (io.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_C))
11384 g.NavMoveDirForDebug = (ImGuiDir)((g.NavMoveDirForDebug + 1) & 3);
11385 if (io.KeyCtrl && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_None)
11386 {
11387 g.NavMoveDir = g.NavMoveDirForDebug;
11388 g.NavMoveFlags |= ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DebugNoResult;
11389 }
11390#endif
11391
11392 // Submit
11393 g.NavMoveForwardToNextFrame = false;
11394 if (g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None)
11395 NavMoveRequestSubmit(g.NavMoveDir, g.NavMoveClipDir, g.NavMoveFlags, g.NavMoveScrollFlags);
11396
11397 // Moving with no reference triggers an init request (will be used as a fallback if the direction fails to find a match)
11398 if (g.NavMoveSubmitted && g.NavId == 0)
11399 {
11400 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: from move, window \"%s\", layer=%d\n", window ? window->Name : "<NULL>", g.NavLayer);
11401 g.NavInitRequest = g.NavInitRequestFromMove = true;
11402 g.NavInitResultId = 0;
11403 g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
11404 }
11405
11406 // When using gamepad, we project the reference nav bounding box into window visible area.
11407 // This is to allow resuming navigation inside the visible area after doing a large amount of scrolling,
11408 // since with gamepad all movements are relative (can't focus a visible object like we can with the mouse).
11409 if (g.NavMoveSubmitted && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main && window != NULL)// && (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Forwarded))
11410 {
11411 bool clamp_x = (g.NavMoveFlags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)) == 0;
11412 bool clamp_y = (g.NavMoveFlags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)) == 0;
11413 ImRect inner_rect_rel = WindowRectAbsToRel(window, ImRect(window->InnerRect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), window->InnerRect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1)));
11414
11415 // Take account of changing scroll to handle triggering a new move request on a scrolling frame. (#6171)
11416 // Otherwise 'inner_rect_rel' would be off on the move result frame.
11417 inner_rect_rel.Translate(CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window) - window->Scroll);
11418
11419 if ((clamp_x || clamp_y) && !inner_rect_rel.Contains(window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer]))
11420 {
11421 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequest: clamp NavRectRel for gamepad move\n");
11422 float pad_x = ImMin(inner_rect_rel.GetWidth(), window->CalcFontSize() * 0.5f);
11423 float pad_y = ImMin(inner_rect_rel.GetHeight(), window->CalcFontSize() * 0.5f); // Terrible approximation for the intent of starting navigation from first fully visible item
11424 inner_rect_rel.Min.x = clamp_x ? (inner_rect_rel.Min.x + pad_x) : -FLT_MAX;
11425 inner_rect_rel.Max.x = clamp_x ? (inner_rect_rel.Max.x - pad_x) : +FLT_MAX;
11426 inner_rect_rel.Min.y = clamp_y ? (inner_rect_rel.Min.y + pad_y) : -FLT_MAX;
11427 inner_rect_rel.Max.y = clamp_y ? (inner_rect_rel.Max.y - pad_y) : +FLT_MAX;
11428 window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer].ClipWithFull(inner_rect_rel);
11429 g.NavId = 0;
11430 }
11431 }
11432
11433 // For scoring we use a single segment on the left side our current item bounding box (not touching the edge to avoid box overlap with zero-spaced items)
11434 ImRect scoring_rect;
11435 if (window != NULL)
11436 {
11437 ImRect nav_rect_rel = !window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer].IsInverted() ? window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] : ImRect(0, 0, 0, 0);
11438 scoring_rect = WindowRectRelToAbs(window, nav_rect_rel);
11439 scoring_rect.TranslateY(scoring_rect_offset_y);
11440 scoring_rect.Min.x = ImMin(scoring_rect.Min.x + 1.0f, scoring_rect.Max.x);
11441 scoring_rect.Max.x = scoring_rect.Min.x;
11442 IM_ASSERT(!scoring_rect.IsInverted()); // Ensure if we have a finite, non-inverted bounding box here will allow us to remove extraneous ImFabs() calls in NavScoreItem().
11443 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(scoring_rect.Min, scoring_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,255)); // [DEBUG]
11444 //if (!g.NavScoringNoClipRect.IsInverted()) { GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(g.NavScoringNoClipRect.Min, g.NavScoringNoClipRect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 200, 0, 255)); } // [DEBUG]
11445 }
11446 g.NavScoringRect = scoring_rect;
11447 g.NavScoringNoClipRect.Add(scoring_rect);
11448}
11449
11450void ImGui::NavUpdateCreateTabbingRequest()
11451{
11452 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11453 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
11454 IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_None);
11455 if (window == NULL || g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
11456 return;
11457
11458 const bool tab_pressed = IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Tab, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat) && !g.IO.KeyCtrl && !g.IO.KeyAlt;
11459 if (!tab_pressed)
11460 return;
11461
11462 // Initiate tabbing request
11463 // (this is ALWAYS ENABLED, regardless of ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard flag!)
11464 // Initially this was designed to use counters and modulo arithmetic, but that could not work with unsubmitted items (list clipper). Instead we use a strategy close to other move requests.
11465 // See NavProcessItemForTabbingRequest() for a description of the various forward/backward tabbing cases with and without wrapping.
11466 const bool nav_keyboard_active = (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
11467 if (nav_keyboard_active)
11468 g.NavTabbingDir = g.IO.KeyShift ? -1 : (g.NavDisableHighlight == true && g.ActiveId == 0) ? 0 : +1;
11469 else
11470 g.NavTabbingDir = g.IO.KeyShift ? -1 : (g.ActiveId == 0) ? 0 : +1;
11471 ImGuiScrollFlags scroll_flags = window->Appearing ? ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeX | ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterY : ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeX | ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeY;
11472 ImGuiDir clip_dir = (g.NavTabbingDir < 0) ? ImGuiDir_Up : ImGuiDir_Down;
11473 NavMoveRequestSubmit(ImGuiDir_None, clip_dir, ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing, scroll_flags); // FIXME-NAV: Once we refactor tabbing, add LegacyApi flag to not activate non-inputable.
11474 g.NavTabbingCounter = -1;
11475}
11476
11477// Apply result from previous frame navigation directional move request. Always called from NavUpdate()
11478void ImGui::NavMoveRequestApplyResult()
11479{
11480 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11481#if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
11482 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DebugNoResult) // [DEBUG] Scoring all items in NavWindow at all times
11483 return;
11484#endif
11485
11486 // Select which result to use
11487 ImGuiNavItemData* result = (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID != 0) ? &g.NavMoveResultLocal : (g.NavMoveResultOther.ID != 0) ? &g.NavMoveResultOther : NULL;
11488
11489 // Tabbing forward wrap
11490 if ((g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing) && result == NULL)
11491 if ((g.NavTabbingCounter == 1 || g.NavTabbingDir == 0) && g.NavTabbingResultFirst.ID)
11492 result = &g.NavTabbingResultFirst;
11493
11494 // In a situation when there are no results but NavId != 0, re-enable the Navigation highlight (because g.NavId is not considered as a possible result)
11495 if (result == NULL)
11496 {
11497 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing)
11498 g.NavMoveFlags |= ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DontSetNavHighlight;
11499 if (g.NavId != 0 && (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DontSetNavHighlight) == 0)
11500 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11501 return;
11502 }
11503
11504 // PageUp/PageDown behavior first jumps to the bottom/top mostly visible item, _otherwise_ use the result from the previous/next page.
11505 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet)
11506 if (g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible.ID != 0 && g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible.ID != g.NavId)
11507 result = &g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible;
11508
11509 // Maybe entering a flattened child from the outside? In this case solve the tie using the regular scoring rules.
11510 if (result != &g.NavMoveResultOther && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID != 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.Window->ParentWindow == g.NavWindow)
11511 if ((g.NavMoveResultOther.DistBox < result->DistBox) || (g.NavMoveResultOther.DistBox == result->DistBox && g.NavMoveResultOther.DistCenter < result->DistCenter))
11512 result = &g.NavMoveResultOther;
11513 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow && result->Window);
11514
11515 // Scroll to keep newly navigated item fully into view.
11516 if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
11517 {
11518 ImRect rect_abs = WindowRectRelToAbs(result->Window, result->RectRel);
11519 ScrollToRectEx(result->Window, rect_abs, g.NavMoveScrollFlags);
11520
11521 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdgeY)
11522 {
11523 // FIXME: Should remove this? Or make more precise: use ScrollToRectEx() with edge?
11524 float scroll_target = (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? result->Window->ScrollMax.y : 0.0f;
11525 SetScrollY(result->Window, scroll_target);
11526 }
11527 }
11528
11529 if (g.NavWindow != result->Window)
11530 {
11531 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FOCUS("[focus] NavMoveRequest: SetNavWindow(\"%s\")\n", result->Window->Name);
11532 g.NavWindow = result->Window;
11533 }
11534 if (g.ActiveId != result->ID)
11535 ClearActiveID();
11536 if (g.NavId != result->ID)
11537 {
11538 // Don't set NavJustMovedToId if just landed on the same spot (which may happen with ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId)
11539 g.NavJustMovedToId = result->ID;
11540 g.NavJustMovedToFocusScopeId = result->FocusScopeId;
11541 g.NavJustMovedToKeyMods = g.NavMoveKeyMods;
11542 }
11543
11544 // Focus
11545 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequest: result NavID 0x%08X in Layer %d Window \"%s\"\n", result->ID, g.NavLayer, g.NavWindow->Name);
11546 SetNavID(result->ID, g.NavLayer, result->FocusScopeId, result->RectRel);
11547
11548 // Tabbing: Activates Inputable or Focus non-Inputable
11549 if ((g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing) && (result->InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable))
11550 {
11551 g.NavNextActivateId = result->ID;
11552 g.NavNextActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput | ImGuiActivateFlags_TryToPreserveState;
11553 g.NavMoveFlags |= ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DontSetNavHighlight;
11554 }
11555
11556 // Activate
11557 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Activate)
11558 {
11559 g.NavNextActivateId = result->ID;
11560 g.NavNextActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_None;
11561 }
11562
11563 // Enable nav highlight
11564 if ((g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DontSetNavHighlight) == 0)
11565 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11566}
11567
11568// Process NavCancel input (to close a popup, get back to parent, clear focus)
11569// FIXME: In order to support e.g. Escape to clear a selection we'll need:
11570// - either to store the equivalent of ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask for a FocusScope and test for it.
11571// - either to move most/all of those tests to the epilogue/end functions of the scope they are dealing with (e.g. exit child window in EndChild()) or in EndFrame(), to allow an earlier intercept
11572static void ImGui::NavUpdateCancelRequest()
11573{
11574 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11575 const bool nav_gamepad_active = (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
11576 const bool nav_keyboard_active = (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
11577 if (!(nav_keyboard_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Escape, ImGuiKeyOwner_None)) && !(nav_gamepad_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadCancel, ImGuiKeyOwner_None)))
11578 return;
11579
11580 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavUpdateCancelRequest()\n");
11581 if (g.ActiveId != 0)
11582 {
11583 ClearActiveID();
11584 }
11585 else if (g.NavLayer != ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
11586 {
11587 // Leave the "menu" layer
11588 NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer_Main);
11589 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11590 }
11591 else if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow != g.NavWindow->RootWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && g.NavWindow->ParentWindow)
11592 {
11593 // Exit child window
11594 ImGuiWindow* child_window = g.NavWindow;
11595 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.NavWindow->ParentWindow;
11596 IM_ASSERT(child_window->ChildId != 0);
11597 ImRect child_rect = child_window->Rect();
11598 FocusWindow(parent_window);
11599 SetNavID(child_window->ChildId, ImGuiNavLayer_Main, 0, WindowRectAbsToRel(parent_window, child_rect));
11600 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11601 }
11602 else if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0 && g.OpenPopupStack.back().Window != NULL && !(g.OpenPopupStack.back().Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal))
11603 {
11604 // Close open popup/menu
11605 ClosePopupToLevel(g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1, true);
11606 }
11607 else
11608 {
11609 // Clear NavLastId for popups but keep it for regular child window so we can leave one and come back where we were
11610 if (g.NavWindow && ((g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) || !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)))
11611 g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[0] = 0;
11612 g.NavId = 0;
11613 }
11614}
11615
11616// Handle PageUp/PageDown/Home/End keys
11617// Called from NavUpdateCreateMoveRequest() which will use our output to create a move request
11618// FIXME-NAV: This doesn't work properly with NavFlattened siblings as we use NavWindow rectangle for reference
11619// FIXME-NAV: how to get Home/End to aim at the beginning/end of a 2D grid?
11620static float ImGui::NavUpdatePageUpPageDown()
11621{
11622 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11623 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
11624 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) || g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL)
11625 return 0.0f;
11626
11627 const bool page_up_held = IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_PageUp, ImGuiKeyOwner_None);
11628 const bool page_down_held = IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_PageDown, ImGuiKeyOwner_None);
11629 const bool home_pressed = IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Home, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat);
11630 const bool end_pressed = IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_End, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat);
11631 if (page_up_held == page_down_held && home_pressed == end_pressed) // Proceed if either (not both) are pressed, otherwise early out
11632 return 0.0f;
11633
11634 if (g.NavLayer != ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
11635 NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer_Main);
11636
11637 if (window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask == 0x00 && window->DC.NavHasScroll)
11638 {
11639 // Fallback manual-scroll when window has no navigable item
11640 if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageUp, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat))
11641 SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y - window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
11642 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageDown, ImGuiKeyOwner_None, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat))
11643 SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y + window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
11644 else if (home_pressed)
11645 SetScrollY(window, 0.0f);
11646 else if (end_pressed)
11647 SetScrollY(window, window->ScrollMax.y);
11648 }
11649 else
11650 {
11651 ImRect& nav_rect_rel = window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer];
11652 const float page_offset_y = ImMax(0.0f, window->InnerRect.GetHeight() - window->CalcFontSize() * 1.0f + nav_rect_rel.GetHeight());
11653 float nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = 0.0f;
11654 if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageUp, true))
11655 {
11656 nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = -page_offset_y;
11657 g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down; // Because our scoring rect is offset up, we request the down direction (so we can always land on the last item)
11658 g.NavMoveClipDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
11659 g.NavMoveFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet;
11660 }
11661 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageDown, true))
11662 {
11663 nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = +page_offset_y;
11664 g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up; // Because our scoring rect is offset down, we request the up direction (so we can always land on the last item)
11665 g.NavMoveClipDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
11666 g.NavMoveFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet;
11667 }
11668 else if (home_pressed)
11669 {
11670 // FIXME-NAV: handling of Home/End is assuming that the top/bottom most item will be visible with Scroll.y == 0/ScrollMax.y
11671 // Scrolling will be handled via the ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdgeY flag, we don't scroll immediately to avoid scrolling happening before nav result.
11672 // Preserve current horizontal position if we have any.
11673 nav_rect_rel.Min.y = nav_rect_rel.Max.y = 0.0f;
11674 if (nav_rect_rel.IsInverted())
11675 nav_rect_rel.Min.x = nav_rect_rel.Max.x = 0.0f;
11676 g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
11677 g.NavMoveFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdgeY;
11678 // FIXME-NAV: MoveClipDir left to _None, intentional?
11679 }
11680 else if (end_pressed)
11681 {
11682 nav_rect_rel.Min.y = nav_rect_rel.Max.y = window->ContentSize.y;
11683 if (nav_rect_rel.IsInverted())
11684 nav_rect_rel.Min.x = nav_rect_rel.Max.x = 0.0f;
11685 g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
11686 g.NavMoveFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdgeY;
11687 // FIXME-NAV: MoveClipDir left to _None, intentional?
11688 }
11689 return nav_scoring_rect_offset_y;
11690 }
11691 return 0.0f;
11692}
11693
11694static void ImGui::NavEndFrame()
11695{
11696 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11697
11698 // Show CTRL+TAB list window
11699 if (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL)
11700 NavUpdateWindowingOverlay();
11701
11702 // Perform wrap-around in menus
11703 // FIXME-NAV: Wrap may need to apply a weight bias on the other axis. e.g. 4x4 grid with 2 last items missing on last item won't handle LoopY/WrapY correctly.
11704 // FIXME-NAV: Wrap (not Loop) support could be handled by the scoring function and then WrapX would function without an extra frame.
11705 const ImGuiNavMoveFlags wanted_flags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY;
11706 if (g.NavWindow && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() && (g.NavMoveFlags & wanted_flags) && (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Forwarded) == 0)
11707 NavUpdateCreateWrappingRequest();
11708}
11709
11710static void ImGui::NavUpdateCreateWrappingRequest()
11711{
11712 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11713 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
11714
11715 bool do_forward = false;
11716 ImRect bb_rel = window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer];
11717 ImGuiDir clip_dir = g.NavMoveDir;
11718 const ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags = g.NavMoveFlags;
11719 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX)))
11720 {
11721 bb_rel.Min.x = bb_rel.Max.x = window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x;
11722 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)
11723 {
11724 bb_rel.TranslateY(-bb_rel.GetHeight()); // Previous row
11725 clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Up;
11726 }
11727 do_forward = true;
11728 }
11729 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX)))
11730 {
11731 bb_rel.Min.x = bb_rel.Max.x = -window->WindowPadding.x;
11732 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)
11733 {
11734 bb_rel.TranslateY(+bb_rel.GetHeight()); // Next row
11735 clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Down;
11736 }
11737 do_forward = true;
11738 }
11739 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY)))
11740 {
11741 bb_rel.Min.y = bb_rel.Max.y = window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y;
11742 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)
11743 {
11744 bb_rel.TranslateX(-bb_rel.GetWidth()); // Previous column
11745 clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Left;
11746 }
11747 do_forward = true;
11748 }
11749 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY)))
11750 {
11751 bb_rel.Min.y = bb_rel.Max.y = -window->WindowPadding.y;
11752 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)
11753 {
11754 bb_rel.TranslateX(+bb_rel.GetWidth()); // Next column
11755 clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Right;
11756 }
11757 do_forward = true;
11758 }
11759 if (!do_forward)
11760 return;
11761 window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] = bb_rel;
11762 NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, move_flags, g.NavMoveScrollFlags);
11763}
11764
11765static int ImGui::FindWindowFocusIndex(ImGuiWindow* window)
11766{
11767 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11768 IM_UNUSED(g);
11769 int order = window->FocusOrder;
11770 IM_ASSERT(window->RootWindow == window); // No child window (not testing _ChildWindow because of docking)
11771 IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder[order] == window);
11772 return order;
11773}
11774
11775static ImGuiWindow* FindWindowNavFocusable(int i_start, int i_stop, int dir) // FIXME-OPT O(N)
11776{
11777 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11778 for (int i = i_start; i >= 0 && i < g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size && i != i_stop; i += dir)
11779 if (ImGui::IsWindowNavFocusable(g.WindowsFocusOrder[i]))
11780 return g.WindowsFocusOrder[i];
11781 return NULL;
11782}
11783
11784static void NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(int focus_change_dir)
11785{
11786 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11787 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindowingTarget);
11788 if (g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
11789 return;
11790
11791 const int i_current = ImGui::FindWindowFocusIndex(g.NavWindowingTarget);
11792 ImGuiWindow* window_target = FindWindowNavFocusable(i_current + focus_change_dir, -INT_MAX, focus_change_dir);
11793 if (!window_target)
11794 window_target = FindWindowNavFocusable((focus_change_dir < 0) ? (g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1) : 0, i_current, focus_change_dir);
11795 if (window_target) // Don't reset windowing target if there's a single window in the list
11796 {
11797 g.NavWindowingTarget = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = window_target;
11798 g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaPos = g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaSize = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
11799 }
11800 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
11801}
11802
11803// Windowing management mode
11804// Keyboard: CTRL+Tab (change focus/move/resize), Alt (toggle menu layer)
11805// Gamepad: Hold Menu/Square (change focus/move/resize), Tap Menu/Square (toggle menu layer)
11806static void ImGui::NavUpdateWindowing()
11807{
11808 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11809 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
11810
11811 ImGuiWindow* apply_focus_window = NULL;
11812 bool apply_toggle_layer = false;
11813
11814 ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
11815 bool allow_windowing = (modal_window == NULL);
11816 if (!allow_windowing)
11817 g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
11818
11819 // Fade out
11820 if (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim && g.NavWindowingTarget == NULL)
11821 {
11822 g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha - io.DeltaTime * 10.0f, 0.0f);
11823 if (g.DimBgRatio <= 0.0f && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha <= 0.0f)
11824 g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = NULL;
11825 }
11826
11827 // Start CTRL+Tab or Square+L/R window selection
11828 const ImGuiID owner_id = ImHashStr("###NavUpdateWindowing");
11829 const bool nav_gamepad_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
11830 const bool nav_keyboard_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
11831 const bool keyboard_next_window = allow_windowing && g.ConfigNavWindowingKeyNext && Shortcut(g.ConfigNavWindowingKeyNext, owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways);
11832 const bool keyboard_prev_window = allow_windowing && g.ConfigNavWindowingKeyPrev && Shortcut(g.ConfigNavWindowingKeyPrev, owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways);
11833 const bool start_windowing_with_gamepad = allow_windowing && nav_gamepad_active && !g.NavWindowingTarget && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadMenu, 0, ImGuiInputFlags_None);
11834 const bool start_windowing_with_keyboard = allow_windowing && !g.NavWindowingTarget && (keyboard_next_window || keyboard_prev_window); // Note: enabled even without NavEnableKeyboard!
11835 if (start_windowing_with_gamepad || start_windowing_with_keyboard)
11836 if (ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow : FindWindowNavFocusable(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1, -INT_MAX, -1))
11837 {
11838 g.NavWindowingTarget = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = window->RootWindow;
11839 g.NavWindowingTimer = g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = 0.0f;
11840 g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaPos = g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaSize = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
11841 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = start_windowing_with_gamepad ? true : false; // Gamepad starts toggling layer
11842 g.NavInputSource = start_windowing_with_keyboard ? ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard : ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad;
11843
11844 // Register ownership of our mods. Using ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobalHigh in the Shortcut() calls instead would probably be correct but may have more side-effects.
11845 if (keyboard_next_window || keyboard_prev_window)
11846 SetKeyOwnersForKeyChord((g.ConfigNavWindowingKeyNext | g.ConfigNavWindowingKeyPrev) & ImGuiMod_Mask_, owner_id);
11847 }
11848
11849 // Gamepad update
11850 g.NavWindowingTimer += io.DeltaTime;
11851 if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
11852 {
11853 // Highlight only appears after a brief time holding the button, so that a fast tap on PadMenu (to toggle NavLayer) doesn't add visual noise
11854 g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha, ImSaturate((g.NavWindowingTimer - NAV_WINDOWING_HIGHLIGHT_DELAY) / 0.05f));
11855
11856 // Select window to focus
11857 const int focus_change_dir = (int)IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_GamepadL1) - (int)IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_GamepadR1);
11858 if (focus_change_dir != 0)
11859 {
11860 NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(focus_change_dir);
11861 g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = 1.0f;
11862 }
11863
11864 // Single press toggles NavLayer, long press with L/R apply actual focus on release (until then the window was merely rendered top-most)
11865 if (!IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadMenu))
11866 {
11867 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer &= (g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha < 1.0f); // Once button was held long enough we don't consider it a tap-to-toggle-layer press anymore.
11868 if (g.NavWindowingToggleLayer && g.NavWindow)
11869 apply_toggle_layer = true;
11870 else if (!g.NavWindowingToggleLayer)
11871 apply_focus_window = g.NavWindowingTarget;
11872 g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
11873 }
11874 }
11875
11876 // Keyboard: Focus
11877 if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard)
11878 {
11879 // Visuals only appears after a brief time after pressing TAB the first time, so that a fast CTRL+TAB doesn't add visual noise
11880 ImGuiKeyChord shared_mods = ((g.ConfigNavWindowingKeyNext ? g.ConfigNavWindowingKeyNext : ImGuiMod_Mask_) & (g.ConfigNavWindowingKeyPrev ? g.ConfigNavWindowingKeyPrev : ImGuiMod_Mask_)) & ImGuiMod_Mask_;
11881 IM_ASSERT(shared_mods != 0); // Next/Prev shortcut currently needs a shared modifier to "hold", otherwise Prev actions would keep cycling between two windows.
11882 g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha, ImSaturate((g.NavWindowingTimer - NAV_WINDOWING_HIGHLIGHT_DELAY) / 0.05f)); // 1.0f
11883 if (keyboard_next_window || keyboard_prev_window)
11884 NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(keyboard_next_window ? -1 : +1);
11885 else if ((io.KeyMods & shared_mods) != shared_mods)
11886 apply_focus_window = g.NavWindowingTarget;
11887 }
11888
11889 // Keyboard: Press and Release ALT to toggle menu layer
11890 // - Testing that only Alt is tested prevents Alt+Shift or AltGR from toggling menu layer.
11891 // - AltGR is normally Alt+Ctrl but we can't reliably detect it (not all backends/systems/layout emit it as Alt+Ctrl). But even on keyboards without AltGR we don't want Alt+Ctrl to open menu anyway.
11892 if (nav_keyboard_active && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiMod_Alt, ImGuiKeyOwner_None))
11893 {
11894 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = true;
11895 g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard;
11896 }
11897 if (g.NavWindowingToggleLayer && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard)
11898 {
11899 // We cancel toggling nav layer when any text has been typed (generally while holding Alt). (See #370)
11900 // We cancel toggling nav layer when other modifiers are pressed. (See #4439)
11901 // We cancel toggling nav layer if an owner has claimed the key.
11902 if (io.InputQueueCharacters.Size > 0 || io.KeyCtrl || io.KeyShift || io.KeySuper || TestKeyOwner(ImGuiMod_Alt, ImGuiKeyOwner_None) == false)
11903 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
11904
11905 // Apply layer toggle on release
11906 // Important: as before version <18314 we lacked an explicit IO event for focus gain/loss, we also compare mouse validity to detect old backends clearing mouse pos on focus loss.
11907 if (IsKeyReleased(ImGuiMod_Alt) && g.NavWindowingToggleLayer)
11908 if (g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap)
11909 if (IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos) == IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePosPrev))
11910 apply_toggle_layer = true;
11911 if (!IsKeyDown(ImGuiMod_Alt))
11912 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
11913 }
11914
11915 // Move window
11916 if (g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
11917 {
11918 ImVec2 nav_move_dir;
11919 if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard && !io.KeyShift)
11920 nav_move_dir = GetKeyMagnitude2d(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow, ImGuiKey_RightArrow, ImGuiKey_UpArrow, ImGuiKey_DownArrow);
11921 if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
11922 nav_move_dir = GetKeyMagnitude2d(ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickLeft, ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickRight, ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickUp, ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickDown);
11923 if (nav_move_dir.x != 0.0f || nav_move_dir.y != 0.0f)
11924 {
11925 const float NAV_MOVE_SPEED = 800.0f;
11926 const float move_step = NAV_MOVE_SPEED * io.DeltaTime * ImMin(io.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, io.DisplayFramebufferScale.y);
11927 g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaPos += nav_move_dir * move_step;
11928 g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
11929 ImVec2 accum_floored = ImFloor(g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaPos);
11930 if (accum_floored.x != 0.0f || accum_floored.y != 0.0f)
11931 {
11932 ImGuiWindow* moving_window = g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow;
11933 SetWindowPos(moving_window, moving_window->Pos + accum_floored, ImGuiCond_Always);
11934 g.NavWindowingAccumDeltaPos -= accum_floored;
11935 }
11936 }
11937 }
11938
11939 // Apply final focus
11940 if (apply_focus_window && (g.NavWindow == NULL || apply_focus_window != g.NavWindow->RootWindow))
11941 {
11942 ClearActiveID();
11943 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11944 apply_focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(apply_focus_window);
11945 ClosePopupsOverWindow(apply_focus_window, false);
11946 FocusWindow(apply_focus_window);
11947 if (apply_focus_window->NavLastIds[0] == 0)
11948 NavInitWindow(apply_focus_window, false);
11949
11950 // If the window has ONLY a menu layer (no main layer), select it directly
11951 // Use NavLayersActiveMaskNext since windows didn't have a chance to be Begin()-ed on this frame,
11952 // so CTRL+Tab where the keys are only held for 1 frame will be able to use correct layers mask since
11953 // the target window as already been previewed once.
11954 // FIXME-NAV: This should be done in NavInit.. or in FocusWindow... However in both of those cases,
11955 // we won't have a guarantee that windows has been visible before and therefore NavLayersActiveMask*
11956 // won't be valid.
11957 if (apply_focus_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext == (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu))
11958 g.NavLayer = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
11959 }
11960 if (apply_focus_window)
11961 g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
11962
11963 // Apply menu/layer toggle
11964 if (apply_toggle_layer && g.NavWindow)
11965 {
11966 ClearActiveID();
11967
11968 // Move to parent menu if necessary
11969 ImGuiWindow* new_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
11970 while (new_nav_window->ParentWindow
11971 && (new_nav_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask & (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)) == 0
11972 && (new_nav_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) != 0
11973 && (new_nav_window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)) == 0)
11974 new_nav_window = new_nav_window->ParentWindow;
11975 if (new_nav_window != g.NavWindow)
11976 {
11977 ImGuiWindow* old_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
11978 FocusWindow(new_nav_window);
11979 new_nav_window->NavLastChildNavWindow = old_nav_window;
11980 }
11981
11982 // Toggle layer
11983 const ImGuiNavLayer new_nav_layer = (g.NavWindow->DC.NavLayersActiveMask & (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)) ? (ImGuiNavLayer)((int)g.NavLayer ^ 1) : ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
11984 if (new_nav_layer != g.NavLayer)
11985 {
11986 // Reinitialize navigation when entering menu bar with the Alt key (FIXME: could be a properly of the layer?)
11987 if (new_nav_layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)
11988 g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[new_nav_layer] = 0;
11989 NavRestoreLayer(new_nav_layer);
11990 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11991 }
11992 }
11993}
11994
11995// Window has already passed the IsWindowNavFocusable()
11996static const char* GetFallbackWindowNameForWindowingList(ImGuiWindow* window)
11997{
11998 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
11999 return ImGui::LocalizeGetMsg(ImGuiLocKey_WindowingPopup);
12000 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) && strcmp(window->Name, "##MainMenuBar") == 0)
12001 return ImGui::LocalizeGetMsg(ImGuiLocKey_WindowingMainMenuBar);
12002 return ImGui::LocalizeGetMsg(ImGuiLocKey_WindowingUntitled);
12003}
12004
12005// Overlay displayed when using CTRL+TAB. Called by EndFrame().
12006void ImGui::NavUpdateWindowingOverlay()
12007{
12008 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12009 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL);
12010
12011 if (g.NavWindowingTimer < NAV_WINDOWING_LIST_APPEAR_DELAY)
12012 return;
12013
12014 if (g.NavWindowingListWindow == NULL)
12015 g.NavWindowingListWindow = FindWindowByName("###NavWindowingList");
12016 const ImGuiViewport* viewport = GetMainViewport();
12017 SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(viewport->Size.x * 0.20f, viewport->Size.y * 0.20f), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX));
12018 SetNextWindowPos(viewport->GetCenter(), ImGuiCond_Always, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
12019 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, g.Style.WindowPadding * 2.0f);
12020 Begin("###NavWindowingList", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
12021 for (int n = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
12022 {
12023 ImGuiWindow* window = g.WindowsFocusOrder[n];
12024 IM_ASSERT(window != NULL); // Fix static analyzers
12025 if (!IsWindowNavFocusable(window))
12026 continue;
12027 const char* label = window->Name;
12028 if (label == FindRenderedTextEnd(label))
12029 label = GetFallbackWindowNameForWindowingList(window);
12030 Selectable(label, g.NavWindowingTarget == window);
12031 }
12032 End();
12033 PopStyleVar();
12034}
12035
12036
12037//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12038// [SECTION] DRAG AND DROP
12039//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12040
12041bool ImGui::IsDragDropActive()
12042{
12043 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12044 return g.DragDropActive;
12045}
12046
12047void ImGui::ClearDragDrop()
12048{
12049 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12050 g.DragDropActive = false;
12051 g.DragDropPayload.Clear();
12052 g.DragDropAcceptFlags = ImGuiDragDropFlags_None;
12053 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev = 0;
12054 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = FLT_MAX;
12055 g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount = -1;
12056
12057 g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.clear();
12058 memset(&g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal, 0, sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal));
12059}
12060
12061// When this returns true you need to: a) call SetDragDropPayload() exactly once, b) you may render the payload visual/description, c) call EndDragDropSource()
12062// If the item has an identifier:
12063// - This assume/require the item to be activated (typically via ButtonBehavior).
12064// - Therefore if you want to use this with a mouse button other than left mouse button, it is up to the item itself to activate with another button.
12065// - We then pull and use the mouse button that was used to activate the item and use it to carry on the drag.
12066// If the item has no identifier:
12067// - Currently always assume left mouse button.
12068bool ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags flags)
12069{
12070 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12071 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
12072
12073 // FIXME-DRAGDROP: While in the common-most "drag from non-zero active id" case we can tell the mouse button,
12074 // in both SourceExtern and id==0 cases we may requires something else (explicit flags or some heuristic).
12075 ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = ImGuiMouseButton_Left;
12076
12077 bool source_drag_active = false;
12078 ImGuiID source_id = 0;
12079 ImGuiID source_parent_id = 0;
12080 if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern))
12081 {
12082 source_id = g.LastItemData.ID;
12083 if (source_id != 0)
12084 {
12085 // Common path: items with ID
12086 if (g.ActiveId != source_id)
12087 return false;
12088 if (g.ActiveIdMouseButton != -1)
12089 mouse_button = g.ActiveIdMouseButton;
12090 if (g.IO.MouseDown[mouse_button] == false || window->SkipItems)
12091 return false;
12092 g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = false;
12093 }
12094 else
12095 {
12096 // Uncommon path: items without ID
12097 if (g.IO.MouseDown[mouse_button] == false || window->SkipItems)
12098 return false;
12099 if ((g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect) == 0 && (g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdWindow != window))
12100 return false;
12101
12102 // If you want to use BeginDragDropSource() on an item with no unique identifier for interaction, such as Text() or Image(), you need to:
12103 // A) Read the explanation below, B) Use the ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID flag.
12104 if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID))
12105 {
12106 IM_ASSERT(0);
12107 return false;
12108 }
12109
12110 // Magic fallback to handle items with no assigned ID, e.g. Text(), Image()
12111 // We build a throwaway ID based on current ID stack + relative AABB of items in window.
12112 // THE IDENTIFIER WON'T SURVIVE ANY REPOSITIONING/RESIZINGG OF THE WIDGET, so if your widget moves your dragging operation will be canceled.
12113 // We don't need to maintain/call ClearActiveID() as releasing the button will early out this function and trigger !ActiveIdIsAlive.
12114 // Rely on keeping other window->LastItemXXX fields intact.
12115 source_id = g.LastItemData.ID = window->GetIDFromRectangle(g.LastItemData.Rect);
12116 KeepAliveID(source_id);
12117 bool is_hovered = ItemHoverable(g.LastItemData.Rect, source_id);
12118 if (is_hovered && g.IO.MouseClicked[mouse_button])
12119 {
12120 SetActiveID(source_id, window);
12121 FocusWindow(window);
12122 }
12123 if (g.ActiveId == source_id) // Allow the underlying widget to display/return hovered during the mouse release frame, else we would get a flicker.
12124 g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = is_hovered;
12125 }
12126 if (g.ActiveId != source_id)
12127 return false;
12128 source_parent_id = window->IDStack.back();
12129 source_drag_active = IsMouseDragging(mouse_button);
12130
12131 // Disable navigation and key inputs while dragging + cancel existing request if any
12132 SetActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys();
12133 }
12134 else
12135 {
12136 window = NULL;
12137 source_id = ImHashStr("#SourceExtern");
12138 source_drag_active = true;
12139 }
12140
12141 if (source_drag_active)
12142 {
12143 if (!g.DragDropActive)
12144 {
12145 IM_ASSERT(source_id != 0);
12146 ClearDragDrop();
12147 ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
12148 payload.SourceId = source_id;
12149 payload.SourceParentId = source_parent_id;
12150 g.DragDropActive = true;
12151 g.DragDropSourceFlags = flags;
12152 g.DragDropMouseButton = mouse_button;
12153 if (payload.SourceId == g.ActiveId)
12154 g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = true;
12155 }
12156 g.DragDropSourceFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
12157 g.DragDropWithinSource = true;
12158
12159 if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
12160 {
12161 // Target can request the Source to not display its tooltip (we use a dedicated flag to make this request explicit)
12162 // We unfortunately can't just modify the source flags and skip the call to BeginTooltip, as caller may be emitting contents.
12163 bool ret = BeginTooltip();
12164 IM_ASSERT(ret); // FIXME-NEWBEGIN: If this ever becomes false, we need to Begin("##Hidden", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings) + SetWindowHiddendAndSkipItemsForCurrentFrame().
12165 IM_UNUSED(ret);
12166
12167 if (g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev && (g.DragDropAcceptFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip))
12168 SetWindowHiddendAndSkipItemsForCurrentFrame(g.CurrentWindow);
12169 }
12170
12171 if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover) && !(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern))
12172 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags &= ~ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect;
12173
12174 return true;
12175 }
12176 return false;
12177}
12178
12179void ImGui::EndDragDropSource()
12180{
12181 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12182 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive);
12183 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinSource && "Not after a BeginDragDropSource()?");
12184
12185 if (!(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
12186 EndTooltip();
12187
12188 // Discard the drag if have not called SetDragDropPayload()
12189 if (g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount == -1)
12190 ClearDragDrop();
12191 g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
12192}
12193
12194// Use 'cond' to choose to submit payload on drag start or every frame
12195bool ImGui::SetDragDropPayload(const char* type, const void* data, size_t data_size, ImGuiCond cond)
12196{
12197 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12198 ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
12199 if (cond == 0)
12200 cond = ImGuiCond_Always;
12201
12202 IM_ASSERT(type != NULL);
12203 IM_ASSERT(strlen(type) < IM_ARRAYSIZE(payload.DataType) && "Payload type can be at most 32 characters long");
12204 IM_ASSERT((data != NULL && data_size > 0) || (data == NULL && data_size == 0));
12205 IM_ASSERT(cond == ImGuiCond_Always || cond == ImGuiCond_Once);
12206 IM_ASSERT(payload.SourceId != 0); // Not called between BeginDragDropSource() and EndDragDropSource()
12207
12208 if (cond == ImGuiCond_Always || payload.DataFrameCount == -1)
12209 {
12210 // Copy payload
12211 ImStrncpy(payload.DataType, type, IM_ARRAYSIZE(payload.DataType));
12212 g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.resize(0);
12213 if (data_size > sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal))
12214 {
12215 // Store in heap
12216 g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.resize((int)data_size);
12217 payload.Data = g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.Data;
12218 memcpy(payload.Data, data, data_size);
12219 }
12220 else if (data_size > 0)
12221 {
12222 // Store locally
12223 memset(&g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal, 0, sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal));
12224 payload.Data = g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal;
12225 memcpy(payload.Data, data, data_size);
12226 }
12227 else
12228 {
12229 payload.Data = NULL;
12230 }
12231 payload.DataSize = (int)data_size;
12232 }
12233 payload.DataFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
12234
12235 // Return whether the payload has been accepted
12236 return (g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount == g.FrameCount) || (g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount == g.FrameCount - 1);
12237}
12238
12239bool ImGui::BeginDragDropTargetCustom(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id)
12240{
12241 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12242 if (!g.DragDropActive)
12243 return false;
12244
12245 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
12246 ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow;
12247 if (hovered_window == NULL || window->RootWindow != hovered_window->RootWindow)
12248 return false;
12249 IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
12250 if (!IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max) || (id == g.DragDropPayload.SourceId))
12251 return false;
12252 if (window->SkipItems)
12253 return false;
12254
12255 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget == false);
12256 g.DragDropTargetRect = bb;
12257 g.DragDropTargetId = id;
12258 g.DragDropWithinTarget = true;
12259 return true;
12260}
12261
12262// We don't use BeginDragDropTargetCustom() and duplicate its code because:
12263// 1) we use LastItemRectHoveredRect which handles items that push a temporarily clip rectangle in their code. Calling BeginDragDropTargetCustom(LastItemRect) would not handle them.
12264// 2) and it's faster. as this code may be very frequently called, we want to early out as fast as we can.
12265// Also note how the HoveredWindow test is positioned differently in both functions (in both functions we optimize for the cheapest early out case)
12266bool ImGui::BeginDragDropTarget()
12267{
12268 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12269 if (!g.DragDropActive)
12270 return false;
12271
12272 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
12273 if (!(g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect))
12274 return false;
12275 ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow;
12276 if (hovered_window == NULL || window->RootWindow != hovered_window->RootWindow || window->SkipItems)
12277 return false;
12278
12279 const ImRect& display_rect = (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect) ? g.LastItemData.DisplayRect : g.LastItemData.Rect;
12280 ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
12281 if (id == 0)
12282 {
12283 id = window->GetIDFromRectangle(display_rect);
12284 KeepAliveID(id);
12285 }
12286 if (g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == id)
12287 return false;
12288
12289 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget == false);
12290 g.DragDropTargetRect = display_rect;
12291 g.DragDropTargetId = id;
12292 g.DragDropWithinTarget = true;
12293 return true;
12294}
12295
12296bool ImGui::IsDragDropPayloadBeingAccepted()
12297{
12298 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12299 return g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev != 0;
12300}
12301
12302const ImGuiPayload* ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(const char* type, ImGuiDragDropFlags flags)
12303{
12304 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12305 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
12306 ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
12307 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive); // Not called between BeginDragDropTarget() and EndDragDropTarget() ?
12308 IM_ASSERT(payload.DataFrameCount != -1); // Forgot to call EndDragDropTarget() ?
12309 if (type != NULL && !payload.IsDataType(type))
12310 return NULL;
12311
12312 // Accept smallest drag target bounding box, this allows us to nest drag targets conveniently without ordering constraints.
12313 // NB: We currently accept NULL id as target. However, overlapping targets requires a unique ID to function!
12314 const bool was_accepted_previously = (g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev == g.DragDropTargetId);
12315 ImRect r = g.DragDropTargetRect;
12316 float r_surface = r.GetWidth() * r.GetHeight();
12317 if (r_surface > g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface)
12318 return NULL;
12319
12320 g.DragDropAcceptFlags = flags;
12321 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = g.DragDropTargetId;
12322 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = r_surface;
12323 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("AcceptDragDropPayload(): %08X: accept\n", g.DragDropTargetId);
12324
12325 // Render default drop visuals
12326 payload.Preview = was_accepted_previously;
12327 flags |= (g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect); // Source can also inhibit the preview (useful for external sources that live for 1 frame)
12328 if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect) && payload.Preview)
12329 window->DrawList->AddRect(r.Min - ImVec2(3.5f,3.5f), r.Max + ImVec2(3.5f, 3.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
12330
12331 g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
12332 payload.Delivery = was_accepted_previously && !IsMouseDown(g.DragDropMouseButton); // For extern drag sources affecting OS window focus, it's easier to just test !IsMouseDown() instead of IsMouseReleased()
12333 if (!payload.Delivery && !(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery))
12334 return NULL;
12335
12336 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("AcceptDragDropPayload(): %08X: return payload\n", g.DragDropTargetId);
12337 return &payload;
12338}
12339
12340// FIXME-DRAGDROP: Settle on a proper default visuals for drop target.
12341void ImGui::RenderDragDropTargetRect(const ImRect& bb)
12342{
12343 GetWindowDrawList()->AddRect(bb.Min - ImVec2(3.5f, 3.5f), bb.Max + ImVec2(3.5f, 3.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
12344}
12345
12346const ImGuiPayload* ImGui::GetDragDropPayload()
12347{
12348 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12349 return (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount != -1) ? &g.DragDropPayload : NULL;
12350}
12351
12352void ImGui::EndDragDropTarget()
12353{
12354 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12355 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive);
12356 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget);
12357 g.DragDropWithinTarget = false;
12358
12359 // Clear drag and drop state payload right after delivery
12360 if (g.DragDropPayload.Delivery)
12361 ClearDragDrop();
12362}
12363
12364//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12365// [SECTION] LOGGING/CAPTURING
12366//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12367// All text output from the interface can be captured into tty/file/clipboard.
12368// By default, tree nodes are automatically opened during logging.
12369//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12370
12371// Pass text data straight to log (without being displayed)
12372static inline void LogTextV(ImGuiContext& g, const char* fmt, va_list args)
12373{
12374 if (g.LogFile)
12375 {
12376 g.LogBuffer.Buf.resize(0);
12377 g.LogBuffer.appendfv(fmt, args);
12378 ImFileWrite(g.LogBuffer.c_str(), sizeof(char), (ImU64)g.LogBuffer.size(), g.LogFile);
12379 }
12380 else
12381 {
12382 g.LogBuffer.appendfv(fmt, args);
12383 }
12384}
12385
12386void ImGui::LogText(const char* fmt, ...)
12387{
12388 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12389 if (!g.LogEnabled)
12390 return;
12391
12392 va_list args;
12393 va_start(args, fmt);
12394 LogTextV(g, fmt, args);
12395 va_end(args);
12396}
12397
12398void ImGui::LogTextV(const char* fmt, va_list args)
12399{
12400 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12401 if (!g.LogEnabled)
12402 return;
12403
12404 LogTextV(g, fmt, args);
12405}
12406
12407// Internal version that takes a position to decide on newline placement and pad items according to their depth.
12408// We split text into individual lines to add current tree level padding
12409// FIXME: This code is a little complicated perhaps, considering simplifying the whole system.
12410void ImGui::LogRenderedText(const ImVec2* ref_pos, const char* text, const char* text_end)
12411{
12412 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12413 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
12414
12415 const char* prefix = g.LogNextPrefix;
12416 const char* suffix = g.LogNextSuffix;
12417 g.LogNextPrefix = g.LogNextSuffix = NULL;
12418
12419 if (!text_end)
12420 text_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end);
12421
12422 const bool log_new_line = ref_pos && (ref_pos->y > g.LogLinePosY + g.Style.FramePadding.y + 1);
12423 if (ref_pos)
12424 g.LogLinePosY = ref_pos->y;
12425 if (log_new_line)
12426 {
12427 LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
12428 g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
12429 }
12430
12431 if (prefix)
12432 LogRenderedText(ref_pos, prefix, prefix + strlen(prefix)); // Calculate end ourself to ensure "##" are included here.
12433
12434 // Re-adjust padding if we have popped out of our starting depth
12435 if (g.LogDepthRef > window->DC.TreeDepth)
12436 g.LogDepthRef = window->DC.TreeDepth;
12437 const int tree_depth = (window->DC.TreeDepth - g.LogDepthRef);
12438
12439 const char* text_remaining = text;
12440 for (;;)
12441 {
12442 // Split the string. Each new line (after a '\n') is followed by indentation corresponding to the current depth of our log entry.
12443 // We don't add a trailing \n yet to allow a subsequent item on the same line to be captured.
12444 const char* line_start = text_remaining;
12445 const char* line_end = ImStreolRange(line_start, text_end);
12446 const bool is_last_line = (line_end == text_end);
12447 if (line_start != line_end || !is_last_line)
12448 {
12449 const int line_length = (int)(line_end - line_start);
12450 const int indentation = g.LogLineFirstItem ? tree_depth * 4 : 1;
12451 LogText("%*s%.*s", indentation, "", line_length, line_start);
12452 g.LogLineFirstItem = false;
12453 if (*line_end == '\n')
12454 {
12455 LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
12456 g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
12457 }
12458 }
12459 if (is_last_line)
12460 break;
12461 text_remaining = line_end + 1;
12462 }
12463
12464 if (suffix)
12465 LogRenderedText(ref_pos, suffix, suffix + strlen(suffix));
12466}
12467
12468// Start logging/capturing text output
12469void ImGui::LogBegin(ImGuiLogType type, int auto_open_depth)
12470{
12471 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12472 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
12473 IM_ASSERT(g.LogEnabled == false);
12474 IM_ASSERT(g.LogFile == NULL);
12475 IM_ASSERT(g.LogBuffer.empty());
12476 g.LogEnabled = true;
12477 g.LogType = type;
12478 g.LogNextPrefix = g.LogNextSuffix = NULL;
12479 g.LogDepthRef = window->DC.TreeDepth;
12480 g.LogDepthToExpand = ((auto_open_depth >= 0) ? auto_open_depth : g.LogDepthToExpandDefault);
12481 g.LogLinePosY = FLT_MAX;
12482 g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
12483}
12484
12485// Important: doesn't copy underlying data, use carefully (prefix/suffix must be in scope at the time of the next LogRenderedText)
12486void ImGui::LogSetNextTextDecoration(const char* prefix, const char* suffix)
12487{
12488 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12489 g.LogNextPrefix = prefix;
12490 g.LogNextSuffix = suffix;
12491}
12492
12493void ImGui::LogToTTY(int auto_open_depth)
12494{
12495 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12496 if (g.LogEnabled)
12497 return;
12498 IM_UNUSED(auto_open_depth);
12499#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
12500 LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_TTY, auto_open_depth);
12501 g.LogFile = stdout;
12502#endif
12503}
12504
12505// Start logging/capturing text output to given file
12506void ImGui::LogToFile(int auto_open_depth, const char* filename)
12507{
12508 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12509 if (g.LogEnabled)
12510 return;
12511
12512 // FIXME: We could probably open the file in text mode "at", however note that clipboard/buffer logging will still
12513 // be subject to outputting OS-incompatible carriage return if within strings the user doesn't use IM_NEWLINE.
12514 // By opening the file in binary mode "ab" we have consistent output everywhere.
12515 if (!filename)
12516 filename = g.IO.LogFilename;
12517 if (!filename || !filename[0])
12518 return;
12519 ImFileHandle f = ImFileOpen(filename, "ab");
12520 if (!f)
12521 {
12522 IM_ASSERT(0);
12523 return;
12524 }
12525
12526 LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_File, auto_open_depth);
12527 g.LogFile = f;
12528}
12529
12530// Start logging/capturing text output to clipboard
12531void ImGui::LogToClipboard(int auto_open_depth)
12532{
12533 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12534 if (g.LogEnabled)
12535 return;
12536 LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_Clipboard, auto_open_depth);
12537}
12538
12539void ImGui::LogToBuffer(int auto_open_depth)
12540{
12541 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12542 if (g.LogEnabled)
12543 return;
12544 LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_Buffer, auto_open_depth);
12545}
12546
12547void ImGui::LogFinish()
12548{
12549 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12550 if (!g.LogEnabled)
12551 return;
12552
12553 LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
12554 switch (g.LogType)
12555 {
12556 case ImGuiLogType_TTY:
12557#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
12558 fflush(g.LogFile);
12559#endif
12560 break;
12561 case ImGuiLogType_File:
12562 ImFileClose(g.LogFile);
12563 break;
12564 case ImGuiLogType_Buffer:
12565 break;
12566 case ImGuiLogType_Clipboard:
12567 if (!g.LogBuffer.empty())
12568 SetClipboardText(g.LogBuffer.begin());
12569 break;
12570 case ImGuiLogType_None:
12571 IM_ASSERT(0);
12572 break;
12573 }
12574
12575 g.LogEnabled = false;
12576 g.LogType = ImGuiLogType_None;
12577 g.LogFile = NULL;
12578 g.LogBuffer.clear();
12579}
12580
12581// Helper to display logging buttons
12582// FIXME-OBSOLETE: We should probably obsolete this and let the user have their own helper (this is one of the oldest function alive!)
12583void ImGui::LogButtons()
12584{
12585 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12586
12587 PushID("LogButtons");
12588#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
12589 const bool log_to_tty = Button("Log To TTY"); SameLine();
12590#else
12591 const bool log_to_tty = false;
12592#endif
12593 const bool log_to_file = Button("Log To File"); SameLine();
12594 const bool log_to_clipboard = Button("Log To Clipboard"); SameLine();
12595 PushTabStop(false);
12596 SetNextItemWidth(80.0f);
12597 SliderInt("Default Depth", &g.LogDepthToExpandDefault, 0, 9, NULL);
12598 PopTabStop();
12599 PopID();
12600
12601 // Start logging at the end of the function so that the buttons don't appear in the log
12602 if (log_to_tty)
12603 LogToTTY();
12604 if (log_to_file)
12605 LogToFile();
12606 if (log_to_clipboard)
12607 LogToClipboard();
12608}
12609
12610
12611//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12612// [SECTION] SETTINGS
12613//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12614// - UpdateSettings() [Internal]
12615// - MarkIniSettingsDirty() [Internal]
12616// - FindSettingsHandler() [Internal]
12617// - ClearIniSettings() [Internal]
12618// - LoadIniSettingsFromDisk()
12619// - LoadIniSettingsFromMemory()
12620// - SaveIniSettingsToDisk()
12621// - SaveIniSettingsToMemory()
12622//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12623// - CreateNewWindowSettings() [Internal]
12624// - FindWindowSettingsByID() [Internal]
12625// - FindWindowSettingsByWindow() [Internal]
12626// - ClearWindowSettings() [Internal]
12627// - WindowSettingsHandler_***() [Internal]
12628//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12629
12630// Called by NewFrame()
12631void ImGui::UpdateSettings()
12632{
12633 // Load settings on first frame (if not explicitly loaded manually before)
12634 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12635 if (!g.SettingsLoaded)
12636 {
12637 IM_ASSERT(g.SettingsWindows.empty());
12638 if (g.IO.IniFilename)
12639 LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
12640 g.SettingsLoaded = true;
12641 }
12642
12643 // Save settings (with a delay after the last modification, so we don't spam disk too much)
12644 if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer > 0.0f)
12645 {
12646 g.SettingsDirtyTimer -= g.IO.DeltaTime;
12647 if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
12648 {
12649 if (g.IO.IniFilename != NULL)
12650 SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
12651 else
12652 g.IO.WantSaveIniSettings = true; // Let user know they can call SaveIniSettingsToMemory(). user will need to clear io.WantSaveIniSettings themselves.
12653 g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
12654 }
12655 }
12656}
12657
12658void ImGui::MarkIniSettingsDirty()
12659{
12660 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12661 if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
12662 g.SettingsDirtyTimer = g.IO.IniSavingRate;
12663}
12664
12665void ImGui::MarkIniSettingsDirty(ImGuiWindow* window)
12666{
12667 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12668 if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings))
12669 if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
12670 g.SettingsDirtyTimer = g.IO.IniSavingRate;
12671}
12672
12673void ImGui::AddSettingsHandler(const ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler)
12674{
12675 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12676 IM_ASSERT(FindSettingsHandler(handler->TypeName) == NULL);
12677 g.SettingsHandlers.push_back(*handler);
12678}
12679
12680void ImGui::RemoveSettingsHandler(const char* type_name)
12681{
12682 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12683 if (ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler = FindSettingsHandler(type_name))
12684 g.SettingsHandlers.erase(handler);
12685}
12686
12687ImGuiSettingsHandler* ImGui::FindSettingsHandler(const char* type_name)
12688{
12689 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12690 const ImGuiID type_hash = ImHashStr(type_name);
12691 for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
12692 if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].TypeHash == type_hash)
12693 return &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n];
12694 return NULL;
12695}
12696
12697// Clear all settings (windows, tables, docking etc.)
12698void ImGui::ClearIniSettings()
12699{
12700 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12701 g.SettingsIniData.clear();
12702 for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
12703 if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ClearAllFn)
12704 g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ClearAllFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
12705}
12706
12707void ImGui::LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(const char* ini_filename)
12708{
12709 size_t file_data_size = 0;
12710 char* file_data = (char*)ImFileLoadToMemory(ini_filename, "rb", &file_data_size);
12711 if (!file_data)
12712 return;
12713 if (file_data_size > 0)
12714 LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(file_data, (size_t)file_data_size);
12715 IM_FREE(file_data);
12716}
12717
12718// Zero-tolerance, no error reporting, cheap .ini parsing
12719void ImGui::LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(const char* ini_data, size_t ini_size)
12720{
12721 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12722 IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
12723 //IM_ASSERT(!g.WithinFrameScope && "Cannot be called between NewFrame() and EndFrame()");
12724 //IM_ASSERT(g.SettingsLoaded == false && g.FrameCount == 0);
12725
12726 // For user convenience, we allow passing a non zero-terminated string (hence the ini_size parameter).
12727 // For our convenience and to make the code simpler, we'll also write zero-terminators within the buffer. So let's create a writable copy..
12728 if (ini_size == 0)
12729 ini_size = strlen(ini_data);
12730 g.SettingsIniData.Buf.resize((int)ini_size + 1);
12731 char* const buf = g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Data;
12732 char* const buf_end = buf + ini_size;
12733 memcpy(buf, ini_data, ini_size);
12734 buf_end[0] = 0;
12735
