12736 // Call pre-read handlers
12737 // Some types will clear their data (e.g. dock information) some types will allow merge/override (window)
12738 for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
12739 if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ReadInitFn)
12740 g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ReadInitFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
12741
12742 void* entry_data = NULL;
12743 ImGuiSettingsHandler* entry_handler = NULL;
12744
12745 char* line_end = NULL;
12746 for (char* line = buf; line < buf_end; line = line_end + 1)
12747 {
12748 // Skip new lines markers, then find end of the line
12749 while (*line == '\n' || *line == '\r')
12750 line++;
12751 line_end = line;
12752 while (line_end < buf_end && *line_end != '\n' && *line_end != '\r')
12753 line_end++;
12754 line_end[0] = 0;
12755 if (line[0] == ';')
12756 continue;
12757 if (line[0] == '[' && line_end > line && line_end[-1] == ']')
12758 {
12759 // Parse "[Type][Name]". Note that 'Name' can itself contains [] characters, which is acceptable with the current format and parsing code.
12760 line_end[-1] = 0;
12761 const char* name_end = line_end - 1;
12762 const char* type_start = line + 1;
12763 char* type_end = (char*)(void*)ImStrchrRange(type_start, name_end, ']');
12764 const char* name_start = type_end ? ImStrchrRange(type_end + 1, name_end, '[') : NULL;
12765 if (!type_end || !name_start)
12766 continue;
12767 *type_end = 0; // Overwrite first ']'
12768 name_start++; // Skip second '['
12769 entry_handler = FindSettingsHandler(type_start);
12770 entry_data = entry_handler ? entry_handler->ReadOpenFn(&g, entry_handler, name_start) : NULL;
12771 }
12772 else if (entry_handler != NULL && entry_data != NULL)
12773 {
12774 // Let type handler parse the line
12775 entry_handler->ReadLineFn(&g, entry_handler, entry_data, line);
12776 }
12777 }
12778 g.SettingsLoaded = true;
12779
12780 // [DEBUG] Restore untouched copy so it can be browsed in Metrics (not strictly necessary)
12781 memcpy(buf, ini_data, ini_size);
12782
12783 // Call post-read handlers
12784 for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
12785 if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ApplyAllFn)
12786 g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ApplyAllFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
12787}
12788
12789void ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToDisk(const char* ini_filename)
12790{
12791 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12792 g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
12793 if (!ini_filename)
12794 return;
12795
12796 size_t ini_data_size = 0;
12797 const char* ini_data = SaveIniSettingsToMemory(&ini_data_size);
12798 ImFileHandle f = ImFileOpen(ini_filename, "wt");
12799 if (!f)
12800 return;
12801 ImFileWrite(ini_data, sizeof(char), ini_data_size, f);
12802 ImFileClose(f);
12803}
12804
12805// Call registered handlers (e.g. SettingsHandlerWindow_WriteAll() + custom handlers) to write their stuff into a text buffer
12806const char* ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToMemory(size_t* out_size)
12807{
12808 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12809 g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
12810 g.SettingsIniData.Buf.resize(0);
12811 g.SettingsIniData.Buf.push_back(0);
12812 for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
12813 {
12814 ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler = &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n];
12815 handler->WriteAllFn(&g, handler, &g.SettingsIniData);
12816 }
12817 if (out_size)
12818 *out_size = (size_t)g.SettingsIniData.size();
12819 return g.SettingsIniData.c_str();
12820}
12821
12822ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(const char* name)
12823{
12824 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12825
12826#if !IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS
12827 // Skip to the "###" marker if any. We don't skip past to match the behavior of GetID()
12828 // Preserve the full string when IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS is set to make .ini inspection easier.
12829 if (const char* p = strstr(name, "###"))
12830 name = p;
12831#endif
12832 const size_t name_len = strlen(name);
12833
12834 // Allocate chunk
12835 const size_t chunk_size = sizeof(ImGuiWindowSettings) + name_len + 1;
12836 ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.alloc_chunk(chunk_size);
12837 IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(settings) ImGuiWindowSettings();
12838 settings->ID = ImHashStr(name, name_len);
12839 memcpy(settings->GetName(), name, name_len + 1); // Store with zero terminator
12840
12841 return settings;
12842}
12843
12844// We don't provide a FindWindowSettingsByName() because Docking system doesn't always hold on names.
12845// This is called once per window .ini entry + once per newly instantiated window.
12846ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::FindWindowSettingsByID(ImGuiID id)
12847{
12848 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12849 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
12850 if (settings->ID == id && !settings->WantDelete)
12851 return settings;
12852 return NULL;
12853}
12854
12855// This is faster if you are holding on a Window already as we don't need to perform a search.
12856ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::FindWindowSettingsByWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
12857{
12858 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12859 if (window->SettingsOffset != -1)
12860 return g.SettingsWindows.ptr_from_offset(window->SettingsOffset);
12861 return FindWindowSettingsByID(window->ID);
12862}
12863
12864// This will revert window to its initial state, including enabling the ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver/ImGuiCond_Once conditions once more.
12865void ImGui::ClearWindowSettings(const char* name)
12866{
12867 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("ClearWindowSettings('%s')\n", name);
12868 ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name);
12869 if (window != NULL)
12870 {
12871 window->Flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings;
12872 InitOrLoadWindowSettings(window, NULL);
12873 }
12874 if (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = window ? FindWindowSettingsByWindow(window) : FindWindowSettingsByID(ImHashStr(name)))
12875 settings->WantDelete = true;
12876}
12877
12878static void WindowSettingsHandler_ClearAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*)
12879{
12880 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12881 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
12882 g.Windows[i]->SettingsOffset = -1;
12883 g.SettingsWindows.clear();
12884}
12885
12886static void* WindowSettingsHandler_ReadOpen(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, const char* name)
12887{
12888 ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(name);
12889 ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = ImGui::FindWindowSettingsByID(id);
12890 if (settings)
12891 *settings = ImGuiWindowSettings(); // Clear existing if recycling previous entry
12892 else
12893 settings = ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(name);
12894 settings->ID = id;
12895 settings->WantApply = true;
12896 return (void*)settings;
12897}
12898
12899static void WindowSettingsHandler_ReadLine(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, void* entry, const char* line)
12900{
12901 ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = (ImGuiWindowSettings*)entry;
12902 int x, y;
12903 int i;
12904 if (sscanf(line, "Pos=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2) { settings->Pos = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); }
12905 else if (sscanf(line, "Size=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2) { settings->Size = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); }
12906 else if (sscanf(line, "Collapsed=%d", &i) == 1) { settings->Collapsed = (i != 0); }
12907}
12908
12909// Apply to existing windows (if any)
12910static void WindowSettingsHandler_ApplyAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*)
12911{
12912 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12913 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
12914 if (settings->WantApply)
12915 {
12916 if (ImGuiWindow* window = ImGui::FindWindowByID(settings->ID))
12917 ApplyWindowSettings(window, settings);
12918 settings->WantApply = false;
12919 }
12920}
12921
12922static void WindowSettingsHandler_WriteAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler, ImGuiTextBuffer* buf)
12923{
12924 // Gather data from windows that were active during this session
12925 // (if a window wasn't opened in this session we preserve its settings)
12926 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12927 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
12928 {
12929 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
12930 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings)
12931 continue;
12932
12933 ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = ImGui::FindWindowSettingsByWindow(window);
12934 if (!settings)
12935 {
12936 settings = ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(window->Name);
12937 window->SettingsOffset = g.SettingsWindows.offset_from_ptr(settings);
12938 }
12939 IM_ASSERT(settings->ID == window->ID);
12940 settings->Pos = ImVec2ih(window->Pos);
12941 settings->Size = ImVec2ih(window->SizeFull);
12942
12943 settings->Collapsed = window->Collapsed;
12944 settings->WantDelete = false;
12945 }
12946
12947 // Write to text buffer
12948 buf->reserve(buf->size() + g.SettingsWindows.size() * 6); // ballpark reserve
12949 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
12950 {
12951 if (settings->WantDelete)
12952 continue;
12953 const char* settings_name = settings->GetName();
12954 buf->appendf("[%s][%s]\n", handler->TypeName, settings_name);
12955 buf->appendf("Pos=%d,%d\n", settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y);
12956 buf->appendf("Size=%d,%d\n", settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y);
12957 buf->appendf("Collapsed=%d\n", settings->Collapsed);
12958 buf->append("\n");
12959 }
12960}
12961
12962
12963//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12964// [SECTION] LOCALIZATION
12965//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12966
12967void ImGui::LocalizeRegisterEntries(const ImGuiLocEntry* entries, int count)
12968{
12969 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12970 for (int n = 0; n < count; n++)
12971 g.LocalizationTable[entries[n].Key] = entries[n].Text;
12972}
12973
12974
12975//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12976// [SECTION] VIEWPORTS, PLATFORM WINDOWS
12977//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12978// - GetMainViewport()
12979// - SetWindowViewport() [Internal]
12980// - UpdateViewportsNewFrame() [Internal]
12981// (this section is more complete in the 'docking' branch)
12982//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12983
12984ImGuiViewport* ImGui::GetMainViewport()
12985{
12986 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12987 return g.Viewports[0];
12988}
12989
12990void ImGui::SetWindowViewport(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
12991{
12992 window->Viewport = viewport;
12993}
12994
12995// Update viewports and monitor infos
12996static void ImGui::UpdateViewportsNewFrame()
12997{
12998 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12999 IM_ASSERT(g.Viewports.Size == 1);
13000
13001 // Update main viewport with current platform position.
13002 // FIXME-VIEWPORT: Size is driven by backend/user code for backward-compatibility but we should aim to make this more consistent.
13003 ImGuiViewportP* main_viewport = g.Viewports[0];
13004 main_viewport->Flags = ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformWindow | ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp;
13005 main_viewport->Pos = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
13006 main_viewport->Size = g.IO.DisplaySize;
13007
13008 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
13009 {
13010 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
13011
13012 // Lock down space taken by menu bars and status bars, reset the offset for fucntions like BeginMainMenuBar() to alter them again.
13013 viewport->WorkOffsetMin = viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMin;
13014 viewport->WorkOffsetMax = viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMax;
13015 viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMin = viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMax = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
13016 viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
13017 }
13018}
13019
13020//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13021// [SECTION] DOCKING
13022//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13023
13024// (this section is filled in the 'docking' branch)
13025
13026
13027//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13028// [SECTION] PLATFORM DEPENDENT HELPERS
13029//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13030
13031#if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS)
13032
13033#ifdef _MSC_VER
13034#pragma comment(lib, "user32")
13035#pragma comment(lib, "kernel32")
13036#endif
13037
13038// Win32 clipboard implementation
13039// We use g.ClipboardHandlerData for temporary storage to ensure it is freed on Shutdown()
13040static const char* GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void* user_data_ctx)
13041{
13042 ImGuiContext& g = *(ImGuiContext*)user_data_ctx;
13043 g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
13044 if (!::OpenClipboard(NULL))
13045 return NULL;
13046 HANDLE wbuf_handle = ::GetClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT);
13047 if (wbuf_handle == NULL)
13048 {
13049 ::CloseClipboard();
13050 return NULL;
13051 }
13052 if (const WCHAR* wbuf_global = (const WCHAR*)::GlobalLock(wbuf_handle))
13053 {
13054 int buf_len = ::WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, wbuf_global, -1, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL);
13055 g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize(buf_len);
13056 ::WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, wbuf_global, -1, g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data, buf_len, NULL, NULL);
13057 }
13058 ::GlobalUnlock(wbuf_handle);
13059 ::CloseClipboard();
13060 return g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data;
13061}
13062
13063static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*, const char* text)
13064{
13065 if (!::OpenClipboard(NULL))
13066 return;
13067 const int wbuf_length = ::MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, text, -1, NULL, 0);
13068 HGLOBAL wbuf_handle = ::GlobalAlloc(GMEM_MOVEABLE, (SIZE_T)wbuf_length * sizeof(WCHAR));
13069 if (wbuf_handle == NULL)
13070 {
13071 ::CloseClipboard();
13072 return;
13073 }
13074 WCHAR* wbuf_global = (WCHAR*)::GlobalLock(wbuf_handle);
13075 ::MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, text, -1, wbuf_global, wbuf_length);
13076 ::GlobalUnlock(wbuf_handle);
13077 ::EmptyClipboard();
13078 if (::SetClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT, wbuf_handle) == NULL)
13079 ::GlobalFree(wbuf_handle);
13080 ::CloseClipboard();
13081}
13082
13083#elif defined(__APPLE__) && TARGET_OS_OSX && defined(IMGUI_ENABLE_OSX_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS)
13084
13085#include <Carbon/Carbon.h> // Use old API to avoid need for separate .mm file
13086static PasteboardRef main_clipboard = 0;
13087
13088// OSX clipboard implementation
13089// If you enable this you will need to add '-framework ApplicationServices' to your linker command-line!
13090static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*, const char* text)
13091{
13092 if (!main_clipboard)
13093 PasteboardCreate(kPasteboardClipboard, &main_clipboard);
13094 PasteboardClear(main_clipboard);
13095 CFDataRef cf_data = CFDataCreate(kCFAllocatorDefault, (const UInt8*)text, strlen(text));
13096 if (cf_data)
13097 {
13098 PasteboardPutItemFlavor(main_clipboard, (PasteboardItemID)1, CFSTR("public.utf8-plain-text"), cf_data, 0);
13099 CFRelease(cf_data);
13100 }
13101}
13102
13103static const char* GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void* user_data_ctx)
13104{
13105 ImGuiContext& g = *(ImGuiContext*)user_data_ctx;
13106 if (!main_clipboard)
13107 PasteboardCreate(kPasteboardClipboard, &main_clipboard);
13108 PasteboardSynchronize(main_clipboard);
13109
13110 ItemCount item_count = 0;
13111 PasteboardGetItemCount(main_clipboard, &item_count);
13112 for (ItemCount i = 0; i < item_count; i++)
13113 {
13114 PasteboardItemID item_id = 0;
13115 PasteboardGetItemIdentifier(main_clipboard, i + 1, &item_id);
13116 CFArrayRef flavor_type_array = 0;
13117 PasteboardCopyItemFlavors(main_clipboard, item_id, &flavor_type_array);
13118 for (CFIndex j = 0, nj = CFArrayGetCount(flavor_type_array); j < nj; j++)
13119 {
13120 CFDataRef cf_data;
13121 if (PasteboardCopyItemFlavorData(main_clipboard, item_id, CFSTR("public.utf8-plain-text"), &cf_data) == noErr)
13122 {
13123 g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
13124 int length = (int)CFDataGetLength(cf_data);
13125 g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize(length + 1);
13126 CFDataGetBytes(cf_data, CFRangeMake(0, length), (UInt8*)g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data);
13127 g.ClipboardHandlerData[length] = 0;
13128 CFRelease(cf_data);
13129 return g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data;
13130 }
13131 }
13132 }
13133 return NULL;
13134}
13135
13136#else
13137
13138// Local Dear ImGui-only clipboard implementation, if user hasn't defined better clipboard handlers.
13139static const char* GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void* user_data_ctx)
13140{
13141 ImGuiContext& g = *(ImGuiContext*)user_data_ctx;
13142 return g.ClipboardHandlerData.empty() ? NULL : g.ClipboardHandlerData.begin();
13143}
13144
13145static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void* user_data_ctx, const char* text)
13146{
13147 ImGuiContext& g = *(ImGuiContext*)user_data_ctx;
13148 g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
13149 const char* text_end = text + strlen(text);
13150 g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize((int)(text_end - text) + 1);
13151 memcpy(&g.ClipboardHandlerData[0], text, (size_t)(text_end - text));
13152 g.ClipboardHandlerData[(int)(text_end - text)] = 0;
13153}
13154
13155#endif
13156
13157// Win32 API IME support (for Asian languages, etc.)
13158#if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS)
13159
13160#include <imm.h>
13161#ifdef _MSC_VER
13162#pragma comment(lib, "imm32")
13163#endif
13164
13165static void SetPlatformImeDataFn_DefaultImpl(ImGuiViewport* viewport, ImGuiPlatformImeData* data)
13166{
13167 // Notify OS Input Method Editor of text input position
13168 HWND hwnd = (HWND)viewport->PlatformHandleRaw;
13169 if (hwnd == 0)
13170 return;
13171
13172 //::ImmAssociateContextEx(hwnd, NULL, data->WantVisible ? IACE_DEFAULT : 0);
13173 if (HIMC himc = ::ImmGetContext(hwnd))
13174 {
13175 COMPOSITIONFORM composition_form = {};
13176 composition_form.ptCurrentPos.x = (LONG)data->InputPos.x;
13177 composition_form.ptCurrentPos.y = (LONG)data->InputPos.y;
13178 composition_form.dwStyle = CFS_FORCE_POSITION;
13179 ::ImmSetCompositionWindow(himc, &composition_form);
13180 CANDIDATEFORM candidate_form = {};
13181 candidate_form.dwStyle = CFS_CANDIDATEPOS;
13182 candidate_form.ptCurrentPos.x = (LONG)data->InputPos.x;
13183 candidate_form.ptCurrentPos.y = (LONG)data->InputPos.y;
13184 ::ImmSetCandidateWindow(himc, &candidate_form);
13185 ::ImmReleaseContext(hwnd, himc);
13186 }
13187}
13188
13189#else
13190
13191static void SetPlatformImeDataFn_DefaultImpl(ImGuiViewport*, ImGuiPlatformImeData*) {}
13192
13193#endif
13194
13195//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13196// [SECTION] METRICS/DEBUGGER WINDOW
13197//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13198// - RenderViewportThumbnail() [Internal]
13199// - RenderViewportsThumbnails() [Internal]
13200// - DebugTextEncoding()
13201// - MetricsHelpMarker() [Internal]
13202// - ShowFontAtlas() [Internal]
13203// - ShowMetricsWindow()
13204// - DebugNodeColumns() [Internal]
13205// - DebugNodeDrawList() [Internal]
13206// - DebugNodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox() [Internal]
13207// - DebugNodeFont() [Internal]
13208// - DebugNodeFontGlyph() [Internal]
13209// - DebugNodeStorage() [Internal]
13210// - DebugNodeTabBar() [Internal]
13211// - DebugNodeViewport() [Internal]
13212// - DebugNodeWindow() [Internal]
13213// - DebugNodeWindowSettings() [Internal]
13214// - DebugNodeWindowsList() [Internal]
13215// - DebugNodeWindowsListByBeginStackParent() [Internal]
13216//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13217
13218#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
13219
13220void ImGui::DebugRenderViewportThumbnail(ImDrawList* draw_list, ImGuiViewportP* viewport, const ImRect& bb)
13221{
13222 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13223 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
13224
13225 ImVec2 scale = bb.GetSize() / viewport->Size;
13226 ImVec2 off = bb.Min - viewport->Pos * scale;
13227 float alpha_mul = 1.0f;
13228 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border, alpha_mul * 0.40f));
13229 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
13230 {
13231 ImGuiWindow* thumb_window = g.Windows[i];
13232 if (!thumb_window->WasActive || (thumb_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
13233 continue;
13234
13235 ImRect thumb_r = thumb_window->Rect();
13236 ImRect title_r = thumb_window->TitleBarRect();
13237 thumb_r = ImRect(ImFloor(off + thumb_r.Min * scale), ImFloor(off + thumb_r.Max * scale));
13238 title_r = ImRect(ImFloor(off + title_r.Min * scale), ImFloor(off + ImVec2(title_r.Max.x, title_r.Min.y) * scale) + ImVec2(0,5)); // Exaggerate title bar height
13239 thumb_r.ClipWithFull(bb);
13240 title_r.ClipWithFull(bb);
13241 const bool window_is_focused = (g.NavWindow && thumb_window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight == g.NavWindow->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight);
13242 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(thumb_r.Min, thumb_r.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_WindowBg, alpha_mul));
13243 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(title_r.Min, title_r.Max, GetColorU32(window_is_focused ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBg, alpha_mul));
13244 window->DrawList->AddRect(thumb_r.Min, thumb_r.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border, alpha_mul));
13245 window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize * 1.0f, title_r.Min, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text, alpha_mul), thumb_window->Name, FindRenderedTextEnd(thumb_window->Name));
13246 }
13247 draw_list->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border, alpha_mul));
13248}
13249
13250static void RenderViewportsThumbnails()
13251{
13252 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13253 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
13254
13255 // We don't display full monitor bounds (we could, but it often looks awkward), instead we display just enough to cover all of our viewports.
13256 float SCALE = 1.0f / 8.0f;
13257 ImRect bb_full(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
13258 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
13259 bb_full.Add(g.Viewports[n]->GetMainRect());
13260 ImVec2 p = window->DC.CursorPos;
13261 ImVec2 off = p - bb_full.Min * SCALE;
13262 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
13263 {
13264 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
13265 ImRect viewport_draw_bb(off + (viewport->Pos) * SCALE, off + (viewport->Pos + viewport->Size) * SCALE);
13266 ImGui::DebugRenderViewportThumbnail(window->DrawList, viewport, viewport_draw_bb);
13267 }
13268 ImGui::Dummy(bb_full.GetSize() * SCALE);
13269}
13270
13271// Draw an arbitrary US keyboard layout to visualize translated keys
13272void ImGui::DebugRenderKeyboardPreview(ImDrawList* draw_list)
13273{
13274 const ImVec2 key_size = ImVec2(35.0f, 35.0f);
13275 const float key_rounding = 3.0f;
13276 const ImVec2 key_face_size = ImVec2(25.0f, 25.0f);
13277 const ImVec2 key_face_pos = ImVec2(5.0f, 3.0f);
13278 const float key_face_rounding = 2.0f;
13279 const ImVec2 key_label_pos = ImVec2(7.0f, 4.0f);
13280 const ImVec2 key_step = ImVec2(key_size.x - 1.0f, key_size.y - 1.0f);
13281 const float key_row_offset = 9.0f;
13282
13283 ImVec2 board_min = GetCursorScreenPos();
13284 ImVec2 board_max = ImVec2(board_min.x + 3 * key_step.x + 2 * key_row_offset + 10.0f, board_min.y + 3 * key_step.y + 10.0f);
13285 ImVec2 start_pos = ImVec2(board_min.x + 5.0f - key_step.x, board_min.y);
13286
13287 struct KeyLayoutData { int Row, Col; const char* Label; ImGuiKey Key; };
13288 const KeyLayoutData keys_to_display[] =
13289 {
13290 { 0, 0, "", ImGuiKey_Tab }, { 0, 1, "Q", ImGuiKey_Q }, { 0, 2, "W", ImGuiKey_W }, { 0, 3, "E", ImGuiKey_E }, { 0, 4, "R", ImGuiKey_R },
13291 { 1, 0, "", ImGuiKey_CapsLock }, { 1, 1, "A", ImGuiKey_A }, { 1, 2, "S", ImGuiKey_S }, { 1, 3, "D", ImGuiKey_D }, { 1, 4, "F", ImGuiKey_F },
13292 { 2, 0, "", ImGuiKey_LeftShift },{ 2, 1, "Z", ImGuiKey_Z }, { 2, 2, "X", ImGuiKey_X }, { 2, 3, "C", ImGuiKey_C }, { 2, 4, "V", ImGuiKey_V }
13293 };
13294
13295 // Elements rendered manually via ImDrawList API are not clipped automatically.
13296 // While not strictly necessary, here IsItemVisible() is used to avoid rendering these shapes when they are out of view.
13297 Dummy(board_max - board_min);
13298 if (!IsItemVisible())
13299 return;
13300 draw_list->PushClipRect(board_min, board_max, true);
13301 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(keys_to_display); n++)
13302 {
13303 const KeyLayoutData* key_data = &keys_to_display[n];
13304 ImVec2 key_min = ImVec2(start_pos.x + key_data->Col * key_step.x + key_data->Row * key_row_offset, start_pos.y + key_data->Row * key_step.y);
13305 ImVec2 key_max = key_min + key_size;
13306 draw_list->AddRectFilled(key_min, key_max, IM_COL32(204, 204, 204, 255), key_rounding);
13307 draw_list->AddRect(key_min, key_max, IM_COL32(24, 24, 24, 255), key_rounding);
13308 ImVec2 face_min = ImVec2(key_min.x + key_face_pos.x, key_min.y + key_face_pos.y);
13309 ImVec2 face_max = ImVec2(face_min.x + key_face_size.x, face_min.y + key_face_size.y);
13310 draw_list->AddRect(face_min, face_max, IM_COL32(193, 193, 193, 255), key_face_rounding, ImDrawFlags_None, 2.0f);
13311 draw_list->AddRectFilled(face_min, face_max, IM_COL32(252, 252, 252, 255), key_face_rounding);
13312 ImVec2 label_min = ImVec2(key_min.x + key_label_pos.x, key_min.y + key_label_pos.y);
13313 draw_list->AddText(label_min, IM_COL32(64, 64, 64, 255), key_data->Label);
13314 if (ImGui::IsKeyDown(key_data->Key))
13315 draw_list->AddRectFilled(key_min, key_max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 128), key_rounding);
13316 }
13317 draw_list->PopClipRect();
13318}
13319
13320// Helper tool to diagnose between text encoding issues and font loading issues. Pass your UTF-8 string and verify that there are correct.
13321void ImGui::DebugTextEncoding(const char* str)
13322{
13323 Text("Text: \"%s\"", str);
13324 if (!BeginTable("list", 4, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit))
13325 return;
13326 TableSetupColumn("Offset");
13327 TableSetupColumn("UTF-8");
13328 TableSetupColumn("Glyph");
13329 TableSetupColumn("Codepoint");
13330 TableHeadersRow();
13331 for (const char* p = str; *p != 0; )
13332 {
13333 unsigned int c;
13334 const int c_utf8_len = ImTextCharFromUtf8(&c, p, NULL);
13335 TableNextColumn();
13336 Text("%d", (int)(p - str));
13337 TableNextColumn();
13338 for (int byte_index = 0; byte_index < c_utf8_len; byte_index++)
13339 {
13340 if (byte_index > 0)
13341 SameLine();
13342 Text("0x%02X", (int)(unsigned char)p[byte_index]);
13343 }
13344 TableNextColumn();
13345 if (GetFont()->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)c))
13346 TextUnformatted(p, p + c_utf8_len);
13347 else
13348 TextUnformatted((c == IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_INVALID) ? "[invalid]" : "[missing]");
13349 TableNextColumn();
13350 Text("U+%04X", (int)c);
13351 p += c_utf8_len;
13352 }
13353 EndTable();
13354}
13355
13356// Avoid naming collision with imgui_demo.cpp's HelpMarker() for unity builds.
13357static void MetricsHelpMarker(const char* desc)
13358{
13359 ImGui::TextDisabled("(?)");
13360 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort) && ImGui::BeginTooltip())
13361 {
13362 ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 35.0f);
13363 ImGui::TextUnformatted(desc);
13364 ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();
13365 ImGui::EndTooltip();
13366 }
13367}
13368
13369// [DEBUG] List fonts in a font atlas and display its texture
13370void ImGui::ShowFontAtlas(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
13371{
13372 for (int i = 0; i < atlas->Fonts.Size; i++)
13373 {
13374 ImFont* font = atlas->Fonts[i];
13375 PushID(font);
13376 DebugNodeFont(font);
13377 PopID();
13378 }
13379 if (TreeNode("Font Atlas", "Font Atlas (%dx%d pixels)", atlas->TexWidth, atlas->TexHeight))
13380 {
13381 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13382 ImGuiMetricsConfig* cfg = &g.DebugMetricsConfig;
13383 Checkbox("Tint with Text Color", &cfg->ShowAtlasTintedWithTextColor); // Using text color ensure visibility of core atlas data, but will alter custom colored icons
13384 ImVec4 tint_col = cfg->ShowAtlasTintedWithTextColor ? GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol_Text) : ImVec4(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f);
13385 ImVec4 border_col = GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol_Border);
13386 Image(atlas->TexID, ImVec2((float)atlas->TexWidth, (float)atlas->TexHeight), ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), ImVec2(1.0f, 1.0f), tint_col, border_col);
13387 TreePop();
13388 }
13389}
13390
13391void ImGui::ShowMetricsWindow(bool* p_open)
13392{
13393 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13394 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
13395 ImGuiMetricsConfig* cfg = &g.DebugMetricsConfig;
13396 if (cfg->ShowDebugLog)
13397 ShowDebugLogWindow(&cfg->ShowDebugLog);
13398 if (cfg->ShowStackTool)
13399 ShowStackToolWindow(&cfg->ShowStackTool);
13400
13401 if (!Begin("Dear ImGui Metrics/Debugger", p_open) || GetCurrentWindow()->BeginCount > 1)
13402 {
13403 End();
13404 return;
13405 }
13406
13407 // Basic info
13408 Text("Dear ImGui %s", GetVersion());
13409 Text("Application average %.3f ms/frame (%.1f FPS)", 1000.0f / io.Framerate, io.Framerate);
13410 Text("%d vertices, %d indices (%d triangles)", io.MetricsRenderVertices, io.MetricsRenderIndices, io.MetricsRenderIndices / 3);
13411 Text("%d visible windows, %d active allocations", io.MetricsRenderWindows, io.MetricsActiveAllocations);
13412 //SameLine(); if (SmallButton("GC")) { g.GcCompactAll = true; }
13413
13414 Separator();
13415
13416 // Debugging enums
13417 enum { WRT_OuterRect, WRT_OuterRectClipped, WRT_InnerRect, WRT_InnerClipRect, WRT_WorkRect, WRT_Content, WRT_ContentIdeal, WRT_ContentRegionRect, WRT_Count }; // Windows Rect Type
13418 const char* wrt_rects_names[WRT_Count] = { "OuterRect", "OuterRectClipped", "InnerRect", "InnerClipRect", "WorkRect", "Content", "ContentIdeal", "ContentRegionRect" };
13419 enum { TRT_OuterRect, TRT_InnerRect, TRT_WorkRect, TRT_HostClipRect, TRT_InnerClipRect, TRT_BackgroundClipRect, TRT_ColumnsRect, TRT_ColumnsWorkRect, TRT_ColumnsClipRect, TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersUsed, TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal, TRT_ColumnsContentFrozen, TRT_ColumnsContentUnfrozen, TRT_Count }; // Tables Rect Type
13420 const char* trt_rects_names[TRT_Count] = { "OuterRect", "InnerRect", "WorkRect", "HostClipRect", "InnerClipRect", "BackgroundClipRect", "ColumnsRect", "ColumnsWorkRect", "ColumnsClipRect", "ColumnsContentHeadersUsed", "ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal", "ColumnsContentFrozen", "ColumnsContentUnfrozen" };
13421 if (cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType < 0)
13422 cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType = WRT_WorkRect;
13423 if (cfg->ShowTablesRectsType < 0)
13424 cfg->ShowTablesRectsType = TRT_WorkRect;
13425
13426 struct Funcs
13427 {
13428 static ImRect GetTableRect(ImGuiTable* table, int rect_type, int n)
13429 {
13430 ImGuiTableInstanceData* table_instance = TableGetInstanceData(table, table->InstanceCurrent); // Always using last submitted instance
13431 if (rect_type == TRT_OuterRect) { return table->OuterRect; }
13432 else if (rect_type == TRT_InnerRect) { return table->InnerRect; }
13433 else if (rect_type == TRT_WorkRect) { return table->WorkRect; }
13434 else if (rect_type == TRT_HostClipRect) { return table->HostClipRect; }
13435 else if (rect_type == TRT_InnerClipRect) { return table->InnerClipRect; }
13436 else if (rect_type == TRT_BackgroundClipRect) { return table->BgClipRect; }
13437 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsRect) { ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->MinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->MaxX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table_instance->LastOuterHeight); }
13438 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsWorkRect) { ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->WorkRect.Min.y, c->WorkMaxX, table->WorkRect.Max.y); }
13439 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsClipRect) { ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return c->ClipRect; }
13440 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersUsed){ ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->ContentMaxXHeadersUsed, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table_instance->LastFirstRowHeight); } // Note: y1/y2 not always accurate
13441 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal){ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->ContentMaxXHeadersIdeal, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table_instance->LastFirstRowHeight); }
13442 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentFrozen) { ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->ContentMaxXFrozen, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table_instance->LastFrozenHeight); }
13443 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentUnfrozen) { ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table_instance->LastFrozenHeight, c->ContentMaxXUnfrozen, table->InnerClipRect.Max.y); }
13444 IM_ASSERT(0);
13445 return ImRect();
13446 }
13447
13448 static ImRect GetWindowRect(ImGuiWindow* window, int rect_type)
13449 {
13450 if (rect_type == WRT_OuterRect) { return window->Rect(); }
13451 else if (rect_type == WRT_OuterRectClipped) { return window->OuterRectClipped; }
13452 else if (rect_type == WRT_InnerRect) { return window->InnerRect; }
13453 else if (rect_type == WRT_InnerClipRect) { return window->InnerClipRect; }
13454 else if (rect_type == WRT_WorkRect) { return window->WorkRect; }
13455 else if (rect_type == WRT_Content) { ImVec2 min = window->InnerRect.Min - window->Scroll + window->WindowPadding; return ImRect(min, min + window->ContentSize); }
13456 else if (rect_type == WRT_ContentIdeal) { ImVec2 min = window->InnerRect.Min - window->Scroll + window->WindowPadding; return ImRect(min, min + window->ContentSizeIdeal); }
13457 else if (rect_type == WRT_ContentRegionRect) { return window->ContentRegionRect; }
13458 IM_ASSERT(0);
13459 return ImRect();
13460 }
13461 };
13462
13463 // Tools
13464 if (TreeNode("Tools"))
13465 {
13466 bool show_encoding_viewer = TreeNode("UTF-8 Encoding viewer");
13467 SameLine();
13468 MetricsHelpMarker("You can also call ImGui::DebugTextEncoding() from your code with a given string to test that your UTF-8 encoding settings are correct.");
13469 if (show_encoding_viewer)
13470 {
13471 static char buf[100] = "";
13472 SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
13473 InputText("##Text", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
13474 if (buf[0] != 0)
13475 DebugTextEncoding(buf);
13476 TreePop();
13477 }
13478
13479 // The Item Picker tool is super useful to visually select an item and break into the call-stack of where it was submitted.
13480 if (Checkbox("Show Item Picker", &g.DebugItemPickerActive) && g.DebugItemPickerActive)
13481 DebugStartItemPicker();
13482 SameLine();
13483 MetricsHelpMarker("Will call the IM_DEBUG_BREAK() macro to break in debugger.\nWarning: If you don't have a debugger attached, this will probably crash.");
13484
13485 // Stack Tool is your best friend!
13486 Checkbox("Show Debug Log", &cfg->ShowDebugLog);
13487 SameLine();
13488 MetricsHelpMarker("You can also call ImGui::ShowDebugLogWindow() from your code.");
13489
13490 // Stack Tool is your best friend!
13491 Checkbox("Show Stack Tool", &cfg->ShowStackTool);
13492 SameLine();
13493 MetricsHelpMarker("You can also call ImGui::ShowStackToolWindow() from your code.");
13494
13495 Checkbox("Show windows begin order", &cfg->ShowWindowsBeginOrder);
13496 Checkbox("Show windows rectangles", &cfg->ShowWindowsRects);
13497 SameLine();
13498 SetNextItemWidth(GetFontSize() * 12);
13499 cfg->ShowWindowsRects |= Combo("##show_windows_rect_type", &cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType, wrt_rects_names, WRT_Count, WRT_Count);
13500 if (cfg->ShowWindowsRects && g.NavWindow != NULL)
13501 {
13502 BulletText("'%s':", g.NavWindow->Name);
13503 Indent();
13504 for (int rect_n = 0; rect_n < WRT_Count; rect_n++)
13505 {
13506 ImRect r = Funcs::GetWindowRect(g.NavWindow, rect_n);
13507 Text("(%6.1f,%6.1f) (%6.1f,%6.1f) Size (%6.1f,%6.1f) %s", r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y, r.GetWidth(), r.GetHeight(), wrt_rects_names[rect_n]);
13508 }
13509 Unindent();
13510 }
13511
13512 Checkbox("Show tables rectangles", &cfg->ShowTablesRects);
13513 SameLine();
13514 SetNextItemWidth(GetFontSize() * 12);
13515 cfg->ShowTablesRects |= Combo("##show_table_rects_type", &cfg->ShowTablesRectsType, trt_rects_names, TRT_Count, TRT_Count);
13516 if (cfg->ShowTablesRects && g.NavWindow != NULL)
13517 {
13518 for (int table_n = 0; table_n < g.Tables.GetMapSize(); table_n++)
13519 {
13520 ImGuiTable* table = g.Tables.TryGetMapData(table_n);
13521 if (table == NULL || table->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 1 || (table->OuterWindow != g.NavWindow && table->InnerWindow != g.NavWindow))
13522 continue;
13523
13524 BulletText("Table 0x%08X (%d columns, in '%s')", table->ID, table->ColumnsCount, table->OuterWindow->Name);
13525 if (IsItemHovered())
13526 GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(table->OuterRect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), table->OuterRect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
13527 Indent();
13528 char buf[128];
13529 for (int rect_n = 0; rect_n < TRT_Count; rect_n++)
13530 {
13531 if (rect_n >= TRT_ColumnsRect)
13532 {
13533 if (rect_n != TRT_ColumnsRect && rect_n != TRT_ColumnsClipRect)
13534 continue;
13535 for (int column_n = 0; column_n < table->ColumnsCount; column_n++)
13536 {
13537 ImRect r = Funcs::GetTableRect(table, rect_n, column_n);
13538 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%6.1f,%6.1f) (%6.1f,%6.1f) Size (%6.1f,%6.1f) Col %d %s", r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y, r.GetWidth(), r.GetHeight(), column_n, trt_rects_names[rect_n]);
13539 Selectable(buf);
13540 if (IsItemHovered())
13541 GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), r.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
13542 }
13543 }
13544 else
13545 {
13546 ImRect r = Funcs::GetTableRect(table, rect_n, -1);
13547 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%6.1f,%6.1f) (%6.1f,%6.1f) Size (%6.1f,%6.1f) %s", r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y, r.GetWidth(), r.GetHeight(), trt_rects_names[rect_n]);
13548 Selectable(buf);
13549 if (IsItemHovered())
13550 GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), r.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
13551 }
13552 }
13553 Unindent();
13554 }
13555 }
13556
13557 Checkbox("Debug Begin/BeginChild return value", &io.ConfigDebugBeginReturnValueLoop);
13558 SameLine();
13559 MetricsHelpMarker("Some calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return false.\n\nWill cycle through window depths then repeat. Windows should be flickering while running.");
13560
13561 TreePop();
13562 }
13563
13564 // Windows
13565 if (TreeNode("Windows", "Windows (%d)", g.Windows.Size))
13566 {
13567 //SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
13568 DebugNodeWindowsList(&g.Windows, "By display order");
13569 DebugNodeWindowsList(&g.WindowsFocusOrder, "By focus order (root windows)");
13570 if (TreeNode("By submission order (begin stack)"))
13571 {
13572 // Here we display windows in their submitted order/hierarchy, however note that the Begin stack doesn't constitute a Parent<>Child relationship!
13573 ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>& temp_buffer = g.WindowsTempSortBuffer;
13574 temp_buffer.resize(0);
13575 for (int i = 0; i < g.Windows.Size; i++)
13576 if (g.Windows[i]->LastFrameActive + 1 >= g.FrameCount)
13577 temp_buffer.push_back(g.Windows[i]);
13578 struct Func { static int IMGUI_CDECL WindowComparerByBeginOrder(const void* lhs, const void* rhs) { return ((int)(*(const ImGuiWindow* const *)lhs)->BeginOrderWithinContext - (*(const ImGuiWindow* const*)rhs)->BeginOrderWithinContext); } };
13579 ImQsort(temp_buffer.Data, (size_t)temp_buffer.Size, sizeof(ImGuiWindow*), Func::WindowComparerByBeginOrder);
13580 DebugNodeWindowsListByBeginStackParent(temp_buffer.Data, temp_buffer.Size, NULL);
13581 TreePop();
13582 }
13583
13584 TreePop();
13585 }
13586
13587 // DrawLists
13588 int drawlist_count = 0;
13589 for (int viewport_i = 0; viewport_i < g.Viewports.Size; viewport_i++)
13590 drawlist_count += g.Viewports[viewport_i]->DrawDataBuilder.GetDrawListCount();
13591 if (TreeNode("DrawLists", "DrawLists (%d)", drawlist_count))
13592 {
13593 Checkbox("Show ImDrawCmd mesh when hovering", &cfg->ShowDrawCmdMesh);
13594 Checkbox("Show ImDrawCmd bounding boxes when hovering", &cfg->ShowDrawCmdBoundingBoxes);
13595 for (int viewport_i = 0; viewport_i < g.Viewports.Size; viewport_i++)
13596 {
13597 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[viewport_i];
13598 for (int layer_i = 0; layer_i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers); layer_i++)
13599 for (int draw_list_i = 0; draw_list_i < viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer_i].Size; draw_list_i++)
13600 DebugNodeDrawList(NULL, viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer_i][draw_list_i], "DrawList");
13601 }
13602 TreePop();
13603 }
13604
13605 // Viewports
13606 if (TreeNode("Viewports", "Viewports (%d)", g.Viewports.Size))
13607 {
13608 Indent(GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
13609 RenderViewportsThumbnails();
13610 Unindent(GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
13611 for (int i = 0; i < g.Viewports.Size; i++)
13612 DebugNodeViewport(g.Viewports[i]);
13613 TreePop();
13614 }
13615
13616 // Details for Popups
13617 if (TreeNode("Popups", "Popups (%d)", g.OpenPopupStack.Size))
13618 {
13619 for (int i = 0; i < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; i++)
13620 {
13621 // As it's difficult to interact with tree nodes while popups are open, we display everything inline.
13622 const ImGuiPopupData* popup_data = &g.OpenPopupStack[i];
13623 ImGuiWindow* window = popup_data->Window;
13624 BulletText("PopupID: %08x, Window: '%s' (%s%s), BackupNavWindow '%s', ParentWindow '%s'",
13625 popup_data->PopupId, window ? window->Name : "NULL", window && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? "Child;" : "", window && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) ? "Menu;" : "",
13626 popup_data->BackupNavWindow ? popup_data->BackupNavWindow->Name : "NULL", window && window->ParentWindow ? window->ParentWindow->Name : "NULL");
13627 }
13628 TreePop();
13629 }
13630
13631 // Details for TabBars
13632 if (TreeNode("TabBars", "Tab Bars (%d)", g.TabBars.GetAliveCount()))
13633 {
13634 for (int n = 0; n < g.TabBars.GetMapSize(); n++)
13635 if (ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.TabBars.TryGetMapData(n))
13636 {
13637 PushID(tab_bar);
13638 DebugNodeTabBar(tab_bar, "TabBar");
13639 PopID();
13640 }
13641 TreePop();
13642 }
13643
13644 // Details for Tables
13645 if (TreeNode("Tables", "Tables (%d)", g.Tables.GetAliveCount()))
13646 {
13647 for (int n = 0; n < g.Tables.GetMapSize(); n++)
13648 if (ImGuiTable* table = g.Tables.TryGetMapData(n))
13649 DebugNodeTable(table);
13650 TreePop();
13651 }
13652
13653 // Details for Fonts
13654 ImFontAtlas* atlas = g.IO.Fonts;
13655 if (TreeNode("Fonts", "Fonts (%d)", atlas->Fonts.Size))
13656 {
13657 ShowFontAtlas(atlas);
13658 TreePop();
13659 }
13660
13661 // Details for InputText
13662 if (TreeNode("InputText"))
13663 {
13664 DebugNodeInputTextState(&g.InputTextState);
13665 TreePop();
13666 }
13667
13668 // Details for Docking
13669#ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
13670 if (TreeNode("Docking"))
13671 {
13672 TreePop();
13673 }
13674#endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
13675
13676 // Settings
13677 if (TreeNode("Settings"))
13678 {
13679 if (SmallButton("Clear"))
13680 ClearIniSettings();
13681 SameLine();
13682 if (SmallButton("Save to memory"))
13683 SaveIniSettingsToMemory();
13684 SameLine();
13685 if (SmallButton("Save to disk"))
13686 SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
13687 SameLine();
13688 if (g.IO.IniFilename)
13689 Text("\"%s\"", g.IO.IniFilename);
13690 else
13691 TextUnformatted("<NULL>");
13692 Text("SettingsDirtyTimer %.2f", g.SettingsDirtyTimer);
13693 if (TreeNode("SettingsHandlers", "Settings handlers: (%d)", g.SettingsHandlers.Size))
13694 {
13695 for (int n = 0; n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; n++)
13696 BulletText("%s", g.SettingsHandlers[n].TypeName);
13697 TreePop();
13698 }
13699 if (TreeNode("SettingsWindows", "Settings packed data: Windows: %d bytes", g.SettingsWindows.size()))
13700 {
13701 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
13702 DebugNodeWindowSettings(settings);
13703 TreePop();
13704 }
13705
13706 if (TreeNode("SettingsTables", "Settings packed data: Tables: %d bytes", g.SettingsTables.size()))
13707 {
13708 for (ImGuiTableSettings* settings = g.SettingsTables.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsTables.next_chunk(settings))
13709 DebugNodeTableSettings(settings);
13710 TreePop();
13711 }
13712
13713#ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
13714#endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
13715
13716 if (TreeNode("SettingsIniData", "Settings unpacked data (.ini): %d bytes", g.SettingsIniData.size()))
13717 {
13718 InputTextMultiline("##Ini", (char*)(void*)g.SettingsIniData.c_str(), g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Size, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, GetTextLineHeight() * 20), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
13719 TreePop();
13720 }
13721 TreePop();
13722 }
13723
13724 if (TreeNode("Inputs"))
13725 {
13726 Text("KEYBOARD/GAMEPAD/MOUSE KEYS");
13727 {
13728 // We iterate both legacy native range and named ImGuiKey ranges, which is a little odd but this allows displaying the data for old/new backends.
13729 // User code should never have to go through such hoops! You can generally iterate between ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN and ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END.
13730 Indent();
13731#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
13732 struct funcs { static bool IsLegacyNativeDupe(ImGuiKey) { return false; } };
13733#else
13734 struct funcs { static bool IsLegacyNativeDupe(ImGuiKey key) { return key < 512 && GetIO().KeyMap[key] != -1; } }; // Hide Native<>ImGuiKey duplicates when both exists in the array
13735 //Text("Legacy raw:"); for (ImGuiKey key = ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET; key < ImGuiKey_COUNT; key++) { if (io.KeysDown[key]) { SameLine(); Text("\"%s\" %d", GetKeyName(key), key); } }
13736#endif
13737 Text("Keys down:"); for (ImGuiKey key = ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET; key < ImGuiKey_COUNT; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1)) { if (funcs::IsLegacyNativeDupe(key) || !IsKeyDown(key)) continue; SameLine(); Text(IsNamedKey(key) ? "\"%s\"" : "\"%s\" %d", GetKeyName(key), key); SameLine(); Text("(%.02f)", GetKeyData(key)->DownDuration); }
13738 Text("Keys pressed:"); for (ImGuiKey key = ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET; key < ImGuiKey_COUNT; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1)) { if (funcs::IsLegacyNativeDupe(key) || !IsKeyPressed(key)) continue; SameLine(); Text(IsNamedKey(key) ? "\"%s\"" : "\"%s\" %d", GetKeyName(key), key); }
13739 Text("Keys released:"); for (ImGuiKey key = ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET; key < ImGuiKey_COUNT; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1)) { if (funcs::IsLegacyNativeDupe(key) || !IsKeyReleased(key)) continue; SameLine(); Text(IsNamedKey(key) ? "\"%s\"" : "\"%s\" %d", GetKeyName(key), key); }
13740 Text("Keys mods: %s%s%s%s", io.KeyCtrl ? "CTRL " : "", io.KeyShift ? "SHIFT " : "", io.KeyAlt ? "ALT " : "", io.KeySuper ? "SUPER " : "");
13741 Text("Chars queue:"); for (int i = 0; i < io.InputQueueCharacters.Size; i++) { ImWchar c = io.InputQueueCharacters[i]; SameLine(); Text("\'%c\' (0x%04X)", (c > ' ' && c <= 255) ? (char)c : '?', c); } // FIXME: We should convert 'c' to UTF-8 here but the functions are not public.
13742 DebugRenderKeyboardPreview(GetWindowDrawList());
13743 Unindent();
13744 }
13745
13746 Text("MOUSE STATE");
13747 {
13748 Indent();
13749 if (IsMousePosValid())
13750 Text("Mouse pos: (%g, %g)", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);
13751 else
13752 Text("Mouse pos: <INVALID>");
13753 Text("Mouse delta: (%g, %g)", io.MouseDelta.x, io.MouseDelta.y);
13754 int count = IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown);
13755 Text("Mouse down:"); for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) if (IsMouseDown(i)) { SameLine(); Text("b%d (%.02f secs)", i, io.MouseDownDuration[i]); }
13756 Text("Mouse clicked:"); for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) if (IsMouseClicked(i)) { SameLine(); Text("b%d (%d)", i, io.MouseClickedCount[i]); }
13757 Text("Mouse released:"); for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) if (IsMouseReleased(i)) { SameLine(); Text("b%d", i); }
13758 Text("Mouse wheel: %.1f", io.MouseWheel);
13759 Text("Mouse source: %s", GetMouseSourceName(io.MouseSource));
13760 Text("Pen Pressure: %.1f", io.PenPressure); // Note: currently unused
13761 Unindent();
13762 }
13763
13764 Text("MOUSE WHEELING");
13765 {
13766 Indent();
13767 Text("WheelingWindow: '%s'", g.WheelingWindow ? g.WheelingWindow->Name : "NULL");
13768 Text("WheelingWindowReleaseTimer: %.2f", g.WheelingWindowReleaseTimer);
13769 Text("WheelingAxisAvg[] = { %.3f, %.3f }, Main Axis: %s", g.WheelingAxisAvg.x, g.WheelingAxisAvg.y, (g.WheelingAxisAvg.x > g.WheelingAxisAvg.y) ? "X" : (g.WheelingAxisAvg.x < g.WheelingAxisAvg.y) ? "Y" : "<none>");
13770 Unindent();
13771 }
13772
13773 Text("KEY OWNERS");
13774 {
13775 Indent();
13776 if (BeginListBox("##owners", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * 6)))
13777 {
13778 for (ImGuiKey key = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN; key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1))
13779 {
13780 ImGuiKeyOwnerData* owner_data = GetKeyOwnerData(&g, key);
13781 if (owner_data->OwnerCurr == ImGuiKeyOwner_None)
13782 continue;
13783 Text("%s: 0x%08X%s", GetKeyName(key), owner_data->OwnerCurr,
13784 owner_data->LockUntilRelease ? " LockUntilRelease" : owner_data->LockThisFrame ? " LockThisFrame" : "");
13785 DebugLocateItemOnHover(owner_data->OwnerCurr);
13786 }
13787 EndListBox();
13788 }
13789 Unindent();
13790 }
13791 Text("SHORTCUT ROUTING");
13792 {
13793 Indent();
13794 if (BeginListBox("##routes", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * 6)))
13795 {
13796 for (ImGuiKey key = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN; key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1))
13797 {
13798 ImGuiKeyRoutingTable* rt = &g.KeysRoutingTable;
13799 for (ImGuiKeyRoutingIndex idx = rt->Index[key - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN]; idx != -1; )
13800 {
13801 char key_chord_name[64];
13802 ImGuiKeyRoutingData* routing_data = &rt->Entries[idx];
13803 GetKeyChordName(key | routing_data->Mods, key_chord_name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(key_chord_name));
13804 Text("%s: 0x%08X", key_chord_name, routing_data->RoutingCurr);
13805 DebugLocateItemOnHover(routing_data->RoutingCurr);
13806 idx = routing_data->NextEntryIndex;
13807 }
13808 }
13809 EndListBox();
13810 }
13811 Text("(ActiveIdUsing: AllKeyboardKeys: %d, NavDirMask: 0x%X)", g.ActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys, g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask);
13812 Unindent();
13813 }
13814 TreePop();
13815 }
13816
13817 if (TreeNode("Internal state"))
13818 {
13819 Text("WINDOWING");
13820 Indent();
13821 Text("HoveredWindow: '%s'", g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->Name : "NULL");
13822 Text("HoveredWindow->Root: '%s'", g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow->Name : "NULL");
13823 Text("HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow: '%s'", g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow ? g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow->Name : "NULL");
13824 Text("MovingWindow: '%s'", g.MovingWindow ? g.MovingWindow->Name : "NULL");
13825 Unindent();
13826
13827 Text("ITEMS");
13828 Indent();
13829 Text("ActiveId: 0x%08X/0x%08X (%.2f sec), AllowOverlap: %d, Source: %s", g.ActiveId, g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame, g.ActiveIdTimer, g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap, GetInputSourceName(g.ActiveIdSource));
13830 DebugLocateItemOnHover(g.ActiveId);
13831 Text("ActiveIdWindow: '%s'", g.ActiveIdWindow ? g.ActiveIdWindow->Name : "NULL");
13832 Text("ActiveIdUsing: AllKeyboardKeys: %d, NavDirMask: %X", g.ActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys, g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask);
13833 Text("HoveredId: 0x%08X (%.2f sec), AllowOverlap: %d", g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame, g.HoveredIdTimer, g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap); // Not displaying g.HoveredId as it is update mid-frame
13834 Text("HoverDelayId: 0x%08X, Timer: %.2f, ClearTimer: %.2f", g.HoverDelayId, g.HoverDelayTimer, g.HoverDelayClearTimer);
13835 Text("DragDrop: %d, SourceId = 0x%08X, Payload \"%s\" (%d bytes)", g.DragDropActive, g.DragDropPayload.SourceId, g.DragDropPayload.DataType, g.DragDropPayload.DataSize);
13836 DebugLocateItemOnHover(g.DragDropPayload.SourceId);
13837 Unindent();
13838
13839 Text("NAV,FOCUS");
13840 Indent();
13841 Text("NavWindow: '%s'", g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Name : "NULL");
13842 Text("NavId: 0x%08X, NavLayer: %d", g.NavId, g.NavLayer);
13843 DebugLocateItemOnHover(g.NavId);
13844 Text("NavInputSource: %s", GetInputSourceName(g.NavInputSource));
13845 Text("NavActive: %d, NavVisible: %d", g.IO.NavActive, g.IO.NavVisible);
13846 Text("NavActivateId/DownId/PressedId: %08X/%08X/%08X", g.NavActivateId, g.NavActivateDownId, g.NavActivatePressedId);
13847 Text("NavActivateFlags: %04X", g.NavActivateFlags);
13848 Text("NavDisableHighlight: %d, NavDisableMouseHover: %d", g.NavDisableHighlight, g.NavDisableMouseHover);
13849 Text("NavFocusScopeId = 0x%08X", g.NavFocusScopeId);
13850 Text("NavWindowingTarget: '%s'", g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingTarget->Name : "NULL");
13851 Unindent();
13852
13853 TreePop();
13854 }
13855
13856 // Overlay: Display windows Rectangles and Begin Order
13857 if (cfg->ShowWindowsRects || cfg->ShowWindowsBeginOrder)
13858 {
13859 for (int n = 0; n < g.Windows.Size; n++)
13860 {
13861 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[n];
13862 if (!window->WasActive)
13863 continue;
13864 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
13865 if (cfg->ShowWindowsRects)
13866 {
13867 ImRect r = Funcs::GetWindowRect(window, cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType);
13868 draw_list->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 128, 255));
13869 }
13870 if (cfg->ShowWindowsBeginOrder && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
13871 {
13872 char buf[32];
13873 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "%d", window->BeginOrderWithinContext);
13874 float font_size = GetFontSize();
13875 draw_list->AddRectFilled(window->Pos, window->Pos + ImVec2(font_size, font_size), IM_COL32(200, 100, 100, 255));
13876 draw_list->AddText(window->Pos, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255), buf);
13877 }
13878 }
13879 }
13880
13881 // Overlay: Display Tables Rectangles
13882 if (cfg->ShowTablesRects)
13883 {
13884 for (int table_n = 0; table_n < g.Tables.GetMapSize(); table_n++)
13885 {
13886 ImGuiTable* table = g.Tables.TryGetMapData(table_n);
13887 if (table == NULL || table->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 1)
13888 continue;
13889 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(table->OuterWindow);
13890 if (cfg->ShowTablesRectsType >= TRT_ColumnsRect)
13891 {
13892 for (int column_n = 0; column_n < table->ColumnsCount; column_n++)
13893 {
13894 ImRect r = Funcs::GetTableRect(table, cfg->ShowTablesRectsType, column_n);
13895 ImU32 col = (table->HoveredColumnBody == column_n) ? IM_COL32(255, 255, 128, 255) : IM_COL32(255, 0, 128, 255);
13896 float thickness = (table->HoveredColumnBody == column_n) ? 3.0f : 1.0f;
13897 draw_list->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, col, 0.0f, 0, thickness);
13898 }
13899 }
13900 else
13901 {
13902 ImRect r = Funcs::GetTableRect(table, cfg->ShowTablesRectsType, -1);
13903 draw_list->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 128, 255));
13904 }
13905 }
13906 }
13907
13908#ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
13909 // Overlay: Display Docking info
13910 if (show_docking_nodes && g.IO.KeyCtrl)
13911 {
13912 }
13913#endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
13914
13915 End();
13916}
13917
13918// [DEBUG] Display contents of Columns
13919void ImGui::DebugNodeColumns(ImGuiOldColumns* columns)
13920{
13921 if (!TreeNode((void*)(uintptr_t)columns->ID, "Columns Id: 0x%08X, Count: %d, Flags: 0x%04X", columns->ID, columns->Count, columns->Flags))
13922 return;
13923 BulletText("Width: %.1f (MinX: %.1f, MaxX: %.1f)", columns->OffMaxX - columns->OffMinX, columns->OffMinX, columns->OffMaxX);
13924 for (int column_n = 0; column_n < columns->Columns.Size; column_n++)
13925 BulletText("Column %02d: OffsetNorm %.3f (= %.1f px)", column_n, columns->Columns[column_n].OffsetNorm, GetColumnOffsetFromNorm(columns, columns->Columns[column_n].OffsetNorm));
13926 TreePop();
13927}
13928
13929// [DEBUG] Display contents of ImDrawList
13930void ImGui::DebugNodeDrawList(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImDrawList* draw_list, const char* label)
13931{
13932 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13933 ImGuiMetricsConfig* cfg = &g.DebugMetricsConfig;
13934 int cmd_count = draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size;
13935 if (cmd_count > 0 && draw_list->CmdBuffer.back().ElemCount == 0 && draw_list->CmdBuffer.back().UserCallback == NULL)
13936 cmd_count--;
13937 bool node_open = TreeNode(draw_list, "%s: '%s' %d vtx, %d indices, %d cmds", label, draw_list->_OwnerName ? draw_list->_OwnerName : "", draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size, draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size, cmd_count);
13938 if (draw_list == GetWindowDrawList())
13939 {
13940 SameLine();
13941 TextColored(ImVec4(1.0f, 0.4f, 0.4f, 1.0f), "CURRENTLY APPENDING"); // Can't display stats for active draw list! (we don't have the data double-buffered)
13942 if (node_open)
13943 TreePop();
13944 return;
13945 }
13946
13947 ImDrawList* fg_draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window); // Render additional visuals into the top-most draw list
13948 if (window && IsItemHovered() && fg_draw_list)
13949 fg_draw_list->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
13950 if (!node_open)
13951 return;
13952
13953 if (window && !window->WasActive)
13954 TextDisabled("Warning: owning Window is inactive. This DrawList is not being rendered!");
13955
13956 for (const ImDrawCmd* pcmd = draw_list->CmdBuffer.Data; pcmd < draw_list->CmdBuffer.Data + cmd_count; pcmd++)
13957 {
13958 if (pcmd->UserCallback)
13959 {
13960 BulletText("Callback %p, user_data %p", pcmd->UserCallback, pcmd->UserCallbackData);
13961 continue;
13962 }
13963
13964 char buf[300];
13965 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "DrawCmd:%5d tris, Tex 0x%p, ClipRect (%4.0f,%4.0f)-(%4.0f,%4.0f)",
13966 pcmd->ElemCount / 3, (void*)(intptr_t)pcmd->TextureId,
13967 pcmd->ClipRect.x, pcmd->ClipRect.y, pcmd->ClipRect.z, pcmd->ClipRect.w);
13968 bool pcmd_node_open = TreeNode((void*)(pcmd - draw_list->CmdBuffer.begin()), "%s", buf);
13969 if (IsItemHovered() && (cfg->ShowDrawCmdMesh || cfg->ShowDrawCmdBoundingBoxes) && fg_draw_list)
13970 DebugNodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox(fg_draw_list, draw_list, pcmd, cfg->ShowDrawCmdMesh, cfg->ShowDrawCmdBoundingBoxes);
13971 if (!pcmd_node_open)
13972 continue;
13973
13974 // Calculate approximate coverage area (touched pixel count)
13975 // This will be in pixels squared as long there's no post-scaling happening to the renderer output.
13976 const ImDrawIdx* idx_buffer = (draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size > 0) ? draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data : NULL;
13977 const ImDrawVert* vtx_buffer = draw_list->VtxBuffer.Data + pcmd->VtxOffset;
13978 float total_area = 0.0f;
13979 for (unsigned int idx_n = pcmd->IdxOffset; idx_n < pcmd->IdxOffset + pcmd->ElemCount; )
13980 {
13981 ImVec2 triangle[3];
13982 for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++, idx_n++)
13983 triangle[n] = vtx_buffer[idx_buffer ? idx_buffer[idx_n] : idx_n].pos;
13984 total_area += ImTriangleArea(triangle[0], triangle[1], triangle[2]);
13985 }
13986
13987 // Display vertex information summary. Hover to get all triangles drawn in wire-frame
13988 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "Mesh: ElemCount: %d, VtxOffset: +%d, IdxOffset: +%d, Area: ~%0.f px", pcmd->ElemCount, pcmd->VtxOffset, pcmd->IdxOffset, total_area);
13989 Selectable(buf);
13990 if (IsItemHovered() && fg_draw_list)
13991 DebugNodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox(fg_draw_list, draw_list, pcmd, true, false);
13992
13993 // Display individual triangles/vertices. Hover on to get the corresponding triangle highlighted.
13994 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
13995 clipper.Begin(pcmd->ElemCount / 3); // Manually coarse clip our print out of individual vertices to save CPU, only items that may be visible.
13996 while (clipper.Step())
13997 for (int prim = clipper.DisplayStart, idx_i = pcmd->IdxOffset + clipper.DisplayStart * 3; prim < clipper.DisplayEnd; prim++)
13998 {
13999 char* buf_p = buf, * buf_end = buf + IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf);
14000 ImVec2 triangle[3];
14001 for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++, idx_i++)
14002 {
14003 const ImDrawVert& v = vtx_buffer[idx_buffer ? idx_buffer[idx_i] : idx_i];
14004 triangle[n] = v.pos;
14005 buf_p += ImFormatString(buf_p, buf_end - buf_p, "%s %04d: pos (%8.2f,%8.2f), uv (%.6f,%.6f), col %08X\n",
14006 (n == 0) ? "Vert:" : " ", idx_i, v.pos.x, v.pos.y, v.uv.x, v.uv.y, v.col);
14007 }
14008
14009 Selectable(buf, false);
14010 if (fg_draw_list && IsItemHovered())
14011 {
14012 ImDrawListFlags backup_flags = fg_draw_list->Flags;
14013 fg_draw_list->Flags &= ~ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines; // Disable AA on triangle outlines is more readable for very large and thin triangles.
14014 fg_draw_list->AddPolyline(triangle, 3, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), ImDrawFlags_Closed, 1.0f);
14015 fg_draw_list->Flags = backup_flags;
14016 }
14017 }
14018 TreePop();
14019 }
14020 TreePop();
14021}
14022
14023// [DEBUG] Display mesh/aabb of a ImDrawCmd
14024void ImGui::DebugNodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox(ImDrawList* out_draw_list, const ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImDrawCmd* draw_cmd, bool show_mesh, bool show_aabb)
14025{
14026 IM_ASSERT(show_mesh || show_aabb);
14027
14028 // Draw wire-frame version of all triangles
14029 ImRect clip_rect = draw_cmd->ClipRect;
14030 ImRect vtxs_rect(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
14031 ImDrawListFlags backup_flags = out_draw_list->Flags;
14032 out_draw_list->Flags &= ~ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines; // Disable AA on triangle outlines is more readable for very large and thin triangles.
14033 for (unsigned int idx_n = draw_cmd->IdxOffset, idx_end = draw_cmd->IdxOffset + draw_cmd->ElemCount; idx_n < idx_end; )
14034 {
14035 ImDrawIdx* idx_buffer = (draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size > 0) ? draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data : NULL; // We don't hold on those pointers past iterations as ->AddPolyline() may invalidate them if out_draw_list==draw_list
14036 ImDrawVert* vtx_buffer = draw_list->VtxBuffer.Data + draw_cmd->VtxOffset;
14037
14038 ImVec2 triangle[3];
14039 for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++, idx_n++)
14040 vtxs_rect.Add((triangle[n] = vtx_buffer[idx_buffer ? idx_buffer[idx_n] : idx_n].pos));
14041 if (show_mesh)
14042 out_draw_list->AddPolyline(triangle, 3, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), ImDrawFlags_Closed, 1.0f); // In yellow: mesh triangles
14043 }
14044 // Draw bounding boxes
14045 if (show_aabb)
14046 {
14047 out_draw_list->AddRect(ImFloor(clip_rect.Min), ImFloor(clip_rect.Max), IM_COL32(255, 0, 255, 255)); // In pink: clipping rectangle submitted to GPU
14048 out_draw_list->AddRect(ImFloor(vtxs_rect.Min), ImFloor(vtxs_rect.Max), IM_COL32(0, 255, 255, 255)); // In cyan: bounding box of triangles
14049 }
14050 out_draw_list->Flags = backup_flags;
14051}
14052
14053// [DEBUG] Display details for a single font, called by ShowStyleEditor().
14054void ImGui::DebugNodeFont(ImFont* font)
14055{
14056 bool opened = TreeNode(font, "Font: \"%s\"\n%.2f px, %d glyphs, %d file(s)",
14057 font->ConfigData ? font->ConfigData[0].Name : "", font->FontSize, font->Glyphs.Size, font->ConfigDataCount);
14058 SameLine();
14059 if (SmallButton("Set as default"))
14060 GetIO().FontDefault = font;
14061 if (!opened)
14062 return;
14063
14064 // Display preview text
14065 PushFont(font);
14066 Text("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog");
14067 PopFont();
14068
14069 // Display details
14070 SetNextItemWidth(GetFontSize() * 8);
14071 DragFloat("Font scale", &font->Scale, 0.005f, 0.3f, 2.0f, "%.1f");
14072 SameLine(); MetricsHelpMarker(
14073 "Note than the default embedded font is NOT meant to be scaled.\n\n"
14074 "Font are currently rendered into bitmaps at a given size at the time of building the atlas. "
14075 "You may oversample them to get some flexibility with scaling. "
14076 "You can also render at multiple sizes and select which one to use at runtime.\n\n"
14077 "(Glimmer of hope: the atlas system will be rewritten in the future to make scaling more flexible.)");
14078 Text("Ascent: %f, Descent: %f, Height: %f", font->Ascent, font->Descent, font->Ascent - font->Descent);
14079 char c_str[5];
14080 Text("Fallback character: '%s' (U+%04X)", ImTextCharToUtf8(c_str, font->FallbackChar), font->FallbackChar);
14081 Text("Ellipsis character: '%s' (U+%04X)", ImTextCharToUtf8(c_str, font->EllipsisChar), font->EllipsisChar);
14082 const int surface_sqrt = (int)ImSqrt((float)font->MetricsTotalSurface);
14083 Text("Texture Area: about %d px ~%dx%d px", font->MetricsTotalSurface, surface_sqrt, surface_sqrt);
14084 for (int config_i = 0; config_i < font->ConfigDataCount; config_i++)
14085 if (font->ConfigData)
14086 if (const ImFontConfig* cfg = &font->ConfigData[config_i])
14087 BulletText("Input %d: \'%s\', Oversample: (%d,%d), PixelSnapH: %d, Offset: (%.1f,%.1f)",
14088 config_i, cfg->Name, cfg->OversampleH, cfg->OversampleV, cfg->PixelSnapH, cfg->GlyphOffset.x, cfg->GlyphOffset.y);
14089
14090 // Display all glyphs of the fonts in separate pages of 256 characters
14091 if (TreeNode("Glyphs", "Glyphs (%d)", font->Glyphs.Size))
14092 {
14093 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetWindowDrawList();
14094 const ImU32 glyph_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
14095 const float cell_size = font->FontSize * 1;
14096 const float cell_spacing = GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y;
14097 for (unsigned int base = 0; base <= IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX; base += 256)
14098 {
14099 // Skip ahead if a large bunch of glyphs are not present in the font (test in chunks of 4k)
14100 // This is only a small optimization to reduce the number of iterations when IM_UNICODE_MAX_CODEPOINT
14101 // is large // (if ImWchar==ImWchar32 we will do at least about 272 queries here)
14102 if (!(base & 4095) && font->IsGlyphRangeUnused(base, base + 4095))
14103 {
14104 base += 4096 - 256;
14105 continue;
14106 }
14107
14108 int count = 0;
14109 for (unsigned int n = 0; n < 256; n++)
14110 if (font->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)(base + n)))
14111 count++;
14112 if (count <= 0)
14113 continue;
14114 if (!TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)base, "U+%04X..U+%04X (%d %s)", base, base + 255, count, count > 1 ? "glyphs" : "glyph"))
14115 continue;
14116
14117 // Draw a 16x16 grid of glyphs
14118 ImVec2 base_pos = GetCursorScreenPos();
14119 for (unsigned int n = 0; n < 256; n++)
14120 {
14121 // We use ImFont::RenderChar as a shortcut because we don't have UTF-8 conversion functions
14122 // available here and thus cannot easily generate a zero-terminated UTF-8 encoded string.
14123 ImVec2 cell_p1(base_pos.x + (n % 16) * (cell_size + cell_spacing), base_pos.y + (n / 16) * (cell_size + cell_spacing));
14124 ImVec2 cell_p2(cell_p1.x + cell_size, cell_p1.y + cell_size);
14125 const ImFontGlyph* glyph = font->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)(base + n));
14126 draw_list->AddRect(cell_p1, cell_p2, glyph ? IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 100) : IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 50));
14127 if (!glyph)
14128 continue;
14129 font->RenderChar(draw_list, cell_size, cell_p1, glyph_col, (ImWchar)(base + n));
14130 if (IsMouseHoveringRect(cell_p1, cell_p2) && BeginTooltip())
14131 {
14132 DebugNodeFontGlyph(font, glyph);
14133 EndTooltip();
14134 }
14135 }
14136 Dummy(ImVec2((cell_size + cell_spacing) * 16, (cell_size + cell_spacing) * 16));
14137 TreePop();
14138 }
14139 TreePop();
14140 }
14141 TreePop();
14142}
14143
14144void ImGui::DebugNodeFontGlyph(ImFont*, const ImFontGlyph* glyph)
14145{
14146 Text("Codepoint: U+%04X", glyph->Codepoint);
14147 Separator();
14148 Text("Visible: %d", glyph->Visible);
14149 Text("AdvanceX: %.1f", glyph->AdvanceX);
14150 Text("Pos: (%.2f,%.2f)->(%.2f,%.2f)", glyph->X0, glyph->Y0, glyph->X1, glyph->Y1);
14151 Text("UV: (%.3f,%.3f)->(%.3f,%.3f)", glyph->U0, glyph->V0, glyph->U1, glyph->V1);
14152}
14153
14154// [DEBUG] Display contents of ImGuiStorage
14155void ImGui::DebugNodeStorage(ImGuiStorage* storage, const char* label)
14156{
14157 if (!TreeNode(label, "%s: %d entries, %d bytes", label, storage->Data.Size, storage->Data.size_in_bytes()))
14158 return;
14159 for (int n = 0; n < storage->Data.Size; n++)
14160 {
14161 const ImGuiStorage::ImGuiStoragePair& p = storage->Data[n];
14162 BulletText("Key 0x%08X Value { i: %d }", p.key, p.val_i); // Important: we currently don't store a type, real value may not be integer.
14163 }
14164 TreePop();
14165}
14166
14167// [DEBUG] Display contents of ImGuiTabBar
14168void ImGui::DebugNodeTabBar(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, const char* label)
14169{
14170 // Standalone tab bars (not associated to docking/windows functionality) currently hold no discernible strings.
14171 char buf[256];
14172 char* p = buf;
14173 const char* buf_end = buf + IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf);
14174 const bool is_active = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible >= GetFrameCount() - 2);
14175 p += ImFormatString(p, buf_end - p, "%s 0x%08X (%d tabs)%s", label, tab_bar->ID, tab_bar->Tabs.Size, is_active ? "" : " *Inactive*");
14176 p += ImFormatString(p, buf_end - p, " { ");
14177 for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < ImMin(tab_bar->Tabs.Size, 3); tab_n++)
14178 {
14179 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
14180 p += ImFormatString(p, buf_end - p, "%s'%s'",
14181 tab_n > 0 ? ", " : "", TabBarGetTabName(tab_bar, tab));
14182 }
14183 p += ImFormatString(p, buf_end - p, (tab_bar->Tabs.Size > 3) ? " ... }" : " } ");
14184 if (!is_active) { PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol_TextDisabled)); }
14185 bool open = TreeNode(label, "%s", buf);
14186 if (!is_active) { PopStyleColor(); }
14187 if (is_active && IsItemHovered())
14188 {
14189 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList();
14190 draw_list->AddRect(tab_bar->BarRect.Min, tab_bar->BarRect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
14191 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y), ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
14192 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y), ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
14193 }
14194 if (open)
14195 {
14196 for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_n++)
14197 {
14198 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
14199 PushID(tab);
14200 if (SmallButton("<")) { TabBarQueueReorder(tab_bar, tab, -1); } SameLine(0, 2);
14201 if (SmallButton(">")) { TabBarQueueReorder(tab_bar, tab, +1); } SameLine();
14202 Text("%02d%c Tab 0x%08X '%s' Offset: %.2f, Width: %.2f/%.2f",
14203 tab_n, (tab->ID == tab_bar->SelectedTabId) ? '*' : ' ', tab->ID, TabBarGetTabName(tab_bar, tab), tab->Offset, tab->Width, tab->ContentWidth);
14204 PopID();
14205 }
14206 TreePop();
14207 }
14208}
14209
14210void ImGui::DebugNodeViewport(ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
14211{
14212 SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
14213 if (TreeNode("viewport0", "Viewport #%d", 0))
14214 {
14215 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = viewport->Flags;
14216 BulletText("Main Pos: (%.0f,%.0f), Size: (%.0f,%.0f)\nWorkArea Offset Left: %.0f Top: %.0f, Right: %.0f, Bottom: %.0f",
14217 viewport->Pos.x, viewport->Pos.y, viewport->Size.x, viewport->Size.y,
14218 viewport->WorkOffsetMin.x, viewport->WorkOffsetMin.y, viewport->WorkOffsetMax.x, viewport->WorkOffsetMax.y);
14219 BulletText("Flags: 0x%04X =%s%s%s", viewport->Flags,
14220 (flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformWindow) ? " IsPlatformWindow" : "",
14221 (flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformMonitor) ? " IsPlatformMonitor" : "",
14222 (flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp) ? " OwnedByApp" : "");
14223 for (int layer_i = 0; layer_i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers); layer_i++)
14224 for (int draw_list_i = 0; draw_list_i < viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer_i].Size; draw_list_i++)
14225 DebugNodeDrawList(NULL, viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer_i][draw_list_i], "DrawList");
14226 TreePop();
14227 }
14228}
14229
14230void ImGui::DebugNodeWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, const char* label)
14231{
14232 if (window == NULL)
14233 {
14234 BulletText("%s: NULL", label);
14235 return;
14236 }
14237
14238 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
14239 const bool is_active = window->WasActive;
14240 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags tree_node_flags = (window == g.NavWindow) ? ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected : ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None;
14241 if (!is_active) { PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol_TextDisabled)); }
14242 const bool open = TreeNodeEx(label, tree_node_flags, "%s '%s'%s", label, window->Name, is_active ? "" : " *Inactive*");
14243 if (!is_active) { PopStyleColor(); }
14244 if (IsItemHovered() && is_active)
14245 GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
14246 if (!open)
14247 return;
14248
14249 if (window->MemoryCompacted)
14250 TextDisabled("Note: some memory buffers have been compacted/freed.");
14251
14252 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
14253 DebugNodeDrawList(window, window->DrawList, "DrawList");
14254 BulletText("Pos: (%.1f,%.1f), Size: (%.1f,%.1f), ContentSize (%.1f,%.1f) Ideal (%.1f,%.1f)", window->Pos.x, window->Pos.y, window->Size.x, window->Size.y, window->ContentSize.x, window->ContentSize.y, window->ContentSizeIdeal.x, window->ContentSizeIdeal.y);
14255 BulletText("Flags: 0x%08X (%s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s..)", flags,
14256 (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? "Child " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) ? "Tooltip " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) ? "Popup " : "",
14257 (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) ? "Modal " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) ? "ChildMenu " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings) ? "NoSavedSettings " : "",
14258 (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs)? "NoMouseInputs":"", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) ? "NoNavInputs" : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) ? "AlwaysAutoResize" : "");
14259 BulletText("Scroll: (%.2f/%.2f,%.2f/%.2f) Scrollbar:%s%s", window->Scroll.x, window->ScrollMax.x, window->Scroll.y, window->ScrollMax.y, window->ScrollbarX ? "X" : "", window->ScrollbarY ? "Y" : "");
14260 BulletText("Active: %d/%d, WriteAccessed: %d, BeginOrderWithinContext: %d", window->Active, window->WasActive, window->WriteAccessed, (window->Active || window->WasActive) ? window->BeginOrderWithinContext : -1);
14261 BulletText("Appearing: %d, Hidden: %d (CanSkip %d Cannot %d), SkipItems: %d", window->Appearing, window->Hidden, window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems, window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems, window->SkipItems);
14262 for (int layer = 0; layer < ImGuiNavLayer_COUNT; layer++)
14263 {
14264 ImRect r = window->NavRectRel[layer];
14265 if (r.Min.x >= r.Max.y && r.Min.y >= r.Max.y)
14266 BulletText("NavLastIds[%d]: 0x%08X", layer, window->NavLastIds[layer]);
14267 else
14268 BulletText("NavLastIds[%d]: 0x%08X at +(%.1f,%.1f)(%.1f,%.1f)", layer, window->NavLastIds[layer], r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y);
14269 DebugLocateItemOnHover(window->NavLastIds[layer]);
14270 }
14271 BulletText("NavLayersActiveMask: %X, NavLastChildNavWindow: %s", window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask, window->NavLastChildNavWindow ? window->NavLastChildNavWindow->Name : "NULL");
14272 if (window->RootWindow != window) { DebugNodeWindow(window->RootWindow, "RootWindow"); }
14273 if (window->ParentWindow != NULL) { DebugNodeWindow(window->ParentWindow, "ParentWindow"); }
14274 if (window->DC.ChildWindows.Size > 0) { DebugNodeWindowsList(&window->DC.ChildWindows, "ChildWindows"); }
14275 if (window->ColumnsStorage.Size > 0 && TreeNode("Columns", "Columns sets (%d)", window->ColumnsStorage.Size))
14276 {
14277 for (int n = 0; n < window->ColumnsStorage.Size; n++)
14278 DebugNodeColumns(&window->ColumnsStorage[n]);
14279 TreePop();
14280 }
14281 DebugNodeStorage(&window->StateStorage, "Storage");
14282 TreePop();
14283}
14284
14285void ImGui::DebugNodeWindowSettings(ImGuiWindowSettings* settings)
14286{
14287 if (settings->WantDelete)
14288 BeginDisabled();
14289 Text("0x%08X \"%s\" Pos (%d,%d) Size (%d,%d) Collapsed=%d",
14290 settings->ID, settings->GetName(), settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y, settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y, settings->Collapsed);
14291 if (settings->WantDelete)
14292 EndDisabled();
14293}
14294
14295void ImGui::DebugNodeWindowsList(ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>* windows, const char* label)
14296{
14297 if (!TreeNode(label, "%s (%d)", label, windows->Size))
14298 return;
14299 for (int i = windows->Size - 1; i >= 0; i--) // Iterate front to back
14300 {
14301 PushID((*windows)[i]);
14302 DebugNodeWindow((*windows)[i], "Window");
14303 PopID();
14304 }
14305 TreePop();
14306}
14307
14308// FIXME-OPT: This is technically suboptimal, but it is simpler this way.
14309void ImGui::DebugNodeWindowsListByBeginStackParent(ImGuiWindow** windows, int windows_size, ImGuiWindow* parent_in_begin_stack)
14310{
14311 for (int i = 0; i < windows_size; i++)
14312 {
14313 ImGuiWindow* window = windows[i];
14314 if (window->ParentWindowInBeginStack != parent_in_begin_stack)
14315 continue;
14316 char buf[20];
14317 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "[%04d] Window", window->BeginOrderWithinContext);
14318 //BulletText("[%04d] Window '%s'", window->BeginOrderWithinContext, window->Name);
14319 DebugNodeWindow(window, buf);
14320 Indent();
14321 DebugNodeWindowsListByBeginStackParent(windows + i + 1, windows_size - i - 1, window);
14322 Unindent();
14323 }
14324}
14325
14326//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
14327// [SECTION] DEBUG LOG WINDOW
14328//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
14329
14330void ImGui::DebugLog(const char* fmt, ...)
14331{
14332 va_list args;
14333 va_start(args, fmt);
14334 DebugLogV(fmt, args);
14335 va_end(args);
14336}
14337
14338void ImGui::DebugLogV(const char* fmt, va_list args)
14339{
14340 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
14341 const int old_size = g.DebugLogBuf.size();
14342 g.DebugLogBuf.appendf("[%05d] ", g.FrameCount);
14343 g.DebugLogBuf.appendfv(fmt, args);
14344 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_OutputToTTY)
14345 IMGUI_DEBUG_PRINTF("%s", g.DebugLogBuf.begin() + old_size);
14346 g.DebugLogIndex.append(g.DebugLogBuf.c_str(), old_size, g.DebugLogBuf.size());
14347}
14348
14349void ImGui::ShowDebugLogWindow(bool* p_open)
14350{
14351 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
14352 if (!(g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize))
14353 SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(0.0f, GetFontSize() * 12.0f), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
14354 if (!Begin("Dear ImGui Debug Log", p_open) || GetCurrentWindow()->BeginCount > 1)
14355 {
14356 End();
14357 return;
14358 }
14359
14360 CheckboxFlags("All", &g.DebugLogFlags, ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventMask_);
14361 SameLine(); CheckboxFlags("ActiveId", &g.DebugLogFlags, ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventActiveId);
14362 SameLine(); CheckboxFlags("Focus", &g.DebugLogFlags, ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventFocus);
14363 SameLine(); CheckboxFlags("Popup", &g.DebugLogFlags, ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventPopup);
14364 SameLine(); CheckboxFlags("Nav", &g.DebugLogFlags, ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventNav);
14365 SameLine(); if (CheckboxFlags("Clipper", &g.DebugLogFlags, ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventClipper)) { g.DebugLogClipperAutoDisableFrames = 2; } if (IsItemHovered()) SetTooltip("Clipper log auto-disabled after 2 frames");
14366 //SameLine(); CheckboxFlags("Selection", &g.DebugLogFlags, ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventSelection);
14367 SameLine(); CheckboxFlags("IO", &g.DebugLogFlags, ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventIO);
14368
14369 if (SmallButton("Clear"))
14370 {
14371 g.DebugLogBuf.clear();
14372 g.DebugLogIndex.clear();
14373 }
14374 SameLine();
14375 if (SmallButton("Copy"))
14376 SetClipboardText(g.DebugLogBuf.c_str());
14377 BeginChild("##log", ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), true, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar);
14378
14379 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
14380 clipper.Begin(g.DebugLogIndex.size());
14381 while (clipper.Step())
14382 for (int line_no = clipper.DisplayStart; line_no < clipper.DisplayEnd; line_no++)
14383 {
14384 const char* line_begin = g.DebugLogIndex.get_line_begin(g.DebugLogBuf.c_str(), line_no);
14385 const char* line_end = g.DebugLogIndex.get_line_end(g.DebugLogBuf.c_str(), line_no);
14386 TextUnformatted(line_begin, line_end);
14387 ImRect text_rect = g.LastItemData.Rect;
14388 if (IsItemHovered())
14389 for (const char* p = line_begin; p < line_end - 10; p++)
14390 {
14391 ImGuiID id = 0;
14392 if (p[0] != '0' || (p[1] != 'x' && p[1] != 'X') || sscanf(p + 2, "%X", &id) != 1)
14393 continue;
